  8747                                  		;;test	ds:fbigfat, 40h	; fbig
  8748                                  					; if (fbigfat)
  8749 00002500 751E                    		jnz	short dobig	; goto dobig; (16 bit fat)
  8750                                  
  8751                                  ; we don't need to change "small fat" logic since it is guaranteed
  8752                                  ; that double word total sector will not use 12 bit fat (unless
  8753                                  ; it's sectors/cluster >= 16 which will never be in this case.)
  8754                                  ; so in this case we assume dx = 0 !!
  8755                                  
  8756 00002502 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; 12 bit fat (FAT12 fs)
  8757 00002504 88EB                    		mov	bl, ch
  8758 00002506 4B                      		dec	bx
  8759 00002507 01C3                    		add	bx, ax		; dx=0
  8760 00002509 D3EB                    		shr	bx, cl		; bx = 1+(bpb->maxsec+BDS.secperclus-1)/
  8761 0000250B 43                      		inc	bx		; BDS.secperclus
  8762 0000250C 80E3FE                  		and	bl, 0FEh	; bx &= ~1; (=number of clusters)
  8763 0000250F 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
  8764 00002511 D1EB                    		shr	bx, 1
  8765 00002513 01F3                    		add	bx, si		; number of FAT bytes ; 08/08/2023
  8766 00002515 81C3FF01                		add	bx, 511		; bx +=	511 + bx/2
  8767 00002519 D0EF                    		shr	bh, 1		; bh >>= 1; (=bx/512)
  8768 0000251B 887D11                  		mov	[di+11h], bh	; [di+BDS.fatsecs]
  8769                                  					; save number of fat sectors
  8770 0000251E EB6A                    		jmp	short massage_bpb
  8771                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  8772                                  
  8773                                  ; for bigfat we do need to extend this logic to 32 bit sector calculation.
  8774                                  
  8775                                  dobig:					
  8776 00002520 B104                    		mov	cl, 4		; 16 (2^4) directory entries per sector
  8777 00002522 52                      		push	dx		; save total sectors (high)
  8778 00002523 8B550C                  		mov	dx, [di+0Ch]	; [di+BDS.direntries]
  8779 00002526 D3EA                    		shr	dx, cl		; root dir sectors = BDS.direntries / 16;
  8780 00002528 29D0                    		sub	ax, dx
  8781 0000252A 5A                      		pop	dx
  8782 0000252B 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0		; dx:ax	= total	sectors	- root dir sectors
  8783 0000252E 83E801                  		sub	ax, 1
  8784 00002531 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0		; dx:ax	= t - r	- d
  8785                                  					; total	secs - reserved	secs - root dir	secs
  8786 00002534 B302                    		mov	bl, 2
  8787 00002536 8A7D08                  		mov	bh, [di+8]	; [di+BDS.secperclus]
  8788                                  					; bx = 256 * BDS.secperclus + 2
  8789                                  
  8790                                  ; I don't understand why to add bx here!!!
  8791                                  
  8792                                  		; 29/12/2018 - Erdogan Tan (Retro DOS v4.0)
  8793                                  		; 27/09/2022
  8794                                  		; (Microsoft FAT32 File	System Specification,
  8795                                  		; December 2000, Page 21)
  8796                                  		; TmpVal1 = DskSize - (BPB_ResvdSecCnt+RootrDirSectors)
  8797                                  		; TmpVal2 = (256*BPB_SecPerClus)+BPB_NumFATs
  8798                                  		; 8/8/2023 (Retro DOS v5.0)
  8799                                  		; If(FATType == FAT32)
  8800                                  		;   TmpVal2 = TmpVal2 / 2;
  8801                                  		; FATsz	= (TmpVal1+(TmpVal2-1))/TmpVal2
  8802                                  		; 8/8/2023 (Retro DOS v5.0)
  8803                                  		; If(FATType == FAT32) {
  8804                                  		;   BPB_FATSz16 = 0;
  8805                                  		;   BPB_FATSz32 = FATSz;
  8806                                  		;} else {
  8807                                  		;   BPB_FATSz16 = LOWORD(FATSz);
  8808                                  		;/* there is no BPB_FATSz32 in a FAT16 BPB */
  8809                                  		;}
  8810                                  					; dx:ax = TmpVal1, bx = TmpVal2
  8811 00002539 01D8                    		add	ax, bx		; 
  8812 0000253B 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0		; dx:ax = TmpVal1+TmpVal2
  8813 0000253E 83E801                  		sub	ax, 1		
  8814 00002541 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0		; dx:ax = TmpVal1+TmpVal2-1
  8815                                  
  8816                                  		;;;
  8817                                  		; 17/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM)
  8818 00002544 F606[081A]20            		test	byte [fbigfat], 20h ; fbigbig (FAT32) flag
  8819 00002549 740D                    		jz      short dobig1
  8820                                  
  8821 0000254B D1EB                    		shr	bx, 1           ; TmpVal2 = TmpVal2 / 2
  8822                                  					; dx:ax = TmpVal1+(2*TmpVal2)-1
  8823 0000254D 83E81F                  		sub	ax, 31          ; reserved sectors = 32 (for FAT32 fs) /// 1+31 = 32
  8824 00002550 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0
  8825 00002553 29D8                    		sub	ax, bx
  8826 00002555 83DA00                  		sbb	dx, 0           ; dx:ax = TmpVal1+(2*TmpVal2)-TmpVal2-1
  8827                                  					;       = TmpVal1+(TmpVal2-1)
  8828                                  dobig1:
  8829 00002558 50                      		push	ax		; save lw of dividend
  8830 00002559 89D0                    		mov	ax, dx		; divide hw of dx:ax at first (as 1st stage)
  8831 0000255B 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  8832 0000255D F7F3                    		div	bx		; 32 bit division, dx:ax/bx
  8833                                  					; remainder in dx is hw of 2nd stage dividend
  8834 0000255F 89C5                    		mov	bp, ax		; hw of quotient
  8835 00002561 58                      		pop	ax		; restore lw of dividend (of 1st stage)
  8836                                  		;;;
  8837                                  
  8838                                  ; assuming dx in the table will never be bigger than bx.
  8839                                  
  8840 00002562 F7F3                    		div	bx		; BDS.fatsecs =
  8841                                  					; ceil((total-dir-res)/(256*BDS.secperclus+2))
  8842 00002564 894511                  		mov	[di+11h], ax	; [di+BDS.fatsecs]
  8843                                  					; number of fat	sectors

  8890                                  		; 17/10/2022

  8901                                  
  8902                                  ; at this point, in bpb of bds table, BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS which is
  8903                                  ; set according to the partition information. we are going to
  8904                                  ; see if (hidden sectors + total sectors) > a word. if it is true,
  8905                                  ; then no change. otherwise, BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS will be moved
  8906                                  ; to BDS_BPB.BPB_TOTALSECTORS and BDS_BPB.BPB_BIGTOTALSECTORS will be set to 0.
  8907                                  ; we don't do this for the bpb information from the boot record. we

  8968                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  8969                                  
  8970                                  ; 15/10/2022
  8971                                  
  8972                                  ;fdisk of pc dos 3.3 and below, os2 1.0 has a bug. the maximum number of
  8973                                  ;sector that can be handled by pc dos 3.3 ibmbio should be 0ffffh.
  8974                                  ;instead, sometimes fdisk use 10000h to calculate the maximum number.
  8975                                  ;so, we are going to check that if BPB_TOTALSECTORS + hidden sector = 10000h
  8976                                  ;then subtract 1 from BPB_TOTALSECTORS.
  8977                                  
  8978                                  		; 17/10/2022
  8979                                  cover_fdisk_bug:
  8980                                  		; 12/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
  8981                                  		; ds = cs
  8982                                  
  8983                                  		; 18/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM)
  8984                                  		; (optimization)
  8985                                  		;push	ax
  8986                                  		;push	dx
  8987                                  		;push	si
  8988                                  
  8989                                  		; 18/12/2023
  8990                                  		; bx = offset disksector
  8991                                  
  8992                                  		; 18/12/2023
  8993 000025B3 807F2629                		cmp	byte [bx+26h], 29h
  8994                                  		; 12/08/2023
  8995                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector+26h], 29h
  8996                                  		;;cmp	byte [cs:disksector+26h], 29h

  9066                                  ; setdrvparms sets up the recommended bpb in each bds in the system based on
  9067                                  ; the form factor. it is assumed that the bpbs for the various form factors
  9068                                  ; are present in the bpbtable. for hard files, the recommended bpb is the same
  9069                                  ; as the bpb on the drive.

  9072                                  ; sysinit straight after this routine.

  9307                                  
  9308                                  ; domini **********************************************************************
  9309                                  ;
  9310                                  ;mini disk initialization routine. called right after dohard
  9311                                  ;modified for >2 hardfile support
  9312                                  ;
  9313                                  ; **cs=ds=es=datagrp
  9314                                  ;
  9315                                  ; **domini will search for every extended partition in the system, and
  9316                                  ;   initialize it.
  9317                                  ;
  9318                                  ; **bdsm stands for bds table for mini disk and located right after the label
  9319                                  ;   end96tpi. end_of_bdsm will have the offset value of the ending
  9320                                  ;   address of bdsm table.
  9321                                  ;
  9322                                  ; **bdsm is the same as usual bds structure except that tim_lo, tim_hi entries
  9323                                  ;   are overlapped and used to identify mini disk and the number of hidden_trks.
  9324                                  ;   right now, they are called as ismini, hidden_trks respectively.
  9325                                  ;
  9326                                  ; **domini will use the same routine in sethard routine after label set2 to
  9327                                  ;   save coding.
  9328                                  ;
  9329                                  ; **drvmax determined in dohard routine will be used for the next
  9330                                  ;   available logical mini disk drive number.
  9331                                  ;
  9332                                  ; input: drvmax, dskdrvs
  9333                                  ;
  9334                                  ; output: minidisk installed. bdsm table established and installed to bds.
  9335                                  ;	  end_of_bdsm - ending offset address of bdsm.
  9336                                  ;
  9337                                  ; called modules:
  9338                                  ;		  getboot
  9339                                  ;		  find_mini_partition (new), xinstall_bds (new), M038
  9340                                  ;
  9341                                  ;		  setmini (new, it will use set2 routine)
  9342                                  ;
  9343                                  ; variables used: end_of_bdsm
  9344                                  ;		  rom_minidisk_num
  9345                                  ;		  mini_hdlim, mini_seclim
  9346                                  ;		  BDS_STRUC, start_bds
  9347                                  ;
  9348                                  ;******************************************************************************
  9349                                  		; 18/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0 IO.SYS/IBMBIO.COM
  9350                                  		; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSDATA:2B10h)
  9351                                  
  9352                                  		; 19/10/2022
  9353                                  domini:
  9354 000026AC 8A36[5F1A]              		mov	dh, [hnum]	; get number of hardfiles
  9355                                  		; 10/12/2022
  9356 000026B0 20F6                    		and	dh, dh
  9357                                  		;cmp	dh, 0
  9358 000026B2 743C                    		jz	short dominiret	; no hard file?	then exit.
  9359 000026B4 B280                    		mov	dl, 80h		; start	with hardfile 80h
  9360                                  domini_loop:
  9361                                  		; 18/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0
  9362 000026B6 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax ; 0
  9363                                  		; ds = cs
  9364                                  		;mov	[cs:ep_start_sector], ax
  9365                                  		;mov	[cs:ep_start_sector+2], ax
  9366                                  		;mov	[cs:ep_hidden_secs], ax
  9367                                  		;mov	[cs:ep_hidden_secs+2], ax
  9368 000026B8 A3[0222]                		mov	[ep_start_sector], ax
  9369 000026BB A3[0422]                		mov	[ep_start_sector+2], ax
  9370 000026BE A3[0622]                		mov	[ep_hidden_secs], ax
  9371 000026C1 A3[0822]                		mov	[ep_hidden_secs+2], ax
  9372                                  		;
  9373 000026C4 52                      		push	dx
  9374 000026C5 8816[5E1A]              		mov	[rom_minidisk_num], dl
  9375 000026C9 B408                    		mov	ah, 8
  9376 000026CB CD13                    		int	13h		; DISK - DISK -	GET CURRENT DRIVE PARAMETERS (XT,AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  9377                                  					; DL = drive number
  9378                                  					; Return: CF set on error, AH =	status code, BL	= drive	type
  9379                                  					; DL = number of consecutive drives
  9380                                  					; DH = maximum value for head number, ES:DI -> drive parameter
  9381                                  		
  9382                                  		; 08/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
  9383                                  		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSDATA:2B36h
  9384                                  		;inc	dh
  9385                                  		;xor	ax, ax
  9386                                  		;mov	al, dh
  9387 000026CD 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax
  9388 000026CF 88F0                    		mov	al, dh	; <= 255
  9389 000026D1 40                      		inc	ax	; (0FFh -> 100h)
  9390 000026D2 A3[641A]                		mov	[mini_hdlim], ax ; # of heads
  9391                                  		;and	cl, 3Fh
  9392                                  		;mov	al, cl
  9393                                  		; 08/08/2023
  9394 000026D5 88C8                    		mov	al, cl
  9395 000026D7 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh
  9396 000026DA A3[661A]                		mov	[mini_seclim], ax ; # of sectors/track
  9397                                  		
  9398                                  		; 18/12/2023
  9399                                  		;push	es ; * ; not necessary
  9400 000026DD 8A16[5E1A]              		mov	dl, [rom_minidisk_num]
  9401 000026E1 E866FA                  		call	getboot		; read master boot record into
  9402                                  					; initbootsegment:bootbias

  9419                                  ;find_mini_partition tries to find every extended partition on a disk.
  9420                                  ;at entry:	di -> bdsm entry

  9423                                  ;		drvmax - logical drive number
  9424                                  ;		mini_hdlim, mini_seclim

  9427                                  ;variables & equates used from original bios - flags, fnon_removable, fbigfat

  9797 00002869 8D5D06                  		lea	bx, [di+6]
  9798 0000286C 8B36[601A]              		mov	si, [last_dskdrv_table]
  9799 00002870 891C                    		mov	[si], bx
  9800 00002872 8306[601A]02            		add	word [last_dskdrv_table], 2
  9801 00002877 FE06[7500]              		inc	byte [drvmax]
  9802                                  		;add	word [end_of_bdss], 100 ; BDS.size = 100
  9803                                  		; 19/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0
  9804 0000287B 8106[621A]9600          		add	word [end_of_bdss], 150 ; BDS.size = 150
  9805 00002881 5B                      		pop	bx
  9806 00002882 5E                      		pop	si
  9807 00002883 C3                      		retn
  9808                                  
  9809                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9810                                  
  9811                                  ; 17/10/2022
  9812                                  ; 15/10/2022
  9813                                  ; 28/12/2018 - Retro DOS v4.0
  9814                                  ; 03/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
  9815                                  
  9816                                  		; 19/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0
  9817                                  cmos_clock_read:
  9818 00002884 50                      		push	ax
  9819 00002885 51                      		push	cx
  9820 00002886 52                      		push	dx
  9821 00002887 55                      		push	bp
  9822 00002888 31ED                    		xor	bp, bp
  9823                                  loop_clock:
  9824 0000288A 31C9                    		xor	cx, cx
  9825 0000288C 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
  9826 0000288E B402                    		mov	ah, 2
  9827 00002890 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- READ REAL TIME CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
  9828                                  					; Return: CH = hours in	BCD
  9829                                  					; CL = minutes in BCD
  9830                                  					; DH = seconds in BCD
  9831                                  		; 19/12/2023
  9832                                  		;cmp	cx, 0
  9833 00002892 21C9                    		and	cx, cx
  9834 00002894 750F                    		jnz	short clock_present
  9835                                  		;cmp	dx, 0
  9836 00002896 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
  9837 00002898 750B                    		jnz	short clock_present
  9838                                  		;cmp	bp, 1		; read again after a slight delay, in case clock
  9839                                  		;je	short no_readdate ; was	at zero	setting.
  9840 0000289A 21ED                    		and	bp, bp
  9841 0000289C 751A                    		jnz	short no_readdate
  9842 0000289E 45                      		inc	bp		; only perform delay once.
  9843                                  		;mov	cx, 4000h	; 16384
  9844                                  		; 19/12/2023
  9845 0000289F B540                    		mov	ch, 40h ; cx = 4000h ; 16384
  9846                                  delay:					
  9847 000028A1 E2FE                    		loop	delay
  9848 000028A3 EBE5                    		jmp	short loop_clock
  9849                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9850                                  
  9851                                  clock_present:
  9852                                  		;mov	byte [cs:havecmosclock], 1 ; set the flag for cmos clock
  9853                                  		; 19/12/2023
  9854                                  		; ds = cs
  9855 000028A5 C606[8C04]01            		mov	byte [havecmosclock], 1 ; set the flag for cmos clock
  9856                                  		
  9857 000028AA E81000                  		call	cmosck		; reset	cmos clock rate	that may be
  9858                                  					; possibly destroyed by	cp dos and
  9859                                  					; post routine did not restore that.
  9860 000028AD 56                      		push	si
  9861 000028AE E8BAEF                  		call	read_real_date	; read real-time clock for date
  9862 000028B1 FA                      		cli
  9863                                  		;mov	ds:daycnt, si	; set system date
  9864 000028B2 8936[8904]              		mov	[daycnt], si
  9865 000028B6 FB                      		sti
  9866 000028B7 5E                      		pop	si
  9867                                  no_readdate:
  9868 000028B8 5D                      		pop	bp
  9869 000028B9 5A                      		pop	dx
  9870 000028BA 59                      		pop	cx
  9871 000028BB 58                      		pop	ax
  9872                                  
  9873                                  cmosck9:	; 19/12/2023
  9874 000028BC C3                      		retn
  9875                                  
  9876                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9877                                  
  9878                                  ; the following code is written by jack gulley in engineering group.
  9879                                  ; cp dos (CP/DOS, OS/2) is changing cmos clock rate for its own purposes
  9880                                  ; and if the use cold boot the system to use pc dos while running cp dos,
  9881                                  ; the cmos clock rate are still slow which slow down disk operations
  9882                                  ; of pc dos which uses cmos clock. pc dos is put this code in msinit
  9883                                  ; to fix this problem at the request of cp dos.
  9884                                  ;
  9885                                  ; the program is modified to be run on msinit. equates are defined
  9886                                  ; in cmosequ.inc. this program will be called by cmos_clock_read procedure.
  9887                                  ;
  9888                                  ;  the following code cmosck is used to insure that the cmos has not
  9889                                  ;	had its rate controls left in an invalid state on older at's.
  9890                                  ;
  9891                                  ;	it checks for an at model byte "fc" with a submodel type of
  9892                                  ;	00, 01, 02, 03 or 06 and resets the periodic interrupt rate
  9893                                  ;	bits in case post has not done it. this initilization routine
  9894                                  ;	is only needed once when dos loads. it should be run as soon
  9895                                  ;	as possible to prevent slow diskette access.
  9896                                  ;
  9897                                  ;	this code exposes one to dos clearing cmos setup done by a
  9898                                  ;	resident program that hides and re-boots the system.
  9899                                  
  9900                                  cmosck:					; check and reset rtc rate bits
  9901                                  
  9902                                  ;model byte and submodel byte were already determined in msinit.
  9903                                  
  9904                                  	; 16/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
  9905                                  	; 19/03/2018 (Model: 0FCh, Sub Model: 01h, REF: AMIBIOS Prog. Guide)
  9906                                  
  9907                                  	; 19/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0
  9908                                  	
  9909                                  		; 19/12/2023
  9910                                  		; ds = cs
  9911                                  		;push	ax ; not necessary ; 19/12/2023
  9912                                  		;
  9913 000028BD 803E[AF05]FC            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0FCh
  9914                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:model_byte], 0FCh
  9915 000028C2 75F8                    		jnz	short cmosck9	; Exit if not an AT model
  9916 000028C4 803E[B005]06            		cmp	byte [secondary_model_byte], 6 ; 21/04/2024
  9917                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:secondary_model_byte], 6
  9918                                  					; Is it 06 for the industral AT ?
  9919 000028C9 7407                    		jz	short cmosck4	; Go reset CMOS periodic rate if 06
  9920 000028CB 803E[B005]04            		cmp	byte [secondary_model_byte], 4
  9921                                  		;cmp	byte [cs:secondary_model_byte], 4
  9922                                  					; Is it 00, 01, 02, or 03 ?
  9923 000028D0 73EA                    		jnb	short cmosck9	; EXIT if problem fixed by POST
  9924                                  					; Also,Secondary_model_byte = 0
  9925                                  					;   when AH=0C0h, int 15h failed.
  9926                                  					;	RESET THE CMOS PERIODIC RATE
  9927                                  					;  Model=FC submodel=00,01,02,03 or 06
  9928                                  cmosck4:
  9929 000028D2 B08A                    		mov	al, 8Ah		; cmos_reg_a|nmi
  9930                                  					; NMI disabled on return
  9931 000028D4 B426                    		mov	ah, 26h		; 00100110b
  9932                                  					; Set divider & rate selection
  9933 000028D6 E80B00                  		call	cmos_write
  9934 000028D9 B08B                    		mov	al, 8Bh		; cmos_reg_b|nmi
  9935                                  					; NMI disabled on return
  9936 000028DB E82000                  		call	cmos_read
  9937 000028DE 2407                    		and	al, 7		; 00000111b
  9938                                  					; clear SET,PIE,AIE,UIE,SQWE
  9939 000028E0 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
  9940 000028E2 B00B                    		mov	al, 0Bh		; cmos_reg_b
  9941                                  					; NMI enabled on return
  9942                                  		; 19/12/2023
  9943                                  		;call	cmos_write
  9944                                  ;cmosck9:
  9945                                  		;pop	ax ; 19/12/2023
  9946                                  		;retn
  9947                                  
  9948                                  		; 19/12/2023
  9949                                  		;jmp	short cmos_write
  9950                                  
  9951                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9952                                  
  9953                                  ;--- cmos_write ----------------------------------------------------------------
  9954                                  ;		write byte to cmos system clock configuration table	       :
  9955                                  ;									       :
  9956                                  ; input: (al)=	cmos table address to be written to			       :
  9957                                  ;		bit    7 = 0 for nmi enabled and 1 for nmi disabled on exit    :
  9958                                  ;		bits 6-0 = address of table location to write		       :
  9959                                  ;	 (ah)=	new value to be placed in the addressed table location	       :
  9960                                  ;									       :
  9961                                  ; output:	value in (ah) placed in location (al) with nmi left disabled   :
  9962                                  ;		if bit 7 of (al) is on. during the cmos update both nmi and    :
  9963                                  ;		normal interrupts are disabled to protect cmos data integrity. :
  9964                                  ;		the cmos address register is pointed to a default value and    :
  9965                                  ;		the interrupt flag restored to the entry state on return.      :
  9966                                  ;		only the cmos location and the nmi state is changed.	       :
  9967                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
  9968                                  
  9969                                  cmos_write:				; write (ah) to location (al)
  9970 000028E4 9C                      		pushf			;
  9971 000028E5 50                      		push	ax		; save work register values
  9972 000028E6 FA                      		cli
  9973 000028E7 50                      		push	ax		; save user nmi	state
  9974 000028E8 0C80                    		or	al, 80h		; disable nmi for us
  9975 000028EA E670                    		out	70h, al		; CMOS Memory/RTC Index	Register:
  9976                                  					; RTC Seconds
  9977 000028EC 90                      		nop
  9978 000028ED 88E0                    		mov	al, ah
  9979 000028EF E671                    		out	71h, al		; CMOS Memory/RTC Data Register
  9980 000028F1 58                      		pop	ax		; get user nmi
  9981 000028F2 2480                    		and	al, 80h
  9982 000028F4 0C0F                    		or	al, 0Fh
  9983 000028F6 E670                    		out	70h, al		; CMOS Memory/RTC Index	Register:
  9984                                  					; RTC Seconds
  9985 000028F8 90                      		nop
  9986 000028F9 E471                    		in	al, 71h		; CMOS Memory/RTC Data Register
  9987 000028FB 58                      		pop	ax		; restore work registers
  9988                                  
  9989                                  		; 19/12/2023
  9990                                  		;push	cs		; *place code segment in stack and
  9991                                  		;call	cmos_popf	; *handle popf for b- level 80286
  9992                                  		;retn
  9993 000028FC EB18                    		jmp	short cmos_rw_popf
  9994                                  
  9995                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
  9996                                  
  9997                                  ;--- CMOS_READ -----------------------------------------------------------------
  9998                                  ;		read byte from cmos system clock configuration table	       :
  9999                                  ;									       :
 10000                                  ; input: (al)=	cmos table address to be read				       :
 10001                                  ;		bit    7 = 0 for nmi enabled and 1 for nmi disabled on exit    :
 10002                                  ;		bits 6-0 = address of table location to read		       :
 10003                                  ;									       :
 10004                                  ; output: (al)	value at location (al) moved into (al). if bit 7 of (al) was   :
 10005                                  ;		on then nmi left disabled. during the cmos read both nmi and  :
 10006                                  ;		normal interrupts are disabled to protect cmos data integrity. :
 10007                                  ;		the cmos address register is pointed to a default value and    :
 10008                                  ;		the interrupt flag restored to the entry state on return.      :
 10009                                  ;		only the (al) register and the nmi state is changed.	       :
 10010                                  ;-------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10011                                  
 10012                                  cmos_read:				; read location (al) into (al)
 10013 000028FE 9C                      		pushf
 10014 000028FF FA                      		cli
 10015 00002900 53                      		push	bx
 10016                                  		;push	ax ; *		; AL = cmos table address to be read
 10017                                  		; 19/12/2023
 10018 00002901 89C3                    		mov	bx, ax ; * ; input
 10019 00002903 0C80                    		or	al, 80h
 10020 00002905 E670                    		out	70h, al		; CMOS Memory/RTC Index	Register:
 10021                                  					; RTC Seconds
 10022 00002907 90                      		nop			; (undocumented delay needed)
 10023 00002908 E471                    		in	al, 71h		; CMOS Memory/RTC Data Register
 10024                                  		
 10025                                  		;mov	bx, ax ; output
 10026                                  		;pop	ax ; * ; input
 10027                                  
 10028                                  		; 19/12/2023
 10029                                  		; al = output, bl = input
 10030 0000290A 93                      		xchg	ax, bx ; *
 10031                                  		; bl = output, al = input
 10032                                  	
 10033 0000290B 2480                    		and	al, 80h
 10034 0000290D 0C0F                    		or	al, 0Fh
 10035 0000290F E670                    		out	70h, al		; CMOS Memory/RTC Index	Register:
 10036                                  					; RTC Seconds
 10037 00002911 90                      		nop
 10038 00002912 E471                    		in	al, 71h		; CMOS Memory/RTC Data Register
 10039                                  		;mov	ax, bx ; * ; output
 10040                                  		; 19/12/2023
 10041 00002914 93                      		xchg	ax, bx
 10042 00002915 5B                      		pop	bx
 10043                                  
 10044                                  		; 19/12/2023
 10045                                  cmos_rw_popf:
 10046 00002916 0E                      		push	cs		; *place code segment in stack and
 10047 00002917 E80100                  		call	cmos_popf	; *handle popf for b- level 80286
 10048 0000291A C3                      		retn			; return with flags restored
 10049                                  
 10050                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10051                                  
 10052                                  cmos_popf:				
 10053 0000291B CF                      		iret			; popf for level b- parts
 10054                                  					; return far and restore flags

 10061                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10062                                  ; MSINIT.ASM (MSDOS 6.0, 1991)
 10063                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10064                                  ; The following routines provide support for reading in the file MSDOS.SYS.
 10065                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10066                                  
 10067                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 10068                                  ;
 10069                                  ; (For Retro DOS, 'IO.SYS' and 'MSDOS.SYS' are already loaded together
 10070                                  ;  at once -as single kernel file- by the Retro DOS boot sector code.
 10071                                  ;  So, following disk reads -MSDOS.SYS loading- is not needed!
 10072                                  ;  Only needing is to move MSDOS Kernel to it's final memory location.) 
 10073                                  
 10074                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10075                                  
 10076                                  ; GetClus, read in a cluster at a specified address
 10077                                  ;
 10078                                  ;  bx = cluster to read
 10079                                  ;  cx = sectors per cluster
 10080                                  ;  es:di = load location
 10081                                  
 10082                                  ; 17/10/2022
 10083                                  ;DISKRD equ diskrd - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h	; (8E5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 10084                                  ; 09/12/2022
 10085                                  DISKRD equ diskrd
 10086                                  
 10087                                  		; 29/12/2023
 10088                                  		; 20/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0
 10089                                  		; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSDATA:2DC4h)
 10090                                  
 10091                                  		; si:bx = (32 bit) cluster to read
 10092                                  		; cx = sectors per cluster
 10093                                  		; es:di = load location
 10094                                  
 10095                                  		; 17/10/2022
 10096                                  getclus:
 10097                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10098                                  		; ds = cs
 10099                                  		
 10100                                  		push	cx ; 1*
 10101                                  		push	di ; 2*
 10102                                  		;mov	[cs:doscnt], cx
 10103                                  		mov	[doscnt], cx ; 12/12/2023
 10104                                  
 10105                                  		; 20/12/2023
 10106                                  		;;mov	[cs:ClusterH], si ; high word of cluster number
 10107                                  		;mov	[ClusterH], si ; high word of cluster number
 10108                                  		mov	bp, si
 10109                                  
 10110                                  		mov	ax, bx
 10111                                  
 10112                                  		;dec	ax
 10113                                  		;dec	ax
 10114                                  		; 20/12/2023
 10115                                  		sub	ax, 2
 10116                                  
 10117                                  		;;sbb	[cs:ClusterH], 0
 10118                                  		;sbb	[ClusterH], 0
 10119                                  		sbb	bp, 0		
 10120                                  
 10121                                  		; 20/12/2023
 10122                                  		;;xchg	ax, [cs:ClusterH]
 10123                                  		;xchg	ax, [ClusterH]
 10124                                  		xchg	ax, bp
 10125                                  
 10126                                  		mul	cx
 10127                                  
 10128                                  		;;xchg	ax, [cs:ClusterH]
 10129                                  		;xchg	ax, [ClusterH]
 10130                                  		xchg	ax, bp ; (+)
 10131                                  		;
 10132                                  		mul	cx		;; convert to logical sector
 10133                                  					;; dx:ax = matching logical sector number
 10134                                  					;;	  starting from the data sector
 10135                                  		;;add	ax, [cs:bios_l]
 10136                                  		;;adc	dx, [cs:bios_h]	; dx:ax	= first	logical	sector to read
 10137                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10138                                  		;add	ax, [bios_l]
 10139                                  		;adc	dx, [bios_h]	; dx:ax	= first	logical	sector to read
 10140                                  
 10141                                  		; 20/12/2023
 10142                                  		;;add	dx, [cs:ClusterH]
 10143                                  		;add	ax, [cs:First_Data_Sector]
 10144                                  		;adc	dx, [cs:First_Data_Sector+2]
 10145                                  		add	dx, bp ; (+)
 10146                                  		;add	dx, [ClusterH]	; convert to logical sector
 10147                                  					; dx:ax	= matching logical sector number
 10148                                  					;	  starting from the data sector
 10149                                  		add	ax, [First_Data_Sector]
 10150                                  		adc	dx, [First_Data_Sector+2]
 10151                                  					; dx:ax = first logical sector to read
 10152                                  unpack:
 10153                                  		; 20/12/2023
 10154                                  		push	ds ; 3* ; ds = cs ; 12/12/2023
 10155                                  		push	dx ; 4* ; * ; 12/12/2023
 10156                                  		push	ax ; 5*
 10157                                  		; 29/12/2023
 10158                                  		push	si ; 6* 
 10159                                  		push	bx ; 7*
 10160                                  
 10161                                  		;;mov	si, [cs:fatloc]
 10162                                  		;mov	si, [fatloc] ; 12/12/2023
 10163                                  		;mov	ds, si
 10164                                  		; 20/12/2023
 10165                                  		;mov	ax, [fatloc]
 10166                                  		;mov	ds, ax
 10167                                  		push	bx ; 8*
 10168                                  		push	word [fatloc] ; 9*
 10169                                  
 10170                                  		;test	byte [cs:fbigfat], 20h
 10171                                  		test	byte [fbigfat], 20h	; fbigbig FAT32 ?
 10172                                  		pop	ds ; 9* ; ds = [fatloc]
 10173                                  		jz      short not_32bit_cluster ; no
 10174                                  unpack32:
 10175                                  		;push	dx
 10176                                  		mov	dx, si
 10177                                  		;mov	si, bx
 10178                                  		pop	si ; 8* ; si = bx
 10179                                  		add	si, si
 10180                                  		adc	dx, dx
 10181                                  		add	si, si
 10182                                  		adc	dx, dx 
 10183                                  			; dx:si = 4*(si:bx) ; clust num offset from FAT entry 0
 10184                                  		call	get_fat_sector
 10185                                  		mov	si, [bx+2]	; high word of the FAT32 cluster number
 10186                                  		mov	bx, [bx]	; low word of the FAT32 cluster number
 10187                                  		;pop	dx
 10188                                  		jmp	short getcl1
 10189                                  
 10190                                  not_32bit_cluster:
 10191                                  		;mov	si, bx		; next cluster
 10192                                  		pop	si ; 8* ; si = bx
 10193                                  		test	byte [cs:fbigfat], 40h	; fbig
 10194                                  					; 16 bit fat?
 10195                                  		jnz	short unpack16	; yes
 10196                                  unpack12:
 10197                                  		shr	si, 1		; 12 bit fat. si = si/2
 10198                                  					; si = clus + clus/2
 10199                                  		add	si, bx		;
 10200                                  					; (si =	byte offset of the cluster in the FAT)
 10201                                  		;push	dx ; 12/12/2023
 10202                                  		xor	dx, dx
 10203                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10204                                  		; ds = FAT buffer segment
 10205                                  		call	get_fat_sector
 10206                                  		;pop	dx ; 12/12/2023
 10207                                  
 10208                                  		mov	ax, [bx]	; save it into ax
 10209                                  		jnz	short even_odd	; if not a splitted fat, check even-odd.
 10210                                  		; 25/06/2023
 10211                                  		;mov	al, [bx]	; splitted fat
 10212                                  		
 10213                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10214                                  		;mov	[cs:temp_cluster], al
 10215                                  		push	ax ; **	; al = low 8 bits of 12 bits cluster number
 10216                                  
 10217                                   		inc	si		; (next	byte)
 10218                                  
 10219                                  		;push	dx ; 12/12/2023
 10220                                  		xor	dx, dx
 10221                                  		call	get_fat_sector
 10222                                  		;pop	dx ; 12/12/2023
 10223                                  
 10224                                  		;mov	al, ds:0
 10225                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10226                                  		; ds = FAT buffer segment
 10227                                  		;mov	al, [0] ; 19/10/2022
 10228                                  		;mov	[cs:temp_cluster+1], al
 10229                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:temp_cluster]
 10230                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10231                                  		;mov	al, [cs:temp_cluster]
 10232                                  		pop	ax  ; ** ; al = low 8 bits of 12 bits cluster number
 10233                                  		mov	ah, [0] ; high 4 bits (bits 7 to 11) of 12 bits cluster num
 10234                                  even_odd:
 10235                                  		; 29/12/2023
 10236                                  		pop	bx ; 7*		; restore old fat entry	value
 10237                                  		push	bx		; save it right	away.
 10238                                  		shr	bx, 1		; was it even or odd?
 10239                                  		jnc	short havclus	; it was even.
 10240                                  		shr	ax, 1		; odd. massage fat value and keep
 10241                                  					; the highest 12 bits.
 10242                                  		shr	ax, 1
 10243                                  		shr	ax, 1
 10244                                  		shr	ax, 1
 10245                                  havclus:
 10246                                  		mov	bx, ax		; now bx = new fat entry.
 10247                                  		and	bx, 0FFFh	; keep low 12 bits.
 10248                                  		jmp	short unpackx
 10249                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10250                                  
 10251                                  unpack16:
 10252                                  		;push	dx	; 12/12/2023
 10253                                  		xor	dx, dx ; 0
 10254                                  		shl	si, 1		; extend to 32 bit offset
 10255                                  		;adc	dx, 0
 10256                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10257                                  		rcl	dx, 1
 10258                                  
 10259                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10260                                  		; ds = FAT buffer segment
 10261                                  		call	get_fat_sector
 10262                                  		;pop	dx	; 12/12/2023
 10263                                  		mov	bx, [bx]	;
 10264                                  					; bx = new fat entry.
 10265                                  unpackx:
 10266                                  		; 20/12/2023
 10267                                  		xor	si, si		; high word of cluster number = 0
 10268                                  					; (FAT12 or FAT16)
 10269                                  getcl1:
 10270                                  		; 29/12/2023
 10271                                  		pop	ax	; 7* - cluster number lw
 10272                                  		;pop	word [cs:ClusterH]
 10273                                  		pop	dx	; 6* - cluster number hw
 10274                                  
 10275                                  		; 20/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM)
 10276                                  		; (this is a fast kernel loading method by the MSDOS programmer)
 10277                                  		; ((consequtive clusters --> consequtive sectors))
 10278                                  
 10279                                  		sub	ax, bx	; previous - current (or current - new)	
 10280                                  		;sbb	[cs:ClusterH], si
 10281                                  		sbb	dx, si
 10282                                  		;;cmp	[cs:ClusterH], -1 ; one apart? (current = previous+1)
 10283                                  		;cmp	dx, -1
 10284                                  		; 29/12/2023
 10285                                  		inc	dx ; -1 -> 0
 10286                                  		jnz	short not_consequental
 10287                                  		;cmp	ax, -1		; 0FFFFh ; is [ClusterH]:ax = -1 ?
 10288                                  		inc	ax ; -1 -> 0
 10289                                  not_consequental:
 10290                                  		pop	ax ; 5* 	; restore logical sector (low)
 10291                                  		pop	dx ; 4* ; * ; 12/12/2023
 10292                                  		pop	ds ; 3*
 10293                                  
 10294                                  		;; 12/12/2023
 10295                                  		;; (this is a fast kernel loading method by the MSDOS programmer)
 10296                                  		;; ((consequtive clusters --> consequtive sectors))
 10297                                  		;; ds = cs
 10298                                  		;sub	si, bx
 10299                                  		;cmp	si, -1		; one apart? (consequtive?)
 10300                                  		;			; (current = previous+1)
 10301                                  
 10302                                  		jnz	short getcl2	; no, read [doscnt] sectors 
 10303                                  
 10304                                  		;add	[cs:doscnt], cx ; (cx = sectors per cluster)
 10305                                  		add	[doscnt], cx ; 12/12/2023 ; add to read count
 10306                                  		jmp	unpack
 10307                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10308                                  
 10309                                  getcl2:
 10310                                  		push	si ; 20/12/2023
 10311                                  		push	bx	
 10312                                  		; bx = low word of the new cluster number
 10313                                  		; 20/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0 (32 bit cluster numbers)
 10314                                  		; si = high word of the new cluster number
 10315                                  		push	dx		; sector to read (high word)
 10316                                  		push	ax		; sector to read (low word)
 10317                                  		
 10318                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10319                                  		; ds = cs
 10320                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:drvfat]	; get drive and	fat spec
 10321                                  		;mov	cx, [cs:doscnt]
 10322                                  		mov	ax, [drvfat]	; get drive and	fat spec
 10323                                  
 10324                                  		;;;
 10325                                  		; 20/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM)
 10326                                  		;
 10327                                  		; dma and segment (64K boundary) overrun precaution
 10328                                  		; (sector count will be decreased if it is required)
 10329                                   		mov	cx, di
 10330                                  		not	cx		; cx = 65535 - cx
 10331                                  		shr	cx, 1		; cx = cx/2
 10332                                  		xor	cl, cl
 10333                                  		xchg	cl, ch		; cx = cx/256
 10334                                  		
 10335                                  		;cmp	cx, [cs:doscnt]	
 10336                                  				; if sector read count > cx, decrease it to cx
 10337                                  		cmp	cx, [doscnt]
 10338                                  		jbe	short getcl3
 10339                                  		;;;
 10340                                  		;mov	cx, [cs:doscnt]
 10341                                  		mov	cx, [doscnt]
 10342                                  getcl3:
 10343                                  		pop	dx		; sector to read for diskrd (low)
 10344                                  		;pop	word [cs:start_sec_h]
 10345                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10346                                  		pop	word [start_sec_h]
 10347                                  					; sector to read for diskrd (high)
 10348                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10349                                  		; ds = cs
 10350                                  		;push	ds
 10351                                  		;push	cs
 10352                                  		;pop	ds
 10353                                  		
 10354                                  		push	cs		; simulate far call
 10355                                  
 10356                                  		; 20/12/2023
 10357                                  		; 17/10/2022
 10358                                  		mov	bp, DISKRD	; offset diskrd
 10359                                  		;mov	bp, 0A2Bh	; 20/12/2023
 10360                                  		;	(PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:0A2Bh ; 364h:0A2Bh)
 10361                                  		;mov	bp, 8E5h	; 17/10/2022
 10362                                  					; 2C7h:8E5h = 70h:2E55h
 10363                                  
 10364                                  		call	call_bios_code	; read the clusters
 10365                                  		
 10366                                  		;pop	ds
 10367                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10368                                  		; ds = cs
 10369                                  		pop	bx		; lw of the new cluster number
 10370                                  		pop	si ; 20/12/2023 ; hw of the new cluster number
 10371                                  
 10372                                  		pop	di ; 2* - (kernel) load location (es:di)
 10373                                  
 10374                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:doscnt]	; get number of	sectors	read
 10375                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10376                                  		mov	ax, [doscnt]
 10377                                  		xchg	ah, al		; multiply by 256
 10378                                  		shl	ax, 1		; times	2 equal	512
 10379                                  		add	di, ax		; update load location
 10380                                  
 10381                                  		pop	cx ; 1*		; restore sectors/cluster
 10382                                  
 10383                                  		retn
 10384                                  
 10385                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 10386                                  
 10387                                  ;function: find and read the corresponding fat sector into ds:0
 10388                                  ;
 10389                                  ;in). dx:si - offset value (starting from fat entry 0) of fat entry to find. M054
 10390                                  ;     ds - fatloc segment
 10391                                  ;     cs:drvfat - logical drive number, fat id
 10392                                  ;     cs:md_sectorsize
 10393                                  ;     cs:last_fat_secnum - last fat sector number read in.
 10394                                  ;
 10395                                  ;out). corresponding fat sector read in.
 10396                                  ;      bx = offset value from fatlog segment.
 10397                                  ;      other registers are saved.
 10398                                  ;      zero flag set if the fat entry is splitted, i.e., when 12 bit fat entry
 10399                                  ;      starts at the last byte of the fat sector. in this case, the caller
 10400                                  ;      should save this byte, and read the next fat sector to get the rest
 10401                                  ;      of the fat entry value. (this will only happen with the 12 bit fat.)
 10402                                  
 10403                                  		; 17/10/2022
 10404                                  get_fat_sector:	
 10405                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10406                                  		; ds = fat buffer segment
 10407                                  
 10408                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10409                                  		;push	ax ; (not necessary)
 10410                                  		push	cx ; read count (sectors per cluster)
 10411                                  		push	di ; IBMDOS.COM/MSDOS.SYS load offset
 10412                                  		push	si ; FAT offset value (from fat entry 0)
 10413                                  		push	es ; IBMDOS.COM/MSDOS.SYS load segment
 10414                                  		push	ds ; FAT buffer segment
 10415                                  
 10416                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10417                                  		push	cs
 10418                                  		pop	ds
 10419                                  	
 10420                                  		mov	ax, si
 10421                                  		;;mov	cx, [cs:md_sectorsize] ; 512
 10422                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10423                                  		;mov	cx, [md_sectorsize] ; 512
 10424                                  		;div	cx		; ax = sector number, dx = offset
 10425                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10426                                  		;nop
 10427                                  
 10428                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10429                                  		div	word [md_sectorsize] ; 512
 10430                                  
 10431                                  		; ax = FAT sector (sequence/index) number
 10432                                  		; dx = cluster number offset
 10433                                  
 10434                                  		; Get rid of the assumption that
 10435                                  		; there	is only	one reserved sector
 10436                                  
 10437                                  		; 12/12/2023 ; *
 10438                                  		;push	es ; *
 10439                                  		;push	ds ; *
 10440                                  		;push	di ; *
 10441                                  		push	ax
 10442                                  		;push	cs ; *
 10443                                  		;pop	ds ; *
 10444                                  
 10445                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:drvfat]	; get drive # and FAT id
 10446                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10447                                  		mov	ax, [drvfat]	; get drive # and FAT id 
 10448                                  		mov	bp, SETDRIVE
 10449                                  		;mov	bp, 5AEh  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM
 10450                                  		;;mov	bp, 4D7h	; setdrive
 10451                                  					; at 2C7h:4D7h = 70h:2A47h
 10452                                  		push	cs		; simulate far call
 10453                                  		call	call_bios_code	; get bds for drive
 10454                                  		pop	ax		; (sector number -without reserved and hidden sectors-)
 10455                                  		add	ax, [es:di+9]	; [es:di+BDS.resectors]
 10456                                  					; add #reserved_sectors
 10457                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10458                                  		;pop	di ; *
 10459                                  		;pop	ds ; *
 10460                                  		;pop	es ; *
 10461                                  
 10462                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10463                                  		; ds = cs
 10464                                  		cmp	ax, [last_fat_sec_num]
 10465                                  		;cmp	ax, [cs:last_fat_sec_num]
 10466                                  		jz	short gfs_split_chk ; don't need to read it again.
 10467                                  		mov	[last_fat_sec_num], ax
 10468                                  		;mov	[cs:last_fat_sec_num], ax
 10469                                  					; sector number
 10470                                  					; (in the partition, without hidden sectors)
 10471                                  		; 13/12/2023
 10472                                  		pop	es ; FAT buffer segment (DS on top of the stack)
 10473                                  		push	es ; (put it on top of the stack again)
 10474                                  
 10475                                  		push	dx ; cluster number offset
 10476                                  
 10477                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10478                                  		xor	cx, cx
 10479                                  		mov	[start_sec_h], cx ;0 
 10480                                  		;mov	word [cs:start_sec_h], 0 
 10481                                  					; prepare to read the fat sector
 10482                                  					; start_sec_h is always	0 for fat sector.
 10483                                  		mov	dx, ax
 10484                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10485                                  		inc	cx ; cx = 1
 10486                                  		;mov	cx, 1		; 1 sector read
 10487                                  		;mov	ax, [cs:drvfat]
 10488                                  		mov	ax, [drvfat]
 10489                                  		;push	ds
 10490                                  		;pop	es
 10491                                  
 10492                                  		xor	di, di	; 0	; es:di	-> fatloc segment:0
 10493                                  		
 10494                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10495                                  		;push	ds
 10496                                  		;push	cs
 10497                                  		;pop	ds
 10498                                  		
 10499                                  		push	cs		; simulate far call
 10500                                  		mov	bp, DISKRD	; 8E5h
 10501                                  		;mov	bp, 8E5h	; offset diskrd
 10502                                  					; 2C7h:8E5h = 70h:2E55h
 10503                                  		call	call_bios_code
 10504                                  
 10505                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10506                                  		;pop	ds
 10507                                  		; ds = cs = biosdata segment
 10508                                  
 10509                                  		pop	dx ; cluster number offset 
 10510                                  
 10511                                  gfs_split_chk:
 10512                                  		; 13/12/2023
 10513                                  		;mov	cx, [cs:md_sectorsize] ; 512
 10514                                  		mov	cx, [md_sectorsize]
 10515                                  ;gfs_split_chk:					
 10516                                  		dec	cx		; 511
 10517                                  		cmp	dx, cx		; if offset points to the
 10518                                  					; last byte of this sector,
 10519                                  					; then splitted	entry.
 10520                                  		mov	bx, dx		; set bx to dx
 10521                                  		
 10522                                  		; 12/12/2023
 10523                                  		; bx = dx = cluster number offset in the FAT buffer
 10524                                  		pop	ds ; FAT buffer segment
 10525                                  		pop	es ; IBMDOS.COM/MSDOS.SYS load segment
 10526                                  		pop	si ; FAT offset value (from fat entry 0)
 10527                                  		pop	di ; IBMDOS.COM/MSDOS.SYS load offset
 10528                                  		pop	cx ; read count (sectors per cluster)
 10529                                  		;pop	ax
 10530                                  
 10531                                  		retn
 10532                                  ; 15/10/2022
 10533                                  ;Bios_Data_Init	ends
 10534                                  
 10535                                  %endif
 10536                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10537                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 10538                                  
 10539                                  		; 09/12/2022
 10540                                  		;db 0
 10541                                  
 10542                                  numbertodiv	equ ($-BData_start)
 10543                                  numbertomod	equ (numbertodiv % 16)
 10544                                  
 10545                                  %if (numbertomod>0) & (numbertomod<16) ; 17/09/2023
 10546 0000291C 00<rep 4h>              		times (16-numbertomod) db 0
 10547                                  %endif
 10548

 10550                                  
 10551                                  ; 09/12/2022
 10552                                  IOSYSCODESEGOFF equ $ - BData_start
 10553                                  ; 29/09/2023
 10554                                  ;IOSYSCODESEGOFF equ $-$$
 10555                                  IOSYSCODESEG	equ (IOSYSCODESEGOFF>>4)+(700h>>4)
 10556                                  
 10557                                  ; 28/09/2023
 10558                                  S1SIZE equ $-$$
