 11466 0000030F E9C3FD                  		jmp	bc_cmderr ; (bc_cmderr sets cf to 1)
 11467                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11468                                  
 11469                                  ;************************************************************************
 11470                                  ;*									*
 11471                                  ;*	aux port driver code -- "aux" == "com1"				*
 11472                                  ;*									*
 11473                                  ;*	the device driver entry/dispatch code sets up auxnum to		*
 11474                                  ;*	give the com port number to use (0=com1, 1=com2, 2=com3...)	*
 11475                                  ;*									*
 11476                                  ;************************************************************************
 11477                                  
 11478                                  ;	values in ah, requesting function of int 14h in rom bios
 11479                                  
 11480                                  ;auxfunc_send	 equ	1	;transmit
 11481                                  ;auxfunc_receive equ	2	;read
 11482                                  ;auxfunc_status	 equ	3	;request status
 11483                                  
 11484                                  ;	error flags, reported by int 14h, reported in ah:
 11485                                  
 11486                                  ;flag_data_ready equ	01h	;data ready
 11487                                  ;flag_overrun	 equ	02h	;overrun error
 11488                                  ;flag_parity	 equ	04h	;parity error
 11489                                  ;flag_frame	 equ	08h	;framing error
 11490                                  ;flag_break	 equ	10h	;break detect
 11491                                  ;flag_tranhol_emp equ	20h	;transmit holding register empty
 11492                                  ;flag_timeout	 equ	80h	;timeout
 11493                                  
 11494                                  ;	these flags reported in al:
 11495                                  
 11496                                  ;flag_cts	 equ	10h	;clear to send
 11497                                  ;flag_dsr	 equ	20h	;data set ready
 11498                                  ;flag_rec_sig	 equ	80h	;receive line signal detect
 11499                                  
 11500                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11501                                  
 11502                                  ;************************************************************************
 11503                                  ;*									*
 11504                                  ;*	aux_read - read cx bytes from [auxnum] aux port to buffer	*
 11505                                  ;*		   at es:di						*
 11506                                  ;*									*
 11507                                  ;************************************************************************
 11508                                  
 11509                                  aux_read:				; 2C7h:30Dh = 70h:287Dh
 11510                                  		;jcxz	short exvec2
 11511 00000312 E311                    		jcxz	exvec2		; 19/10/2022
 11512 00000314 E88000                  		call	getbx		; put address of auxbuf	in bx
 11513 00000317 30C0                    		xor	al, al
 11514 00000319 8607                    		xchg	al, [bx]
 11515 0000031B 08C0                    		or	al, al
 11516 0000031D 7503                    		jnz	short aux2
 11517                                  aux1:					
 11518 0000031F E80500                  		call	auxin		; get character	from port
 11519                                  					; won't return if error
 11520                                  aux2:					
 11521 00000322 AA                      		stosb
 11522 00000323 E2FA                    		loop	aux1		; if more characters, go around	again
 11523                                  exvec2:					
 11524 00000325 F8                      		clc			; all done, successful exit
 11525                                  auxin_retn:	; 18/12/2022
 11526 00000326 C3                      		retn
 11527                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11528                                  
 11529                                  ;************************************************************************
 11530                                  ;*									*
 11531                                  ;*	auxin - call rom bios to read character from aux port		*
 11532                                  ;*		if error occurs, map the error and return one		*
 11533                                  ;*		level up to device driver exit code, setting		*
 11534                                  ;*		the number of bytes transferred appropriately		*
 11535                                  ;*									*
 11536                                  ;************************************************************************
 11537                                  
 11538                                  auxin:					
 11539 00000327 B402                    		mov	ah, 2		; auxfunc_receive
 11540 00000329 E83A00                  		call	auxop
 11541 0000032C F6C40E                  		test	ah, 0Eh		; flag_frame|flag_parity|flag_overrun
 11542                                  		;jnz	short arbad	; skip if any error bits set
 11543                                  		;retn
 11544                                  		; 25/06/2023 (BugFix)
 11545 0000032F 74F5                    		jz	short auxin_retn
 11546                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11547                                  
 11548                                  arbad:					
 11549 00000331 58                      		pop	ax		; remove return	address	(near call)
 11550                                  		;xor	al, al
 11551                                  		;or	al, 0B0h	; flag_rec_sig|	flag_dsr|flag_cts
 11552                                  		; 11/08/2023
 11553 00000332 B0B0                    		mov	al, 0B0h	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:0334h
 11554 00000334 E9A0FD                  		jmp	bc_err_cnt
 11555                                  
 11556                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11557                                  
 11558                                  ;************************************************************************
 11559                                  ;*									*
 11560                                  ;*	aux_rdnd - non-destructive aux port read			*
 11561                                  ;*									*
 11562                                  ;************************************************************************
 11563                                  
 11564                                  aux_rdnd:				; 2C7h:335h = 70h:28A5h
 11565 00000337 E85D00                  		call	getbx
 11566 0000033A 8A07                    		mov	al, [bx]	; have bx point	to auxbuf
 11567 0000033C 08C0                    		or	al, al		; if al	is non-zero (char in buffer)
 11568 0000033E 7511                    		jnz	short auxdrx	; then return character
 11569 00000340 E82100                  		call	auxstat		; if not, get status of	aux device
 11570 00000343 F6C401                  		test	ah, 1		; flag_data_ready - test data ready
 11571 00000346 740C                    		jz	short auxbus	; then device is busy (not ready)
 11572 00000348 A820                    		test	al, 20h		; flag_dsr - test data set ready
 11573 0000034A 7408                    		jz	short auxbus	; then device is busy (not ready)
 11574 0000034C E8D8FF                  		call	auxin		; else aux is ready, get character
 11575 0000034F 8807                    		mov	[bx], al
 11576                                  auxdrx:					
 11577 00000351 E99EFE                  		jmp	rdexit		; return busy status
 11578                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11579                                  
 11580                                  auxbus:					
 11581 00000354 E970FE                  		jmp	z_bus_exit
 11582                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11583                                  
 11584                                  ;************************************************************************
 11585                                  ;*									*
 11586                                  ;*	aux_wrst - return aux port write status				*
 11587                                  ;*									*
 11588                                  ;************************************************************************
 11589                                  
 11590                                  aux_wrst:				; 2C7h:355h = 70h:28C5h
 11591 00000357 E80A00                  		call	auxstat		; get status of	aux in ax
 11592 0000035A A820                    		test	al, 20h		; test data set	ready
 11593 0000035C 74F6                    		jz	short auxbus	; then device is busy (not ready)
 11594 0000035E F6C420                  		test	ah, 20h		; flag_tranhol_emp - test transmit hold	reg empty
 11595 00000361 74F1                    		jz	short auxbus	; then device is busy (not ready)
 11596                                  		; 12/12/2022
 11597                                  		; cf=0	; (test instruction resets cf)
 11598                                  		;clc
 11599 00000363 C3                      		retn
 11600                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11601                                  
 11602                                  ;************************************************************************
 11603                                  ;*									*
 11604                                  ;*	auxstat - call rom bios to determine aux port status		*
 11605                                  ;*									*
 11606                                  ;*	exit:	ax = status						*
 11607                                  ;*		dx = [auxnum]						*
 11608                                  ;*									*
 11609                                  ;************************************************************************
 11610                                  
 11611                                  auxstat:				
 11612 00000364 B403                    		mov	ah, 3		; auxfunc_status
 11613                                  
 11614                                  		; fall into auxop
 11615                                  
 11616                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 11617                                  
 11618                                  ;************************************************************************
 11619                                  ;*									*
 11620                                  ;*	auxop - perform rom-biox aux port interrupt			*
 11621                                  ;*									*
 11622                                  ;*	entry:	ah = int 14h function number				*
 11623                                  ;*	exit:	ax = results						*
 11624                                  ;*		dx = [auxnum]						*
 11625                                  ;*									*
 11626                                  ;************************************************************************
 11627                                  
 11628                                  auxop:		; proc near
 11629                                  		; 20/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0
 11630                                  		;mov	dx, [auxnum]	; ah=function code
 11631                                  		;			; 0=init, 1=send, 2=receive, 3=status
 11632                                  		;			; get port number
 11633                                  		;
 11634                                  		;int	14h		; SERIAL I/O - GET USART STATUS
 11635                                  		;			; DX = port number (0-3)
 11636                                  		;			; Return: AX = port status code
 11637                                  		; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM)
 11638 00000366 1E                      		push	ds
 11639 00000367 FF36[2100]              		push	word [auxnum]
 11640 0000036B 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx ; 0
 11641 0000036D 8EDA                    		mov	ds, dx
 11642 0000036F 5A                      		pop	dx
 11643 00000370 9C                      		pushf			; simulate INT 14h
 11644 00000371 FA                      		cli
 11645                                  		;call	dword ptr ds:50h
 11646 00000372 FF1E5000                		call	far [14h*4]	; INT 14h vector (14h*4 = 50h)
 11647 00000376 1F                      		pop	ds
 11648 00000377 C3                      		retn
 11649                                  
 11650                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11651                                  
 11652                                  ;************************************************************************
 11653                                  ;*									*
 11654                                  ;*	aux_flsh - flush aux input buffer - set contents of		*
 11655                                  ;*		   auxbuf [auxnum] to zero				*
 11656                                  ;*									*
 11657                                  ;*	cas - shouldn't this code call the rom bios input function	*
 11658                                  ;*	      repeatedly until it isn't ready?  to flush out any	*
 11659                                  ;*	      pending serial input queue if there's a tsr like MODE	*
 11660                                  ;*	      which is providing interrupt-buffering of aux port?	*
 11661                                  ;*									*
 11662                                  ;************************************************************************
 11663                                  
 11664                                  aux_flsh:				; 2C7h:36Ch = 70h:28DCh
 11665 00000378 E81C00                  		call	getbx		; flush	aux input buffer
 11666 0000037B C60700                  		mov	byte [bx], 0	; get bx to point to auxbuf
 11667                                  					; zero out buffer
 11668                                  		;clc			; all done, successful return
 11669                                  		; 12/12/2022
 11670                                  		; cf=0 ('add' instruction in 'getbx')
 11671 0000037E C3                      		retn
 11672                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11673                                  
 11674                                  ;************************************************************************
 11675                                  ;*									*
 11676                                  ;*	aux_writ - write to aux device					*
 11677                                  ;*									*
 11678                                  ;************************************************************************
 11679                                  
 11680                                  aux_writ:				; 2C7h:374h = 70h:28E4h
 11681                                  		;jcxz	short exvec2	; write	to aux device (if cx > 0)
 11682 0000037F E3A4                    		jcxz	exvec2		; 19/10/2022
 11683                                  aux_loop:				
 11684 00000381 268A05                  		mov	al, [es:di]	; get character	to be written
 11685                                  					; move di pointer to next character
 11686 00000384 47                      		inc	di
 11687 00000385 B401                    		mov	ah, 1		; auxfunc_send - indicates a write
 11688 00000387 E8DCFF                  		call	auxop		; send character over aux port
 11689 0000038A F6C480                  		test	ah, 80h		; check	for error
 11690 0000038D 7405                    		jz	short awok	; then no error
 11691 0000038F B00A                    		mov	al, 10		; else indicate	write fault
 11692 00000391 E943FD                  		jmp	bc_err_cnt	; call error routines
 11693                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11694                                  
 11695                                  awok:					
 11696 00000394 E2EB                    		loop	aux_loop	; if cx	is non-zero,
 11697                                  					; still	more character to print
 11698                                  		;clc			; all done, successful return
 11699                                  		; 12/12/2022
 11700                                  		; cf=0 (test instruction above)	
 11701 00000396 C3                      		retn
 11702

 11704

 11708                                  ;*		selected aux port ([auxnum])				*
 11709                                  ;*									*
 11710                                  ;************************************************************************
 11711                                  
 11712                                  getbx:	
 11713 00000397 8B1E[2100]              		mov	bx, [auxnum]	; return bx -> single byte input buffer
 11714                                  					; for selected aux port	([auxnum])
 11715                                  		;add	bx, offset auxbuf
 11716 0000039B 81C3[1600]              		add	bx, auxbuf	; 19/10/2022
 11717                                  		; 12/12/2022
 11718                                  		; cf=0 (if [auxnum] is valid number) 
 11719 0000039F C3                      		retn

 11724                                  
 11725                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------
 11726                                  ;								:
 11727                                  ;		    clock device driver 			:
 11728                                  ;								:
 11729                                  ;								:
 11730                                  ;   this file contains the clock device driver. 		:
 11731                                  ;								:
 11732                                  ;   the routines in this files are:				:
 11733                                  ;								:
 11734                                  ;	routine 		function			:
 11735                                  ;	------- 		--------			:
 11736                                  ;	tim_writ		set the current time		:
 11737                                  ;	tim_read		read the current time		:
 11738                                  ;	time_to_ticks		convert time to corresponding	:
 11739                                  ;				  number of clock ticks 	:
 11740                                  ;								:
 11741                                  ; the clock ticks at the rate of:				:
 11742                                  ;								:
 11743                                  ;	1193180/65536 ticks/second (about 18.2 ticks per second):
 11744                                  ; see each routine for information on the use.			:
 11745                                  ;								:
 11746                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------
 11747                                  
 11748                                  ; convert time to ticks
 11749                                  ; input : time in cx and dx
 11750                                  ; ticks returned in cx:dx
 11751                                  
 11752                                  ;19/07/2019
 11753                                  ;09/03/2019
 11754                                  
 11755                                  time_to_ticks:				; 0070h:2906h =	02C7h:0396h
 11756                                  
 11757                                  ; first convert from hour,min,sec,hund. to
 11758                                  ; total number of 100th of seconds
 11759                                  
 11760 000003A0 B03C                    		mov	al, 60
 11761 000003A2 F6E5                    		mul	ch		; hours	to minutes
 11762 000003A4 B500                    		mov	ch, 0
 11763 000003A6 01C8                    		add	ax, cx		; total	minutes
 11764 000003A8 B97017                  		mov	cx, 6000	; 60*100
 11765 000003AB 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; get out of the way of	the multiply
 11766 000003AD F7E1                    		mul	cx		; convert to 1/100 sec
 11767 000003AF 89C1                    		mov	cx, ax
 11768 000003B1 B064                    		mov	al, 100
 11769 000003B3 F6E7                    		mul	bh		; convert seconds to 1/100 sec
 11770 000003B5 01C1                    		add	cx, ax		; combine seconds with hours and min
 11771 000003B7 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0		; ripple carry
 11772 000003BA B700                    		mov	bh, 0
 11773 000003BC 01D9                    		add	cx, bx		; combine 1/100	sec
 11774 000003BE 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0
 11775                                  
 11776                                  	; dx:cx is time in 1/100 sec
 11777                                  
 11778 000003C1 92                      		xchg	ax, dx
 11779 000003C2 91                      		xchg	ax, cx		; now time is in cx:ax
 11780 000003C3 BB0BE9                  		mov	bx, 59659
 11781 000003C6 F7E3                    		mul	bx		; multiply low half
 11782 000003C8 87CA                    		xchg	dx, cx
 11783 000003CA 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; cx->ax, ax->dx, dx->cx
 11784 000003CB F7E3                    		mul	bx		; multiply high	half
 11785 000003CD 01C8                    		add	ax, cx		; combine overlapping products
 11786 000003CF 83D200                  		adc	dx, 0
 11787 000003D2 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; ax:dx=time*59659
 11788 000003D3 BB0500                  		mov	bx, 5
 11789 000003D6 F6F3                    		div	bl		; divide high half by 5
 11790 000003D8 88C1                    		mov	cl, al
 11791 000003DA B500                    		mov	ch, 0
 11792 000003DC 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; remainder of divide-by-5
 11793 000003DE 98                      		cbw
 11794 000003DF 92                      		xchg	ax, dx		; use it to extend low half
 11795 000003E0 F7F3                    		div	bx		; divide low half by 5
 11796 000003E2 89C2                    		mov	dx, ax		; cx:dx	is now number of ticks in time
 11797 000003E4 CB                      		retf			; far return
 11798                                  
 11799                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11800                                  
 11801                                  ; 17/10/2022
 11802                                  ; 15/10/2022
 11803                                  
 11804                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------
 11805                                  ;
 11806                                  ; tim_writ sets the current time
 11807                                  ;
 11808                                  ; on entry es:[di] has the current time:
 11809                                  ;
 11810                                  ;	number of days since 1-1-80	(word)
 11811                                  ;	minutes (0-59)			(byte)
 11812                                  ;	hours (0-23)			(byte)
 11813                                  ;	hundredths of seconds (0-99)	(byte)
 11814                                  ;	seconds (0-59)			(byte)
 11815                                  ;
 11816                                  ; each number has been checked for the correct range.
 11817                                  ;
 11818                                  ;	NOTE: Any changes in this routine probably require corresponding
 11819                                  ;	changes in the version that is built with the power manager driver.
 11820                                  ;	See ptime.asm.
 11821                                  ;
 11822                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------
 11823                                  
 11824                                  	; 08/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 11825                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:03EAh
 11826                                  tim_writ:				; 2C7h:3DBh = 70h:294Bh
 11827 000003E5 268B05                  		mov	ax, [es:di]
 11828 000003E8 50                      		push	ax		; daycnt. we need to set this at the very
 11829                                  					; end to avoid tick windows.
 11830 000003E9 803E[8C04]00            		cmp	byte [havecmosclock], 0
 11831                                  		;cmp	ds:havecmosclock, 0
 11832 000003EE 7423                    		jz	short no_cmos_1
 11833 000003F0 268A4503                		mov	al, [es:di+3]	; near indirect	calls
 11834                                  					; get binary hours
 11835                                  					; convert to bcd
 11836                                  		;call	far [bintobcd]
 11837                                  		;;call	ds:bintobcd	; call far [bintobcd]
 11838                                  		; 08/08/2023
 11839 000003F4 E8E800                  		call	bintobcd
 11840 000003F7 88C5                    		mov	ch, al		; ch = bcd hours
 11841 000003F9 268A4502                		mov	al, [es:di+2]	; get binary minutes
 11842                                  		;call	far [bintobcd]
 11843                                  		;;call	ds:bintobcd	; convert to bcd
 11844 000003FD E8DF00                  		call	bintobcd
 11845 00000400 88C1                    		mov	cl, al		; cl = bcd minutes
 11846 00000402 268A4505                		mov	al, [es:di+5]	; get binary seconds
 11847                                  		;call	far [bintobcd]
 11848                                  		;;call	ds:bintobcd
 11849 00000406 E8D600                  		call	bintobcd
 11850                                  
 11851 00000409 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; dh = bcd seconds
 11852 0000040B B200                    		mov	dl, 0		; dl = 0 (st) or 1 (dst)
 11853 0000040D FA                      		cli
 11854 0000040E B403                    		mov	ah, 3
 11855 00000410 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET REAL TIME	CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
 11856                                  					; CH = hours in	BCD, CL	= minutes in BCD
 11857                                  					;  DH =	seconds	in BCD,DL = 01h	if daylight savings, 00h if standard time
 11858                                  					; Return: CMOS clock set
 11859 00000412 FB                      		sti
 11860                                  no_cmos_1:				
 11861 00000413 268B4D02                		mov	cx, [es:di+2]
 11862 00000417 268B5504                		mov	dx, [es:di+4]
 11863                                  		; 17/10/2022
 11864 0000041B FF1E[0606]              		call	far [ttticks]
 11865                                  		;call	dword ptr ds:ttticks ; call far	[ttticks]
 11866                                  					; convert time to ticks
 11867                                  					; cx:dx	now has	time in	ticks
 11868 0000041F FA                      		cli			; turn off timer
 11869 00000420 B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 11870 00000422 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET TIME OF DAY
 11871                                  					; CX:DX	= clock	count
 11872                                  					; Return: time of day set
 11873                                  		;pop	ds:daycnt
 11874 00000424 8F06[8904]              		pop	word [daycnt]
 11875 00000428 FB                      		sti
 11876                                  		;cmp	ds:havecmosclock, 0
 11877 00000429 803E[8C04]00            		cmp	byte [havecmosclock], 0
 11878 0000042E 7409                    		jz	short no_cmos_2
 11879                                  
 11880                                  		; 08/08/2023
 11881                                  		;call	far [daycnttoday]
 11882                                  		;;call	ds:daycnttoday	; call far [daycnttoday]
 11883                                  					; convert to bcd format
 11884 00000430 E80700                  		call	daycnttoday
 11885                                  
 11886 00000433 FA                      		cli
 11887 00000434 B405                    		mov	ah, 5
 11888 00000436 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- SET DATE IN REAL TIME	CLOCK (AT,XT286,CONV,PS)
 11889                                  					; DL = day in BCD, DH =	month in BCD, CL = year	in BCD
 11890                                  					; CH = century (19h or 20h)
 11891                                  					; Return: CMOS clock set
 11892 00000438 FB                      		sti
 11893                                  no_cmos_2:
 11894                                  		; 12/12/2022
 11895                                  		; cf=0
 11896                                  		;clc
 11897 00000439 C3                      		retn
 11898                                  
 11899                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11900                                  
 11901                                  ; 08/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 11902                                  ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:0440h
 11903                                  %if 1 
 11904                                  
 11905                                  ; CMOS Clock setting support routines used by MSCLOCK.
 11906                                  ; Warning!!! This code will be dynamically relocated by MSINIT.
 11907                                  
 11908                                  daycnttoday:	; proc near
 11909                                  
 11910                                  ; entry: [daycnt] = number of days since 1-1-80
 11911                                  ;
 11912                                  ; return: ch - century in bcd
 11913                                  ;	  cl - year in bcd
 11914                                  ;	  dh - month in bcd
 11915                                  ;	  dl - day in bcd
 11916                                  
 11917                                  		; 20/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0
 11918                                  
 11919                                  		; 08/08/2023 (ds:) (near proc)
 11920                                  		; 16/10/2022 (cs:) (far proc)		
 11921 0000043A FF36[8904]              		push	word [daycnt] ; save daycnt
 11922 0000043E 813E[8904]891C          		cmp	word [daycnt], 7305 ; (365*20+(20/4))
 11923                                  					; # days from 1-1-1980 to 1-1-2000
 11924 00000444 7308                    		jnb	short century20
 11925                                  		;mov	byte [base_century], 19
 11926                                  		;mov	byte [base_year], 80
 11927                                  		; 08/08/2023
 11928 00000446 C706[8D04]1350          		mov	word [base_century], 5013h
 11929 0000044C EB0C                    		jmp	short years
 11930                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 11931                                  		
 11932                                  century20:				
 11933                                  		;mov	byte [base_century], 20
 11934                                  		;mov	byte [base_year], 0
 11935                                  		; 08/08/2023
 11936 0000044E C706[8D04]1400          		mov	word [base_century], 20
 11937 00000454 812E[8904]891C          		sub	word [daycnt], 7305 ; (365*20+(20/4))
 11938                                  					; adjust daycnt
 11939                                  years:					
 11940 0000045A 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 11941 0000045C A1[8904]                		mov	ax, [daycnt]
 11942 0000045F BBB505                  		mov	bx, 1461	; (366+365*3)
 11943                                  					; # of days in a Leap year block
 11944 00000462 F7F3                    		div	bx		; AX = # of leap block,	DX = daycnt
 11945 00000464 8916[8904]              		mov	[daycnt], dx	; save daycnt left
 11946 00000468 B304                    		mov	bl, 4
 11947 0000046A F6E3                    		mul	bl		; AX = # of years. Less	than 100
 11948 0000046C 0006[8E04]              		add	[base_year], al ; So, ah = 0. Adjust year
 11949 00000470 FF06[8904]              		inc	word [daycnt]	; set daycnt to	1 base
 11950                                  		; 08/08/2023
 11951 00000474 BB6E01                  		mov	bx, 366
 11952 00000477 B90300                  		mov	cx, 3
 11953                                  		;cmp	word [daycnt], 366 ; daycnt=remainder of leap year
 11954 0000047A 391E[8904]              		cmp	[daycnt], bx ; 366
 11955 0000047E 7619                    		jbe	short leapyear	; within 366+355+355+355 days.
 11956 00000480 FE06[8E04]              		inc	byte [base_year] ; if daycnt <= 366, then leap year
 11957                                  		;sub	word [daycnt], 366 ; else daycnt--, base_year++ ;
 11958 00000484 291E[8904]              		sub	[daycnt], bx ; 366 ; 08/08/2023
 11959                                  		;mov	cx, 3		; And next three years are normal
 11960                                  		; 08/08/2023
 11961 00000488 4B                      		dec	bx ; 365
 11962                                  regularyear:	; 20/12/2023
 11963                                  		;cmp	word [daycnt], 365 ; for(i=1; i>3 or daycnt <=365; i++)
 11964 00000489 391E[8904]              		cmp	[daycnt], bx ; 365 ; 08/08/2023
 11965 0000048D 760F                    		jbe	short yeardone	; {if (daycnt >	365)
 11966 0000048F FE06[8E04]              		inc	byte [base_year] ; { daycnt -=	365
 11967                                  		;sub	word [daycnt], 365 ; }
 11968 00000493 291E[8904]              		sub	[daycnt], bx ; 365 ; 08/08/2023
 11969 00000497 E2F0                    		loop	regularyear	; }
 11970                                  					;
 11971                                  					; should never fall through loop
 11972                                  leapyear:	
 11973 00000499 C606[9004]1D            		mov	byte [february], 29 ; 08/08/2023			
 11974                                  		;mov	byte [month_tab+1], 29 ; leap year.
 11975                                  					; change month table.
 11976                                  yeardone:				
 11977 0000049E 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx
 11978 000004A0 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 11979 000004A2 A1[8904]                		mov	ax, [daycnt]
 11980                                  		;mov	si, offset month_tab
 11981 000004A5 BE[8F04]                		mov	si, month_tab	; 19/10/2022
 11982                                  		;mov	cx, 12
 11983                                  		; 08/08/2023
 11984 000004A8 B10C                    		mov	cl, 12
 11985                                  months:					
 11986 000004AA FEC3                    		inc	bl
 11987                                  		; 08/08/2023
 11988 000004AC 8A14                    		mov	dl, [si]	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:04B7h
 11989 000004AE 39D0                    		cmp	ax, dx		; cmp daycnt for each month till fit
 11990                                  					; dh=0
 11991 000004B0 7605                    		jbe	short month_done
 11992 000004B2 46                      		inc	si		; next month
 11993 000004B3 29D0                    		sub	ax, dx		; adjust daycnt
 11994 000004B5 E2F3                    		loop	months		;
 11995                                  					; should never fall through loop
 11996                                  month_done:	
 11997 000004B7 C606[9004]1C            		mov	byte [february], 28 ; 08/08/2023
 11998                                  		;mov	byte [month_tab+1], 28
 11999                                  					; restore month table value
 12000 000004BC 88DA                    		mov	dl, bl
 12001 000004BE 8A36[8E04]              		mov	dh, [base_year]
 12002 000004C2 8A0E[8D04]              		mov	cl, [base_century] ; al=day,dl=month,dh=year,cl=cntry
 12003 000004C6 E81600                  		call	bintobcd	; convert "day"	to bcd
 12004                                  					; dl = bcd day,	al = month
 12005 000004C9 86C2                    		xchg	dl, al
 12006 000004CB E81100                  		call	bintobcd	; dh = bcd month, al = year
 12007 000004CE 86C6                    		xchg	dh, al
 12008 000004D0 E80C00                  		call	bintobcd	; cl = bcd year, al = century
 12009 000004D3 86C1                    		xchg	cl, al
 12010 000004D5 E80700                  		call	bintobcd	; ch = bcd century
 12011 000004D8 88C5                    		mov	ch, al
 12012 000004DA 8F06[8904]              		pop	word [daycnt] ; restore original value
 12013 000004DE C3                      		retn
 12014                                  
 12015                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12016                                  
 12017                                  bintobcd:	; proc near		; real time clock support
 12018                                  
 12019                                  ;convert a binary input in al (less than 63h or 99 decimal)
 12020                                  ;into a bcd value in al. ah destroyed.	
 12021                                  		
 12022 000004DF D40A                    		aam			; AH = AL/10, AL = AL MOD 10
 12023 000004E1 D510                    		aad     10h             ; db 0D5h,10h
 12024                                  					; AL = (AH*10H)+AL, AH = 0
 12025 000004E3 C3                      		retn
 12026                                  %endif
 12027                                  
 12028                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12029                                  
 12030                                  ; 15/10/2022
 12031                                  
 12032                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12033                                  ; gettime reads date and time
 12034                                  ; and returns the following information:
 12035                                  ;
 12036                                  ;	es:[di]  =count of days since 1-1-80
 12037                                  ;	es:[di+2]=hours
 12038                                  ;	es:[di+3]=minutes
 12039                                  ;	es:[di+4]=seconds
 12040                                  ;	es:[di+5]=hundredths of seconds
 12041                                  ;
 12042                                  ;	NOTE: Any changes in this routine probably require corresponding
 12043                                  ;	changes in the version that is built with the power manager driver.
 12044                                  ;	See ptime.asm.
 12045                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12046                                  
 12047                                  tim_read:				; 2C7h:435h = 70h:29A5h
 12048 000004E4 E84A00                  		call	GetTickCnt
 12049 000004E7 8B36[8904]              		mov	si, [daycnt]
 12050                                  
 12051                                  ; we now need to convert the time in tick to the time in 100th of
 12052                                  ; seconds. the relation between tick and seconds is:
 12053                                  ;
 12054                                  ;		 65,536 seconds
 12055                                  ;	       ----------------
 12056                                  ;		1,193,180 tick
 12057                                  ;
 12058                                  ; to get to 100th of second we need to multiply by 100. the equation is:
 12059                                  ;
 12060                                  ;	ticks from clock  * 65,536 * 100
 12061                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
 12062                                  ;		1,193,180
 12063                                  ;
 12064                                  ; fortunately this formula simplifies to:
 12065                                  ;
 12066                                  ;	ticks from clock * 5 * 65,536
 12067                                  ;      --------------------------------- = time in 100th of seconds
 12068                                  ;		59,659
 12069                                  ;
 12070                                  ; the calculation is done by first multipling tick by 5. next we divide by
 12071                                  ; 59,659. in this division we multiply by 65,536 by shifting the dividend
 12072                                  ; my 16 bits to the left.
 12073                                  ;
 12074                                  ; start with ticks in cx:dx
 12075                                  ; multiply by 5
 12076                                  
 12077 000004EB 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 12078 000004ED 89D3                    		mov	bx, dx		; start	with ticks in cx:dx
 12079                                  					; multiply by 5
 12080 000004EF D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 12081 000004F1 D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	2
 12082 000004F3 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 12083 000004F5 D1D1                    		rcl	cx, 1		; times	4
 12084 000004F7 01DA                    		add	dx, bx
 12085 000004F9 11C8                    		adc	ax, cx		; times	5
 12086 000004FB 92                      		xchg	ax, dx
 12087                                  
 12088                                  ; now have ticks * 5 in	dx:ax
 12089                                  ; we now need to multiply by 65536 and divide by 59659 d.
 12090                                  
 12091 000004FC B90BE9                  		mov	cx, 59659	; get divisor
 12092 000004FF F7F1                    		div	cx		; dx now has remainder
 12093                                  					; ax has high word of final quotient
 12094                                  
 12095                                  		; 08/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 12096                                  		;mov	bx, ax		; put high word	in safe	place
 12097 00000501 93                      		xchg	bx, ax
 12098 00000502 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; this is the multiply by 65536
 12099 00000504 F7F1                    		div	cx		; bx:ax	now has	time in	100th of seconds
 12100                                  
 12101                                  ; rounding based on the	remainder may be added here
 12102                                  ; the result in	bx:ax is time in 1/100 second.
 12103                                  
 12104 00000506 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		
 12105 00000508 B9C800                  		mov	cx, 200		; extract 1/100's
 12106                                  
 12107                                  ; division by 200 is necessary to ensure no overflow--max result
 12108                                  ; is number of seconds in a day/2 = 43200.
 12109                                  
 12110 0000050B F7F1                    		div	cx
 12111 0000050D 80FA64                  		cmp	dl, 100		; remainder over 100?
 12112 00000510 7203                    		jb	short noadj
 12113 00000512 80EA64                  		sub	dl, 100		; keep 1/100's less than 100
 12114                                  noadj:					
 12115 00000515 F5                      		cmc			; if we	subtracted 100,	carry is now set
 12116 00000516 88D3                    		mov	bl, dl		; save 1/100's
 12117                                  
 12118                                  ; to compensate	for dividing by	200 instead of 100, we now multiply
 12119                                  ; by two, shifting a one in if the remainder had exceeded 100.
 12120                                  
 12121 00000518 D1D0                    		rcl	ax, 1		
 12122 0000051A B200                    		mov	dl, 0
 12123 0000051C D1D2                    		rcl	dx, 1
 12124                                  		;mov	cx, 60		; divide out seconds
 12125                                  		; 20/12/2023
 12126 0000051E B13C                    		mov	cl, 60
 12127 00000520 F7F1                    		div	cx
 12128 00000522 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; save the seconds
 12129 00000524 F6F1                    		div	cl		; break	into hours and minutes
 12130 00000526 86E0                    		xchg	al, ah
 12131                                  
 12132                                  ; time is now in ax:bx (hours, minutes, seconds, 1/100 sec)
 12133                                  
 12134                                  		; 08/08/2023
 12135                                  		;push	ax
 12136                                  		;mov	ax, si		; daycnt
 12137 00000528 96                      		xchg	ax, si
 12138 00000529 AB                      		stosw
 12139                                  		;pop	ax
 12140 0000052A 96                      		xchg	ax, si		; al = hours, ah = minutes
 12141 0000052B AB                      		stosw
 12142 0000052C 89D8                    		mov	ax, bx
 12143 0000052E AB                      		stosw
 12144 0000052F F8                      		clc			; [es:di] = count of days since 1-1-80
 12145                                  					;   [es:di+2] = hours
 12146                                  					;   [es:di+3] = minutes
 12147                                  					;   [es:di+4] = seconds
 12148                                  					;   [es:di+5] = hundredths of seconds
 12149 00000530 C3                      		retn
 12150                                  
 12151                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 12152                                  
 12153                                  ; 15/10/2022
 12154                                  
 12155                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12156                                  ;
 12157                                  ; procedure : GetTickCnt
 12158                                  ;
 12159                                  ;		Returns the tick count in CX:DX. Takes care of DayCnt in case
 12160                                  ;		of rollover [except when power management driver is in use]. 
 12161                                  ;		Uses the following logic for updating Daycnt
 12162                                  ;
 12163                                  ;		if ( rollover ) {
 12164                                  ;			if ( t_switch )
 12165                                  ;				daycnt++ ;
 12166                                  ;			else
 12167                                  ;				daycnt += rollover ;
 12168                                  ;		}
 12169                                  ;
 12170                                  ; USES : AX
 12171                                  ;
 12172                                  ; RETURNS : CX:DX - tick count
 12173                                  ; MODIFIES : daycnt
 12174                                  ;
 12175                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12176                                  
 12177                                  		; 17/10/2022
 12178                                  GetTickCnt:
 12179 00000531 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 12180 00000533 CD1A                    		int	1Ah		; CLOCK	- GET TIME OF DAY
 12181                                  					; Return: CX:DX	= clock	count
 12182                                  					; AL = 00h if clock was	read or	written	(via AH=0,1) since the previous
 12183                                  					; midnight
 12184                                  					; Otherwise, AL	> 0
 12185                                  		; 20/12/2023
 12186 00000535 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 12187 00000537 3826[8B04]              		cmp	byte [t_switch], ah ; 0
 12188                                  		;cmp	byte [t_switch], 0 ; use old method ? (>0 is yes)
 12189 0000053B 7505                    		jnz	short inc_case	; old method assumes that Int 1Ah returns rollover flag
 12190                                  		;xor	ah, ah		; new method assumes that Int 1Ah returns roll over count
 12191                                  					; and not flag
 12192 0000053D 0106[8904]              		add	[daycnt], ax
 12193 00000541 C3                      		retn
 12194                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12195                                  
 12196                                  inc_case:
 12197 00000542 08C0                    		or	al, al
 12198 00000544 7404                    		jz	short no_rollover
 12199 00000546 FF06[8904]              		inc	word [daycnt]
 12200                                  no_rollover:
 12201 0000054A C3                      		retn
 12202

 12244                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
 12245                                  ;	disk interface routines
 12246                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------------
 12247                                  
 12248                                  ; device attribute bits:
 12249                                  ;	bit 6 - get/set map for logical drives and generic ioctl.
 12250                                  
 12251                                  ;MAXERR		equ	5
 12252                                  ;MAX_HD_FMT_ERR	equ	2
 12253                                  
 12254                                  ;LSTDRV	equ 504h
 12255                                  
 12256                                  ; some floppies do not have changeline. as a result, media-check would
 12257                                  ; normally return i-don't-know, the dos would continually reread the fat and
 12258                                  ; discard cached data. we optimize this by implementing a logical door-latch:
 12259                                  ; it is physically impossible to change a disk in under 2 seconds. we retain
 12260                                  ; the time of the last successful disk operation and compare it with the current
 12261                                  ; time during media-check. if < 2 seconds and at least 1 timer tick has passed,
 12262                                  ; the we say no change. if > 2 seconds then we say i-don't-know. finally, 
 12263                                  ; since we cannot trust the timer to be always available, we record the number 
 12264                                  ; of media checks that have occurred when no apparent time has elapsed. while
 12265                                  ; this number is < a given threshold, we say no change. when it exceeds that
 12266                                  ; threshold, we say i-don't-know and reset the counter to 0. when we store 
 12267                                  ; the time of last successful access, if we see that time has passed too,
 12268                                  ; we reset the counter.
 12269                                  
 12270                                  accessmax	equ	5
 12271                                  
 12272                                  ; due to various bogosities, we need to continually adjust what the head
 12273                                  ; settle time is.  the following algorithm is used:
 12274                                  ;
 12275                                  ;   get the current head settle value.
 12276                                  ;   if it is 0, then
 12277                                  ;	set slow = 15
 12278                                  ;   else
 12279                                  ;	set slow = value
 12280                                  ;   ...
 12281                                  ;*********************************************
 12282                                  ;************ old algorithm ******************
 12283                                  ;*   if we are seeking and writing then
 12284                                  ;*	 use slow
 12285                                  ;*   else
 12286                                  ;*	 use fast
 12287                                  ;*********************************************
 12288                                  ;*********** ibm's requested logic ***********
 12289                                  ;   if we are seeking and writing and not on an at then
 12290                                  ;	use slow
 12291                                  ;   else
 12292                                  ;	use fast
 12293                                  ;   ...
 12294                                  ;   restore current head settle value
 12295                                  ;
 12296                                  ;
 12297                                  ;---------------------------------------
 12298                                  multrk_on	equ	10000000b	;user spcified mutitrack=on, or system turns
 12299                                  					; it on after handling config.sys file as a
 12300                                  					; default value, if multrk_flag = multrk_off1.
 12301                                  multrk_off1	equ	00000000b	;initial value. no "multitrack=" command entered.
 12302                                  multrk_off2	equ	00000001b	;user specified multitrack=off.
 12303                                  
 12304                                  ; close data segment, open Bios_Code segment
 12305                                  
 12306                                  ; 15/10/2022

 12391                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12392                                  ; setdrive scans through the data structure of bdss, and returns a pointer to
 12393                                  ; the one that belongs to the drive specified. carry is set if none exists
 12394                                  ; for the drive. Pointer is returned in es:[di]

 12402                                  X_Scan_Loop:

 12404 000005AC 7409                    		jz	short X_SetDrv

 12416                                  	; 21/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1)
 12417                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:05C2h
 12418                                  
 12419                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 12420                                  ; if id is f9, have a 96tpi disk else
 12421                                  ; if bit 2 is 0 then media is not removable and could not have changed
 12422                                  ;  otherwise if within 2 secs of last disk operation media could not
 12423                                  ;    have changed, otherwise dont know if media has changed
 12424                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------

 12426                                  media_chk:				; 2C7h:4EBh = 70h:2A5Bh

 12429                                  		; 21/12/2023
 12430 000005BE 26F6454001              		test	byte [es:di+40h], 1

 12432                                  					; fchanged_by_format
 12433 000005C3 7415                    		jz	short WeAreNotFakingIt
 12434                                  		; 21/12/2023

 12436                                  		; 12/12/2022

 12463                                  
 12464                                  		; If we have a floppy with changeline support, we ask the ROM
 12465                                  		; to determine if media has changed. We do not perform the
 12466                                  		; 2 second check for these drives.

 12516                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 12517                                  
 12518                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12519                                  ; perform a check on the time passed since the last access for this physical
 12520                                  ; drive.
 12521                                  ; we are accessing the same drive. if the time of last successful access was
 12522                                  ; less than 2 seconds ago, then we may presume that the disk was not changed.
 12523                                  ; returns in si:
 12524                                  ;	0 - if time of last access was >= 2 seconds
 12525                                  ;	1 - if time was < 2 seconds (i.e no media change assumed)
 12526                                  ; registers affected ax,cx,dx, flags.
 12527                                  ;
 12528                                  ;	assume es:di -> bds, ds->Bios_Data
 12529                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12530                                  
 12531                                  		; 21/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0 IBMBIO.COM
 12532                                  		; 19/10/2022
 12533                                  Check_Time_Of_Access:
 12534 0000062A BE0100                  		mov	si, 1		; presume no change.
 12535 0000062D E801FF                  		call	GetTickCnt	; cx:dx	is the elapsed time
 12536                                  		; 21/12/2023
 12537 00000630 268B4579                		mov	ax, [es:di+79h]
 12538                                  		;mov	ax, [es:di+47h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_lo]
 12539                                  					; get stored time
 12540 00000634 29C2                    		sub	dx, ax
 12541                                  		; 21/12/2023
 12542 00000636 268B457B                		mov	ax, [es:di+7Bh]
 12543                                  		;mov	ax, [es:di+49h]	; [es:di+BDS.tim_hi]
 12544 0000063A 19C1                    		sbb	cx, ax
 12545                                  		; 11/08/2023
 12546                                  		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:0646h
 12547                                  		;mov	al, [accesscount]
 12548 0000063C 7515                    		jnz	short timecheck_unk ; cx<>0 => >1 hour
 12549 0000063E 09D2                    		or	dx, dx		; time must pass
 12550 00000640 750C                    		jnz	short timepassed ; yes, examine max value
 12551                                  		; 11/08/2023
 12552                                  		;inc	al
 12553                                  		;cmp	al, 5
 12554                                  		;;inc	byte [accesscount]
 12555                                  		;;cmp	byte [accesscount], 5
 12556                                  		;			; if count is less than threshold, ok
 12557                                  		;jb	short timecheck_ret
 12558                                  		;;dec	byte [accesscount] ; don't let the count wrap
 12559                                  		; 11/08/2023
 12560                                  		;dec	al
 12561                                  		;jmp	short timecheck_unk ; "i don't know" if media changed
 12562                                  		; 11/08/2023

 12753                                  		;test	byte [es:di+59], 20h 
 12754                                  			; (here, es:di points to the BDS offset +136)
 12755                                  			; purpose: test byte [es:di+BDS.fatsiz], fbigbig
 12756                                  			; applied: test byte [es:BDS.fatsiz+136], fbigbig -BUG!-
 12757                                  
 12758                                  			; (PCDOS 7.1 BUG note: 26/06/2023 - Erdogan Tan)
 12759                                  			;; ! NOTE - 11/08/2023 - Erdogan Tan (Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS bugfix)
 12760                                  			; Microsoft/IBM code has a bug here because the BDS's
 12761                                  			; .volid and .filesys_id fields will be reset
 12762                                  			; (to their default text) according to 'BDS.fatsiz' flags
 12763                                  			; at the BDS offset 59 but current (this) code checks flags
 12764                                  			; at ES:DI+59 while DI points the BDS offset 136!? ; (PCDOS 7.1)
 12765                                  			;; at the BDS offset 31 but current (this) code checks flags
 12766                                  			;; at ES:DI+31 while DI points the BDS offset 86!? ; (MSDOS 6.22)
 12767                                  			;
 12768                                  			; Correct Code:
 12769                                  			; ;test byte [ES:59],20h or [ES:BDS.fatsiz],fbigbig  ; (PCDOS 7.1)	
 12770                                  			; ;;test byte [ES:31],40h or [ES:BDS.fatsiz],fbig  ; (MSDOS 6.22)
 12771                                  			; 11/09/2023
 12772                                  			; (before 'rep movsb') 'mov al,[es:di+BDS.Fatsiz]' and then
 12773                                  			; (after 'rep movsb') 'test al,fbig' (AL is free/proper to use here)	
 12774                                  			;
 12775                                  			; Same BUG is existing in MSDOS 6.22 IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:05EFh
 12776                                  			; and in Windows ME IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:0E1Ah as 'test byte [es:di+59],20h'
 12777                                  
 12778                                  			;
 12779                                  			; (Why this bug did not affect MSDOS and PCDOS 7.x applications:
 12780                                  			; 'clear_ids' is used for floppy disks only and the default
 12781                                  			; option of 'clear_ids' is FAT12 volid and filesys_id text
 12782                                  			; when the flag bit has wrong value for FAT16/40h or FAT32/20h.)
 12783

 12832                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12833                                  ;	getbp - return bpb from the drive specified by the bds.
 12834                                  ;	    if the return_fake_bpb flag is set, then it does nothing.
 12835                                  ;	    note that we never come here for fixed disks.
 12836                                  ;	    for all other cases,
 12837                                  ;	      - it reads boot sector to pull out the bpb
 12838                                  ;	      - if no valid bpb is found, it then reads the fat sector,
 12839                                  ;		to get the fat id byte to build the bpb from there.
 12840                                  ;
 12841                                  ;   inputs:	es:di point to correct bds.
 12842                                  ;
 12843                                  ;   outputs:	fills in bpb in current bds if valid bpb or fat id on disk.
 12844                                  ;		carry set, and al=7 if invalid disk.
 12845                                  ;		carry set and error code in al if other error.
 12846                                  ;		if failed to recognize the boot record, then will set the
 12847                                  ;		set_id_flag to 0.
 12848                                  ;		this routine will only work for a floppy diskette.
 12849                                  ;		     for a fixed disk, it will just return.
 12850                                  ;
 12851                                  ;	****** Note: getbp is a clone of getbp which uses the newer
 12852                                  ;	  segment definitions. It should be migrated towards.
 12853                                  ;	   now es:di has the bds, ds: has Bios_Data
 12854                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12855                                  
 12856                                  		; 29/12/2023
 12857                                  		; 21/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1)
 12858                                  GetBp:
 12859                                  		; if returning fake bpb then return bpb as is.
 12860                                  		; 21/12/2023
 12861 000006D6 26F6453F05              		test	byte [es:di+3Fh], 5 ; PCDOS 7.1
 12862                                  		;test	byte [es:di+BDS.flags], return_fake_bpb|fnon_removable		
 12863                                  		;test	byte [es:di+23h], 5 ; MSDOS 6.22 (& MSDOS 5.0)
 12864                                  		;jz	short getbp1	; getbp1
 12865                                  		;jmp	getret_exit
 12866                                  		; 21/12/2023
 12867 000006DB 75F8                    		jnz	short getret_exit
 12868                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12869                                  getbp1:	
 12870 000006DD 51                      		push	cx
 12871 000006DE 52                      		push	dx
 12872 000006DF 53                      		push	bx
 12873                                  
 12874                                  		; attempt to read in boot sector and determine bpb.
 12875                                  		; we assume that the 2.x and greater dos disks all
 12876                                  		; have a valid boot sector.
 12877

 12879 000006E3 720A                    		jb	short getbp_err_ret_brdg ; carry set if there was error.

 12883                                  		;jmp	short Has1

 12885 000006EC E9B500                  		jmp	getret
 12886                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12887                                  
 12888                                  getbp_err_ret_brdg:
 12889 000006EF E9B600                  		jmp	getbp_err_ret
 12890                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 12891                                  
 12892                                  		; we have a 1.x diskette. In this case read in the fat ID byte
 12893                                  		; and fill in bpb from there.
 12894                                  dofatbpb:

 12901                                  					; jump to has1!!!!!! or	has720K

 13088                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 13089                                  
 13090                                  ; 15/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 13091                                  
 13092                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
 13093                                  ; read in the boot sector. set carry if error in reading sector.
 13094                                  ; bx is set to 1 if the boot sector is invalid, otherwise it is 0.
 13095                                  ;
 13096                                  ;	assumes es:di -> bds, ds-> Bios_Data
 13097                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------
 13098                                  
 13099                                  ; 10/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 13100                                  
 13101                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 13102                                  ; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, BIOSCODE:06C3h)
 13103                                  ; ((MSDOS 6.22 IO.SYS, BIOSCODE:06C3h)) ; 22/12/2023
 13104                                  
 13105                                  ; 22/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0
 13106                                  ; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM, BIOSCODE:07C6h)
 13107                                  
 13108                                  readbootsec:	
 13109 000007B2 B600                    		mov	dh, 0		; head 0
 13110 000007B4 B90100                  		mov	cx, 1		; cylinder 0, sector 1
 13111 000007B7 E8FC00                  		call	read_sector
 13112 000007BA 7243                    		jb	short err_ret
 13113 000007BC 31DB                    		xor	bx, bx		; assume valid boot sector
 13114                                  
 13115                                  		; put a sanity check for the boot sector in here to detect
 13116                                  		; boot sectors that do not have valid bpbs. we examine the
 13117                                  		; first two bytes - they must contain a long jump (69h) or a
 13118                                  		; short jump (EBh) followed by a nop (90h), or a short jump
 13119                                  		; (E9h). if this test is passed, we further check by examining
 13120                                  		; the signature at the end of the boot sector for the word
 13121                                  		; AA55h. if the signature is not present, we examine the media
 13122                                  		; descriptor byte to see if it is valid. for dos 3.3, this
 13123                                  		; logic is modified a little bit. we are not going to check
 13124                                  		; signature. instead we are going to sanity check the media
 13125                                  		; byte in bpb regardless of the validity of signature. this is
 13126                                  		; to save the already developed commercial products that have
 13127                                  		; good jump instruction and signature but with the false bpb
 13128                                  		; informations
 13129                                  
 13130                                  ; that will crash the diskette drive operation. (for example, symphony diskette).
 13131                                  
 13132                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13133                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13134                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 69h ; is it a direct jump?
 13135                                  		;jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; don't need to find a nop
 13136                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 0E9h ; dos 2.0 jump?
 13137                                  		;jz	short check_bpb_mediabyte ; no need for	nop
 13138                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector], 0EBh ; how about a short jump?
 13139                                  		;jnz	short invalidbootsec
 13140                                  		;cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
 13141                                  		;jnz	short invalidbootsec
 13142                                  
 13143                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 13144 000007BE A0[5201]                		mov	al, [disksector]
 13145 000007C1 3C69                    		cmp	al, 69h		; is it a direct jump?
 13146 000007C3 740F                    		je	short check_bpb_mediabyte
 13147                                  					; don't need to find a nop
 13148 000007C5 3CE9                    		cmp	al, 0E9h	; dos 2.0 jump?
 13149 000007C7 740B                    		je	short check_bpb_mediabyte
 13150                                  					; no need for nop
 13151 000007C9 3CEB                    		cmp	al, 0EBh	; how about a short jump?
 13152 000007CB 7530                    		jne	short invalidbootsec
 13153 000007CD 803E[5401]90            		cmp	byte [disksector+2], 90h ; is next one a nop?
 13154 000007D2 7529                    		jne	short invalidbootsec
 13155                                  
 13156                                  ; 15/10/5022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 13157                                  ;
 13158                                  ;; 10/03/2019
 13159                                  ;; (MSDOS 3.3, MSDISK.ASM, 1988)
 13160                                  ;;
 13161                                  ;; Don't have to perform the following signature check since
 13162                                  ;; we need to check the media byte even with the good signatured diskette.
 13163                                  ;;
 13164                                  ;;check_signature:
 13165                                  ;;		cmp	word [cs:disksector+1FEh],0AA55h ; see if non-ibm
 13166                                  ;;							 ; disk or 1.x media.
 13167                                  ;;		jz	short checksinglesided ; go see if singled sided medium.
 13168                                  ;;					       ; may need some special handling
 13169                                  
 13170                                  ; check for non-ibm disks which do not have the signature AA55h at the
 13171                                  ; end of the boot sector, but still have a valid boot sector. this is done
 13172                                  ; by examining the media descriptor in the boot sector.
 13173                                  
 13174                                  		; 19/10/2022
 13175                                  check_bpb_mediabyte:
 13176 000007D4 A0[6701]                		mov	al, [disksector+15h]
 13177                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 13178 000007D7 50                      		push	ax ; 02/09/2023
 13179 000007D8 24F0                    		and	al, 0F0h
 13180 000007DA 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h	; allow	for strange media
 13181 000007DC 58                      		pop	ax ; 02/09/2023
 13182 000007DD 751E                    		jnz	short invalidbootsec
 13183                                  
 13184                                  ; there were some (apparently a lot of them) diskettes that had been formatted
 13185                                  ; under dos 3.1 and earlier versions which have invalid bpbs in their boot
 13186                                  ; sectors. these are specifically diskettes that were formatted in drives
 13187                                  ; with one head, or whose side 0 was bad. these contain bpbs in the boot
 13188                                  ; sector that have the sec/clus field set to 2 instead of 1, as is standard
 13189                                  ; in dos. in order to support them, we have to introduce a "hack" that will
 13190                                  ; help our build bpb routine to recognise these specific cases, and to
 13191                                  ; set up out copy of the bpb accordingly.
 13192                                  ; we do this by checking to see if the boot sector is off a diskette that
 13193                                  ; is single-sided and is a pre-dos 3.20 diskette. if it is, we set the
 13194                                  ; sec/clus field to 1. if not, we carry on as normal.
 13195                                  
 13196                                  checksinglesided:
 13197                                  		;mov	al, [disksector+15h]
 13198                                  		; 02/09/2023
 13199                                  		; al = [disksector+15h]
 13200 000007DF 3CF0                    		cmp	al, 0F0h
 13201 000007E1 741B                    		jz	short gooddsk
 13202 000007E3 A801                    		test	al, 1
 13203 000007E5 7517                    		jnz	short gooddsk
 13204 000007E7 813E[5A01]332E          		cmp	word [disksector+8], 2E33h ; "3."
 13205 000007ED 7507                    		jnz	short mustbeearlier
 13206 000007EF 803E[5C01]32            		cmp	byte [disksector+0Ah], 32h ; "2"
 13207 000007F4 7308                    		jnb	short gooddsk
 13208                                  
 13209                                  ; we must have a pre-3.20 diskette. set the sec/clus field to 1
 13210                                  
 13211                                  mustbeearlier:				
 13212 000007F6 C606[5F01]01            		mov	byte [disksector+0Dh], 1
 13213                                  					; [disksector+EXT_BOOT.BPB+EBPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER]
 13214 000007FB EB01                    		jmp	short gooddsk
 13215                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13216                                  
 13217                                  invalidbootsec:				
 13218 000007FD 43                      		inc	bx		; indicate that boot sector invalid
 13219                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13220                                  movbpb_ret:
 13221                                  gooddsk:				
 13222 000007FE F8                      		clc
 13223                                  err_ret:
 13224 000007FF C3                      		retn
 13225                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 13226                                  
 13227                                  		; 10/12/2022
 13228                                  ;err_ret:				
 13229                                  		;retn
