 17608                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 17609                                  
 17610                                  ; 16/10/2022
 17611                                  
 17612                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17613                                  ;
 17614                                  ; procedure : HMAPtr
 17615                                  ;
 17616                                  ;		Gets the offset of the free HMA area ( with respect to
 17617                                  ;							seg ffff )
 17618                                  ;		If DOS has not moved high, tries to move DOS high.
 17619                                  ;		In the course of doing this, it will allocate all the HMA
 17620                                  ;		and set the FreeHMAPtr to past the end of the BIOS and 
 17621                                  ;		DOS code. The call to MoveDOSIntoHMA (which is a pointer)
 17622                                  ;		enters the routine in sysinit1 called FTryToMovDOSHi.
 17623                                  ;
 17624                                  ;	RETURNS : offset of free HMA in DI
 17625                                  ;		  BIOS_DATA, seg in DS
 17626                                  ;
 17627                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17628                                  
 17629                                  		; 17/10/2022
 17630                                  HMAPtr:
 17631 00001727 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 17632                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:Bios_Data_Word]
 17633 0000172C 8B3E[D707]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 17634                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 17635 00001730 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 17636 00001733 750F                    		jnz	short HMAPtr_retn
 17637 00001735 803E[DD07]00            		cmp	byte [SysinitPresent], 0
 17638                                  		;cmp	ds:SysinitPresent, 0
 17639 0000173A 7408                    		jz	short HMAPtr_retn
 17640 0000173C FF1E[D907]              		call	far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 17641                                  		;call	ds:MoveDOSIntoHMA ; call far [MoveDOSIntoHMA]
 17642 00001740 8B3E[D707]              		mov	di, [FreeHMAPtr]
 17643                                  		;mov	di, ds:FreeHMAPtr
 17644                                  HMAPtr_retn:
 17645 00001744 C3                      		retn
 17646                                  
 17647                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 17648                                  
 17649                                  ; 16/10/2022
 17650                                  
 17651                                  ; move a 512 byte sector from ds:si to es:di, do not trash cx
 17652                                  ; but go ahead and update direction flag, si, & di
 17653                                  
 17654                                  move_sector:
 17655                                  
 17656                                  ; The 80386 microprocessor considers an access to WORD 0FFFFh in
 17657                                  ; any segment to be a fault. Theoretically, this could be handled
 17658                                  ; by the fault handler and the behavior of an 8086 could be emulated
 17659                                  ; by wrapping the high byte to offset 0000h. This would be a lot
 17660                                  ; of work and was, indeed, blown off by the Win386 guys. COMPAQ
 17661                                  ; also handles the fault incorrectly in their ROM BIOS for real
 17662                                  ; mode. Their fault handler was only designed to deal with one
 17663                                  ; special case which occurred in a magazine benchmark, but didn't
 17664                                  ; handle the general case worth beans.
 17665                                  ;
 17666                                  ; Simply changing this code to do a byte loop would work okay but
 17667                                  ; would involve a general case performance hit. Therefore, we'll
 17668                                  ; check for either source or destination offsets being within one
 17669                                  ; sector of the end of their segments and only in that case fall
 17670                                  ; back to a byte move.
 17671                                  
 17672 00001745 FC                      		cld
 17673 00001746 51                      		push	cx
 17674 00001747 B90001                  		mov	cx, 256
 17675 0000174A 81FE00FE                		cmp	si, 0FE00h
 17676 0000174E 770A                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 17677 00001750 81FF00FE                		cmp	di, 0FE00h
 17678 00001754 7704                    		ja	short movsec_bytes
 17679 00001756 F3A5                    		rep movsw
 17680 00001758 59                      		pop	cx
 17681 00001759 C3                      		retn
 17682                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17683                                  
 17684                                  movsec_bytes:
 17685 0000175A D1E1                    		shl	cx, 1
 17686 0000175C F3A4                    		rep movsb
 17687 0000175E 59                      		pop	cx
 17688 0000175F C3                      		retn
 17689                                  
 17690                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 17691                                  
 17692                                  ; 16/10/2022
 17693                                  
 17694                                  ; check_wrap is a routine that adjusts the starting sector, starting head
 17695                                  ; and starting cylinder for an int 13 request that requests i/o of a lot
 17696                                  ; of sectors. it only does this for fixed disks. it is used in the sections
 17697                                  ; of code that handle ecc errors and dma errors. it is necessary, because
 17698                                  ; ordinarily the rom would take care of wraps around heads and cylinders,
 17699                                  ; but we break down a request when we get an ecc or dma error into several
 17700                                  ; i/o of one or more sectors. in this case, we may already be beyond the
 17701                                  ; number of sectors on a track on the medium, and the request would fail.
 17702                                  ;
 17703                                  ; input conditions:
 17704                                  ;	all registers set up for an int 13 request.
 17705                                  ;
 17706                                  ; output:
 17707                                  ;	dh - contains starting head number for request
 17708                                  ;	cx - contains starting sector and cylinder numbers
 17709                                  ;	(the above may or may not have been changed, and are 0-based)
 17710                                  ;	all other registers preserved.
 17711                                  
 17712                                  		; 26/12/2023 - Retro DOS 5.0
 17713                                  check_wrap:	
 17714 00001760 50                      		push	ax
 17715 00001761 53                      		push	bx
 17716 00001762 06                      		push	es
 17717 00001763 57                      		push	di
 17718 00001764 E86C00                  		call	find_bds	; get pointer to bds for drive in dl
 17719 00001767 725E                    		jb	short no_wrap	; finished if DOS doesn't use it
 17720                                  		; 26/12/2023
 17721 00001769 26F6453F01              		test	byte [es:di+3Fh], 1
 17722                                  		; 12/12/2022
 17723                                  		;test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 17724                                  		;;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 17725 0000176E 7457                    		jz	short no_wrap	; no wrapping for removable media
 17726 00001770 268B5D13                		mov	bx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 17727 00001774 89C8                    		mov	ax, cx
 17728 00001776 83E03F                  		and	ax, 3Fh		; extract sector number
 17729 00001779 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx		; are we going to wrap?
 17730 0000177B 764A                    		jbe	short no_wrap
 17731 0000177D F6F3                    		div	bl		; ah=new sector	#, al=#	of head	wraps
 17732                                  
 17733                                  ; we need to be careful here. if the new sector # is 0, then we are on the
 17734                                  ; last sector on that track.
 17735                                  
 17736 0000177F 08E4                    		or	ah, ah
 17737 00001781 7503                    		jnz	short not_on_bound
 17738                                  		; 18/12/2022
 17739 00001783 48                      		dec	ax ; *
 17740 00001784 88DC                    		mov	ah, bl		; set sector=BDS_BPB.BPB_SECTORSPERTRACK
 17741                                  					; if on	boundary
 17742                                  		;dec	al ; *		; also decrement # of head wraps
 17743                                  not_on_bound:
 17744 00001786 80E1C0                  		and	cl, 0C0h	; zero out sector #
 17745 00001789 08E1                    		or	cl, ah		; or in	new sector #
 17746 0000178B 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; ax = # of head wraps
 17747 0000178D 40                      		inc	ax
 17748 0000178E 00F0                    		add	al, dh		; add in starting head #
 17749 00001790 80D400                  		adc	ah, 0		; catch	any carry
 17750                                  		; 02/09/2023
 17751 00001793 268B5D15                		mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 17752 00001797 39D8                    		cmp	ax, bx
 17753                                  		;cmp	ax, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 17754                                  					; are we going to wrap around a	head?
 17755 00001799 7632                    		jbe	short no_wrap_head ; do	not lose new head number!!
 17756 0000179B 52                      		push	dx		; preserve drive number and head number
 17757 0000179C 31D2                    		xor	dx, dx
 17758                                  		;mov	bx, [es:di+15h]	; [es:di+BDS.heads]
 17759 0000179E F7F3                    		div	bx		; dx=new head #, ax=# of cylinder wraps
 17760                                  
 17761                                  ; careful here! if new head # is 0, then we are on the last head.
 17762                                  
 17763 000017A0 09D2                    		or	dx, dx
 17764 000017A2 7507                    		jnz	short no_head_bound
 17765 000017A4 89DA                    		mov	dx, bx		; on boundary. set to BDS_BPB.BPB_HEADS
 17766                                  
 17767                                  ; if we had some cylinder wraps, we need to reduce them by one!!
 17768                                  
 17769 000017A6 09C0                    		or	ax, ax
 17770 000017A8 7401                    		jz	short no_head_bound
 17771 000017AA 48                      		dec	ax		; reduce number	of cylinder wraps
 17772                                  no_head_bound:				
 17773 000017AB 88D7                    		mov	bh, dl		; bh has new head number
 17774 000017AD 5A                      		pop	dx		; restore drive number and head number
 17775 000017AE FECF                    		dec	bh		; get it 0-based
 17776 000017B0 88FE                    		mov	dh, bh		; set up new head number in dh
 17777 000017B2 88CF                    		mov	bh, cl
 17778 000017B4 80E73F                  		and	bh, 3Fh		; preserve sector number
 17779 000017B7 B306                    		mov	bl, 6
 17780 000017B9 86D9                    		xchg	cl, bl
 17781 000017BB D2EB                    		shr	bl, cl		; get ms cylinder bits to ls end
 17782 000017BD 00C5                    		add	ch, al		; add in cylinder wrap
 17783 000017BF 10E3                    		adc	bl, ah		; add in high byte
 17784 000017C1 D2E3                    		shl	bl, cl		; move up to ms	end
 17785 000017C3 86CB                    		xchg	bl, cl		; restore cylinder bits	into cl
 17786 000017C5 08F9                    		or	cl, bh		; or in	sector number
 17787                                  no_wrap:				
 17788 000017C7 F8                      		clc
 17789 000017C8 5F                      		pop	di
 17790 000017C9 07                      		pop	es
 17791 000017CA 5B                      		pop	bx
 17792 000017CB 58                      		pop	ax
 17793 000017CC C3                      		retn
 17794                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17795                                  
 17796                                  no_wrap_head:				
 17797 000017CD 88C6                    		mov	dh, al		; do not lose new head number
 17798 000017CF FECE                    		dec	dh		; get it 0-based
 17799 000017D1 EBF4                    		jmp	short no_wrap
 17800                                  
 17801                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 17802                                  
 17803                                  ; 16/10/2022
 17804                                  
 17805                                  ; this is a special version of the bds lookup code which is
 17806                                  ; based on physical drives rather than the usual logical drives
 17807                                  ; carry is set if the physical drive in dl is found, es:di -> its bds
 17808                                  ; otherwise carry is clear
 17809                                  ;
 17810                                  ; guaranteed to trash no registers except es:di
 17811                                  
 17812                                  		; 19/10/2022
 17813                                  find_bds:	
 17814 000017D3 C43E[1901]              		les	di, [start_bds]	; point es:di to first bds
 17815                                  fbds_1:					
 17816 000017D7 26385504                		cmp	[es:di+4], dl	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 17817 000017DB 7409                    		jz	short fdbs_2
 17818 000017DD 26C43D                  		les	di, [es:di]	; [es:di+BDS.link]
 17819                                  					; go to next bds
 17820 000017E0 83FFFF                  		cmp	di, 0FFFFh
 17821 000017E3 75F2                    		jnz	short fbds_1
 17822 000017E5 F9                      		stc
 17823                                  fdbs_2:					
 17824 000017E6 C3                      		retn
 17825                                  
 17826                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 17827                                  
 17828                                  ; 16/10/2022
 17829                                  		; 17/10/2022
 17830                                  doint:
 17831                                  		; 10/12/2022
 17832 000017E7 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 17833                                  					; get physical drive number
 17834                                  		; 19/10/2022 - Temporary !
 17835                                  		;db	8Ah, 96h, 8, 0	; mov dl, [bp+8]	
 17836                                  		
 17837 000017EA 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 17838 000017EC 08C0                    		or	al, al
 17839 000017EE 7410                    		jz	short dointdone	; if zero sectors, return ax=0
 17840                                  		; 10/12/2022
 17841 000017F0 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 17842                                  					; get request code
 17843                                  		;db	8Ah, 0A6h, 3, 0	; mov ah, [bp+3]
 17844 000017F3 FF7610                  		push	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 17845                                  		;db	0FFh, 0B6h, 10h, 0 ; push word [bp+10h]
 17846 000017F6 9D                      		popf
 17847                                  		;call	far 70h:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:14EAh
 17848                                  		; 17/10/2022
 17849 000017F7 9A[0B07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 17850                                  		;;call	call_orig13	; call far 70h:797h
 17851                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 17852 000017FC 9C                      		pushf
 17853                                  		; 10/12/2022
 17854 000017FD 8F4610                  		pop	word [bp+10h]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldf]
 17855                                  		;db	8Fh, 86h, 10h, 0 ; pop word [bp+10h]
 17856                                  dointdone:				
 17857 00001800 C3                      		retn
 17858                                  
 17859                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17860                                  
 17861                                  ; 16/10/2022
 17862                                  
 17863                                  ; this is the true int 13 handler. we parse the request to see if there is
 17864                                  ; a dma violation. if so, depending on the function, we:
 17865                                  ;   read/write break the request into three pieces and move the middle one
 17866                                  ;	       into our internal buffer.
 17867                                  ;
 17868                                  ;   format     copy the format table into the buffer
 17869                                  ;   verify     point the transfer address into the buffer
 17870                                  ;
 17871                                  ; this is the biggest bogosity of all. the ibm controller does not handle
 17872                                  ; operations that cross physical 64k boundaries. in these cases, we copy
 17873                                  ; the offending sector into the buffer below and do the i/o from there.
 17874                                  
 17875                                  ;struc INT13FRAME
 17876                                  ;.oldbp: resw
 17877                                  ;.oldax: resw 
 17878                                  ;.oldbx: resw
 17879                                  ;.oldcx: resw
 17880                                  ;.olddx: resw
 17881                                  ;.oldds: resw	; now we save caller's ds, too
 17882                                  ;.olddd: resd
 17883                                  ;.oldf:	resw
 17884                                  ;end struc
 17885                                  
 17886                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17887                                  
 17888                                  ;   entry conditions:
 17889                                  ;	ah = function
 17890                                  ;	al = number of sectors
 17891                                  ;	es:bx = dma address
 17892                                  ;	cx = packed track and sector
 17893                                  ;	dx = head and drive
 17894                                  ;   output conditions:
 17895                                  ;	no dma violation.
 17896                                  
 17897                                  ;	use extreme caution when working with this code. In general,
 17898                                  ;	  all registers are hot at all times.
 17899                                  ;
 17900                                  ;	question:  does this code handle cases where dma errors
 17901                                  ;	  occur during ecc retries, and where ecc errors occur during
 17902                                  ;	  dma breakdowns???? Hmmmmm.
 17903                                  
 17904                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17905                                  
 17906                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17907                                  
 17908                                  		; 26/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0
 17909                                  		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:1889h
 17910                                  dtype_array:
 17911 00001801 90004000                		dd 400090h		; 40h:90h is drive type array addr
 17912                                  
 17913                                  ; 17/10/2022
 17914                                  ;DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array - DOSBIOSEG_2C7h ; (14F5h for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 17915                                  ; 09/12/2022
 17916                                  DTYPEARRAY equ dtype_array
 17917                                  
 17918                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17919                                  
 17920                                  ; stick some special stuff out of mainline
 17921                                  
 17922                                  ; we know we're doing a format command. if we have changeline
 17923                                  ; support, then flag some special changed stuff and set changed
 17924                                  ; by format bit for all logical drives using this physical drive
 17925                                  
 17926                                  format_special_stuff:
 17927 00001805 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0	; do we have changeline support?
 17928 0000180A 7459                    		jz	short format_special_stuff_done ; brif not
 17929 0000180C 53                      		push	bx
 17930 0000180D BB4001                  		mov	bx, 140h	; fchanged_by_format+fchanged
 17931 00001810 E85104                  		call	set_changed_dl	; indicate that media changed by format
 17932 00001813 5B                      		pop	bx
 17933 00001814 EB4F                    		jmp	short format_special_stuff_done
 17934                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17935                                  
 17936                                  ; 16/10/2022
 17937                                  
 17938                                  ; we know we've got ec35's on the system. Now see if we're doing
 17939                                  ; a floppy. If so, create a mask and see if this particular
 17940                                  ; drive is an ec35. If so, set dtype_array[drive]=93h
 17941                                  
 17942                                  		; 19/10/2022
 17943                                  ec35_special_stuff:
 17944 00001816 84D2                    		test	dl, dl		; floppy or hard disk?
 17945 00001818 7852                    		js	short ec35_special_stuff_done ;	if hard	drive, we're done
 17946 0000181A 50                      		push	ax		; see if this PARTICULAR drive is ec35
 17947 0000181B 51                      		push	cx
 17948 0000181C 88D1                    		mov	cl, dl		; turn drive number into bit map
 17949 0000181E B001                    		mov	al, 1		; assume drive 0
 17950 00001820 D2E0                    		shl	al, cl		; shift	over correct number of times
 17951 00001822 8406[A204]              		test	[ec35flag], al	; electrically compatible 3.5 incher?
 17952 00001826 59                      		pop	cx
 17953 00001827 58                      		pop	ax
 17954 00001828 7442                    		jz	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 17955                                  					; done if this floppy is not an	ec35
 17956 0000182A 53                      		push	bx		; free up a far	pointer	(es:bx)
 17957 0000182B 06                      		push	es
 17958                                  		; 17/10/2022
 17959 0000182C 2EC41E[0118]            		les	bx, [cs:DTYPEARRAY]
 17960                                  		;les	bx, dword ptr cs:DTYPEARRAY ; [cs:dtype_array]
 17961                                  					; 0070h:3A65h =	2C7h:14F5h
 17962 00001831 00D3                    		add	bl, dl
 17963 00001833 80D700                  		adc	bh, 0		; find entry for this drive
 17964 00001836 26C60793                		mov	byte [es:bx], 93h ; establish drive type as:
 17965                                  					; (360k	disk in	360k drive,
 17966                                  					; no double-stepping, 250 kbs transfer rate)
 17967 0000183A 07                      		pop	es
 17968 0000183B 5B                      		pop	bx
 17969 0000183C EB2E                    		jmp	short ec35_special_stuff_done
 17970                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 17971                                  
 17972                                  ; 16/10/2022
 17973                                  
 17974                                  ; ps2_30 machine has some problem with ah=8h (read drive parm), int 13h.
 17975                                  ; this function does not reset the common buses after the execution.
 17976                                  ; to solve this problem, when we detect ah=8h, then we will save the result and
 17977                                  ; will issue ah=1 (read status) call to reset the buses.
 17978                                  
 17979                                  ps2_special_stuff:
 17980 0000183E 803E[1E00]08            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 8 ; (ps2_30)
 17981                                  					; read driver parm ?
 17982 00001843 7407                    		jz	short ps2_30_problem
 17983 00001845 803E[1E00]15            		cmp	byte [prevoper], 15h
 17984                                  					; apparently function 15h fails, too
 17985 0000184A 752D                    		jnz	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 17986                                  ps2_30_problem:
 17987 0000184C 50                      		push	ax
 17988 0000184D B401                    		mov	ah, 1
 17989                                  		; 26/12/2023
 17990                                  		;call	70h:70Bh ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM BIOSCODE:18D7h
 17991                                  		;		 ; call BIOSDATA:call_orig13	
 17992                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1543h
 17993                                  		; 17/10/2022
 17994 0000184F 9A[0B07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 17995                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far 70:797h
 17996                                  					; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 17997 00001854 58                      		pop	ax
 17998 00001855 EB22                    		jmp	short ps2_special_stuff_done
 17999                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18000                                  
 18001                                  ; 17/10/2022
 18002                                  ; 16/10/2022
 18003                                  
 18004                                  ; here is the actual int13 handler
 18005                                  
 18006                                  i13z:					; 0070h:3ABBh =	02C7h:154Bh
 18007                                  
 18008                                  ; cas -- inefficient! could push ds and load ds-> Bios_Data before
 18009                                  ; vectoring up here from Bios_Data
 18010                                  
 18011                                  		; 19/10/2022
 18012 00001857 1E                      		push	ds		; save caller's ds register first thing
 18013                                  		;;mov	ds, word [cs:0030h]
 18014                                  					; and set up our own ds -> Bios_Data
 18015 00001858 2E8E1E[3000]            		mov	ds, [cs:BIOSDATAWORD]
 18016                                  		;mov	ds, word ptr cs:BIOSDATAWORD ; [cs:0030h]
 18017                                  					; = [02C7h:0030h] = [0070h:25A0h]
 18018                                  
 18019                                  ; let the operation proceed. if there is a dma violation, then we do things
 18020                                  
 18021 0000185D A3[1E00]                		mov	[prevoper], ax	; save request
 18022 00001860 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 18023 00001863 74A0                    		jz	short format_special_stuff
 18024                                  					; go do special stuff for format
 18025                                  format_special_stuff_done:
 18026 00001865 803E[A204]00            		cmp	byte [ec35flag], 0 ; any electrically compat 3.5 inchers?
 18027 0000186A 75AA                    		jnz	short ec35_special_stuff
 18028                                  					; go handle it out of line if so
 18029                                  ec35_special_stuff_done:
 18030                                  		; 26/12/2023
 18031                                  		;call	70h:70Bh ; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM BIOSCODE:18EDh
 18032                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1560h
 18033 0000186C 9A[0B07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 18034                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 18035                                  		
 18036 00001871 9C                      		pushf			; save result flags
 18037                                  		
 18038 00001872 803E[AF05]FA            		cmp	byte [model_byte], 0FAh ; is this a ps2/30?
 18039                                  					; mdl_ps2_30
 18040 00001877 74C5                    		jz	short ps2_special_stuff
 18041                                  					; exit mainline to address special
 18042                                  ps2_special_stuff_done:			; ps2/30 problem if so
 18043 00001879 9D                      		popf
 18044 0000187A 7221                    		jb	short goterr13	; error	on original orig13 call-thru?
 18045                                  ret_from_i13:
 18046 0000187C 1F                      		pop	ds
 18047 0000187D CA0200                  		retf	2		; restore ds &	iret w/flags
 18048                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18049                                  
 18050                                  ; most of our code exits through here. If carry isn't set, then
 18051                                  ; just do a simple exit. Else doublecheck that we aren't getting
 18052                                  ; a changeline error.
 18053                                  
 18054                                  i13ret_ck_chglinerr:			
 18055 00001880 73FA                    		jnb	short ret_from_i13 ; done if not an error termination
 18056                                  i13_ret_error:				
 18057 00001882 80FC06                  		cmp	ah, 6		; did i	see a change event?
 18058 00001885 7513                    		jnz	short int13b	; skip if wrong	error
 18059 00001887 08D2                    		or	dl, dl		; is this for the hard disk?
 18060 00001889 780F                    		js	short int13b	; yes, ignore
 18061 0000188B 803E[7700]00            		cmp	byte [fhave96], 0
 18062 00001890 7408                    		jz	short int13b	; just in case ROM returned this
 18063                                  					; error	even though it told us it
 18064                                  					; never	would
 18065 00001892 53                      		push	bx
 18066 00001893 BB4000                  		mov	bx, 40h		; fchanged
 18067 00001896 E8CB03                  		call	set_changed_dl
 18068 00001899 5B                      		pop	bx
 18069                                  int13b:
 18070 0000189A F9                      		stc			; now return the error
 18071 0000189B EBDF                    		jmp	short ret_from_i13
 18072                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18073                                  
 18074                                  ; some kind of error occurred. see if it is dma violation
 18075                                  
 18076                                  goterr13:
 18077 0000189D 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; dma error?
 18078 000018A0 747C                    		jz	short gotdmaerr
 18079                                  goterr13_xxxx:
 18080 000018A2 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; ecc error?
 18081 000018A5 75DB                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error ; other error. just	return back.
 18082 000018A7 803E[A905]01            		cmp	byte [media_set_for_format], 1 ; formatting?
 18083 000018AC 74D4                    		jz	short i13_ret_error
 18084                                  
 18085 000018AE 803E[1F00]02            		cmp	byte [prevoper+1], 2
 18086                                  		;cmp	byte ptr ds:prevoper+1,	2 ; ecc-corrected error
 18087                                  					; (2 = romread)
 18088                                  					; ECC correction only applies to reads
 18089 000018B3 75CD                    		jnz	short i13_ret_error
 18090                                  
 18091 000018B5 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah
 18092                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15ABh
 18093                                  		; 17/10/2022
 18094 000018B7 9A[0B07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 18095                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 18096                                  					; call far 70:797h
 18097 000018BC A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]
 18098 000018BF 30E4                    		xor	ah, ah		; return code =	no error
 18099 000018C1 3C01                    		cmp	al, 1		; if request for one sector, assume ok
 18100 000018C3 74B7                    		jz	short ret_from_i13 ; return with carry clear
 18101 000018C5 53                      		push	bx
 18102 000018C6 51                      		push	cx
 18103 000018C7 52                      		push	dx
 18104 000018C8 A2[2000]                		mov	[number_of_sec], al
 18105                                  loop_ecc:
 18106 000018CB B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 18107                                  
 18108                                  ; we do reads one sector at a time. this ensures that we will eventually
 18109                                  ; finish the request since ecc errors on one sector do read in that sector.
 18110                                  ;
 18111                                  ; we need to put in some "intelligence" into the ecc handler to handle reads
 18112                                  ; that attempt to read more sectors than are available on a particular
 18113                                  ; track.
 18114                                  ;
 18115                                  ; we call check_wrap to set up the sector #, head # and cylinder # for
 18116                                  ; this request.
 18117                                  ;
 18118                                  ; at this point, all registers are set up for the call to orig13, except
 18119                                  ; that there may be a starting sector number that is bigger than the number
 18120                                  ; of sectors on a track.
 18121                                  ;
 18122 000018CE E88FFE                  		call	check_wrap	; get correct parameters for int 13
 18123                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15C5h
 18124                                  		; 17/10/2022
 18125 000018D1 9A[0B07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 18126                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 18127 000018D6 730C                    		jnb	short ok11_op
 18128 000018D8 80FC09                  		cmp	ah, 9		; DMA error during ECC read?
 18129 000018DB 741B                    		jz	short handle_dma_during_ecc
 18130 000018DD 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h		; only allow ecc errors
 18131 000018E0 7510                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err
 18132                                  		; 10/12/2022
 18133                                  		; xor ax ax -> ah = 0
 18134                                  		;mov	ah, 0		; ecc error. reset the system again.
 18135 000018E2 31C0                    		xor	ax, ax		; clear	the error code so that if this
 18136                                  					; was the last sector, no error	code
 18137                                  					; will be returned for the corrected
 18138                                  					; read.	(clear carry too.)
 18139                                  ok11_op:
 18140 000018E4 FE0E[2000]              		dec	byte [number_of_sec]
 18141 000018E8 7409                    		jz	short ok11_exit	; all done?
 18142 000018EA FEC1                    		inc	cl		; advance sector number
 18143                                  					; add 200h to address
 18144 000018EC FEC7                    		inc	bh
 18145 000018EE FEC7                    		inc	bh
 18146 000018F0 EBD9                    		jmp	short loop_ecc
 18147                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18148                                  
 18149                                  ; locate error returns centrally
 18150                                  
 18151                                  ok11_exit_err:
 18152 000018F2 F9                      		stc			; set carry bit again.
 18153                                  ok11_exit:
 18154 000018F3 5A                      		pop	dx
 18155 000018F4 59                      		pop	cx
 18156 000018F5 5B                      		pop	bx
 18157 000018F6 EB88                    		jmp	short i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 18158                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18159                                  
 18160                                  ; do the single sector read again, this time into our temporary
 18161                                  ; buffer, which is guaranteed not to have a DMA error, then
 18162                                  ; move the data to its proper location and proceed
 18163                                  
 18164                                  handle_dma_during_ecc:
 18165 000018F8 06                      		push	es
 18166 000018F9 53                      		push	bx
 18167 000018FA BB[5201]                		mov	bx, disksector
 18168 000018FD 1E                      		push	ds
 18169 000018FE 07                      		pop	es		; point es:bx to buffer
 18170 000018FF B80102                  		mov	ax, 201h	; read one sector
 18171                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:15F8h
 18172                                  		; 17/10/2022
 18173 00001902 9A[0B07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 18174                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 18175 00001907 5B                      		pop	bx
 18176 00001908 07                      		pop	es
 18177 00001909 7305                    		jnb	short handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr
 18178 0000190B 80FC11                  		cmp	ah, 11h
 18179 0000190E 75E2                    		jnz	short ok11_exit_err ; if anything but ecc error, bomb out
 18180                                  
 18181                                  ; now we're kosher. Copy the data to where it belongs and resume
 18182                                  ; the ECC looping code.
 18183                                  
 18184                                  handle_dma_during_ecc_noerr:
 18185 00001910 56                      		push	si
 18186 00001911 57                      		push	di
 18187 00001912 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 18188 00001914 BE[5201]                		mov	si, disksector
 18189 00001917 E82BFE                  		call	move_sector
 18190 0000191A 5F                      		pop	di
 18191 0000191B 5E                      		pop	si
 18192 0000191C EBC6                    		jmp	short ok11_op
 18193                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18194                                  
 18195                                  ; we truly have a dma violation. restore register ax and retry the
 18196                                  ; operation as best we can.
 18197                                  
 18198                                  gotdmaerr:
 18199 0000191E A1[1E00]                		mov	ax, [prevoper]	; 19/10/2022
 18200 00001921 FB                      		sti
 18201 00001922 80FC02                  		cmp	ah, 2		; romread
 18202 00001925 723B                    		jb	short i13_done_dmaerr
 18203                                  					; just pass dma error thru for
 18204                                  					; functions we don't handle
 18205 00001927 80FC04                  		cmp	ah, 4		; romverify
 18206 0000192A 743C                    		jz	short intverify
 18207 0000192C 80FC05                  		cmp	ah, 5		; romformat
 18208 0000192F 7448                    		jz	short intformat
 18209 00001931 772F                    		ja	short i13_done_dmaerr
 18210                                  
 18211                                  ; we are doing a read/write call. check for dma problems
 18212                                  
 18213                                  ;	******** set up stack frame here!!! ********
 18214                                  
 18215 00001933 52                      		push	dx
 18216 00001934 51                      		push	cx
 18217 00001935 53                      		push	bx
 18218 00001936 50                      		push	ax
 18219 00001937 55                      		push	bp
 18220 00001938 89E5                    		mov	bp, sp
 18221 0000193A 8CC2                    		mov	dx, es		; check	for 64k	boundary error
 18222                                  		; 26/12/2023
 18223                                  		;add	dx, dx
 18224                                  		;add	dx, dx
 18225                                  		;add	dx, dx
 18226                                  		;add	dx, dx		; dx = dx*16
 18227 0000193C D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 18228 0000193E D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 18229 00001940 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1
 18230 00001942 D1E2                    		shl	dx, 1		; segment converted to absolute	address
 18231 00001944 01DA                    		add	dx, bx		; combine with offset
 18232 00001946 81C2FF01                		add	dx, 511		; simulate a transfer
 18233                                  
 18234                                  ; if carry is set, then we are within 512 bytes of the end of the segment.
 18235                                  ; we skip the first transfer and perform the remaining buffering and transfer
 18236                                  
 18237 0000194A 7303                    		jnb	short no_skip_first
 18238 0000194C E98300                  		jmp	bufferx		; restore dh=head & do buffer
 18239                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18240                                  
 18241                                  no_skip_first:
 18242 0000194F D0EE                    		shr	dh, 1		; dh = number of sectors before	address
 18243 00001951 B480                    		mov	ah, 128		; ah = max number of sectors in	segment
 18244 00001953 28F4                    		sub	ah, dh
 18245                                  
 18246                                  ; ah is now the number of sectors that we can successfully write in this
 18247                                  ; segment. if this number is above or equal to the requested number, then we
 18248                                  ; continue the operation as normal. otherwise, we break it into pieces.
 18249                                  ;
 18250                                  ; wait a sec. this is goofy. the whole reason we got here in the
 18251                                  ; first place is because we got a dma error. so it's impossible
 18252                                  ; for the whole block to fit, unless the dma error was returned
 18253                                  ; in error.
 18254                                  
 18255 00001955 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; can we fit it	in?
 18256 00001957 7236                    		jb	short doblock	; no, perform blocking.
 18257                                  
 18258                                  ; yes, the request fits. let it happen.
 18259                                  
 18260 00001959 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 18261                                  					; set up head number
 18262 0000195C E888FE                  		call	doint
 18263 0000195F E9D900                  		jmp	bad13		; and return from this place
 18264                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18265                                  
 18266                                  i13_done_dmaerr:
 18267 00001962 B409                    		mov	ah, 9		; pass dma error thru to caller
 18268 00001964 F9                      		stc
 18269 00001965 E914FF                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; return with error,
 18270                                  					; we know it's not a changeline error
 18271                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18272                                  
 18273                                  ; verify the given sectors. place the buffer pointer into our space.
 18274                                  
 18275                                  intverify:
 18276 00001968 06                      		push	es		; save caller's dma address
 18277 00001969 53                      		push	bx
 18278 0000196A 1E                      		push	ds		; es:bx	-> Bios_Data:disksector
 18279 0000196B 07                      		pop	es
 18280                                  dosimple:
 18281 0000196C BB[5201]                		mov	bx, disksector
 18282                                  					; do the i/o from Bios_Data:disksector
 18283                                  		;;call	far 70:797h ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS BIOSCODE:1665h
 18284                                  		; 17/10/2022
 18285 0000196F 9A[0B07]7000            		call	DOSBIOSSEG:call_orig13
 18286                                  		;call	call_orig13	; call far KERNEL_SEGMENT:call_orig13
 18287 00001974 5B                      		pop	bx
 18288 00001975 07                      		pop	es
 18289 00001976 E907FF                  		jmp	i13ret_ck_chglinerr
 18290                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18291                                  
 18292                                  ; format operation. copy the parameter table into Bios_Data:disksector
 18293                                  
 18294                                  intformat:
 18295 00001979 06                      		push	es
 18296 0000197A 53                      		push	bx
 18297 0000197B 56                      		push	si
 18298 0000197C 57                      		push	di
 18299 0000197D 1E                      		push	ds
 18300                                  
 18301                                  ; point ds to the caller's dma buffer, es to Bios_Data
 18302                                  ; in other words, swap (ds, es)
 18303                                  
 18304 0000197E 06                      		push	es
 18305 0000197F 1E                      		push	ds
 18306 00001980 07                      		pop	es
 18307 00001981 1F                      		pop	ds
 18308 00001982 89DE                    		mov	si, bx
 18309 00001984 BF[5201]                		mov	di, disksector
 18310 00001987 E8BBFD                  		call	move_sector	; user's data into Bios_Data:disksector
 18311 0000198A 1F                      		pop	ds
 18312 0000198B 5F                      		pop	di
 18313 0000198C 5E                      		pop	si		; do the i/o from
 18314 0000198D EBDD                    		jmp	short dosimple	; Bios_Data:disksector
 18315                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18316                                  
 18317                                  ; we can't fit the request into the entire block. perform the operation on
 18318                                  ; the first block.
 18319                                  ;
 18320                                  ; doblock is modified to correctly handle multi-sector disk i/o.
 18321                                  ; old doblock had added the number of sectors i/oed (ah in old doblock) after
 18322                                  ; the doint call to cl. observing only the lower 6 bits of cl(=max. 64) can
 18323                                  ; represent a starting sector, if ah was big, then cl would be clobbered.
 18324                                  ; by the way, we still are going to use cl for this purpose since checkwrap
 18325                                  ; routine will use it as an input. to prevent cl from being clobbered, a
 18326                                  ; safe number of sectors should be calculated like "63 - # of sectors/track".
 18327                                  ; doblock will handle the first block of requested sectors within the
 18328                                  ; boundary of this safe value.
 18329                                  
 18330                                  		; 26/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0
 18331                                  doblock:
 18332                                  
 18333                                  ; try to get the # of sectors/track from bds via rom drive number.
 18334                                  ; for any mini disks installed, here we have to pray that they have the
 18335                                  ; same # of sector/track as the main dos partition disk drive.
 18336                                  				
 18337 0000198F 8B5608                  		mov	dx, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 18338                                  					; get head #, drive #
 18339 00001992 51                      		push	cx
 18340 00001993 06                      		push	es
 18341 00001994 57                      		push	di		; ah - # of sectors before dma boundary
 18342                                  					; al - requested # of sectors for i/o.
 18343 00001995 E83BFE                  		call	find_bds
 18344 00001998 268B4D13                		mov	cx, [es:di+13h]	; [es:di+BDS.secpertrack]
 18345                                  		; 26/12/2023
 18346 0000199C 26F6453F01              		test	byte [es:di+3Fh], 1
 18347                                  		; 12/12/2022
 18348                                  		;test	byte [es:di+23h], 1
 18349                                  		;;test	word [es:di+23h], 1 ; [es:di+BDS.flags],fnon_removable
 18350 000019A1 5F                      		pop	di
 18351 000019A2 07                      		pop	es
 18352 000019A3 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; set al=ah for	floppies
 18353 000019A5 7404                    		jz	short doblockflop ; they are track by track operation
 18354 000019A7 B43F                    		mov	ah, 63		; ah = 63-secpt	(# safe	sectors??)
 18355 000019A9 28CC                    		sub	ah, cl		; al - # of sectors before dma boundary
 18356                                  doblockflop:
 18357 000019AB 59                      		pop	cx
 18358                                  doblockcontinue:
 18359 000019AC 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; if safe_# >= #_of_sectors_to_go_before dma,
 18360 000019AE 7305                    		jnb	short doblocklast ; then #_of_sectors_to_go as it is for doint.
 18361 000019B0 50                      		push	ax
 18362 000019B1 88E0                    		mov	al, ah		; otherwise, set al to ah to operate.
 18363 000019B3 EB03                    		jmp	short doblockdoint
 18364                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18365                                  
 18366                                  doblocklast:
 18367 000019B5 88C4                    		mov	ah, al
 18368 000019B7 50                      		push	ax
 18369                                  doblockdoint:				; let ah = al =	# of sectors for this shot
 18370 000019B8 E82CFE                  		call	doint
 18371 000019BB 727E                    		jb	short bad13	; something happened, bye!
 18372 000019BD 58                      		pop	ax
 18373 000019BE 286602                  		sub	[bp+2],	ah	; sub [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax], ah
 18374                                  					; decrement by the successful operation
 18375 000019C1 00E1                    		add	cl, ah		; advance sector #. safety gauranteed.
 18376 000019C3 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; advance dma addres
 18377 000019C5 00E7                    		add	bh, ah		; twice	for 512	byte sectors
 18378 000019C7 38C4                    		cmp	ah, al		; check	the previous value
 18379 000019C9 740A                    		jz	short buffer	; if #_of_sectors_to_go	< safe_#,
 18380                                  					; then we are done already.
 18381 000019CB 28E0                    		sub	al, ah		; otherwise,
 18382                                  					; #_sector_to_go = #_of_sector_to_go - safe_#
 18383 000019CD E890FD                  		call	check_wrap	; get new cx, dh for the next operation.
 18384 000019D0 EBDA                    		jmp	short doblockcontinue ;	handles	next sectors left.
 18385                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18386                                  
 18387                                  bufferx:
 18388 000019D2 8A7609                  		mov	dh, [bp+9]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx+1]
 18389                                  					; set up head number
 18390                                  buffer:
 18391 000019D5 53                      		push	bx
 18392 000019D6 8A6603                  		mov	ah, [bp+3]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax+1]
 18393 000019D9 80FC03                  		cmp	ah, 3		; romwrite
 18394 000019DC 7525                    		jnz	short doread	;
 18395                                  					
 18396                                  ; copy the offending sector into local buffer
 18397                                  
 18398 000019DE 06                      		push	es
 18399 000019DF 1E                      		push	ds
 18400 000019E0 56                      		push	si
 18401 000019E1 57                      		push	di
 18402 000019E2 1E                      		push	ds		; exchange segment registers
 18403 000019E3 06                      		push	es
 18404 000019E4 1F                      		pop	ds
 18405 000019E5 07                      		pop	es
 18406 000019E6 BF[5201]                		mov	di, disksector	; where to move
 18407 000019E9 57                      		push	di		; save it
 18408 000019EA 89DE                    		mov	si, bx		; source
 18409 000019EC E856FD                  		call	move_sector	; move sector into local buffer
 18410 000019EF 5B                      		pop	bx		; new transfer address
 18411                                  					; (es:bx = Bios_Data:diskbuffer)
 18412 000019F0 5F                      		pop	di		; restore caller's di & si
 18413 000019F1 5E                      		pop	si
 18414 000019F2 1F                      		pop	ds		; restore Bios_Data
 18415                                  
 18416                                  ; see if we are wrapping around a track or head
 18417                                  
 18418 000019F3 B001                    		mov	al, 1		; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 18419                                  					; get drive number
 18420 000019F5 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]
 18421 000019F8 E865FD                  		call	check_wrap	; sets up registers if wrap-around
 18422                                  					;
 18423                                  					; ah is	function
 18424                                  					; al is	1 for single sector transfer
 18425                                  					; es:bx	is local transfer addres
 18426                                  					; cx is	track/sector number
 18427                                  					; dx is	head/drive number
 18428                                  					; si,di	unchanged
 18429 000019FB E8E9FD                  		call	doint
 18430 000019FE 07                      		pop	es		; restore caller's dma segment
 18431 000019FF 723A                    		jb	short bad13	; go clean up
 18432 00001A01 EB22                    		jmp	short dotail
 18433                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18434                                  
 18435                                  ; reading a sector. do int first, then move things around
 18436                                  
 18437                                  doread:
 18438 00001A03 06                      		push	es
 18439 00001A04 53                      		push	bx
 18440 00001A05 1E                      		push	ds		; es = Bios_Code
 18441 00001A06 07                      		pop	es
 18442 00001A07 BB[5201]                		mov	bx, disksector
 18443 00001A0A B001                    		mov	al, 1
 18444 00001A0C 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 18445                                  					; get drive number
 18446 00001A0F E84EFD                  		call	check_wrap	;
 18447                                  					; ah = function
 18448                                  					; al = 1 for single sector
 18449                                  					; es:bx	points to local	buffer
 18450                                  					; cx, dx are track/sector, head/drive
 18451 00001A12 E8D2FD                  		call	doint
 18452 00001A15 5B                      		pop	bx
 18453 00001A16 07                      		pop	es
 18454 00001A17 7222                    		jb	short bad13
 18455 00001A19 56                      		push	si
 18456 00001A1A 57                      		push	di
 18457 00001A1B 89DF                    		mov	di, bx
 18458 00001A1D BE[5201]                		mov	si, disksector
 18459 00001A20 E822FD                  		call	move_sector
 18460 00001A23 5F                      		pop	di
 18461 00001A24 5E                      		pop	si
 18462                                  
 18463                                  ; note the fact that we've done 1 more sector
 18464                                  
 18465                                  dotail:
 18466 00001A25 5B                      		pop	bx		; retrieve new dma area
 18467 00001A26 80C702                  		add	bh, 2		; advance over sector
 18468 00001A29 41                      		inc	cx
 18469 00001A2A 8A4602                  		mov	al, [bp+2]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.oldax]
 18470 00001A2D F8                      		clc
 18471 00001A2E FEC8                    		dec	al
 18472 00001A30 7409                    		jz	short bad13	; no more i/o
 18473                                  
 18474                                  ; see if we wrap around a track or head boundary with starting sector
 18475                                  ; we already have the correct head number to pass to check_wrap
 18476                                  
 18477 00001A32 8A5608                  		mov	dl, [bp+8]	; [bp+INT13FRAME.olddx]
 18478 00001A35 E828FD                  		call	check_wrap
 18479 00001A38 E8ACFD                  		call	doint
 18480                                  
 18481                                  ; we are done. ax has the final code; we throw away what we got before
 18482                                  
 18483                                  ; M046  -- okay gang. Now we've either terminated our DMA loop,
 18484                                  ;	   or we've finished. If carry is set now, our only
 18485                                  ;	   hope for salvation is that it was a read operation
 18486                                  ;	   and the error code is ECC error. In that case, we'll
 18487                                  ;	   just pop the registers and go do the old ECC thing.
 18488                                  ;	   When the DMA error that got us here in the first
 18489                                  ;	   place occurs, it'll handle it.
 18490                                  
 18491                                  bad13:
 18492 00001A3B 89EC                    		mov	sp, bp
 18493 00001A3D 5D                      		pop	bp
 18494 00001A3E 5B                      		pop	bx
 18495 00001A3F 5B                      		pop	bx
 18496 00001A40 59                      		pop	cx
 18497 00001A41 5A                      		pop	dx
 18498 00001A42 7203                    		jb	short xgoterr13_xxxx ; go handle ECC errors
 18499 00001A44 E935FE                  		jmp	ret_from_i13	; non-error exit
 18500                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18501                                  
 18502                                  xgoterr13_xxxx:	
 18503 00001A47 E958FE                  		jmp	goterr13_xxxx
 18504                                  
 18505                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18506                                  		; 10/12/2022
 18507                                  		;db 	0
 18508                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18509                                  
 18510                                  ;Bios_Code ends

 18520                                  dsk_init:				; 2C7h:1742h = 70h:3CB2h
 18521 00001A4A 8A26[7500]              		mov	ah, [drvmax]

 18523 00001A51 1E                      		push	ds		; pass result in es:di
 18524 00001A52 07                      		pop	es
 18525 00001A53 E934EC                  		jmp	SetPtrSav

 18527                                  ; =============== S U B	R O U T	I N E =======================================
 18528                                  
 18529                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18530                                  ; install_bds installs a bds at location es:di into the current linked list of
 18531                                  ; bds maintained by this device driver. it places the bds at the end of the
 18532                                  ; list. Trashes (at least) ax, bx, di, si
 18533                                  ;---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 18534                                  
 18535                                  		; 26/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0
 18536                                  		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - BIOSCODE:1AE0h
 18537                                  install_bds:
 18538 00001A56 1E                      		push	ds		; save Bios_Data segment
 18539 00001A57 BE[1901]                		mov	si, start_bds	; beginning of chain
 18540                                  
 18541                                  		; ds:si now points to link to first bds
 18542                                  		; assume bds list is non-empty
 18543                                  loop_next_bds:
 18544 00001A5A C534                    		lds	si, [si]	; [si+BDS.link]
 18545                                  					; fetch	next bds
 18546 00001A5C 268A4504                		mov	al, [es:di+4]	; [es:di+BDS.drivenum]
 18547 00001A60 384404                  		cmp	[si+4],	al	; does this one	share a	physical
 18548                                  					; drive	with new one?
 18549 00001A63 7518                    		jnz	short next_bds
 18550 00001A65 B310                    		mov	bl, 10h		; fi_am_mult
 18551                                  		; 26/12/2023
 18552 00001A67 26085D3F                		or	[es:di+3Fh], bl
 18553                                  		;or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 18554                                  					; set both of them to i_am_mult	if so
 18555 00001A6B 085C3F                  		or	[si+3Fh], bl
 18556                                  		;or	[si+23h], bl	; [si+BDS.flags]
 18557 00001A6E 2680653FDF              		and	byte [es:di+3Fh], 0DFh
 18558                                  		;and	byte [es:di+23h], 0DFh ; [es:di+BDS.flags],~fi_own_physical
 18559                                  					; we don't own it
 18560 00001A73 8A5C3F                  		mov	bl, [si+3Fh]
 18561                                  		;mov	bl, [si+23h]	; [si+BDS.flags]
 18562                                  					; determine if changeline available
 18563 00001A76 80E302                  		and	bl, 2		; fchangeline
 18564 00001A79 26085D3F                		or	[es:di+3Fh], bl
 18565                                  		;or	[es:di+23h], bl	; [es:di+BDS.flags]
 18566                                  next_bds:
 18567                                  		; 02/09/2023 (PCDOS 7.1)
 18568 00001A7D B8FFFF                  		mov	ax, 0FFFFh	; -1
 18569 00001A80 3904                    		cmp	[si], ax	; [si+BDS.link],-1
 18570                                  		;cmp	word [si], 0FFFFh ; [si+BDS.link],-1
 18571                                  					; are we at end	of list?
 18572 00001A82 75D6                    		jnz	short loop_next_bds
 18573 00001A84 8C4402                  		mov	[si+2], es	; [si+BDS.link+2],es
 18574                                  					; install bds
 18575 00001A87 893C                    		mov	[si], di
 18576 00001A89 268905                  		mov	[es:di], ax	; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 18577                                  		;mov	word [es:di], 0FFFFh ; [es:di+BDS.link],-1
 18578                                  					; set next pointer to null
 18579 00001A8C 1F                      		pop	ds
 18580                                  
 18581                                  ; 01/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - BIOSCODE:1785h)
 18582                                  ; 16/10/2022 (MSDOS 6.0 Code)
 18583                                  
 18584                                  ; **** If the new drive has a higher EOT value, we must alter the
 18585                                  ;      'eot' variable appropriately.
 18586                                  
 18587                                  		; 26/12/2023
 18588 00001A8D 268A4550                		mov	al, [es:di+50h]	; [es:di+BDS.rsecpertrack]
 18589                                  		; 01/06/2019
 18590                                  		;mov	al,[es:di+52]
 18591                                  		; 22/07/2023
 18592                                  		;mov	al,[es:di+BDS.rsecpertrack]
 18593 00001A91 3A06[2C01]              		cmp	al,[eot]
 18594 00001A95 7603                    		jbe	short _eot_ok
 18595 00001A97 A2[2C01]                		mov	[eot],al
 18596                                  _eot_ok:
 18597 00001A9A C3                      		retn

 18611                                  ;  ask to swap the disk in drive a:
