 19889 00000001 ??                      .REQUNIT:	resb 1		;Device unit number
 19890 00000002 ??                      .REQFUNC:	resb 1		;Type of request
 19891 00000003 ????                    .REQSTAT:	resw 1		;Status Word
 19892 00000005 ????????????????                	resb 8		;Reserved for queue links
 19893                                  .size:
 19894                                  endstruc
 19895                                  
 19896                                  ;Status word masks
 19897                                  STERR   EQU     8000H           ;Bit 15 - Error
 19898                                  STBUI   EQU     0200H           ;Bit 9 - Buisy
 19899                                  STDON   EQU     0100H           ;Bit 8 - Done
 19900                                  STECODE EQU     00FFH           ;Error code
 19901                                  WRECODE EQU     0
 19902                                  
 19903                                  ;Function codes
 19904                                  DEVINIT EQU     0               ;Initialization
 19905                                  DINITHL EQU     26              ;Size of init header
 19906                                  DEVMDCH EQU     1               ;Media check
 19907                                  DMEDHL  EQU     15              ;Size of media check header
 19908                                  DEVBPB  EQU     2               ;Get BPB

 19910                                  DBPBHL  EQU     22              ;Size of Get BPB header

 19913                                  DEVRDND EQU     5               ;Non destructive read no wait (character devs)
 19914                                  DRDNDHL EQU     14              ;Size of non destructive read header
 19915                                  DEVIST  EQU     6               ;Input status

 19918                                  ; 21/02/2024

 19922                                  DEVWRTV EQU     9               ;Write with verify

 19924                                  DEVOFL  EQU     11              ;Output flush

 19928                                  struc	SYS_FCB
 19929 00000000 ??                      .fcb_drive:	resb 1
 19930 00000001 ????????????????        .fcb_name:	resb 8
 19931 00000009 ??????                  .fcb_ext:	resb 3
 19932 0000000C ????                    .fcb_EXTENT:	resw 1
 19933 0000000E ????                    .fcb_RECSIZ:	resw 1	; Size of record (user settable)
 19934 00000010 ????                    .fcb_FILSIZ:	resw 1	; Size of file in bytes; used with the following
 19935                                                          ; word
 19936 00000012 ????                    .fcb_DRVBP:	resw 1	; BP for SEARCH FIRST and SEARCH NEXT
 19937 00000014 ????                    .fcb_FDATE:	resw 1	; Date of last writing
 19938 00000016 ????                    .fcb_FTIME:	resw 1	; Time of last writing
 19939 00000018 ??                      .fcb_DEVID:	resb 1	; Device ID number, bits 0-5 if file.
 19940                                                          ; bit 7=0 for file, bit 7=1 for I/O device
 19941                                                          ; If file, bit 6=0 if dirty
 19942                                                          ; If I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 19943                                                          ;               Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 19944                                                          ;               Bit 0=1 if console input device
 19945                                                          ;               Bit 1=1 if console output device
 19946                                                          ;               Bit 2=1 if null device
 19947                                                          ;               Bit 3=1 if clock device
 19948 00000019 ????                    .fcb_FIRCLUS:	resw 1	; First cluster of file
 19949 0000001B ????                    .fcb_CLUSPOS:	resw 1	; Position of last cluster accessed
 19950 0000001D ????                    .fcb_LSTCLUS:	resw 1	; Last cluster accessed and directory
 19951 0000001F ??                                   	resb 1	; pack 2 12 bit numbers into 24 bits...
 19952 00000020 ??                      .fcb_NR:	resb 1	; Next record
 19953 00000021 ????????                .fcb_RR:	resb 4	; Random record
 19954                                  .size:
 19955                                  endstruc
 19956                                  
 19957                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 19958                                  ; Field definition for I/O buffer information
 19959                                  
 19960                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, BUFFER.INC, 1991)
 19961                                  
 19962                                  	; 03/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMDOS.COM)
 19963                                  
 19964                                  struc BUFFINFO
 19965 00000000 ????                    .buf_next:	resw 1		; Pointer to next buffer in list
 19966 00000002 ????                    .buf_prev:	resw 1		; Pointer to prev buffer in list
 19967 00000004 ??                      .buf_ID:	resb 1		; Drive of buffer (bit 7 = 0)
 19968                                  				; SFT table index (bit 7 = 1)
 19969                                  				; = FFH if buffer free
 19970 00000005 ??                      .buf_flags:	resb 1		; Bit 7 = 1 if Remote file buffer
 19971                                  				;	= 0 if Local device buffer
 19972                                  				; Bit 6 = 1 if buffer dirty
 19973                                  				; Bit 5 = Reserved
 19974                                  				; Bit 4 = Search bit (bit 7 = 1)
 19975                                  				; Bit 3 = 1 if buffer is DATA
 19976                                  				; Bit 2 = 1 if buffer is DIR
 19977                                  				; Bit 1 = 1 if buffer is FAT
 19978                                  				; Bit 0 = Reserved
 19979 00000006 ????????                .buf_sector:	resd 1		; Sector number of buffer (flags bit 7 = 0)
 19980                                  ; The next two items are often refed as a word (flags bit 7 = 0)
 19981 0000000A ??                      .buf_wrtcnt:	resb 1		; For FAT sectors, # times sector written out
 19982 0000000B ????                    .buf_wrtcntinc:	resw 1		; "   "     "   , # sectors between each write
 19983 0000000D ????                    		resw 1 ; * ; 03/01/2024 ; PCDOS 7.1
 19984                                  			   ; hw of sectors per FAT
 19985 0000000F ????????                .buf_DPB:	resd 1		; Pointer to drive parameters
 19986 00000013 ????                    .buf_fill:	resw 1		; How full buffer is (flags bit 7 = 1)
 19987 00000015 ??                      .buf_reserved:	resb 1		; make DWORD boundary for 386
 19988 00000016 ????                    		resw 1 ; * ; 03/01/2024 ; PCDOS 7.1
 19989                                  			   ; reserved word for dword boundary
 19990                                  .size:	; 20 bytes ; MSDOS 5.0 to 6.22
 19991                                  	; 24 bytes ; PCDOS 7.1 ; 03/01/2024
 19992                                  endstruc
 19993                                  
 19994                                  %define buf_offset	BUFFINFO.buf_sector ; 22/07/2019
 19995                                  				;For buf_flags bit 7 = 1, this is the byte
 19996                                  				;offset of the start of the buffer in
 19997                                  				;the file pointed to by buf_ID. Thus
 19998                                  				;the buffer starts at location
 19999                                  				;buf_offset in the file and contains
 20000                                  				;buf_fill bytes.
 20001                                  
 20002                                  bufinsiz	equ	BUFFINFO.size	; Size of structure in bytes
 20003                                  
 20004                                  
 20005                                  buf_Free	equ	0FFh		; buf_id of free buffer
 20006                                  
 20007                                  ;Flag byte masks
 20008                                  buf_isnet	EQU	10000000B
 20009                                  buf_dirty	EQU	01000000B
 20010                                  ;***
 20011                                  buf_visit	EQU	00100000B
 20012                                  ;***
 20013                                  buf_snbuf	EQU	00010000B
 20014                                  
 20015                                  buf_isDATA	EQU	00001000B
 20016                                  buf_isDIR	EQU	00000100B
 20017                                  buf_isFAT	EQU	00000010B
 20018                                  buf_type_0	EQU	11110001B	; AND sets type to "none"
 20019                                  
 20020                                  buf_NetID	EQU	bufinsiz
 20021                                  
 20022                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20023                                  
 20024                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20025                                  ;**	DPB - Drive Parameter Block
 20026                                  
 20027                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.0, DPB.INC, 1991)
 20028                                  
 20029                                  ;	BUGBUG - this isn't authorative - it's my probably incomplete and
 20030                                  ;	possibly inaccurate deductions from code study... - jgl
 20031                                  ;
 20032                                  ;	The DPB is DOS's main structure for describing block devices.
 20033                                  ;	It contains info about the "Drive" intermingled with info about
 20034                                  ;	the FAT file system which is presumably on the drive.  I don't know
 20035                                  ;	how those fields are used if it's not the FAT file system - BUGBUG
 20036                                  ;
 20037                                  ;	The DPBs are statically allocated and chained off of DPBHead.
 20038                                  ;	Users scan this chain looking for a match on DPB_DRIVE.
 20039                                  ;	The DPBs are built at init time from info in the SYSDEV structure.
 20040                                  
 20041                                  ; 08/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0 (MSDOS 3.3, DPB.INC, 24/07/1987)
 20042                                  
 20043                                  ; 12/05/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 20044                                  
 20045                                  ; 01/01/2024
 20046                                  %if 0
 20047                                  
 20048                                  struc	DPB
 20049                                  .DRIVE:		resb 1		; Logical drive # assoc with DPB (A=0,B=1,...)
 20050                                  .UNIT:		resb 1		; Driver unit number of DPB
 20051                                  .SECTOR_SIZE:	resw 1		; Size of physical sector in bytes
 20052                                  .CLUSTER_MASK:	resb 1		; Sectors/cluster - 1
 20053                                  .CLUSTER_SHIFT:	resb 1		; Log2 of sectors/cluster
 20054                                  .FIRST_FAT:	resw 1		; Starting record of FATs
 20055                                  .FAT_COUNT:	resb 1		; Number of FATs for this drive
 20056                                  .ROOT_ENTRIES:	resw 1		; Number of directory entries
 20057                                  .FIRST_SECTOR:	resw 1		; First sector of first cluster
 20058                                  .MAX_CLUSTER:	resw 1		; Number of clusters on drive + 1
 20059                                  ; MSDOS 3.3
 20060                                  ;.FAT_SIZE:	resb 1		; Number of records occupied by FAT
 20061                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 20062                                  .FAT_SIZE:	resw 1		; Number of records occupied by FAT
 20063                                  .DIR_SECTOR:	resw 1		; Starting record of directory
 20064                                  .DRIVER_ADDR:	resd 1		; Pointer to driver
 20065                                  .MEDIA:		resb 1		; Media byte
 20066                                  .FIRST_ACCESS:	resb 1		; This is initialized to -1 to force a media
 20067                                  				; check the first time this DPB is used
 20068                                  .NEXT_DPB:	resd 1		; Pointer to next Drive parameter block
 20069                                  .NEXT_FREE:	resw 1		; Cluster # of last allocated cluster
 20070                                  .FREE_CNT:	resw 1		; Count of free clusters, -1 if unknown
 20071                                  .size:
 20072                                  endstruc
 20073                                  
 20074                                  %else
 20075                                  
 20076                                  ; 01/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (PCDOS 7.1)
 20077                                  
 20078                                  struc	DPB
 20079 00000000 ??                      .DRIVE:		resb 1	; 0	; Logical drive # assoc with DPB (A=0,B=1,...)
 20080 00000001 ??                      .UNIT:		resb 1	; 1	; Driver unit number of DPB
 20081 00000002 ????                    .SECTOR_SIZE:	resw 1	; 2	; Size of physical sector in bytes
 20082 00000004 ??                      .CLUSTER_MASK:	resb 1	; 4	; Sectors/cluster - 1
 20083 00000005 ??                      .CLUSTER_SHIFT:	resb 1	; 5	; Log2 of sectors/cluster
 20084 00000006 ????                    .FIRST_FAT:	resw 1	; 6	; Starting record of FATs
 20085 00000008 ??                      .FAT_COUNT:	resb 1	; 8	; Number of FATs for this drive
 20086 00000009 ????                    .ROOT_ENTRIES:	resw 1	; 9	; Number of directory entries
 20087 0000000B ????                    .FIRST_SECTOR:	resw 1	; 11	; First sector of first cluster
 20088 0000000D ????                    .MAX_CLUSTER:	resw 1	; 13	; Number of clusters on drive + 1
 20089 0000000F ????                    .FAT_SIZE:	resw 1	; 15	; Number of records occupied by FAT
 20090 00000011 ????                    .DIR_SECTOR:	resw 1	; 17	; Starting record of directory
 20091 00000013 ????????                .DRIVER_ADDR:	resd 1  ; 19	; Pointer to driver
 20092 00000017 ??                      .MEDIA:		resb 1	; 23	; Media byte
 20093 00000018 ??                      .FIRST_ACCESS:	resb 1	; 24	; This is initialized to -1 to force a media
 20094                                  				; check the first time this DPB is used
 20095 00000019 ????????                .NEXT_DPB:	resd 1	; 25	; Pointer to next Drive parameter block
 20096 0000001D ????                    .NEXT_FREE:	resw 1	; 29	; Cluster # of last allocated cluster
 20097 0000001F ????                    .FREE_CNT:	resw 1	; 31	; Count of free clusters, -1 if unknown
 20098                                  ; FAT32 fs ; 01/01/2024
 20099                                  ; ref: https://en.wikibooks.org/wiki/
 20100                                  ;      First_steps_towards_system_programming_under_MS-DOS_7/Appendix
 20101                                  ;   -- A.03-1. Structure of Drive Parameters Blocks (DPB) ---
 20102 00000021 ????                    .FREE_CNT_HW:	resw 1	; 33	; High word of free cluster count
 20103 00000023 ????                    .EXT_FLAGS:	resw 1	; 35	; FAT32 extended flags (active FAT number)
 20104 00000025 ????                    .FSINFO_SECTOR:	resw 1	; 37	; (FAT32 fs) FSINFO structure sector address
 20105 00000027 ????                    .BKBOOT_SECTOR:	resw 1	; 39	; (FAT32 fs) Backup Boot Sector address
 20106 00000029 ????????                .FCLUS_FSECTOR: resd 1	; 41	; The first cluster's first sector address
 20107 0000002D ????????                .LAST_CLUSTER:	resd 1	; 45	; The last cluster number
 20108 00000031 ????????                .FAT32_SIZE:	resd 1	; 49	; Number of FAT sectors (for FAT32 fs)	 
 20109 00000035 ????????                .ROOT_CLUSTER:	resd 1	; 53	; Root directory's cluster number (FAT32 fs)
 20110                                  ; 01/01/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 20111 00000039 ????????                .FAT32_NXTFREE:	resd 1  ; 57	; The next free cluster (for FAT32 fs)
 20112                                  .size:		; 61 bytes ; 01/01/2024 (PCDOS 7.1)
 20113                                  endstruc

 20115                                  %endif

 20422                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20423                                  ; BIOSTRUC.INC (MSDOS 3.3 - 24/07/1987) 	
 20424                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20425                                  					  ;;Rev 3.30 Modification
 20426                                  ; ROM BIOS CALL PACKET STRUCTURES					  
 20427                                  									  
 20428                                  ;*******************************					  
 20429                                  ;System Service call ( Int 15h )					  
 20430                                  ;*******************************					  
 20431                                  ;Function AH = 0C0h, Return system configuration			  
 20432                                  ;For PC and PCJR on return:						  
 20433                                  ;	(AH)	= 80h							  
 20434                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 20435                                  ;For PCXT, PC PORTABLE and PCAT on return:				  
 20436                                  ;	(AH)	= 86h							  
 20437                                  ;	(CY)	= 1							  
 20438                                  ;For all others:							  
 20439                                  ;	(AH)	= 0							  
 20440                                  ;	(CY)	= 0							  
 20441                                  ;	(ES:BX) = pointer to system descriptor vector in ROS		  
 20442                                  ; System descriptor :							  
 20443                                  ;	DW	xxxx		length of descriptor in bytes,		  
 20444                                  ;				minimum length = 8			  
 20445                                  ;	DB	xx		model byte				  
 20446                                  ;				0FFh	= PC				  
 20447                                  ;				0FEh	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 20448                                  ;				0FDh	= PC/JR 			  
 20449                                  ;				0FCh	= PC/AT				  
 20450                                  ;				0F9h	= Convertable			  
 20451                                  ;				0F8h	= Model 80			  
 20452                                  ;				0E0 thru 0EFh = reserved		  
 20453                                  ;									  
 20454                                  ;	DB	xx		secondary model byte			  
 20455                                  ;				000h	= PC1				  
 20456                                  ;				000h	= PC/XT, Portable		  
 20457                                  ;				000h	= PC/JR 			  
 20458                                  ;				000h	= PC/AT 			  
 20459                                  ;				001h	= PC/AT Model 339		  
 20460                                  ;				003h	= PC/RT				  
 20461                                  ;				000h	= Convertable			  
 20462                                  ;									  
 20463                                  ;	DB	xx		bios revision level			  
 20464                                  ;				00 for first release, subsequent release  
 20465                                  ;				of code with same model byte and	  
 20466                                  ;				secondary model byte require revison level
 20467                                  ;				to increase by one.			  
 20468                                  ;									  
 20469                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 1		  
 20470                                  ;				X0000000 = 1, bios use DMA channel 3	  
 20471                                  ;					 = 0, DMA channel 3 not used	  
 20472                                  ;									  
 20473                                  ;				0X000000 = 1, 2nd Interrupt chip present  
 20474                                  ;					 = 0, 2nd Interrupt chip not present
 20475                                  ;									  
 20476                                  ;				00X00000 = 1, Real Time Clock present	  
 20477                                  ;					 = 0, Real Time Clock not present 
 20478                                  ;									  
 20479                                  ;				000X0000 = 1, Keyboard escape sequence(INT 15h)
 20480                                  ;						called in keyboard interrupt
 20481                                  ;						(Int 09h).		  
 20482                                  ;					 = 0, Keyboard escape sequence not
 20483                                  ;						called. 		  
 20484                                  ;				0000XXXX reserved			  
 20485                                  ;									  
 20486                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 20487                                  ;									  
 20488                                  ;	DB	xx		feature information byte 2 - reserved	  
 20489                                  ;

 20613                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20614                                  ; CURDIR.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991)
 20615                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20616                                  ; 22/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 20617                                  
 20618                                  ;**	CDS - Current Directory Structure
 20619                                  ;
 20620                                  ; CDS items are used bu the internal routines to store cluster numbers and
 20621                                  ; network identifiers for each logical name.  The ID field is used dually,
 20622                                  ; both as net ID and for a cluster number for local devices. In the case
 20623                                  ; of local devices, the cluster number will be -1 if there is a potential
 20624                                  ; of the disk being changed or if the path must be recracked.
 20625                                  ;
 20626                                  ;	Some pathnames have special preambles, such as
 20627                                  ;
 20628                                  ;		\\machine\sharename\...
 20629                                  ;	For these pathnames we can't allow ".." processing to back us
 20630                                  ;	up into the special front part of the name.  The CURDIR_END field
 20631                                  ;	holds the address of the seperator character which marks
 20632                                  ;	the split between the special preamble and the regular
 20633                                  ;	path list; ".." processing isn't allowed to back us up past
 20634                                  ;	(i.e., before) CURDIR_END
 20635                                  ;	For the root, it points at the leading /. For net
 20636                                  ;	assignments it points at the end (nul) of the initial assignment:
 20637                                  ;	A:/	\\foo\bar	    \\foo\bar\blech\bozo
 20638                                  ;	  ^		 ^		     ^
 20639                                  
 20640                                  DIRSTRLEN	EQU	64+3		; Max length in bytes of directory strings
 20641                                  TEMPLEN 	EQU	DIRSTRLEN*2
 20642                                  
 20643                                  struc 		curdir_list
 20644                                  ; MSDOS 3.3
 20645 00000000 <res 43h>               .cdir_text	resb	DIRSTRLEN	; text of assignment and curdir
 20646 00000043 ????                    .cdir_flags	resw	1		; various flags
 20647 00000045 ????????                .cdir_devptr	resd	1		; local pointer to DPB or net device
 20648 00000049 ????????                .cdir_ID	resw	2		; cluster of current dir (net ID)
 20649 0000004D ????                    .cdir_usr_word	resw	1
 20650 0000004F ????                    .cdir_end	resw	1		; end of assignment
 20651                                  ; MSDOS 6.0
 20652 00000051 ??                      .cdir_type:	resb	1		; IFS drive (2=ifs, 4=netuse)
 20653 00000052 ????????                .cdir_ifd_hdr:	resd	1		; Ptr to File System Header
 20654 00000056 ????                    .cdir_fsda:	resb	2		; File System Dependent Data Area
 20655                                  .size:
 20656                                  endstruc
 20657                                  
 20658                                  curdirlen	EQU	curdir_list.size	; Needed for screwed up
 20659                                  						; ASM87 which doesn't allow
 20660                                  						; Size directive as a macro
 20661                                  						; argument
 20662                                  %define curdir_netID	dword [curdir_list.cdir_ID]
 20663                                  
 20664                                  ;**	Flag values for CURDIR_FLAGS
 20665                                  
 20666                                  ;Flag word masks
 20667                                  curdir_isnet	EQU	1000000000000000B
 20668                                  curdir_isifs	EQU	1000000000000000B
 20669                                  curdir_inuse	EQU	0100000000000000B
 20670                                  curdir_splice	EQU	0010000000000000B
 20671                                  curdir_local	EQU	0001000000000000B

 20673                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20674                                  ; SF.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 20675                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 20676                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 20677                                  
 20678                                  ; 09/04/2024 - Retro DOS v4.2 (BugFix)
 20679                                  ; 09/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 20680                                  
 20681                                  ; system file table
 20682                                  
 20683                                  ;**	System File Table SuperStructure
 20684                                  ;
 20685                                  ;	The system file table entries are allocated in contiguous groups.
 20686                                  ;	There may be more than one such groups; the SF "superstructure"
 20687                                  ;	tracks the groups.
 20688                                  
 20689                                  struc	SF
 20690 00000000 ????????                .SFLink:	resd	1
 20691 00000004 ????                    .SFCount:	resw	1		; number of entries
 20692 00000006 ????                    .SFTable:	resw	1		; beginning of array of the following
 20693                                  .size:
 20694                                  endstruc
 20695                                  
 20696                                  ;**	System file table entry
 20697                                  ;
 20698                                  ;	These are the structures which are at SFTABLE in the SF structure.
 20699                                  
 20700                                  struc	SF_ENTRY
 20701 00000000 ????                    .sf_ref_count:	resw	1		; number of processes sharing entry
 20702                                  					;   if FCB then ref count
 20703 00000002 ????                    .sf_mode: 	resw	1		; mode of access or high bit on if FCB
 20704 00000004 ??                      .sf_attr: 	resb	1		; attribute of file
 20705 00000005 ????                    .sf_flags:	resw	1		;Bits 8-15
 20706                                  					; Bit 15 = 1 if remote file
 20707                                  					;	 = 0 if local file or device
 20708                                  					; Bit 14 = 1 if date/time is not to be
 20709                                  					;   set from clock at CLOSE.  Set by
 20710                                  					;   FILETIMES and FCB_CLOSE.  Reset by
 20711                                  					;   other reseters of the dirty bit
 20712                                  					;   (WRITE)
 20713                                  					; Bit 13 = Pipe bit (reserved)
 20714                                  					;
 20715                                  					; Bits 0-7 (old FCB_devid bits)
 20716                                  					; If remote file or local file, bit
 20717                                  					; 6=0 if dirty Device ID number, bits
 20718                                  					; 0-5 if local file.
 20719                                  					; bit 7=0 for local file, bit 7
 20720                                  					;      =1 for local I/O device
 20721                                  					; If local I/O device, bit 6=0 if EOF (input)
 20722                                  					;		Bit 5=1 if Raw mode
 20723                                  					;		Bit 0=1 if console input device
 20724                                  					;		Bit 1=1 if console output device
 20725                                  					;		Bit 2=1 if null device
 20726                                  					;		Bit 3=1 if clock device
 20727 00000007 ????????                .sf_devptr:	resd	1		; Points to DPB if local file, points
 20728                                  					; to device header if local device,
 20729                                  					; points to net device header if
 20730                                  					; remote
 20731 0000000B ????                    .sf_firclus:	resw	1		; First cluster of file (bit 15 = 0)
 20732                                  ;.sf_lstclus:	resw	1 ; *	
 20733 0000000D ????                    .sf_time: 	resw	1		; Time associated with file
 20734 0000000F ????                    .sf_date: 	resw	1		; Date associated with file
 20735 00000011 ????????                .sf_size: 	resd	1		; Size associated with file
 20736 00000015 ????????                .sf_position:	resd	1		; Read/Write pointer or LRU count for FCBs
 20737                                  ;
 20738                                  ; Starting here, the next 7 bytes may be used by the file system to store an
 20739                                  ; ID
 20740                                  ;
 20741 00000019 ????                    .sf_cluspos:	resw	1		; Position of last cluster accessed
 20742 0000001B ????????                .sf_dirsec:	resd	1 ; 09/04/2024	; Sector number of directory sector for this file
 20743 0000001F ??                      .sf_dirpos:	resb	1		; Offset of this entry in the above
 20744                                  ;
 20745                                  ; End of 7 bytes of file-system specific info.
 20746                                  ;
 20747 00000020 <res Bh>                .sf_name:	resb	11		; 11 character name that is in the
 20748                                  					; directory entry.  This is used by
 20749                                  					; close to detect file deleted and
 20750                                  					; disk changed errors.
 20751                                  ; SHARING INFO
 20752 0000002B ????????                .sf_chain:	resd	1		; link to next SF
 20753 0000002F ????                    .sf_UID:	resw	1
 20754 00000031 ????                    .sf_PID:	resw	1
 20755 00000033 ????                    .sf_MFT:	resw	1
 20756 00000035 ????                    .sf_lstclus:	resw	1 ; *		; Last cluster accessed
 20757 00000037 ????????                .sf_IFS_HDR:	resd 	1 ; **
 20758                                  .size:
 20759                                  endstruc

 21036                                  	; include MSSTACK.INC	;Main stack program and data definitions

 21042                                  ; 05/07/2018
 21043                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21044                                  ; 04/06/2018 - Retro DOS v3.0
 21045                                  
 21046                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21047                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT)
 21048                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21049                                  
 21050                                  ;	MSStack.inc
 21051                                  ;
 21052                                  ;	Interrupt level 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7,(10, 11, 12, 14, 15 - AT level)
 21053                                  ;	should follow the standard Interrupt Sharing Scheme which has
 21054                                  ;	a standard header structure.
 21055                                  ;	Fyi, the following shows the relations between
 21056                                  ;	the interrupt vector and interrupt level.
 21057                                  ; VEC(Hex)    2  8  9  A  B  C	D  E  70  72  73  74  76  77
 21058                                  ; LVL(Deci)   9  0  1  2  3  4	5  6   8  10  11  12  14  15
 21059                                  ;	MSSTACK module modifies the following interrupt vectors
 21060                                  ;	to meet the standard Interrupt Sharing standard;
 21061                                  ;	  A, B, C, D, E, 72, 73, 74, 76, 77.
 21062                                  ;	Also, for interrupt level 7 and 15, the FirstFlag in a standard header
 21063                                  ;	should be initialized to indicat whether this interrupt handler is
 21064                                  ;	the first (= 80h) or not.  The FirstFlag entry of INT77h's
 21065                                  ;	program header is initialized in STKINIT.INC module.
 21066                                  ;	FirstFlag is only meaningful for interrupt level 7 and 15.
 21067                                  ;
 21068                                  
 21069                                  ;  User specifies the number of stack elements - default = 9
 21070                                  ;						 minimum = 8
 21071                                  ;						 maximum = 64
 21072                                  ;
 21073                                  ;  Intercepts Asynchronous Hardware Interrupts only
 21074                                  ;
 21075                                  ;  Picks a stack from pool of stacks and switches to it
 21076                                  ;
 21077                                  ;  Calls the previously saved interrupt vector after pushing flags
 21078                                  ;
 21079                                  ;  On return, returns the stack to the stack pool
 21080                                  ;
 21081                                  
 21082                                  ; This is a modification of STACKS:
 21083                                  ; 1. To fix a bug which was causing the program to take up too much space.
 21084                                  ; 2. To dispense stack space from hi-mem first rather than low-mem first.
 21085                                  ;    . Clobbers the stack that got too big instead of innocent stack
 21086                                  ;    . Allows system to work if the only stack that got too big was the most
 21087                                  ;      deeply nested one
 21088                                  ; 3. Disables NMI interrupts while setting the NMI vector.
 21089                                  ; 4. Does not intercept any interrupts on a PCjr.
 21090                                  ; 5. Double checks that a nested interrupt didn't get the same stack.
 21091                                  ; 6. Intercepts Ints 70, 72-77 for PC-ATs and other future products
 21092                                  
 21093                                  		;EVEN
 21094                                  ;align 2
 21095                                  		; 21/10/2022
 21096                                  
 21097 00000000 0000                    		dw	0	; spare field but leave these in order
 21098 00000002 0000                    stackcount:	dw	0
 21099 00000004 0000                    stackat: 	dw	0
 21100 00000006 0000                    stacksize:	dw	0
 21101 00000008 0000                    stacks:		dw	0
 21102 0000000A 0000                    		dw	0
 21103                                  
 21104 0000000C [0800]                  firstentry:	dw	stacks
 21105 0000000E [4800]                  lastentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 21106 00000010 [4800]                  nextentry:	dw	stacks+(defaultcount*entrysize)-entrysize
 21107                                  
 21108                                  ;***********************************************************************
 21109                                  ; THESE ARE THE INDIVIDUAL INTERRUPT HANDLERS
 21110                                  
 21111                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 21112                                  
 21113 00000012 00000000                old02:	dd	0
 21114                                  
 21115                                  int02:
 21116                                  
 21117                                  ; *********************************************************************
 21118                                  ;
 21119                                  ; this is special support for the pc convertible / nmi handler
 21120                                  ;
 21121                                  ;	on the pc convertible, there is a situation where an nmi can be 
 21122                                  ;	caused by using the "out" instructions to certain ports. when this
 21123                                  ;	occurs, the pc convertible hardware *guarantees* that **nothing** 
 21124                                  ;	can stop the nmi or interfere with getting to the nmi handler. this
 21125                                  ;	includes other type of interrupts (hardware and software), and
 21126                                  ;	also includes other type of nmi's. when any nmi has occured,
 21127                                  ;	no other interrtupt (hardware, software or nmi) can occur until
 21128                                  ;	the software takes specific steps to allow further interrupting.
 21129                                  ;
 21130                                  ;	for pc convertible, the situation where the nmi is generated by the
 21131                                  ;	"out" to a control port requires "fixing-up" and re-attempting. in
 21132                                  ;	otherwords, it is actually a "restartable exception". in this
 21133                                  ;	case, the software handler must be able to get to the stack in
 21134                                  ;	order to figure out what instruction caused the problem, where
 21135                                  ;	it was "out"ing to and what value it was "out"ing.  therefore,
 21136                                  ;	we will not switch stacks in this situation. this situation is
 21137                                  ;	detected by interrogating port 62h, and checking for a bit value
 21138                                  ;	of 80h. if set, *****do not switch stacks*****.
 21139                                  ;
 21140                                  ; *********************************************************************
 21141                                  
 21142 00000016 50                      	push	ax
 21143 00000017 06                      	push	es
 21144 00000018 B800F0                  	mov	ax,0F000h
 21145 0000001B 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 21146                                  	; 02/11/2022
 21147 0000001D 26803EFEFFF9            	cmp	byte [es:0FFFEh],0F9h ; mdl_convert ; check if convertible
 21148 00000023 07                      	pop	es
 21149 00000024 750C                    	jne	short normal02
 21150                                  
 21151 00000026 E462                    	in	al,62h		; PC/XT PPI port C. Bits:
 21152                                  				; 0-3: values of DIP switches
 21153                                  				; 5: 1=Timer 2 channel out
 21154                                  				; 6: 1=I/O channel check
 21155                                  				; 7: 1=RAM parity check error occurred.
 21156 00000028 A880                    	test	al,80h
 21157 0000002A 7406                    	jz	short normal02
 21158                                  special02:
 21159 0000002C 58                      	pop	ax
 21160 0000002D 2EFF2E[1200]            	jmp	far [cs:old02]
 21161                                  normal02:
 21162 00000032 58                      	pop	ax
 21163 00000033 E81101                  	call	do_int_stacks
 21164 00000036 [1200]                  	dw	old02

 21392                                  ;********************************************************************
 21393                                  ;common routines
 21394                                  ;********************************************************************
 21395                                  
 21396                                  ; do interrupt stack switching. the fake return address holds
 21397                                  ; a pointer to the far-pointer of the actual interrupt
 21398                                  ; service routine
 21399                                  
 21400                                  ; 21/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 21401                                  ; 21/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 21402                                  
 21403                                  ;allocbyte   equ 0
 21404                                  ;intlevel    equ 1
 21405                                  ;savedsp     equ 2
 21406                                  ;savedss     equ 4
 21407                                  ;newsp       equ 6
 21408                                  
 21409                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)
 21410                                  ; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:0147h)
 21411                                  
 21412                                  do_int_stacks:
 21413 00000147 50                      	push	ax
 21414 00000148 55                      	push	bp
 21415 00000149 06                      	push	es
 21416 0000014A 2E8E06[0A00]            	mov	es,[cs:stacks+2]	; Get segment of stacks
 21417 0000014F 2E8B2E[1000]            	mov	bp,[cs:nextentry]	; get most likely candidate
 21418 00000154 B001                    	mov	al,allocated ; 1
 21419                                  	; 21/10/2022
 21420                                  	;xchg	[es:bp+allocbyte],al 
 21421                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21422 00000156 26864600                	xchg	[es:bp],al		; grab the entry
 21423 0000015A 3C00                    	cmp	al,free ; 0		; still avail?
 21424 0000015C 7551                    	jne	short notfree02
 21425                                  
 21426 0000015E 2E832E[1000]08          	sub	word [cs:nextentry],entrysize ; set for next interrupt
 21427                                  
 21428                                  found02:
 21429 00000164 26896602                	mov	[es:bp+savedsp],sp	; save sp value
 21430 00000168 268C5604                	mov	[es:bp+savedss],ss	; save ss also
 21431                                  
 21432 0000016C 89E8                    	mov	ax,bp			; temp save of table offset
 21433                                  
 21434 0000016E 268B6E06                	mov	bp,[es:bp+newsp]	; get new SP value
 21435                                  	; 21/10/2022
 21436                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+6]
 21437                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21438                                  	;cmp	[es:bp+0],ax	
 21439 00000172 26394600                	cmp	[es:bp],ax		; check for offset into table
 21440 00000176 7544                    	jne	short foundbad02
 21441                                  
 21442                                  	; 02/07/2023 (MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT code)
 21443 00000178 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es			; point ss,sp to the new stack
 21444 0000017A 8EC5                    	mov	es,bp
 21445 0000017C 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp
 21446 0000017E 8B6E06                  	mov	bp,[bp+6]
 21447 00000181 8ED0                    	mov	ss,ax
 21448 00000183 8CC4                    	mov	sp,es
 21449 00000185 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 21450 00000187 2E8B6E00                	mov	bp,[cs:bp]
 21451                                  
 21452                                  	; 21/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT code)
 21453                                  	;push    bp
 21454                                  	;mov     bp,sp
 21455                                  	;mov     ax,[bp+8]
 21456                                  	;pop     bp
 21457                                  	;push    es
 21458                                  	;pop     ss
 21459                                  	;mov     sp,bp
 21460                                  	;mov     bp,ax
 21461                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21462                                  	;;mov	bp,[cs:bp+0]	
 21463                                  	;mov	bp,[cs:bp]	
 21464                                  
 21465 0000018B 9C                      	pushf				; go execute the real interrupt handler
 21466                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21467 0000018C 2EFF5E00                	call	far [cs:bp]		;  which will iret back to here
 21468                                  	; 21/10/2022
 21469                                  	;call	far [cs:bp+0]
 21470                                  
 21471 00000190 89E5                    	mov	bp,sp			; retrieve the table offset for us
 21472                                  	; 11/12/2022
 21473 00000192 268B6E00                	mov	bp,[es:bp]		;  but leave it on the stack
 21474                                  	; 21/10/2022
 21475                                  	;mov	bp,[es:bp+0]
 21476 00000196 268E5604                	mov	ss,[es:bp+savedss]	; get old stack back
 21477 0000019A 268B6602                	mov	sp,[es:bp+savedsp]
 21478                                  
 21479                                  	; 11/12/2022

 23059                                  ; Now, if this is not romdos, we decide what to do with the DOS code.
 23060                                  ; It will either be relocated to low memory, above the DOS data structures,
 23061                                  ; or else it will be located in HiMem, in which case a stub with the DOS
 23062                                  ; code entry points will be located in low memory. Dos_segreinit is used
 23063                                  ; to tell the DOS data where the code has been placed, and to install the
 23064                                  ; low memory stub if necessary. If the DOS is going to go into HiMem, we
 23065                                  ; must first initialize it in its present location and load the installable
 23066                                  ; device drivers. Then, if a HiMem driver has been located, we can actually
 23067                                  ; relocate the DOS code into HiMem.
 23068                                  ;
 23069                                  ; For ROMDOS, if DOS=HIGH is indicated, then we need to call dos_segreinit
 23070                                  ; to install the low memory stub (this must be done before allowing any
 23071                                  ; device drivers to hook interrupt vectors). Otherwise, we don't need to 
 23072                                  ; call dos_segreinit at all, since the interrupt vector table has already 
 23073                                  ; been patched.

 23465                                  ;   Once we get to this point, the above code, which is below "retry"

 23469                                  retry:		; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:094Ch ; 07/04/2024
 23470 0000078E BA[8C44]                	mov	dx,commnd	; now pointing to file description
 23471                                  
 23472                                  ; we are going to open the command interpreter and size it as is done in
 23473                                  ; ldfil. the reason we must do this is that sysinit is in free memory. if
 23474                                  ; there is not enough room for the command interpreter,exec will probably
 23475                                  ; overlay our stack and code so when it returns with an error sysinit won't be
 23476                                  ; here to catch it. this code is not perfect (for instance .exe command
 23477                                  ; interpreters are possible) because it does its sizing based on the
 23478                                  ; assumption that the file being loaded is a .com file. it is close enough to
 23479                                  ; correctness to be usable.
 23480                                  
 23481                                  ; first, find out where the command interpreter is going to go.
 23482                                  
 23483 00000791 52                      	push	dx		; save pointer to name
 23484 00000792 BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFFh

 23492 000007A1 B449                    	mov	ah,49h	; DEALLOC
 23493 000007A3 CD21                    	int	21h		; give it right back
 23494 000007A5 89DD                    	mov	bp,bx
 23495                                  
 23496                                  ; es:0 points to block,and bp is the size of the block in para.
 23497                                  
 23498                                  ; we will now adjust the size in bp down by the size of sysinit.
 23499                                  ; we need to do this because exec might get upset if some of the exec
 23500                                  ; data in sysinit is overlayed during the exec.
 23501                                  
 23502                                  	; 22/10/2022
 23503                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT:083Bh)

 23505 000007AB 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs		 ; get location of beginning of sysinit
 23506                                  
 23507                                  ; Note that the "config_wrkseg" environment data is a segment in
 23508                                  ; unallocated memory (as of the Dealloc of [area], above). This is ideal
 23509                                  ; in one sense, because Exec is going to make a copy of it for COMMAND.COM
 23510                                  ; anyway, and no one has responsibility for freeing "config_wrkseg". But
 23511                                  ; we need to make sure that there's no way Exec will stomp on that data
 23512                                  ; before it can copy it, and one way to do that is to make the available
 23513                                  ; memory calculation even more "paranoid", by subtracting "config_wrkseg"
 23514                                  ; from the "memory_size" segment value (which is typically A000h) instead
 23515                                  ; of the current sysinit CS....
 23516                                  ;
 23517                                  ; The reason I use the term "paranoid" is because this code should have
 23518                                  ; slid the data required by Exec up to the very top of memory, because as
 23519                                  ; it stands, you have to have sizeof(COMMAND.COM) PLUS 64K to load just
 23520                                  ; COMMAND.COM (64k is about what sysinit, and all the goop above sysinit,
 23521                                  ; consumes). Now it's just a little worse (65K or more, depending on
 23522                                  ; the size of your CONFIG.SYS, since the size of the environment workspace
 23523                                  ; is determined by the size of CONFIG.SYS.... -JTP
 23524                                  
 23525                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21, IO.SYS)

 23853                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23854                                  ; procedure : AllocFreeMem
 23855                                  ;
 23856                                  ; Allocate Max memory from DOS to find out where to load DOS.
 23857                                  ; DOS is at temporary location when this call is being made
 23858                                  ;
 23859                                  ; Inputs : None
 23860                                  ; Outputs: The biggest chunk of memory is allocated (all mem at init time)
 23861                                  ;	   [area] & [memhi] set to the para value of the start of the
 23862                                  ;	   free memory.
 23863                                  ;
 23864                                  ; Uses   : AX, BX
 23865                                  ;
 23866                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23867                                  	
 23868                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 23869                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:09A2h)
 23870                                  
 23871                                  	; 08/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 23872                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM, SYSINIT:0AB5h)
 23873                                  
 23874                                  	; 23/10/2022
 23875                                  AllocFreeMem:
 23876 000008F5 BBFFFF                  	mov	bx,0FFFFh
 23877 000008F8 B448                    	mov	ah,48h ; ALLOC
 23878 000008FA CD21                    	int	21h			; first time fails
 23879 000008FC B448                    	mov	ah,48h ; ALLOC
 23880 000008FE CD21                    	int	21h			; second time gets it
 23881                                  	; 11/12/2022
 23882                                  	; ds = cs
 23883                                  	;mov	[cs:area],ax
 23884                                  	;mov	[cs:memhi],ax		; memhi:memlo now points to
 23885 00000900 A3[6403]                	mov	[area],ax
 23886 00000903 A3[6003]                	mov	[memhi],ax		; memhi:memlo now points to			
 23887 00000906 C3                      	retn				; start of free memory
 23888                                  				
 23889                                  	; include msbio.cl6
 23890                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23891                                  DOSLOMSG:

 23898                                  ; procedure : LoadDOSHiOrLo
 23899                                  ;
 23900                                  ;		Tries to move DOS into HMA. If it fails then loads
 23901                                  ;		DOS into Low memory. For ROMDOS, nothing is actually
 23902                                  ;		moved; this just tries to allocate the HMA, and prints
 23903                                  ;		a message if this is not possible.
 23904                                  ;
 23905                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23906

 23917                                  	; 23/10/2022
 23918                                  	;push	cs
 23919                                  	;pop	ds

 23922 0000095F B409                    	mov	ah,9
 23923 00000961 BA[0709]                	mov	dx,DOSLOMSG		; inform user that we are
 23924 00000964 CD21                    	int	21h			; loading low
 23925                                  
 23926                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
 23927                                  	; actually move the dos, and reinitialize it.
 23928                                  
 23929 00000966 BB0100                  	mov	bx,1				; M012
 23930                                  						;  use int 21 alloc for mem

 23932                                  	; 11/12/2022
 23933                                  	; ds = cs
 23934                                  	;mov	es,[cs:CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION]	; give dos its temporary loc.

 23954                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23955                                  ;
 23956                                  ; procedure : TryToMovDOSHi
 23957                                  ;
 23958                                  ;		This tries to move DOS into HMA.
 23959                                  ;		Returns CY if it failed.
 23960                                  ;		If it succeeds returns with carry cleared.
 23961                                  ;
 23962                                  ;		For ROMDOS, dos_segreinit must be called again to allow
 23963                                  ;		the A20 switching code in the low mem stub to be installed.
 23964                                  ; 
 23965                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 23966                                  
 23967                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 23968                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:092Ah)
 23969                                  TryToMovDOSHi:
 23970                                  	; 11/12/2022
 23971                                  	; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23972                                  	; ds = cs
 23973 0000097C E81300                  	call	MovDOSHi
 23974 0000097F 7210                    	jc	short ttldhx
 23975                                  
 23976                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS
 23977                                  	; 23/10/2022
 23978                                  	;mov	es,[cs:CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION] ; give dos its temporary loc.
 23979                                  	;;mov	es,[cs:FINAL_DOS_LOCATION] ; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 23980                                  	; 11/12/2022
 23981                                  	; ds = cs
 23982 00000981 8E06[7302]              	mov	es,[CURRENT_DOS_LOCATION]
 23983                                  ;else
 23984                                  ;	..
 23985                                  ;endif ; ROMDOS
 23986                                  
 23987                                  	; 11/12/2022
 23988                                  	; ds = cs
 23989 00000985 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax			; ax = 00 ---> install stub
 23990                                  	;call	far [cs:dos_segreinit]	; call dos segreinit
 23991 00000987 FF1E[7D02]              	call	far [dos_segreinit]
 23992                                  	;mov	byte [cs:runhigh],1
 23993 0000098B C606[6C02]01            	mov	byte [runhigh],1
 23994 00000990 F8                      	clc
 23995                                  ttldhx:
 23996 00000991 C3                      	retn

 24000                                  ; procedure : MovDOSHi
 24001                                  ;
 24002                                  ;		Tries to allocate HMA and Move DOS/BIOS code into HMA
 24003                                  ;		For ROMDOS, the code is not actually moved, but the
 24004                                  ;		HMA is allocated and prepared for sub-allocation.
 24005                                  ;
 24006                                  ;		Returns : CY if it failed
 24007                                  ;
 24008                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 24009

 24019                                  
 24020                                  ;ifndef ROMDOS

 24022

 24025

 24028

 24030

 24032                                  	; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 24033                                  	;xor	di,di
 24034                                  	
 24035                                  	; 23/10/2022
 24036                                  	;mov	cx,[cs:hi_doscod_size]		; pass the code size of DOS
 24037                                  	; 11/12/2022
 24038                                  	; ds = cs
 24039                                  	;mov	cx,[hi_doscod_size]		; when it is in HMA
 24040                                  	; 08/03/2025 (MiniDOS)
 24041 0000099F 8B0E[8102]              	mov	cx,[dos_code_size]	
 24042 000009A3 E81100                  	call	MovDOS				; and move it
 24043                                  
 24044                                  	; ES:DI points to free HMA after DOS
 24045                                  ;else
 24046                                  ;	; allocate space at beginning of HMA to allow for CPMHack

 24393                                  ; BUGBUG -- 5 Aug 92 -- chuckst -- Allocating space for DOS
 24394                                  ;	  using DOS itself causes an arena to be generated.
 24395                                  ;	  Unfortunately, certain programs (like PROTMAN$)
 24396                                  ;	  assume that the device drivers are loaded into
 24397                                  ;	  the first arena. For this reason, MagicDrv's
 24398                                  ;	  main device driver header arena is manually
 24399                                  ;	  truncated from the arena chain, and the space
 24400                                  ;	  for DOS is allocated using the following
 24401                                  ;	  simple code, which also assumes that the
 24402                                  ;	  first arena is the free one where DOS's low
 24403                                  ;	  stub will go.
 24404                                  ;
 24405                                  ; M012 : BEGIN
 24406                                  
 24407                                  	; 23/10/2022
 24408                                  update_arena:
 24409 00000A23 1E                      	push	ds ; ds = cs
 24410 00000A24 57                      	push	di
 24411 00000A25 51                      	push	cx
 24412 00000A26 52                      	push	dx
 24413                                  	; 23/10/2022
 24414                                  	;lds	di,[cs:DOSINFO]			; get ptr to DOS var
 24415                                  	; 11/12/2022
 24416                                  	; ds = cs 
 24417 00000A27 C53E[6D02]              	lds	di,[DOSINFO] ; 27/03/2019	
 24418 00000A2B 4F                      	dec	di
 24419 00000A2C 4F                      	dec	di				; Arena head is immediately
 24420                                  						;  before sysvar
 24421 00000A2D 8E05                    	mov	es,[di]				; es = arena head
 24422                                  	;mov	cx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]		; cx = total low mem size
 24423 00000A2F 268B0E0300              	mov	cx,[es:3]
 24424 00000A34 39D9                    	cmp	cx,bx				; is it sufficient ?
 24425 00000A36 7227                    	jb	short FatalErr			; no, fatal error
 24426                                  
 24427                                  	;mov	dl,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 24428 00000A38 268A160000              	mov	dl,[es:0]
 24429 00000A3D 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es
 24430 00000A3F 01D8                    	add	ax,bx				; ax = new arena head
 24431 00000A41 8905                    	mov	[di],ax				; store it in DOS data area
 24432 00000A43 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 24433                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIGNATURE],dl		; type of arena
 24434 00000A45 88160000                	mov	[0],dl
 24435                                  	;mov	word [ARENA.OWNER],0		; free
 24436 00000A49 C70601000000            	mov	word [1],0
 24437 00000A4F 29D9                    	sub	cx,bx				; size of the new block
 24438                                  	;mov	[ARENA.SIZE],cx			; store it in the arena
 24439 00000A51 890E0300                	mov	[3],cx
 24440 00000A55 8CC0                    	mov	ax,es				; return seg to the caller
 24441                                  	; 23/10/2022
 24442                                  	;; 24/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (ORG 0)	; Take care ORG 30h of
 24443 00000A57 83E803                  	sub	ax,3				;  BIOS code
 24444 00000A5A 5A                      	pop	dx
 24445 00000A5B 59                      	pop	cx
 24446 00000A5C 5F                      	pop	di
 24447 00000A5D 1F                      	pop	ds ; ds = cs
 24448 00000A5E C3                      	retn
 24449                                  ;
 24450                                  ; M012 : END
 24451                                  ;
 24452                                  FatalErr:

 24470                                  ;
 24471                                  ; procedure : AllocHMA
 24472                                  ;
 24473                                  ;	grab_the_hma tries to enable a20 and make sure there is memory
 24474                                  ;	  up there. If it gets any sort of error, it will return with
 24475                                  ;	  carry set so that we can resort to running low.
 24476                                  ;
 24477                                  ;	It also returns ES: -> 0ffffh if it returns success
 24478                                  ;
 24479                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 24480                                  
 24481                                  AllocHMA:
 24482                                  ;	cas note:  The pre-286 check is no longer needed here since the
 24483                                  ;		   presence of XMS is sufficient. However, this code hasn't
 24484                                  ;		   been deleted because it can be recycled for skipping the
 24485                                  ;		   extra pass of CONFIG.SYS and assuming we're running low
 24486                                  ;		   in the case of a pre-286.
 24487                                  
 24488                                  ;;	see if we're running on a pre-286. If not, force low.
 24489                                  ;
 24490                                  ;	xor	ax,ax
 24491                                  ;	pushf			; save flags (like int)
 24492                                  ;	push	ax
 24493                                  ;	popf
 24494                                  ;	pushf
 24495                                  ;	pop	ax
 24496                                  ;	popf			; restore original flags (like int)

 24499                                  ;	jz	short grab_hma_error
 24500                                  
 24501                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 24502                                  	; (SYSINIT:0A26h)
 24503                                  
 24504                                  	; 13/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 24505                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:0C41h)

 24519                                  		; - Multiplex - XMS - GET DRIVER ADDRESS
 24520                                  		; Return: ES:BX -> driver entry point
 24521                                  
 24522 00000A7B 891E[0E00]              	mov	[xms],bx
 24523                                  	;mov	[0Eh], bx

 24526

 24533

 24535

 24547                                  	;call	dword ptr ds:0Eh

 24550 00000A9F 751A                    	jnz	short grabhma_error ; error if couldn't enable A20
 24551

 24553 00000AA4 7415                    	jz	short grabhma_error ; yes, we cant use HMA

 24556 00000AA9 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax

 24560                                  	; 11/12/2022
