 24647                                  
 24648                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 24649                                  ;
 24650                                  ; following piece of code will be moved into a para boundary. And the para
 24651                                  ; address posted in seg of int 19h vector. Offset of int 19h will point to
 24652                                  ; VDint19. This is to protect HMA from apps which use VDISK header method
 24653                                  ; to determine free extended memory.
 24654                                  ;
 24655                                  ; For more details read "power programming" column by Ray Duncan in the
 24656                                  ; May 30 1989 issue of PC Magazine (pp 377-388) [USING EXTENDED MEMORY,PART 1]
 24657                                  ;
 24658                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 24659                                  
 24660                                  	; 30/12/2023 - Retro DOS 5.0
 24661 00000AE3 00                      	db	0
 24662                                  
 24663                                  ; 13/04/2024
 24664                                  ;align 2
 24665                                  
 24666                                  	; 30/12/2023
 24667                                  	; PCDOS v7.1 IBMBIO.COM, SYSYINIT:0CBCh
 24668                                  
 24669                                  StartVDHead:
 24670                                  ;-------------- what follows is a dummy device driver header (not used by DOS)
 24671                                  
 24672 00000AE4 00000000                	dd	0		; link to next device driver
 24673 00000AE8 0080                    	dw	8000h		; device attribute
 24674 00000AEA 0000                    	dw	0		; strategy routine offset
 24675 00000AEC 0000                    	dw	0		; interrupt routine offset
 24676 00000AEE 01                      	db	1		; number of units
 24677                                  	;db	7 dup(0) 
 24678 00000AEF 00<rep 7h>              	times	7 db 0 		; reserved area
 24679                                  VDiskSig1:
 24680 00000AF6 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 24681                                  
 24682                                  VLEN1	equ	($-VDiskSig1)
 24683                                  
 24684 00000AFB 202056332E33            	db	'  V3.3'	; vdisk label
 24685                                  	;db	15 dup (0)	; pad
 24686 00000B01 00<rep Fh>              	times	15 db 0
 24687 00000B10 0000                    	dw	0		; bits 0-15 of free HMA
 24688 00000B12 11                      	db	11h		; bits 16-23 of free HMA (1M + 64K)
 24689                                  VDInt19:
 24690 00000B13 EA                      	db	0EAh		; jmp to old vector
 24691                                  OldVDInt19:
 24692 00000B14 00000000                	dd	0		; Saved int 19 vector
 24693                                  
 24694                                  EndVDHead: ; label byte
 24695                                  
 24696                                  VDiskHMAHead:	
 24697 00000B18 000000                  	db	0,0,0		; non-bootable disk
 24698                                  VDiskSig2:
 24699 00000B1B 564449534B              	db	'VDISK'
 24700                                  
 24701                                  VLEN2	equ	($-VDiskSig2)
 24702                                  
 24703 00000B20 332E33                  	db	'3.3'		; OEM - signature
 24704 00000B23 8000                    	dw	128		; number of bytes/sector
 24705 00000B25 01                      	db	1		; sectors/cluster
 24706 00000B26 0100                    	dw	1		; reserved sectors
 24707 00000B28 01                      	db	1		; number of FAT copies
 24708 00000B29 4000                    	dw	64		; number of root dir entries
 24709 00000B2B 0002                    	dw	512		; number of sectors
 24710 00000B2D FE                      	db	0FEh		; media descriptor
 24711 00000B2E 0600                    	dw	6		; number of sectors/FAT
 24712 00000B30 0800                    	dw	8		; sectors per track
 24713 00000B32 0100                    	dw	1		; number of heads
 24714 00000B34 0000                    	dw	0		; number of hidden sectors
 24715 00000B36 4004                    	dw	440h		; Start of free HMA in K (1M+64K)
 24716                                  
 24717                                  EndVDiskHMAHead: ; label byte
 24718                                  
 24719                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 24720                                  ;
 24721                                  ; procedure : InstVDiskHeader
 24722                                  ;
 24723                                  ;             Installs the VDISK header to reserve the 64k of HMA
 24724                                  ;	      It puts a 32 byte header at 10000:0 and
 24725                                  ;	      another header at (seg of int19):0
 24726                                  ;
 24727                                  ; Inputs : None
 24728                                  ;
 24729                                  ; Outputs : None
 24730                                  ;
 24731                                  ; USES : DS,SI,AX,CX,DX
 24732                                  ;
 24733                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 24734                                  
 24735                                  	; 23/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 24736                                  
 24737                                  InstVDiskHeader:
 24738 00000B38 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 24739 00000B3A 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			; seg of int vect table
 24740                                  
 24741                                  ;-------------- save old int 19 vector
 24742                                  
 24743                                  	; 23/10/2022
 24744 00000B3C A16400                  	mov	ax,[19h*4]
 24745                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19],ax
 24746 00000B3F 2EA3[140B]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19],ax
 24747 00000B43 A16600                  	mov	ax,[19h*4+2]
 24748                                  	;mov	[OldVDInt19+2],ax
 24749 00000B46 2EA3[160B]              	mov	[cs:OldVDInt19+2],ax
 24750                                  
 24751                                  ;-------------- calculate seg of new int 19 handler
 24752                                  
 24753 00000B4A B448                    	mov	ah,48h			; allocate memory
 24754                                  	;mov	bx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead+15)>>4
 24755                                  	; 23/10/2022
 24756 00000B4C BB0400                  	mov	bx,4
 24757 00000B4F CD21                    	int	21h
 24758                                  
 24759                                  ;	if carry, fatal hanging error!!!!!
 24760                                  
 24761 00000B51 48                      	dec	ax			; point to arena
 24762 00000B52 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax
 24763                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8	; owner = System
 24764 00000B54 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:1],8
 24765                                  	;mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC' ; System Code
 24766 00000B5B 26C70608005343          	mov	word [es:8],'SC' ; 4353h
 24767 00000B62 40                      	inc	ax
 24768 00000B63 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax			; get back to allocated memory
 24769                                  
 24770                                  ;-------------- install new int 19 vector
 24771                                  
 24772 00000B65 FA                      	cli				; no reboots at this time
 24773                                  	;mov	word [19h*4],(VDInt19-StartVDHead)
 24774 00000B66 C70664002F00            	mov	word [19h*4],47
 24775 00000B6C A36600                  	mov	[19h*4+2],ax
 24776                                  
 24777                                  ;-------------- move the code into proper place
 24778                                  
 24779                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDHead-StartVDHead)
 24780 00000B6F B93400                  	mov	cx,52
 24781 00000B72 BE[E40A]                	mov	si,StartVDHead
 24782 00000B75 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 24783 00000B77 0E                      	push	cs
 24784 00000B78 1F                      	pop	ds
 24785 00000B79 FC                      	cld
 24786 00000B7A F3A4                    	rep	movsb
 24787 00000B7C FB                      	sti				; BUGBUG is sti OK now?
 24788                                  
 24789                                  ;-------------- mov the HMA VDisk head into HMA
 24790                                  
 24791                                  	; 23/10/2022
 24792 00000B7D 57                      	push	di
 24793 00000B7E 06                      	push	es
 24794                                  
 24795                                  	;mov	ax,0FFFFh
 24796                                  	;mov	es,ax
 24797                                  	; 03/09/2023
 24798 00000B7F 49                      	dec	cx
 24799                                  	; cx = 0FFFFh
 24800 00000B80 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx
 24801                                  
 24802 00000B82 BF1000                  	mov	di,10h
 24803                                  	;mov	cx,(EndVDiskHMAHead-VDiskHMAHead)

 24813                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 24814                                  ; procedure : ClrVDISKHeader
 24815                                  ;
 24816                                  ;		Clears the first 32 bytes at 1MB boundary
 24817                                  ;		So that DOS/HIMEM is not confused about the VDISK header
 24818                                  ;		left by previous DOS=HIGH session
 24819                                  ;

 24821                                  
 24822                                  struc desc
 24823 00000000 ????                     .seg_lim:	resw	1		; seg limit 64K 
 24824 00000002 ????                     .lo_word:	resw	1		; 24 bit seg physical 
 24825 00000004 ??                       .hi_byte:	resb 	1		; address
 24826 00000005 ??                       .acc_rights:	resb	1		; access rights ( CPL0 - R/W )
 24827 00000006 ????                     .reserved:	resw	1		;
 24828                                   .size:
 24829                                  endstruc

 24837 00000B98 00<rep 8h>              		times 8 db 0
 24838 00000BA0 FFFF                    src_desc:	dw	0FFFFh		; desc	<0ffffh,0,0,93h,0>
 24839 00000BA2 0000                    		dw	0

 24842 00000BA6 0000                    		dw	0

 24846 00000BAD 93                      		db	93h

 24856                                  
 24857                                  ; 25/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0 (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, MSDOS 6.0 SYSINIT1.ASM)
 24858                                  
 24859                                  ; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 24860                                  ; (SYSINIT:0CA6h)
 24861                                  
 24862                                  ClrVDISKHeader:	; proc	near
 24863                                  
 24864                                  ;; 04/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimized)
 24865                                  ;;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 24866                                  ;; The following workaround get around a problem with the	      ;I070
 24867                                  ;; Tortugas and PS/2 30-286 BIOS when password server mode	      ;I070
 24868                                  ;; is set. On those machines the INT 15h block move code	      ;I070
 24869                                  ;; goes through the 8042 to twiddle A20 instead of port 92h.	      ;I070
 24870                                  ;; In password server mode the 8042 is disabled so the block	      ;I070
 24871                                  ;; move crashes the system. We can do this because these	      ;I070
 24872                                  ;; systems clear all of memory on a cold boot.			      ;I070
 24873                                  ;								      ;I070
 24874                                  ;               in      al,64h         ; Test for password servr mode ;I070
 24875                                  ;               test    al,10h         ; Is keyboard inhibited?	      ;I070
 24876                                  ;               jnz     short ClrVDISKok ; No, go do block move.      ;I070
 24877                                  ;                                      ; Check for Tortugas...	      ;I070
 24878                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],19F8h                ;I070
 24879                                  ;               je      short ClrVDISKno                              ;I070
 24880                                  ;                                      ; Check for mod 30-286	      ;I070
 24881                                  ;               cmp     word [cs:sys_model_byte],09FCh                ;I070
 24882                                  ;               jne     short ClrVDISKok			      ;I070
 24883                                  ;ClrVDISKno: 	retn	               ; Return w/o block move.	      ;I070
 24884                                  ;								      ;I070
 24885                                  ;ClrVDISKok:							      ;I070
 24886                                  ;-----------------------------------------------------------	      ;I070
 24887                                  
 24888                                  	; 30/12/2023 - Retro DOS v5.0
 24889                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:0DBAh
 24890                                  ClrVDISKHeader:
 24891 00000BE0 E464                    	in	al,64h	; 8042 keyboard controller status register
 24892                                  			; 7:  PERR    1=parity error in data received from keyboard
 24893                                  			;    +----------- AT Mode ----------+------------ PS/2 Mode ------------+
 24894                                  			; 6: |RxTO    receive (Rx) timeout  | TO     general timeout (Rx or Tx) |
 24895                                  			; 5: |TxTO    transmit (Tx) timeout | MOBF   mouse output buffer full   |
 24896                                  			;    +------------------------------+-----------------------------------+
 24897                                  			; 4:  INH     0=keyboard communications inhibited
 24898                                  			; 3:  A2      0=60h was the port last written to, 1=64h was last
 24899                                  			; 2:  SYS     distinguishes reset types: 0=cold reboot, 1=warm reboot
 24900                                  			; 1:  IBF     1=input buffer full (keyboard can't accept data)
 24901                                  			; 0:  OBF     1=output buffer full (data from keyboard is available)
 24902 00000BE2 A810                    	test	al,10h	; test bit 4 - Is keyboard inhibited?
 24903 00000BE4 7511                    	jnz	short ClrVDISKok ; No, go do block move
 24904                                  	; 30/12/2023
 24905                                  	; ds = cs	
 24906 00000BE6 813E[B702]F819          	cmp	word [sys_model_byte],19F8h ; check for TORTUGA models
 24907 00000BEC 7408                    	jz	short ClrVDISKno ; do not use INT 15h block move code
 24908                                  				 ; (while 8042 is disabled)
 24909 00000BEE 813E[B702]FC09          	cmp	word [sys_model_byte],9FCh ; check for PS/2 30-286 model
 24910 00000BF4 7501                    	jnz	short ClrVDISKok
 24911                                  ClrVDISKno:
 24912 00000BF6 C3                      	retn
 24913                                  ; ---------------------------------------------------------------------------
 24914                                  	; 30/12/2023
 24915                                  ClrVDISKok:
 24916                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24917                                  	; ds = cs
 24918                                  
 24919                                  	; 30/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2
 24920                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS SYSINIT:0CBFh)
 24921                                  
 24922 00000BF7 06                      	push	es
 24923 00000BF8 8CC8                    	mov	ax,cs
 24924 00000BFA 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax
 24925 00000BFC B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 24926 00000BFE D3EA                    	shr	dx,cl
 24927 00000C00 B104                    	mov	cl,4
 24928 00000C02 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 24929 00000C04 05[C00B]                	add	ax,ClrdVDISKHead
 24930 00000C07 80D200                  	adc	dl,0
 24931                                  
 24932                                  	;; 23/10/2022
 24933                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.lo_word],ax
 24934                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+2],ax
 24935                                  	;;mov	[cs:src_desc+desc.hi_byte],dl
 24936                                  	;mov	[cs:src_desc+4],dl
 24937                                  	; 12/12/2022
 24938                                  	;mov	[src_desc+desc.lo_word],ax
 24939 00000C0A A3[A20B]                	mov	[src_desc+2],ax
 24940                                  	;mov	[src_desc+desc.hi_byte],dl
 24941 00000C0D 8816[A40B]              	mov	[src_desc+4],dl
 24942                                  
 24943 00000C11 B91000                  	mov	cx,16	; 16 words
 24944 00000C14 0E                      	push	cs
 24945 00000C15 07                      	pop	es
 24946 00000C16 BE[900B]                	mov	si,bmove
 24947 00000C19 B487                    	mov	ah,87h
 24948 00000C1B CD15                    	int	15h	; EXTENDED MEMORY - BLOCK MOVE (AT,XT286,PS)
 24949                                  			; CX = number of words to move 
 24950                                  			; ES:SI -> global descriptor table
 24951                                  			; Return: CF set on error, AH = status
 24952 00000C1D 07                      	pop	es
 24953 00000C1E C3                      	retn

 24957                                  ; procedure : SaveFreeHMAPtr
 24958                                  ;
 24959                                  ;		Save the Free HMA pointer in BIOS variable for later use.
 24960                                  ;		(INT 2f ax==4a01 call returns pointer to free HMA)
 24961                                  ;		Normalizes the pointer to ffff:xxxx format and stores only
 24962                                  ;		the offset.
 24963                                  ;

 24976 00000C27 B8FFFF                  	mov	ax,0FFFFh	   ; HMA segment
 24977                                  	; 03/09/2023

 24981 00000C2F 83C70F                  	add	di,15		   ; para round

 24984 00000C37 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl
 24985 00000C39 29C7                    	sub	di,ax
 24986                                  	;
 24987                                  	; 03/09/2023

 24997                                  	;mov	byte [inHMA],0FFh  ; (ds:0Dh)
 24998 00000C3F 1F                      	pop	ds

 25175                                  ;	should handle the system that does not have any floppies.

 26102                                  
 26103                                  ;global rearm command for shared interrupt devices attached in the system;
 26104                                  ;shared interrupt attachment has some problem when it issues interrupt
 26105                                  ;during a warm reboot. once the interrupt is presented by the attachment,
 26106                                  ;no further interrupts on that level will be presented until a global rearm
 26107                                  ;is issued. by the request of the system architecture group, msbio will
 26108                                  ;issue a global rearm after every device driver is loaded.
 26109                                  ;to issue a global rearm:	;for pc1,xt,palace
 26110                                  ;
 26111                                  ;			  out 02f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 2
 26112                                  ;			  out 02f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 3
 26113                                  ;			  out 02f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 4
 26114                                  ;			  out 02f5h,xx  ; interrupt level 5
 26115                                  ;			  out 02f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 6
 26116                                  ;			  out 02f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 7
 26117                                  ;
 26118                                  ;	for pc at,in addition to the above commands,
 26119                                  ;	need to handle the secondary interrupt handler
 26120                                  ;
 26121                                  ;			  out 06f2h,xx  ; interrupt level 10
 26122                                  ;			  out 06f3h,xx  ; interrupt level 11
 26123                                  ;			  out 06f4h,xx  ; interrupt level 12
 26124                                  ;			  out 06f6h,xx  ; interrupt level 14
 26125                                  ;			  out 06f7h,xx  ; interrupt level 15
 26126                                  ;
 26127                                  ;	for round-up machine
 26128                                  ;
 26129                                  ;			  none.
 26130                                  
 26131                                  ; where xx stands for any value.
 26132                                  ;
 26133                                  ; for your information,after naples level machine,the system service bios
 26134                                  ; call (int 15h),function ah=0c0h returns the system configuration parameters
 26135                                  
 26136                                  	; 24/10/2022
 26137                                  
 26138 00000FFF 50                      	push	ax
 26139 00001000 53                      	push	bx
 26140 00001001 52                      	push	dx
 26141 00001002 06                      	push	es
 26142                                  
 26143 00001003 B0FF                    	mov	al,0FFh 		;reset h/w by writing to port
 26144 00001005 BAF202                  	mov	dx,2F2h 		;get starting address
 26145 00001008 EE                      	out	dx,al			; out 02f2h,0ffh

 26342                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 26343                                  ; Do_Install_Exec
 26344                                  ;
 26345                                  ; This procedure is used to EXEC a program being loaded via the 
 26346                                  ; "install=" mechanism in config.sys. It does this by setting up
 26347                                  ; the parameters, and then jumping to sysinit_base, which has been
 26348                                  ; setup in low memory. When complete, sysinit_base will jump back
 26349                                  ; up to this procedure (if sysinit remains uncorrupted by the installed
 26350                                  ; program).

 26353                                  
 26354                                  do_install_exec:			; now,handles install= command.
 26355                                  
 26356 000010E7 56                      	push	si			; save si for config.sys again.
 26357                                  
 26358                                  ; we are going to call load/exec function.
 26359                                  ; set es:bx to the parameter block here;;;;;;;
 26360                                  ; set ds:dx to the asciiz string. remember that we already has 0
 26361                                  ; after the filename. so parameter starts after that. if next
 26362                                  ; character is a line feed (i.e. 10),then assume that the 0
 26363                                  ; we already encountered used to be a carrage return. in this
 26364                                  ; case,let's set the length to 0 which will be followed by
 26365                                  ; carridge return.

 26367                                  ; es:si -> command line in config.sys. points to the first non blank
 26368                                  ;character after =.

 26372 000010EA 07                      	pop	es

 26374 000010EC 89F2                    	mov	dx,si			; ds:dx->file name,0 in config.sys image.
 26375

 26513                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 26514                                  
 26515                                  ;**	ParaRound - Round Up length to paragraph multiple
 26516                                  ;
 26517                                  ;	ParaRound rounds a byte count up to a multiple of 16, then divides
 26518                                  ;	by 16 yielding a "length in paragraphs" value.
 26519                                  ;
 26520                                  ;	ENTRY	(ax) = byte length
 26521                                  ;	EXIT	(ax) = rounded up length in paragraphs
 26522                                  ;	USES	ax, flags
 26523                                  
 26524                                  ParaRound:
 26525 00001163 83C00F                  	add	ax,15
 26526 00001166 D1D8                    	rcr	ax,1
 26527 00001168 D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 26528 0000116A D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 26529 0000116C D1E8                    	shr	ax,1
 26530 0000116E C3                      	retn
 26531                                  
 26532                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 26533                                  ; sysinit_base module.
 26534                                  ;
 26535                                  ; This module is relocated by the routine EndFile to a location in low
 26536                                  ; memory. It is then called by SYSINIT to perform the EXEC of programs
 26537                                  ; that are being loaded by the "install=" command. After the EXEC call
 26538                                  ; completes, this module performs a checksum on the SYSINIT code (at the
 26539                                  ; top of memory) to be sure that the EXECed program did not damage it.
 26540                                  ; If it did, then this module will print an error message and stop the
 26541                                  ; system. Otherwise, it returns control to SYSINIT.
 26542                                  ;
 26543                                  ;in: after relocation,
 26544                                  ;    ax = 4b00h - load and execute the program dos function.
 26545                                  ;    ds = confbot. segment of config.sys file image
 26546                                  ;    es = sysinitseg. segment of sysinit module itself.
 26547                                  ;    ds:dx = pointer to asciiz string of the path,filename to be executed.
 26548                                  ;    es:bx = pointer to a parameter block for load.
 26549                                  ;    SI_end (byte) - offset vaule of end of sysinit module label
 26550                                  ;    bigsize (word) - # of word from confbot to SI_end.
 26551                                  ;    chksum (word) - sum of every byte from confbot to SI_end in a
 26552                                  ;			word boundary moduler form.
 26553                                  ;    sysinit_ptr (dword ptr) - return address to sysinit module.
 26554                                  ;
 26555                                  ;note: sysinit should save necessary registers and when the control is back
 26556                                  
 26557                                  	; 24/10/2022
 26558                                  	; (SYSINIT:115Ch for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 26559                                  sysinit_base:				
 26560 0000116F 2E8C166200              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_ss],ss	; save stack
 26561 00001174 2E89266400              	mov	[cs:sysinit_base_sp],sp	
 26562 00001179 CD21                    	int	21h			; load/exec dos call.
 26563 0000117B 2E8E166200              	mov	ss,[cs:sysinit_base_ss]	; restore stack
 26564 00001180 2E8B266400              	mov	sp,[cs:sysinit_base_sp]
 26565 00001185 1F                      	pop	ds			; restore confbot seg
 26566 00001186 07                      	pop	es			; restore sysinitseg
 26567 00001187 7216                    	jc	short sysinit_base_end	; load/exec function failed.
 26568                                  					; at this time,i don't have to worry about
 26569                                  					; that sysinit module has been broken or not.
 26570 00001189 E81800                  	call	sum_up			; otherwise,check if it is good.
 26571 0000118C 263906[D602]            	cmp	[es:checksum],ax
 26572 00001191 740C                    	je	short sysinit_base_end
 26573                                  
 26574                                  ;	memory broken. show "memory allocation error" message and stall.
 26575                                  
 26576 00001193 B409                    	mov	ah,9
 26577 00001195 0E                      	push	cs
 26578 00001196 1F                      	pop	ds
 26579                                  	; 30/12/2022
 26580                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS, SYSINIT:12B8h)
 26581                                  	;mov	dx,102
 26582 00001197 BA6600                  	mov	dx,mem_alloc_err_msgx-sysinit_base ; 65h (for MSDOS 5.0 SYSINIT)
 26583                                  					; 66h (for MSDOS 6.21 SYSINIT)

 26586                                  		; DS:DX -> string terminated by "$"

 26601                                  ;-------------------------------------
 26602                                  
 26603                                  sum_up:
 26604                                  
 26605                                  ;in:   es - sysinitseg.
 26606                                  ;out:  ax - result
 26607                                  ;
 26608                                  ;remark: since this routine will only check starting from "locstack" to the end of
 26609                                  ;	 sysinit segment,the data area, and the current stack area are not
 26610                                  ;	 coverd. in this sense,this check sum routine only gives a minimal
 26611                                  ;	 gaurantee to be safe.

 26613                                  ;first sum up confbot seg.
 26614                                  
 26615 000011A4 1E                      	push	ds
 26616                                  	; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 26617                                  	; (SYSINIT:12C6h)
 26618 000011A5 26A1[9F02]              	mov	ax,[es:CONFBOT]
 26619                                  	; 24/10/2022
 26620                                  	;mov	ax,[es:top_of_cdss]
 26621 000011A9 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 26622 000011AB 31F6                    	xor	si,si
 26623 000011AD 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax

 26625                                  					; whole test better fail.
 26626 000011B4 D1E9                    	shr	cx,1			; make it a word count
 26627 000011B6 7406                    	jz	short sum_sys_code	; when config.sys file not exist.
 26628                                  sum1:

 26630 000011BA 46                      	inc	si
 26631 000011BB 46                      	inc	si
 26632 000011BC E2FA                    	loop	sum1

 26634                                  sum_sys_code:

 26636 000011BE BEBE11                  	mov	si,locstack ;; 5A6h (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)

 26639                                  			    ; 586h (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM, SYSINIT)	
 26640                                  				        ; starting after the stack.  M069
 26641                                  					;  this does not cover the possible stack code!!!
 26642                                  	;;;mov	cx,22688  ; for MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS
 26643                                  	; 02/11/2022
 26644                                  	;;mov	cx,3D20h  ; (15648) for MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS (SYSINIT)	
 26645                                  	; 10/04/2024

 26649 000011C4 29F1                    	sub	cx,si			;  from after_checksum to SI_end

 26659                                  ; 24/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)

 26689                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 26690                                  ; Set_Buffer
 26691                                  ;
 26692                                  ;function: set buffers in the real memory.				  
 26693                                  ;	   lastly set the memhi,memlo for the next available free address.
 26694                                  ;
 26695                                  ;input:    ds:bx -> buffinfo.
 26696                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo = 0] = available space for the hash bucket.	  
 26697                                  ;	   singlebuffersize = buffer header size + sector size		  
 26698                                  ;
 26699                                  ;output:   buffers Queue established.	       				   
 26700                                  ;	   [memhi]:[memlo] = address of the next available free space.	   
 26701                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 26702                                  
 26703                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 26704                                  	; (SYSINIT:11DCh)
 26705

 26709                                  set_buffer:
 26710 000011F0 30D2                    	xor	dl,dl				; assume buffers not in HMA
 26711 000011F2 E85500                  	call	GetBufferAddr
 26712 000011F5 7402                    	jz	short set_buff_1

 26714                                  set_buff_1:
 26715                                  	; 25/10/2022
 26716                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue],di	; head of Buff Q

 26718                                  	;mov	[bx+BUFFINF.Buff_Queue+2],es

 26724 00001205 2E8B0E[9702]            	mov	cx,[cs:buffers]

 26726

 26760                                  set_buff_2:

 26763 00001241 2E800E[D814]02          	or	byte [cs:setdevmarkflag],2

 26767 00001247 E9072F                  	jmp	round

 26769                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 26770                                  ; procedure : GetBufferAddr
 26771                                  ;
 26772                                  ;	      Gets the buffer address either in HMA or in Lo Mem
 26773                                  ;
 26774                                  ; returns in es:di the buffer adress
 26775                                  ; returns NZ if allocated in HMA
 26776                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 26777                                  
 26778                                  	; 25/10/2022 
 26779                                  GetBufferAddr:
 26780 0000124A 53                      	push	bx
 26781 0000124B 52                      	push	dx
 26782                                  
 26783                                  ; 18/03/2025 - MiniDOS 1.0
 26784                                  %if 0
 26785                                  	; 11/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 26786                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM
 26787                                  	;;;
 26788                                  	cmp	byte [cs:dosdata_umb],2
 26789                                  				; is dosdata moved to UMB ? (DOSDATA=UMB done)
 26790                                  	jne	short gba_1     ; no
 26791                                  	cmp	word [bx+2],0FFFFh ; is the buffer (already) in HMA ?
 26792                                  	je	short gba_2	; yes
 26793                                  gba_1:
 26794                                  	;;;
 26795                                  
 26796                                  %endif
 26797 0000124C 2EA1[9B02]              	mov	ax, [cs:singlebuffersize]
 26798 00001250 2EF726[9702]            	mul	word [cs:buffers]
 26799                                  	;add	ax,0Fh
 26800 00001255 83C00F                  	add	ax,15 
 26801                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26802                                  	;and	ax,~15	; 0FFF0h	; para round
 26803                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26804 00001258 24F0                    	and	al,~15	; 0F0h
 26805 0000125A 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 26806 0000125C B8024A                  	mov	ax,4A02h
 26807                                  	;mov	ax,((multMULT<<8)+multMULTALLOCHMA)
 26808 0000125F CD2F                    	int	2Fh	; DOS 5+ - ALLOCATE HMA SPACE
 26809                                  			;     AX = 4A02h
 26810                                  			;     BX = number of bytes
 26811                                  			; Return:
 26812                                  			;     ES:DI -> start of allocated HMA block or FFFFh:FFFFh
 26813                                  			;     BX = number of bytes actually allocated
 26814                                  			;	   (rounded up to next paragraph)
 26815                                  			; Notes:
 26816                                  			;     this call is not valid unless DOS is loaded in the HMA
 26817                                  			;     (DOS=HIGH)
 26818                                  
 26819 00001261 83FFFF                  	cmp	di,0FFFFh
 26820 00001264 7506                    	jne	short got_hma
 26821                                  	
 26822                                  	;mov	di,0		; dont xor di,di Z flag needed
 26823                                  	; 05/09/2023
 26824                                  	; zf=1
 26825 00001266 47                      	inc	di ; 0FFFFh -> 0
 26826                                  	; zf=1
 26827                                  	
 26828                                  	;zf=1
 26829                                  	;xor	di,di	; 25/10/2022
 26830                                  	;zf=1
 26831 00001267 2E8E06[6003]            	mov	es,[cs:memhi]
 26832                                  got_hma:
 26833 0000126C 5A                      	pop	dx
 26834 0000126D 5B                      	pop	bx
 26835 0000126E C3                      	retn
 26836                                  
 26837                                  	; 11/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 26838                                  	; PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM
 26839                                  	;;;
 26840                                  gba_2:

 26842 00001271 09FF                    	or	di,di
 26843                                  	;pop	dx
 26844                                  	;pop	bx
 26845                                  	;retn
 26846                                  	; 11/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 26847 00001273 EBF7                    	jmp	short got_hma
 26848                                  	;;;

 26871 0000128A 26C74504FF00            	mov	word [es:di+4],00FFh

 26873 00001290 26C745060000            	mov	word [es:di+6],0
 26874                                  	;mov	word [es:di+buffinfo.buf_sector+2],0 ; to compensate the masm 3 bug
 26875 00001296 26C745080000            	mov	word [es:di+8],0
 26876 0000129C C3                      	retn
 26877                                  
 26878                                  ; ======================================================================
 26879                                  ; MSSTACK initialization routine - MSDOS 6.0 - SYSDINIT1.ASM - 1991
 26880                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 26881                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 26882                                  
 26883                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 26884                                  ; ibmstack initialization routine.
 26885                                  ;
 26886                                  ;	to follow the standard interrupt sharing scheme, msstack.asm
 26887                                  ;	has been modified. this initialization routine also has to
 26888                                  ;	be modified because for the interrupt level 7 and 15, firstflag
 26889                                  ;	should be set to signal that this interrupt handler is the
 26890                                  ;	first handler hooked to this interrupt vector.
 26891                                  ;	we determine this by looking at the instruction pointed by
 26892                                  ;	this vector. if it is iret, then this handler should be the
 26893                                  ;	first one. in our case, only the interrupt vector 77h is the
 26894                                  ;	interrupt level 15. (we don't hook interrupt level 7.)
 26895                                  ;
 26896                                  ;	the followings are mainly due to m.r.t; ptm fix of p886 12/3/86
 26897                                  ;	some design changes are needed to the above interrupt sharing
 26898                                  ;	method. the above sharing scheme assumes that 1). interrupt
 26899                                  ;	sharing is never done on levels that have bios support. 2). "phantom"
 26900                                  ;	interrupts would only be generated on levels 7 and 15.
 26901                                  ;	these assumptions are not true any more. we have to use the firstflag
 26902                                  ;	for every level of interrupt. we will set the firstflag on the following
 26903                                  ;	conditions:
 26904                                  ;
 26905                                  ;	 a.	 if the cs portion of the vector is 0000, then "first"
 26906                                  ;	 b. else if cs:ip points to valid shared header, then not "first"
 26907                                  ;	 c. else if cs:ip points to an iret, then "first"
 26908                                  ;	 d. else if cs:ip points to dummy, then "first"
 26909                                  ;
 26910                                  ;	where dummy is - the cs portion must be f000, and the ip portion must
 26911                                  ;	be equal to the value at f000:ff01. this location is the initial value
 26912                                  ;	from vector_table for interrupt 7, one of the preserved addresses in all
 26913                                  ;	the bioses for all of the machines.
 26914                                  ;
 26915                                  ;	system design group requests bios to handle the phantom interrupts.
 26916                                  ;
 26917                                  ;	the "phantom" interrupt is an illegal interrupt such as an interrupt
 26918                                  ;	produced by the bogus adapter card even without interrupt request is
 26919                                  ;	set.  more specifically, 1). the 8259 has a feature when running in
 26920                                  ;	edge triggered mode to latch a pulse and present the interrupt when
 26921                                  ;	the processor indicates interrupt acknowledge (inta). the interrupt
 26922                                  ;	pulse was exist at the time of inta to get a "phantom" interrupt.
 26923                                  ;	2). or, this is caused by adapter cards placing a glitch on the
 26924                                  ;	interrupt line.
 26925                                  ;
 26926                                  ;	to handle those "phantom" interrupts, the main stack code will check
 26927                                  ;	the own firstflag, and if it is not "first" (which means the forward
 26928                                  ;	pointer points to the legal shared interrupt handler), then pass the
 26929                                  ;	control. if it is the first, then the following action should be
 26930                                  ;	taken. we don't have to implement skack logic in this case.
 26931                                  ;
 26932                                  ;	to implement this logic, we rather choose a simple method.
 26933                                  ;	if ont of the above "firstflag" conditions is met, we are not
 26934                                  ;	going to hook this interrupt vector. the reason is if the original
 26935                                  ;	vector points to "iret" and do nothing, we don't need
 26936                                  ;	to implement the stack logic for it. this will simplify implementation
 26937                                  ;	while maintaining compatibility with the old version of dos.
 26938                                  ;	this implies that in the main stack code, there might be a stack code
 26939                                  ;	that will never be used, a dead code.
 26940                                  ;
 26941                                  ;in - cs, ds -> sysinitseg, es -> relocated stack code & data.
 26942                                  
 26943                                  	; 25/10/2022 - Retro DOS 4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYSINIT)
 26944                                  	; (SYSINIT:1287h)
 26945                                  
 26946                                  	; 11/04/2024 - Retro DOS 5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM)
 26947                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:157Ch)
 26948                                  
 26949                                  	; 14/12/2022
 26950                                  stackinit:
 26951 0000129D 50                      	push	ax
 26952 0000129E 1E                      	push	ds
 26953 0000129F 06                      	push	es
 26954 000012A0 53                      	push	bx
 26955 000012A1 51                      	push	cx
 26956 000012A2 52                      	push	dx
 26957 000012A3 57                      	push	di
 26958 000012A4 56                      	push	si
 26959 000012A5 55                      	push	bp
 26960                                  
 26961                                  ;currently es -> stack code area
 26962                                  
 26963                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26964                                  	; ds = cs
 26965 000012A6 A1[8A02]                	mov	ax,[stack_count]
 26966 000012A9 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax  ; *!*!*  
 26967                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26968                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1290h)
 26969                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_count] ; !!	;defined in cs
 26970 000012AB 26A3[0200]              	mov	[es:stackcount],ax		;defined in stack code area
 26971                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1298h)
 26972 000012AF A1[8C02]                	mov	ax,[stack_size]	 ; !!		;in cs
 26973 000012B2 26A3[0600]              	mov	[es:stacksize],ax
 26974                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26975 000012B6 A1[8E02]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr]			; offset
 26976                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26977                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 26978                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr]  ; !!
 26979 000012B9 26A3[0800]              	mov	[es:stacks],ax
 26980                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26981 000012BD 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax ; *!*
 26982 000012BF A1[9002]                	mov	ax,[stack_addr+2]
 26983                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 26984                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:129Fh)
 26985                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:stack_addr+2] ; !!	; segment
 26986 000012C2 26A3[0A00]              	mov	[es:stacks+2],ax
 26987                                  
 26988                                  ; initialize the data fields with the parameters
 26989                                  
 26990                                  ; "firstentry" will always be at stacks
 26991                                  
 26992                                  	;mov	bp,[es:stacks]			; get offset of stack
 26993                                  	; 12/12/2022
 26994                                  	; bp = [es:stacks] ; *!*
 26995 000012C6 26892E[0C00]            	mov	[es:firstentry],bp
 26996                                  
 26997                                  ; the stacks will always immediately follow the table entries
 26998                                  
 26999 000012CB B80800                  	mov	ax,entrysize ; 8
 27000                                  	;mov	cx,[es:stackcount]
 27001                                  	; 12/12/2022
 27002                                  	; cx = [es:stackcount] ; *!*!*
 27003 000012CE F7E1                    	mul	cx
 27004 000012D0 01E8                    	add	ax,bp
 27005 000012D2 26A3[0400]              	mov	[es:stackat],ax
 27006 000012D6 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 27007 000012D8 83EB02                  	sub	bx,2
 27008                                  
 27009                                  ; zero the entire stack area to start with
 27010                                  
 27011 000012DB 268B3E[0400]            	mov	di,[es:stackat]
 27012 000012E0 26A1[0600]              	mov	ax,[es:stacksize]
 27013 000012E4 F7E1                    	mul	cx
 27014 000012E6 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax
 27015 000012E8 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 27016 000012EA 06                      	push	es
 27017 000012EB 1F                      	pop	ds				;ds = relocated stack code seg.
 27018                                  
 27019                                  ;now, ds -> stack code area
 27020                                  
 27021 000012EC 8E06[0A00]              	mov	es,[stacks+2]			; get segment of stack area.
 27022 000012F0 FC                      	cld
 27023 000012F1 F3AA                    	rep	stosb
 27024                                  
 27025 000012F3 8B0E[0200]              	mov	cx,[stackcount]
 27026                                  
 27027                                  ; loop for "count" times, building a table entry
 27028                                  ;  cs = sysinitseg, ds = relocated stack code seg, es = segment of stack space
 27029                                  ;  cx = number of entries
 27030                                  ;  es:bp => base of stacks - 2

 27793                                  
 27794                                  ; 13/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0 (Modified PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM, SYSINIT)
 27795                                  ; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:1905h)
 27796                                  
 27797                                  new_init_loop:
 27798                                  
 27799                                  ; 18/03/2025 - MiniDOS 1.0
 27800                                  %if 0
 27801                                  	;;; 13/04/2024 (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM)
 27802                                  	cmp	byte [cs:dosdata_umb],2
 27803                                  				; is DOSDATA=UMB done ? (DOSDATA is in UMB)
 27804                                  	jne	short new_init_loop_1st
 27805                                  	push	ds		; restore original/previous interrupt handler
 27806                                  				; (from int19old?? field in BIOSDATA)
 27807                                  	;mov	ax,70h
 27808                                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG
 27809                                  	mov	ds,ax
 27810                                  	lds	ax,[di]		; restore original Int ?? handler addr from int19old?? field
 27811                                  	mov	[es:si],ax	; copy the original int handler addr to its int vector addr
 27812                                  	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 27813                                  	pop	ds
 27814                                  new_init_loop_1st: 
 27815                                  	;;;
 27816                                  
 27817                                  %endif
 27818                                  
 27819                                  ;input: si=ofset into vector table of the particular int vector being adjusted
 27820                                  ;	bx=ds:offset of oldxx, where will be saved the pointer to original owner
 27821                                  ;	dx=ds:offset of intxx, the new interrupt handler
 27822                                  ;	di=offset value of int19old&aa variable in bios.
 27823                                  ;	es=zero, segid of vector table
 27824                                  ;	ds=relocated stack code segment
 27825                                  
 27826                                  ; 13/04/2024
 27827                                  %if 0
 27828                                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 27829                                  	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 27830                                  	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 27831                                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 27832                                  
 27833                                  	push	ds
 27834                                  	;;mov	ax,Bios_Data ; 70h
 27835                                  	;mov	ax,KERNEL_SEGMENT ; 70h
 27836                                  	; 21/10/2022
 27837                                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 27838                                  	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 27839                                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;int 19 handler
 27840                                  	mov	[di],ax
 27841                                  	mov	ax,[es:si+2]
 27842                                  	mov	[di+2],ax
 27843                                  	pop	ds
 27844                                  %else
 27845                                  	; 13/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 27846 0000148F 1E                      	push	ds
 27847 00001490 268B4402                	mov	ax,[es:si+2]		;remember segid in vector
 27848 00001494 894702                  	mov	[bx+2],ax		; to original owner in ds
 27849 00001497 50                      	push	ax
 27850 00001498 268B04                  	mov	ax,[es:si]		;remember offset in vector
 27851 0000149B 8907                    	mov	[bx],ax			; to original owner in ds
 27852 0000149D 50                      	push	ax
 27853 0000149E B87000                  	mov	ax,DOSBIODATASEG ; 0070h
 27854 000014A1 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax			;set int19oldxx value in bios for
 27855 000014A3 58                      	pop	ax			;int 19 handler
 27856 000014A4 8905                    	mov	[di],ax
 27857 000014A6 58                      	pop	ax
 27858 000014A7 894502                  	mov	[di+2],ax
 27859 000014AA 1F                      	pop	ds
 27860                                  %endif
 27861 000014AB 268914                  	mov	[es:si],dx  	;set vector to point to new int handler
 27862 000014AE 268C5C02                	mov	[es:si+2],ds
 27863 000014B2 C3                      	retn

 28120                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMS block structure
 28121                                  struc _$P_PARMS_Blk
 28122 00000000 ????                     .PARMSX_Address:  resw 1		;AN000; Address of PARMSX
 28123 00000002 ??                       .Num_Extra:	   resb 1		;AN000; Number of extra stuff
 28124 00000003 ??                       .Len_Extra_Delim: resb 1		;AN000; Length of extra delimiter
 28125                                  endstruc
 28126                                  
 28127                                  _$P_Len_PARMS	   equ	4		;AN000;
 28128                                  _$P_I_Use_Default  equ	0		;AN000; no extra stuff specified
 28129                                  _$P_I_Have_Delim   equ	1		;AN000; extra delimiter specified
 28130                                  _$P_I_Have_EOL	   equ	2		;AN000; extra EOL specified
 28131                                  
 28132                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28133                                  ; PARMSX	LABEL	BYTE
 28134                                  ;		DB	minp,maxp	; MIN, MAX POSITIONAL OPERANDS ALLOWED
 28135                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF POSITIONAL 1
 28136                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxp-1 TIMES
 28137                                  ;		DB	maxs		; # OF SWITCHES
 28138                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF SWITCH 1
 28139                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxs-1 TIMES
 28140                                  ;		DB	maxk		; # OF KEYWORD
 28141                                  ;		DW	CONTROL 	; DESCRIPTION OF KEYWORD 1
 28142                                  ;		:			; REPEATS maxk-1 TIMES
 28143                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28144                                  
 28145                                  ;-------------------------------- PARMSX block structure
 28146                                  struc _$P_PARMSX_Blk		;AN000;
 28147 00000000 ??                       .MinP: resb 1			;AN000; Minimum positional number
 28148 00000001 ??                       .MaxP:	resb 1			;AN000; Maximum positional number
 28149 00000002 ????                     .1st_Control: resw 1		;AN000; Address of the 1st CONTROL block
 28150                                  endstruc
 28151                                  
 28152                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28153                                  ; << Control field definition  >>
 28154                                  ;
 28155                                  ;
 28156                                  ;CONTROL   LABEL   BYTE
 28157                                  ;	   DW	   MATCH_FLAGS	   ; CONTROLS TYPE MATCHED
 28158                                  ;				   ; 8000H=NUMERIC VALUE, (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 28159                                  ;				   ; 4000H=SIGNED NUMERIC VALUE (VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 28160                                  ;				   ; 2000H=SIMPLE STRING(VALUE LIST WILL BE CHECKED)
 28161                                  ;				   ; 1000H=DATE STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 28162                                  ;				   ; 0800H=TIME STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 28163                                  ;				   ; 0400H=COMPLEX LIST (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 28164                                  ;				   ; 0200H=FILE SPEC (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 28165                                  ;				   ; 0100H=DRIVE ONLY (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 28166                                  ;				   ; 0080H=QUOTED STRING (VALUE LIST WON'T BE CHECKED)
 28167                                  ;				   ; 0010H=IGNORE ":" AT END IN MATCH
 28168                                  ;				   ; 0002H=REPEATS ALLOWED
 28169                                  ;				   ; 0001H=OPTIONAL
 28170                                  ;	   DW	   FUNCTION_FLAGS
 28171                                  ;				   ; 0001H=CAP RESULT BY FILE TABLE
 28172                                  ;				   ; 0002H=CAP RESULT BY CHAR TABLE
 28173                                  ;				   ; 0010H=REMOVE ":" AT END
 28174                                  ; (tm10)			   ; 0020H=colon is not necessary for switch
 28175                                  ;	   DW	   RESULT	   ; RESULT BUFFER
 28176                                  ;	   DW	   VALUES	   ; VALUE LISTS
 28177                                  ;	   DB	   nid		   ; NUMBER OF KEYWORD/SWITCH SYNONYMS IN FOLLOWING LIST
 28178                                  ;	   DB	   "...",0         ; IF n >0, KEYWORD 1
 28179                                  ;	   :
 28180                                  ;
 28181                                  ;Note:
 28182                                  ;    - The MATCH_FLAG is bit significant. You can set, for example, TIME bit and
 28183                                  ;      DATE bit simalteniously.
 28184                                  ;
 28185                                  ;      The parser examins each bit along with the following priority.
 28186                                  ;
 28187                                  ;      COMPLEX -> DATE -> TIME -> NUMERIC VAL -> SIGNED NUMERIC VAL -> DRIVE ->
 28188                                  ;      FILE SPEC -> SIMPLE STRING.
 28189                                  ;
 28190                                  ;    - When the FUNCTION_FLAG is 0001 or 0002, the STRING pointed to by a pointer
 28191                                  ;      in the result buffer is capitalized.
 28192                                  ;
 28193                                  ;    - Match_Flags 0001H and 0002H have meaning only for the positional.
 28194                                  ;
 28195                                  ;    - The "...",0 (bottom most line) does require '=' or '/'. When you need a
 28196                                  ;      switch, for example, '/A', then STRING points to;
 28197                                  ;
 28198                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 28199                                  ;			DB   '/A',0
 28200                                  ;
 28201                                  ;      When you need a keyword, for example, 'CODEPAGE=', then "...",0 will be;
 28202                                  ;
 28203                                  ;			DB    1 	; number of following synonyms
 28204                                  ;			DB   'CODEPAGE=',0
 28205                                  ;
 28206                                  ;    - "..." must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 28207                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 28208                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 28209                                  ;
 28210                                  ;    - One "..." can contain only one switch or keyword. If you need, for
 28211                                  ;      example /A and /B, the format will be;
 28212                                  ;
 28213                                  ;			DB    2 	; number of following synonyms
 28214                                  ;			DB    '/A',0
 28215                                  ;			DB    '/B',0
 28216                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28217                                  
 28218                                  ;**** Match_Flags
 28219                                  
 28220                                  _$P_Num_Val	   equ	8000h		;AN000; Numeric Value
 28221                                  _$P_SNum_Val	   equ	4000h		;AN000; Signed numeric value
 28222                                  _$P_Simple_S	   equ	2000h		;AN000; Simple string
 28223                                  _$P_Date_S	   equ	1000h		;AN000; Date string
 28224                                  _$P_Time_S	   equ	0800h		;AN000; Time string
 28225                                  _$P_Cmpx_S	   equ	0400h		;AN000; Complex string
 28226                                  _$P_File_Spc	   equ	0200h		;AN000; File Spec
 28227                                  _$P_Drv_Only	   equ	0100h		;AN000; Drive Only
 28228                                  _$P_Qu_String	   equ	0080h		;AN000; Quoted string
 28229                                  _$P_Ig_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Ignore colon at end in match
 28230                                  _$P_Repeat	   equ	0002h		;AN000; Repeat allowed
 28231                                  _$P_Optional	   equ	0001h		;AN000; Optional
 28232                                  
 28233                                  ;**** Function flags
 28234                                  
 28235                                  _$P_CAP_File	   equ	0001h		;AN000; CAP result by file table
 28236                                  _$P_CAP_Char	   equ	0002h		;AN000; CAP result by character table
 28237                                  _$P_Rm_Colon	   equ	0010h		;AN000; Remove ":" at the end
 28238                                  _$P_colon_is_not_necessary equ 0020h	;AN000;(tm10) /+10 and /+:10
 28239                                  
 28240                                  ;-------------------------------- Control block structure
 28241                                  struc _$P_Control_Blk
 28242 00000000 ????                     .Match_Flag:	 resw 1		;AN000; Controls type matched
 28243 00000002 ????                     .Function_Flag: resw 1		;AN000; Function should be taken
 28244 00000004 ????                     .Result_Buf:	 resw 1		; Result buffer address
 28245 00000006 ????                     .Value_List:	 resw 1		;AN000; Value list address
 28246 00000008 ??                       .nid:		 resb 1		;AN000; # of keyword/SW synonyms
 28247 00000009 ??                       .KEYorSW:	 resb 1		;AN000; keyword or sw
 28248                                  endstruc
 28249                                  
 28250                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28251                                  ; << Value List Definition >>
 28252                                  ;
 28253                                  ;VALUES 	LABEL	BYTE
 28254                                  ;		DB	nval			; NUMBER OF VALUE DEFINITIONS (0 - 3)
 28255                                  ;	     +-
 28256                                  ;	     |	DB	nrng			; NUMBER OF RANGES
 28257                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF RANGE MATCHED
 28258                                  ;	     | +DD	X,Y			; RANGE OF VALUES
 28259                                  ;	     |	:
 28260                                  ;	     |	DB	nnval			; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 28261                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF NUMBER CHOICE MATCHED
 28262                                  ;	     | +DD	VALUE			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF NUMBER
 28263                                  ;	     |	:
 28264                                  ;	     |	DB	nstrval 		; NUMBER OF CHOICES
 28265                                  ;	     | +DB	ITEM_TAG		; RETURN VALUE IF STRING CHOICE MATCHED
 28266                                  ;	     | +DW	STRING			; SPECIFIC CHOICE IF STING
 28267                                  ;	     +-	:
 28268                                  ;
 28269                                  ;STRING 	DB	"...",0                 ; ASCIIZ STRING IMAGE
 28270                                  ;
 28271                                  ;Note:
 28272                                  ;    - ITEM_TAG must not be 0FFH, which will be used in the result buffer
 28273                                  ;      when no choice lists are provided.
 28274                                  ;
 28275                                  ;    - STRING must consist of upper case characters only because the parser
 28276                                  ;      performs pattern matching after converting input to upper case (by
 28277                                  ;      using the current country upper case table)
 28278                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28279                                  
 28280                                  _$P_nval_None	   equ	0		;AN000; no value list ID
 28281                                  _$P_nval_Range	   equ	1		;AN000; range list ID
 28282                                  _$P_nval_Value	   equ	2		;AN000; value list ID
 28283                                  _$P_nval_String	   equ	3		;AN000; string list ID
 28284                                  _$P_Len_Range	   equ	9		;AN000; Length of a range choice(two DD plus one DB)
 28285                                  _$P_Len_Value	   equ	5		;AN000; Length of a value choice(one DD plus one DB)
 28286                                  _$P_Len_String	   equ	3		;AN000; Length of a string choice(one DW plus one DB)
 28287                                  _$P_No_nrng	   equ	0		;AN000; (tm07) no nrng. nnval must not be 0.
 28288                                  
 28289                                  struc _$P_Val_List
 28290 00000000 ??                       .NumofList: resb 1			;AN000; number of following choice
 28291 00000001 ????                     .Val_XL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of value
 28292 00000003 ????                     .Val_XH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of value
 28293 00000005 ????                     .Val_YL:    resw 1			;AN000; lower word of another value
 28294 00000007 ????                     .Val_YH:    resw 1			;AN000; higher word of another value
 28295                                  endstruc
 28296                                  
 28297                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28298                                  ; << Result Buffer Definition  >>
 28299                                  ;
 28300                                  ;RESULT 	LABEL	BYTE			; BELOW FILLED IN FOR DEFAULTS
 28301                                  ;		DB	type			; TYPE RETURNED: 0=RESERVED,
 28302                                  ;						;	1=NUMBER, 2=LIST INDEX,
 28303                                  ;						;	3=STRING, 4=COMPLEX,
 28304                                  ;						;	5=FILESPEC, 6=DRIVE
 28305                                  ;						;	7=DATE, 8=TIME
 28306                                  ;						;	9=QUOTED STRING
 28307                                  ;		DB	ITEM_TAG		; MATCHED ITEM TAG
 28308                                  ;
 28309                                  ;		dw	synonym@		; es:@ points to found SYNONYM if provided.
 28310                                  ;
 28311                                  ;            +-
 28312                                  ;	    | DD	n			; VALUE IF NUMBER
 28313                                  ;	    | or
 28314                                  ;	    |	DW	i			; INDEX (OFFSET) INTO VALUE LIST
 28315                                  ;	    |					; (ES presents Segment address)
 28316                                  ;	    | or
 28317                                  ;	    |	DD	STRING			; OFFSET OF STRING VALUE
 28318                                  ;	    | or
 28319                                  ;	    |	DB	drv			; DRIVE NUMBER (1-A, 2-B,..., 26-Z)
 28320                                  ;	    | or
 28321                                  ;	    |	DW	YEAR	   ;(1980-2099)  IN CASE OF DATE
 28322                                  ;	    |	DB	MONTH	   ;(1-12)	 Note: Range check is not performed.
 28323                                  ;	    |	DB	DATE	   ;(1-31)	       0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified.
 28324                                  ;	    | or
 28325                                  ;	    |	DB	HOUR	   ;(0-23)	  IN CASE OF TIME
 28326                                  ;	    |	DB	MINUTES    ;(0-59)	  Note: Range check is not performed .
 28327                                  ;	    |	DB	SECONDS    ;(0-59)		0 is filled when the corresponding field was not specified .
 28328                                  ;	    |	DB	HUNDREDTHS ;(0-99)
 28329                                  ;	    +-
 28330                                  ;
 28331                                  ;
 28332                                  ;Note: ITEM_TAG is 0FFH when the caller does not specify the choice
 28333                                  ;      list.
 28334                                  ;
 28335                                  ;      YEAR: If the input value for the year is less than 100, parser
 28336                                  ;	     adds 1900 to it.  For example, when 87 is input to parser for
 28337                                  ;	     the year value, he returns 1987.
 28338                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 28339                                  
 28340                                  ;-------------------------------- Result block structure
 28341                                  struc _$P_Result_Blk
 28342 00000000 ??                       .Type:        resb 1		;AN000; Type returned
 28343 00000001 ??                       .Item_Tag:    resb 1		;AN000; Matched item tag
 28344 00000002 ????                     .SYNONYM_Ptr: resw 1		;AN000; pointer to Synonym list returned
 28345 00000004 ????????                 .Picked_Val:  resb 4		;AN000; value
 28346                                  endstruc
 28347

 28349                                  ;**** values for the type field in the result block
 28350                                  
 28351                                  _$P_EOL		   equ	0		;AN000; End of line
 28352                                  _$P_Number	   equ	1		;AN000; Number
 28353                                  _$P_List_Idx	   equ	2		;AN000; List Index
 28354                                  _$P_String	   equ	3		;AN000; String
 28355                                  _$P_Complex	   equ	4		;AN000; Complex
 28356                                  _$P_File_Spec	   equ	5		;AN000; File Spec
 28357                                  _$P_Drive	   equ	6		;AN000; Drive
 28358                                  _$P_Date_F	   equ	7		;AN000; Date
 28359                                  _$P_Time_F	   equ	8		;AN000; Time
 28360                                  _$P_Quoted_String  equ	9		;AN000; Quoted String
 28361                                  
 28362                                  _$P_No_Tag	   equ	0FFh		;AN000; No ITEM_TAG found
 28363                                  
 28364                                  ;**** Return code
 28365                                  ;
 28366                                  ; following return code will be returned in the AX register.
 28367                                  
 28368                                  _$P_No_Error	   equ	0		;AN000; No error
 28369                                  _$P_Too_Many	   equ	1		;AN000; Too many operands
 28370                                  _$P_Op_Missing	   equ	2		;AN000; Required operand missing
 28371                                  _$P_Not_In_SW	   equ	3		;AN000; Not in switch list provided
 28372                                  _$P_Not_In_Key	   equ	4		;AN000; Not in keyword list provided
 28373                                  _$P_Out_Of_Range   equ	6		;AN000; Out of range specified
 28374                                  _$P_Not_In_Val	   equ	7		;AN000; Not in value list provided
 28375                                  _$P_Not_In_Str	   equ	8		;AN000; Not in string list provided
 28376                                  _$P_Syntax	   equ	9		;AN000; Syntax error
 28377                                  _$P_RC_EOL	   equ	-1		;AN000; End of command line

 28389 000014E2 0000                    _$P_SI_Save:	   dw	0		;AN000; Pointer of command buffer
 28390 000014E4 0000                    _$P_DX:		   dw	0		;AN000; Return result buffer address
 28391 000014E6 00                      _$P_Terminator:	   db	0		;AN000; Terminator code (ASCII)
 28392 000014E7 0000                    _$P_DBCSEV_OFF:	   dw	0		;AN000; Offset of DBCS EV
 28393 000014E9 0000                    _$P_DBCSEV_SEG:	   dw	0		;AN000; Segment of DBCS EV
 28394 000014EB 0000                    _$P_Flags:	   dw	0		;AN000; Parser internal flags
 28395                                  %define _$P_Flags1 _$P_Flags		;AN038; to reference first byte flags

 28462                                  ; PARSE.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
