 28464                                  ; 27/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 28465                                  
 28466                                  ;***********************************************************************
 28467                                  ; SysParse;
 28468                                  ;
 28469                                  ;  Function : Parser Entry
 28470                                  ;
 28471                                  ;  Input: DS:SI -> command line
 28472                                  ;	  ES:DI -> parameter block
 28473                                  ;	  cs -> psdata.inc
 28474                                  ;	  CX = operand ordinal
 28475                                  ;
 28476                                  ;	  Note:  ES is the segment containing all the control blocks defined
 28477                                  ;		 by the caller, except for the DOS COMMAND line parms, which
 28478                                  ;		 is in DS.
 28479                                  ;
 28480                                  ;  Output: CY = 1   error of caller, means invalid parameter block or
 28481                                  ;		    invalid value list. But this parser does NOT implement
 28482                                  ;		    this feature. Therefore CY always zero.
 28483                                  ;
 28484                                  ;	   CY = 0   AX = return code
 28485                                  ;		    BL = terminated delimiter code
 28486                                  ;		    CX = new operand ordinal
 28487                                  ;		    SI = set past scaned operand
 28488                                  ;		    DX = selected result buffer
 28489                                  ;
 28490                                  ; Use:	_$P_Skip_Delim, _$P_Chk_EOL, _$P_Chk_Delim, _$P_Chk_DBCS
 28491                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Swtch, _$P_Chk_Pos_Control, _$P_Chk_Key_Control
 28492                                  ;	_$P_Chk_Sw_Control, _$P_Fill_Result
 28493                                  ;
 28494                                  ; Vars: _$P_Ordinal(RW), _$P_RC(RW), _$P_SI_Save(RW), _$P_DX(R), _$P_Terminator(R)
 28495                                  ;	_$P_SaveSI_Cmpx(W), _$P_Flags(RW), _$P_Found_SYNONYM(R), _$P_Save_EOB(W)
 28496                                  ;
 28497                                  ;-------- Modification History -----------------------------------------
 28498                                  ;
 28499                                  ;  4/04/87 : Created by K. K,
 28500                                  ;  4/28/87 : _$P_Val_YH assemble error (tm01)
 28501                                  ;	   : JMP SHORT assemble error (tm02)
 28502                                  ;  5/14/87 : Someone doesn't want to include psdata (tm03)
 28503                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_Bridge is missing when TimeSw equ 0 and (CmpxSw equ 1 or
 28504                                  ;	     DateSW equ 1)	      (tm04)
 28505                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_SorD_Quote is missing when QusSw equ 0 and CmpxSW equ 1
 28506                                  ;				      (tm05) in PSDATA.INC
 28507                                  ;  6/12/87 : _$P_FileSp_Char and _$P_FileSP_Len are missing
 28508                                  ;	     when FileSW equ 0 and DrvSW equ 1 (tm06) in PSDATA.INC
 28509                                  ;  6/18/87 : $VAL1 and $VAL3, $VAL2 and $VAL3 can be used in the same
 28510                                  ;	     value-list block	      (tm07)
 28511                                  ;  6/20/87 : Add _$P_SW to check if there's an omiting parameter after
 28512                                  ;	     switch (keyword) or not. If there is, backup si for next call
 28513                                  ;	     (tm08)
 28514                                  ;  6/24/87 : Complex Item checking does not work correctly when CmpSW equ 1
 28515                                  ;	     and DateSW equ 0 and TimeSW equ 0 (tm09)
 28516                                  ;  6/24/87 : New function flag _$P_colon_is_not_necessary for switch
 28517                                  ;	     /+15 and /+:15 are allowed for user (tm10)
 28518                                  ;  6/29/87 : ECS call changes DS register but it causes the address problem
 28519                                  ;	     in user's routines. _$P_Chk_DBCS (tm11)
 28520                                  ;  7/10/87 : Switch with no_match flag (0x0000H) does not work correctly
 28521                                  ;					  (tm12)

 29167                                  ; _$P_Fill_Result
 29168                                  ;
 29169                                  ; Function: Fill the result buffer
 29170                                  ;
 29171                                  ; Input:    AH = Item tag
 29172                                  ;	    AL = type
 29173                                  ;		  AL = 1: CX,DX has 32bit number (CX = high)
 29174                                  ;		  AL = 2: DX has index(offset) into value list
 29175                                  ;		  AL = 6: DL has driver # (1-A, 2-B, ... , 26 - Z)
 29176                                  ;		  AL = 7: DX has year, CL has month and CH has date
 29177                                  ;		  AL = 8: DL has hours, DH has minutes, CL has seconds,
 29178                                  ;			  amd CH has hundredths

 29586                                  ;***********************************************************************
 29587                                  ; _$P_Value / _$P_SValue
 29588                                  ;
 29589                                  ; Function:  Make 32bit value from cs:SI and see value list
 29590                                  ;	     and make result buffer.
 29591                                  ;	     _$P_SValue is an entry point for the signed value
 29592                                  ;	     and this will simply call _$P_Value after the handling
 29593                                  ;	     of the sign character, "+" or "-"
 29594                                  ;
 29595                                  ; Input:     cs:SI -> _$P_STRING_BUF
 29596                                  ;	     ES:BX -> CONTROL block
 29597                                  ;
 29598                                  ; Output:    None
 29599                                  ;
 29600                                  ; Use:	_$P_Fill_Result, _$P_Check_OVF
 29601                                  ;
 29602                                  ; Vars: _$P_RC(W), _$P_Flags(RW)
 29603                                  ;***********************************************************************
 29604                                  
 29605                                  	; 26/10/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0
 29606                                  	; (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1B0Bh)
 29607                                  
 29608                                  	; 07/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 29609                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1C46h)  	
 29610                                  _$P_SValue:				;AN000; when signed value here
 29611 00001945 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 29612 00001946 2E800E[EC14]80          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Signed ;AC034; indicate a signed numeric
 29613 0000194C 2E8026[EC14]FD          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Neg ;AC034; assume positive value
 29614                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],~_$P_Neg ; 07/07/2023 
 29615 00001952 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get sign
 29616 00001955 3C2B                    	cmp	al,_$P_Plus		;AN000; "+" ?
 29617 00001957 740A                    	je	short _$P_SVal00	;AN000;
 29618                                  
 29619 00001959 3C2D                    	cmp	al,_$P_Minus		;AN000; "-" ?
 29620 0000195B 7507                    	jne	short _$P_Sval01	;AN000; else
 29621                                  
 29622 0000195D 2E800E[EC14]02          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; set this is negative value
 29623                                  _$P_SVal00:				;AN000;
 29624 00001963 46                      	inc	si			;AN000; skip sign char
 29625                                  _$P_Sval01:				;AN000;
 29626 00001964 E80200                  	call	_$P_Value		;AN000; and process value
 29627 00001967 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 29628 00001968 C3                      	retn
 29629                                  
 29630                                  ;***********************************************************************
 29631                                  
 29632                                  	; 07/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 29633                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1C6Ah)
 29634                                  
 29635                                  	; 26/10/2022
 29636                                  _$P_Value:				;AN000;
 29637 00001969 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 29638 0000196A 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 29639 0000196B 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 29640 0000196C 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 29641 0000196D 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx			;AN000; cx = higher 16 bits
 29642 0000196F 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			;AN000; dx = lower 16 bits
 29643 00001971 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; save control pointer
 29644                                  _$P_Value_Loop:				;AN000;
 29645 00001972 2E8A04                  	mov	al,[cs:si]		;AN000; get character
 29646 00001975 08C0                    	or	al,al			;AN000; end of line ?
 29647 00001977 7438                    	jz	short _$P_Value00	;AN000;
 29648                                  
 29649 00001979 E8DC00                  	call	_$P_0099 		;AN000; make asc(0..9) to bin(0..9)
 29650 0000197C 722F                    	jc	short _$P_Value_Err0	;AN000;
 29651                                  
 29652 0000197E 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah			;AN000;
 29653 00001980 89C5                    	mov	bp,ax			;AN000; save binary number
 29654                                  
 29655                                  ; 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 29656                                  ; Ref: Disassembled PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM SYSINIT code
 29657                                  ;				Erdogan Tan - July 2023
 29658                                  %if 0
 29659                                  	shl	dx,1			;AN000; to have 2*x

 29892                                  ; _$P_Check_OVF
 29893                                  ;
 29894                                  ; Function:  Check if overflow is occurred with consideration of
 29895                                  ;	     signed or un-signed numeric value
 29896                                  ;
 29897                                  ; Input:     Flag register
 29898                                  ;
 29899                                  ; Output:    CY = 1  :	Overflow
 29900                                  ;
 29901                                  ; Vars:     _$P_Flags(R)
 29902                                  ;***********************************************************************
 29903                                  
 29904                                  	; 26/10/2022
 29905                                  _$P_Check_OVF:
 29906 00001A46 9C                      	pushf				;AN000;
 29907 00001A47 2EF606[EC14]02          	test	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_Neg ;AC034; is it negative value ?
 29908 00001A4D 7502                    	jnz	short _$P_COVF 		;AN000; if no, check overflow
 29909                                  
 29910 00001A4F 9D                      	popf				;AN000; by the CY bit
 29911 00001A50 C3                      	retn				;AN000;
 29912                                  
 29913                                  _$P_COVF:				;AN000;
 29914 00001A51 9D                      	popf				;AN000; else,
 29915 00001A52 7002                    	jo	short _$P_COVF00	;AN000; check overflow by the OF
 29916                                  
 29917 00001A54 F8                      	clc				;AN000; indicate it with CY bit
 29918 00001A55 C3                      	retn				;AN000; CY=0 means no overflow
 29919                                  
 29920                                  _$P_COVF00:				;AN000;
 29921 00001A56 F9                      	stc				;AN000; and CY=1 means overflow
 29922 00001A57 C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 30427                                  ;***********************************************************************
 30428                                  ; _$P_Skip_Delim;

 30430                                  ; Function: Skip delimiters specified in the PARMS list, white space
 30431                                  ;	    and comma.

 30490                                  ; _$P_Chk_EOL;
 30491                                  ;
 30492                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of End of Line characters.
 30493                                  ;
 30494                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 30495                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 30496                                  ;

 30500                                  _$P_Chk_EOL:
 30501 00001C52 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;

 30542                                  ;***********************************************************************
 30543                                  ; _$P_Chk_Delim;
 30544                                  ;
 30545                                  ; Function: Check if AL is one of delimiter characters.
 30546                                  ;	    if AL+[si] is DBCS blank, it is replaced with two SBCS
 30547                                  ;	    blanks.
 30548                                  ;
 30549                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 30550                                  ;	    DS:SI -> Next Character
 30551                                  ;	    ES:DI -> Parameter List
 30552                                  ;
 30553                                  ; Output:   ZF = 1 if one of delimiter characters
 30554                                  ;	    SI points to the next character
 30555                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W), _$P_Flags(W)
 30556                                  ;***********************************************************************
 30557                                  
 30558                                  	; 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 30559                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1FAEh
 30560                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:2451h) ; (Retro DOS v5.0)
 30561                                  
 30562                                  _$P_Chk_Delim:
 30563 00001C87 53                      	push	bx			;AN000;
 30564 00001C88 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 30565 00001C89 2EC606[E614]20          	mov	byte [cs:_$P_Terminator],_$P_Space 
 30566                                  					;AC034; Assume terminated by space
 30567                                  	;and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags20,0DFh
 30568 00001C8F 2E8026[EC14]DF          	and	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],0FFh-_$P_Extra ;AC034;
 30569 00001C95 3C20                    	cmp	al,_$P_Space ; 20h	;AN000; Space ?
 30570 00001C97 7423                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 30571                                  
 30572 00001C99 3C09                    	cmp	al,_$P_TAB		;AN000; TAB ?
 30573 00001C9B 741F                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 30574                                  
 30575 00001C9D 3C2C                    	cmp	al,_$P_Comma		;AN000; Comma ?
 30576 00001C9F 741E                    	je	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit0 ;AN000;
 30577                                  
 30578                                  ; Note: _$P_Chk_Delim00 part of code is nonsense here
 30579                                  ;        because _$P_Space = _$P_DBSP1 = 20h
 30580                                  ;        Erdogan Tan - 08/07/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization)
 30581                                  ;_$P_Chk_Delim00:
 30582                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:246Bh)
 30583                                  	; (MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:1FC8h)
 30584                                  %if 0
 30585                                  	; 26/10/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 30586                                  _$P_Chk_Delim00: 			;AN000;
 30587                                  	cmp	al,_$P_DBSP1	; 20h	;AN000; 1st byte of DBCS Space ?
 30588                                  	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 30589                                  
 30590                                  	cmp	byte [si],_$P_DBSP2 ; 20h ;AN000; 2nd byte of DBCS Space ?
 30591                                  	jne	short _$P_Chk_Delim01	;AN000;
 30592                                  
 30593                                  	mov	al,_$P_Space		;AN000;
 30594                                  	inc	si			;AN000; make si point to next character
 30595                                  	cmp	al,al			;AN000; Set ZF
 30596                                  	jmp	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 30597                                  %endif
 30598                                  
 30599                                  _$P_Chk_Delim01: 			;AN000;
 30600 00001CA1 26807DFE01              	cmp	byte [es:di-_$P_PARMS_Blk.Num_Extra],_$P_I_Have_Delim 
 30601                                  					;AN000; delimiter character specified ?
 30602 00001CA6 7214                    	jb	short _$P_Chk_Delim_Exit ;AN000;
 30603                                  
 30604                                  	;xor	cx,cx			;AN000;
 30605 00001CA8 30ED                    	xor	ch,ch
 30606                                  	;mov	cl,[es:di+3]
 30607 00001CAA 268A4D03                	mov	cl,[es:di+_$P_PARMS_Blk.Len_Extra_Delim] 
 30608                                  					;AN000; get length of delimiter list
 30609                                  	;or	cx,cx			;AN000; No extra Delim character ?
 30610                                  	;jz	short _$P_Chk_Delim_NZ 	;AN000;
 30611                                  	; 08/07/2023
 30612 00001CAE E30B                    	jcxz	_$P_Chk_Delim_NZ
 30613                                  
 30614 00001CB0 BB0300                  	mov	bx,_$P_Len_PARMS-1 ; 3	;AN000; set bx to 1st extra delimiter
 30615                                  _$P_Chk_Delim_Loop:			;AN000;
 30616 00001CB3 43                      	inc	bx			;AN000;
 30617 00001CB4 263A01                  	cmp	al,[es:bx+di]		;AN000; Check extra Delim character

 30644                                  ;***********************************************************************
 30645                                  ; _$P_Chk_Switch;
 30646                                  ;
 30647                                  ; Function: Check if AL is the switch character not in first position of
 30648                                  ;	    _$P_STRING_BUF
 30649                                  ;
 30650                                  ; Input:    AL = character code
 30651                                  ;	    BX = current pointer within _$P_String_Buf
 30652                                  ;	    SI =>next char on command line (following the one in AL)
 30653                                  ;
 30654                                  ; Output:   CF = 1 (set)if AL is switch character, and not in first
 30655                                  ;		 position, and has no chance of being part of a date string,
 30656                                  ;		 i.e. should be treated as a delimiter.
 30657                                  
 30658                                  ;	    CF = 0 (reset, cleared) if AL is not a switch char, is in the first
 30659                                  ;		 position, or is a slash but may be part of a date string, i.e.
 30660                                  ;		 should not be treated as a delimiter.
 30661                                  ;
 30662                                  ; Vars:  _$P_Terminator(W)
 30663                                  
 30664                                  ; Use:	 _$P_0099
 30665                                  ;***********************************************************************
 30666                                  
 30667                                  _$P_Chk_Switch:
 30668                                  	;;lea	bp,[cs:_$P_STRING_BUF]	;AN020;AC034
 30669                                  	;lea	bp,[_$P_STRING_BUF]	;BP=OFFSET of _$P_String_Buf even in group addressing
 30670                                  	; 08/07/2023
 30671 00001CD5 BD[F514]                	mov	bp,_$P_STRING_BUF
 30672                                  
 30673                                  ;	.IF <BX NE BP> THEN		;AN020;IF not first char THEN
 30674 00001CD8 39EB                    	cmp	bx,bp			;AN000;
 30675 00001CDA 7406                    	je	short _$P_STRUC_L2	;AN000;
 30676                                  
 30677                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;otherwise see if a slash
 30678 00001CDC 3C2F                    	cmp	al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 30679 00001CDE 750C                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L5 	;AN000;
 30680                                  
 30681 00001CE0 F9                      	stc				;AN020;not in first position and is slash
 30682                                  	;jmp     short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 30683                                  	; 12/12/2022
 30684 00001CE1 C3                      	retn
 30685                                  
 30686                                  ; 12/12/2022
 30687                                  ;_$P_STRUC_L5:				;AN000;
 30688                                  ;	CLC				;AN020;not a slash
 30689                                  ;;	    .ENDIF			;AN020;
 30690                                  ;;	.ELSE				;AN020;is first char in the buffer, ZF=0
 30691                                  ;	jmp	short _$P_STRUC_L1	;AN000;
 30692                                  
 30693                                  _$P_STRUC_L2:				;AN000;
 30694                                  ;	.IF <AL EQ _$P_Switch> THEN	;AN020;
 30695 00001CE2 3C2F                    	cmp     al,_$P_Switch		;AN000;
 30696 00001CE4 7506                    	jne	short _$P_STRUC_L12	;AN000;
 30697                                  
 30698 00001CE6 2E800E[EC14]40          	or	byte [cs:_$P_Flags2],_$P_SW ;AN020 ;AC034;;could be valid switch, first char and is slash
 30699                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 30700                                  
 30701                                  	; 12/12/2022
 30702                                  	; cf=0
 30703                                  	;retn
 30704                                  
 30705                                  _$P_STRUC_L5:
 30706                                  	; 12/12/2022
 30707                                  _$P_STRUC_L12:				;AN000;
 30708 00001CEC F8                      	clc				;AN020;CF=0 indicating first char
 30709                                  ;	.ENDIF				;AN020;
 30710                                  _$P_STRUC_L1:				;AN000;
 30711 00001CED C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 30713                                  ;**************************************************************************
 30714                                  ; _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 30715                                  ;
 30716                                  ;  Function: Check if a specified byte is in ranges of the DBCS lead bytes
 30717                                  ;
 30718                                  ;  Input:
 30719                                  ;	  AL	= Code to be examineed
 30720                                  ;
 30721                                  ;  Output:
 30722                                  ;	  If CF is on then a lead byte of DBCS
 30723                                  ;
 30724                                  ; Use: INT 21h w/AH=63
 30725                                  ;
 30726                                  ; Vars:  _$P_DBCSEV_Seg(RW), _$P_DBCSEV_Off(RW)
 30727                                  ;***************************************************************************
 30728                                  
 30729                                  _$P_Chk_DBCS:
 30730 00001CEE 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000;
 30731 00001CEF 56                      	push	si			;AN000;
 30732 00001CF0 53                      	push	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 30733                                  	;cmp	word [cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],0 ;AC034; ALREADY SET ?
 30734                                  	;jne	short _$P_DBCS00	;AN000;
 30735                                  	; 08/07/2023
 30736 00001CF1 2E8B36[E914]            	mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]
 30737 00001CF6 21F6                    	and	si,si ; 0 ?
 30738 00001CF8 7525                    	jnz	short _$P_DBCS00 ; already set
 30739 00001CFA 50                      	push	ax			;AN000;
 30740 00001CFB 1E                      	push	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 30741 00001CFC 51                      	push	cx			;AN000;
 30742 00001CFD 52                      	push	dx			;AN000;
 30743 00001CFE 57                      	push	di			;AN000;
 30744 00001CFF 55                      	push	bp			;AN000;
 30745 00001D00 06                      	push	es			;AN000;
 30746                                  	; si = 0 ; 08/07/2023
 30747                                  	;xor	si,si			;AN000;
 30748 00001D01 8EDE                    	mov	ds,si ; 0		;AN000;
 30749 00001D03 B80063                  	mov	ax,_$P_DOS_GetEV ; 6300h ;AN000; GET DBCS EV CALL
 30750 00001D06 CD21                    	int	21h			;AN000;
 30751                                  		; DOS - 3.2+ only - GET DOUBLE BYTE CHARACTER SET LEAD TABLE
 30752 00001D08 8CDB                    	mov	bx,ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 30753 00001D0A 09DB                    	or	bx,bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 30754 00001D0C 07                      	pop	es			;AN000;
 30755 00001D0D 5D                      	pop	bp			;AN000;
 30756 00001D0E 5F                      	pop	di			;AN000;
 30757 00001D0F 5A                      	pop	dx			;AN000;
 30758 00001D10 59                      	pop	cx			;AN000;
 30759 00001D11 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000; (tm11)
 30760 00001D12 58                      	pop	ax			;AN000;
 30761 00001D13 7424                    	jz	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000;
 30762                                  _$P_DBCS02:				;AN000;
 30763 00001D15 2E8936[E714]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF],si	;AC034; save EV offset
 30764 00001D1A 2E891E[E914]            	mov	[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG],bx	;AC034; save EV segment (tm11)
 30765                                  _$P_DBCS00:				;AN000;
 30766                                  	;mov	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]	;AC034; load EV offset
 30767                                  	;mov	ds,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_SEG]	;AC034; and segment
 30768                                  	; 08/07/2023
 30769 00001D1F 2EC536[E714]            	lds	si,[cs:_$P_DBCSEV_OFF]
 30770                                  _$P_DBCS_LOOP:				;AN000;
 30771 00001D24 833C00                  	cmp	word [si],0		;AN000; zero vector ?
 30772 00001D27 7410                    	je	short _$P_NON_DBCS	;AN000; then exit
 30773 00001D29 3A04                    	cmp	al,[si] 		;AN000;
 30774 00001D2B 7208                    	jb	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000; Check if AL is in
 30775 00001D2D 3A4401                  	cmp	al,[si+1]		;AN000;   range of
 30776 00001D30 7703                    	ja	short _$P_DBCS01	;AN000;      the vector
 30777 00001D32 F9                      	stc				;AN000; if yes, indicate DBCS and exit
 30778 00001D33 EB04                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_EXIT	;AN000;
 30779                                  _$P_DBCS01:				;AN000;
 30780 00001D35 46                      	inc	si			;AC035; add '2' to
 30781 00001D36 46                      	inc	si			;AC035;  SI reg
 30782                                  					;AN000; get next vector
 30783 00001D37 EBEB                    	jmp	short _$P_DBCS_LOOP	;AN000; loop until zero vector found
 30784                                  _$P_NON_DBCS:				;AN000;
 30785                                  	; 12/12/2022
 30786                                  	; cf=0
 30787                                  	;clc				;AN000; indicate SBCS
 30788                                  _$P_DBCS_EXIT:				;AN000;
 30789 00001D39 5B                      	pop	bx			;AN000; (tm11)
 30790 00001D3A 5E                      	pop	si			;AN000;
 30791 00001D3B 1F                      	pop	ds			;AN000;
 30792 00001D3C C3                      	retn				;AN000;

 30804                                  struc p_parms
 30805 00000000 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?
 30806 00000002 ??                      	resb	1	; db 1	; an extra delimiter list
 30807 00000003 ??                      	resb	1	; db 1	; length is 1
 30808 00000004 ??                      	resb 	1	; db ';' ; delimiter
 30809                                  .size:
 30810                                  endstruc
 30811                                  
 30812                                  struc p_pos
 30813 00000000 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; numeric value??
 30814 00000002 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; function
 30815 00000004 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; result value buffer
 30816                                  
 30817                                  ; note: by defining result_val before this structure, we could remove
 30818                                  ;  the "result_val" from every structure invocation
 30819                                  
 30820 00000006 ????                    	resw	1	; dw ?	; value list

 31420                                  ; 30/03/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 31421                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 31422                                  
 31423                                  ;   Module:   HIGHVAR.INC - Data common to LOADHIGH and DEVICEHIGH, res seg
 31424                                  ;
 31425                                  ;   Date:     May 14, 1992
 31426                                  ;
 31427                                  ;******************************************************************************
 31428                                  ;
 31429                                  ;   Modification log:
 31430                                  ;
 31431                                  ;     DATE    WHO      DESCRIPTION
 31432                                  ;   --------  -------  --------------------------------------------------------
 31433                                  ;   05/14/92  t-richj  Original
 31434                                  ;   06/21/92  t-richj  Final revisions before check-in
 31435                                  ;
 31436                                  ;******************************************************************************
 31437                                  ;
 31438                                  ; There are two primary definitions which need to be made, selectively, before
 31439                                  ; this include file should be used.  These are:
 31440                                  ;    HV_Extern - If this has been defined, variables for this module will be
 31441                                  ;                declared as external.  Otherwise, variables will be declared
 31442                                  ;                public, as well as defined, here.  LoadHigh declares HV_Extern
 31443                                  ;                in stub.asm and loadhi.asm, and does not declare it in
 31444                                  ;                rdata.asm... DeviceHigh does not declare HV_Extern anywhere
 31445                                  ;                (as only one module, sysconf.asm, includes this file).
 31446                                  ;    HV_LoadHigh - This should be defined when this module is going into
 31447                                  ;                  command.com, for LoadHigh.  All of loadhi.asm, stub.asm and
 31448                                  ;                  rdata.asm define this, while io.sys' sysconf.asm does not.
 31449                                  ;
 31450                                  ;******************************************************************************
 31451                                  
 31452                                  ; To keep track of which UMBs were specified on the DH/LH command lines, and
 31453                                  ; to keep track of the minimum sizes given for each, there're two arrays kept
 31454                                  ; in { IO.SYS: sysinitseg / COMMAND.COM: DATARES }... each is MAXUMB elements
 31455                                  ; big.  16 should be around 14 too many for most users, so there's no expected
 31456                                  ; space problem (it's just such a nice round number, eh?).
 31457                                  
 31458                                  MAXUMB	equ	16
 31459                                  
 31460                                  ; Memory elements owned by the system are marked as PSP address 8 in both the
 31461                                  ; USA and Japan; Japanese systems also use 9 under more bizzarre conditions.
 31462                                  
 31463                                  FreePSPOwner	equ	0	; Free MCBs all have an owner PSP address of 0
 31464                                  SystemPSPOwner	equ	8
 31465                                  ;JapanPSPOwner	equ	9
 31466                                  
 31467                                  ; for LoadHigh and DeviceHigh:
 31468                                  ;
 31469                                  ;	fInHigh - Is set to 1 during HideUMBs(), and back to zero in
 31470                                  ;	          UnHideUMBs().
 31471                                  ;	fUmbTiny - Is set to 1 iff the user has specified /S on the command-
 31472                                  ;	           line.
 31473                                  ;	SegLoad - Segment address for first UMB specified; set automatically.
 31474                                  ;	UmbLoad - The load UMB number; for example, this is 3 if the user has
 31475                                  ;	          given a command-line like "/L:3,500;4"
 31476                                  ;	UmbUsed - An array of characters, each of which is 1 iff the UMB
 31477                                  ;	          matching its index number was specified on the command-line;
 31478                                  ;	          for example, after "/L:3,500;4;7", UmbUsed[3], [4] and [7]
 31479                                  ;	          will be set to 1.  All others will be set to 0.
 31480                                  ;	UmbSize - An array of words, each of which is interpereted as a size
 31481                                  ;	          specified by the user for a UMB (in the above example, all
 31482                                  ;	          elements would be zero save UmbSize[3], which would be 500.
 31483                                  ;	fm_umb - Set to the old UMB link-state (0x80 or 0x00)
 31484                                  ;	fm_strat - Set to the old memory-allocation strategy (0$00000???)
 31485                                  ;	fm_argc  - Number of arguments received by ParseVar() (see ParseVar()
 31486                                  ;	           for details).
 31487                                  
 31488 00001F15 00                      fInHigh:  db	0
 31489 00001F16 00                      fUmbTiny: db	0
 31490 00001F17 0000                    SegLoad:  dw	0
 31491 00001F19 00                      UmbLoad:  db	0
 31492 00001F1A 00<rep 10h>             UmbUsed:  times MAXUMB db 0 ; times 16 db 0  ; db 16 dup(?)
 31493 00001F2A 0000<rep 10h>           UmbSize:  times MAXUMB dw 0 ; times 16 dw 0  ; dw 16 dup(?)
 31494 00001F4A 00                      fm_umb:   db	0
 31495 00001F4B 00                      fm_strat: db	0
 31496 00001F4C 00                      fm_argc:  db	0	
 31497                                  
 31498                                  ; UmbLoad is set to UNSPECIFED, below, until /L:umb is read; at which point
 31499                                  ; UmbLoad is set to the UMB number given.
 31500                                  
 31501                                  UNSPECIFIED	equ	-1
 31502                                  
 31503                                  ;%endif ; 27/10/2022

 31631                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 31632                                  ;
 31633                                  ;  The size of the CONFIG.SYS workspace (for recreating the in-memory
 31634                                  ;  CONFIG.SYS image, and later for building the initial environment) need
 31635                                  ;  not be any larger than CONFIG.SYS itself, EXCEPT for the fact that
 31636                                  ;  we (may) add a variable to the environment that does not explicity appear
 31637                                  ;  in CONFIG.SYS, and that variable is CONFIG (as in CONFIG=COMMON).
 31638                                  ;  The default setting for CONFIG cannot result in more than 1 paragraph
 31639                                  ;  of extra space, so here we account for it (the worst case of course is
 31640                                  ;  when CONFIG.SYS is some very small size, like 0 -JTP)
 31641                                  ;

 31823                                  ;   sysinit converts the SHELL= keyword to an 'S', so it expects to find an 'S'

 31826                                  ;   spot.

 32032                                  ;******************************************************************************
 32033                                  ;									      *
 32034                                  ; function: parse the parameters of buffers= command.			      *
 32035                                  ;									      *
 32036                                  ; input :								      *
 32037                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 32038                                  ; output:								      *
 32039                                  ;	buffers set							      *
 32040                                  ;	buffer_slash_x	flag set if /x option chosen.			      *
 32041                                  ;	h_buffers set if secondary buffer cache specified.		      *
 32042                                  ;									      *
 32043                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 32044                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 32045                                  ; logic:								      *
 32046                                  ; {									      *
 32047                                  ;	set di points to buf_parms;  /*parse control definition*/	      *
 32048                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 32049                                  ;	reset buffer_slash_x;						      *
 32050                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 32051                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 32052                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 32053                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_synonym_ptr == slash_e) then /*not a switch *
 32054                                  ;		    buffer_slash_x = 1					      *
 32055                                  ;	       else if	 (cx == 1) then 	    /* first positional */    *
 32056                                  ;			  buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val;		      *
 32057                                  ;		    else  h_buffers = result_val._$P_picked_val; 	      *
 32058                                  ;	  else	{show error message;error exit} 			      *
 32059                                  ;	};								      *
 32060                                  ;	if (buffer_slash_x is off & buffers > 99) then show_error;	      *
 32061                                  ; };									      *
 32062                                  ;									      *

 32166                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32167                                  
 32168                                  ;****************************************************************************
 32169                                  ;									    *
 32170                                  ; function: parse the parameters of break = command.			    *
 32171                                  ;									    *
 32172                                  ; input :								    *
 32173                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				    *
 32174                                  ; output:								    *
 32175                                  ;	turn the control-c check on or off.				    *
 32176                                  ;									    *
 32177                                  ; subroutines to be called:						    *
 32178                                  ;	sysinit_parse							    *
 32179                                  ; logic:								    *
 32180                                  ; {									    *
 32181                                  ;	set di to brk_parms;						    *
 32182                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						    *
 32183                                  ;	while (end of command line)					    *
 32184                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						    *
 32185                                  ;	  if (no error) then						    *
 32186                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_item_tag == 1) then	  /*on		 */ *
 32187                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,on;					    *
 32188                                  ;	       else					  /*off 	 */ *
 32189                                  ;		   set p_ctrl_break,off;				    *
 32190                                  ;	  else {show message;error_exit};				    *
 32191                                  ;	};								    *
 32192                                  ;	if (no error) then						    *
 32193                                  ;	   dos function call to set ctrl_break check according to	    *
 32194                                  ; };									    *
 32195                                  ;									    *
 32196                                  ;****************************************************************************
 32197

 32207                                  ;%if 0
 32208                                  ;ifdef	MULTI_CONFIG
 32209 000021AC E8CC1D                  	call	query_user              ; query the user if config_cmd
 32210 000021AF 7233                    	jc	short trym		; has the CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY bit set
 32211                                  ;endif

 32263                                  ; multitrack command
 32264                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 32265                                  
 32266                                  ;******************************************************************************
 32267                                  ;									      *
 32268                                  ; function: parse the parameters of multitrack= command.		      *
 32269                                  ;									      *
 32270                                  ; input :								      *
 32271                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				      *
 32272                                  ; output:								      *
 32273                                  ;	turn multrk_flag on or off.					      *
 32274                                  ;									      *
 32275                                  ; subroutines to be called:						      *
 32276                                  ;	sysinit_parse							      *
 32277                                  ; logic:								      *
 32278                                  ; {									      *
 32279                                  ;	set di to brk_parms;						      *
 32280                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						      *
 32281                                  ;	while (end of command line)					      *
 32282                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						      *
 32283                                  ;	  if (no error) then						      *
 32284                                  ;	       if (result_val._$P_item_tag == 1) then	  /*on		 */   *
 32285                                  ;		   set p_mtrk,on;					      *
 32286                                  ;	       else					  /*off 	 */   *
 32287                                  ;		   set p_mtrk,off;					      *
 32288                                  ;	  else {show message;error_exit};				      *
 32289                                  ;	};								      *
 32290                                  ;	if (no error) then						      *
 32291                                  ;	   dos function call to set multrk_flag according to p_mtrk.	      *
 32292                                  ;									      *
 32293                                  ; };									      *
 32294                                  ;									      *
 32295                                  ;******************************************************************************

 33768                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33769                                  ; setting internal stack parameters
 33770                                  ; stacks=m,n where
 33771                                  ;	m is the number of stacks (range 8 to 64,default 9)
 33772                                  ;	n is the stack size (range 32 to 512 bytes,default 128)
 33773                                  ; j.k. 5/5/86: stacks=0,0 implies no stack installation.
 33774                                  ;	any combinations that are not within the specified limits will
 33775                                  ;	result in "unrecognized command" error.
 33776                                  ;--------------------------------------------------------------------------
 33777                                  
 33778                                  ;**************************************************************************
 33779                                  ;									  *
 33780                                  ; function: parse the parameters of stacks= command.			  *
 33781                                  ;	    the minimum value for "number of stacks" and "stack size" is  *
 33782                                  ;	    8 and 32 each.  in the definition of sysparse value list,they *
 33783                                  ;	    are set to 0.  this is for accepting the exceptional case of  *
 33784                                  ;	    stacks=0,0 case (,which means do not install the stack.)	  *
 33785                                  ;	    so,after sysparse is done,we have to check if the entered	  *
 33786                                  ;	    values (stack_count,stack_size) are within the actual range,  *
 33787                                  ;	    (or if "0,0" pair has been entered.)			  *
 33788                                  ; input :								  *
 33789                                  ;	es:si -> parameters in command line.				  *
 33790                                  ; output:								  *
 33791                                  ;	set the variables stack_count,stack_size.			  *
 33792                                  ;									  *
 33793                                  ; subroutines to be called:						  *
 33794                                  ;	sysinit_parse							  *
 33795                                  ; logic:								  *
 33796                                  ; {									  *
 33797                                  ;	set di points to stks_parms;					  *
 33798                                  ;	set dx,cx to 0; 						  *
 33799                                  ;	while (end of command line)					  *
 33800                                  ;	{ sysinit_parse;						  *
 33801                                  ;	  if (no error) then						  *
 33802                                  ;	     { if (cx == 1) then /* first positional = stack count */	  *
 33803                                  ;		   p_stack_count = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 33804                                  ;	       if (cx == 2) then /* second positional = stack size */	  *
 33805                                  ;		   p_stack_size = result_val._$P_picked_val;		  *
 33806                                  ;	     }								  *
 33807                                  ;	  else	/*error exit*/						  *
 33808                                  ;	     error exit;						  *
 33809                                  ;	};								  *
 33810                                  ;	here check p_stack_count,p_stack_size if it meets the condition;  *
 33811                                  ;	if o.k.,then set stack_count,stack_size;			  *
 33812                                  ;	 else error_exit;						  *
 33813                                  ; };									  *
 33814                                  ;**************************************************************************

 34620                                  sysinit_parse:
 34621                                  
 34622                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34623                                  ;set up registers for sysparse
 34624                                  ;in)	es:si -> command line in confbot
 34625                                  ;	di -> offset of the parse control definition.
 34626                                  ;
 34627                                  ;out)	calls sysparse.
 34628                                  ;	carry will set if parse error.
 34629                                  ;	*** the caller should check the eol condition by looking at ax
 34630                                  ;	*** after each call.
 34631                                  ;	*** if no parameters are found,then ax will contain a error code.
 34632                                  ;	*** if the caller needs to look at the synomym@ of the result,
 34633                                  ;	***  the caller should use cs:@ instead of es:@.
 34634                                  ;	cx register should be set to 0 at the first time the caller calls this
 34635                                  ;	 procedure.
 34636                                  ;	ax - exit code
 34637                                  ;	bl - terminated delimeter code
 34638                                  ;	cx - new positional ordinal
 34639                                  ;	si - set to pase scanned operand
 34640                                  ;	dx - selected result buffer
 34641                                  ;------------------------------------------------------------------------------
 34642                                  
 34643                                  	; 03/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 34644                                  	; (SYSINIT:2D78h)
 34645                                  
 34646                                  	; 14/04/2024 - Retro DOS v5.0
 34647                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:32F3h)
 34648                                  
 34649                                  	; 09/09/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (Optimization)

 34989                                  ; procedure : LieInt12Mem
 34990                                  ;
 34991                                  ;	Input : DevEntry points to Device Start address (offset == 0)
 34992                                  ;		alloclim set to the limit of low memory.
 34993                                  ;
 34994                                  ;	Output : none
 34995                                  ;
 34996                                  ;	Changes the ROM BIOS variable which stores the total low memory
 34997                                  ;	If a 3com device driver (any character device with name 'PROTMAN$')
 34998                                  ;	is being loaded alloclim is converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 34999                                  ;	Else if a device driver being loaded into UMB the DevLoadEnd is
 35000                                  ;	converted into Ks and stored in 40:13h
 35001                                  ;
 35002                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35003                                  
 35004                                  LieInt12Mem:
 35005                                  	; 11/12/2022
 35006                                  	; ds = cs

 35009                                  					; assuming that it is 3Com
 35010 000028D0 E84200                  	call	IsIt3Com		; Is it 3Com driver?
 35011 000028D3 740A                    	jz	short lim_set		; yes, lie to him differently
 35012                                  	; 13/05/2019
 35013                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:DeviceHi],0	; Is the DD being loaded in UMB
 35014                                  	;je	short limx		; no, don't lie
 35015                                  	;mov	ax,[cs:DevLoadEnd]	; lie INT 12 as end of UMB
 35016                                  	; 11/12/2022
 35017                                  	; ds = cs
 35018 000028D5 803E[6B1F]00            	cmp	byte [DeviceHi],0
 35019 000028DA 74F0                    	je	short limx
 35020 000028DC A1[511F]                	mov	ax,[DevLoadEnd]
 35021                                  lim_set:
 35022                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 35023                                  	; 11/12/2022
 35024                                  	;call	SetInt12Mem
 35025                                  ;limx:
 35026                                  	;retn
 35027                                  	
 35028                                  	;jmp	short SetInt12Mem 
 35029                                  
 35030                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35031                                  ;
 35032                                  ; procedure : SetInt12Mem
 35033                                  ;
 35034                                  ;	Input : AX = Memory size to be set (in paras)
 35035                                  ;	Output : none
 35036                                  ;
 35037                                  ;	Sets the variable 40:13 to the memory size passed in AX
 35038                                  ;	It saves the old value in 40:13 in OldInt12Mem,
 35039                                  ;	It also sets a flag Int12Lied to 0ffh, which is checked before
 35040                                  ;	restoring the value of 40:13
 35041                                  ;
 35042                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35043                                  
 35044                                  	; 01/11/2022
 35045                                  SetInt12Mem:
 35046 000028DF 1E                      	push	ds
 35047 000028E0 BB4000                  	mov	bx,40h
 35048 000028E3 8EDB                    	mov	ds,bx			; ROM BIOS Data Segment
 35049 000028E5 8B1E1300                	mov	bx,[13h]		; INT 12 memory variable
 35050                                  	;mov	[cs:OldInt12Mem],bx	; save it
 35051 000028E9 B106                    	mov	cl,6
 35052 000028EB D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl			; convert paras into Ks
 35053 000028ED A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; Lie
 35054                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0FFh ; mark that we are lying
 35055 000028F0 1F                      	pop	ds
 35056                                  	; 14/04/2024
 35057                                  	; ds = cs
 35058 000028F1 891E[6F1F]              	mov	[OldInt12Mem],bx
 35059 000028F5 C606[6E1F]FF            	mov	byte [Int12Lied],0FFh
 35060                                  ;limx:
 35061 000028FA C3                      	retn
 35062                                  
 35063                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35064                                  ;
 35065                                  ; procedure : TrueInt12Mem
 35066                                  ;
 35067                                  ;	Input : Int12Lied = 0 if we are not lying currently
 35068                                  ;			  = 0ffh if we are lying
 35069                                  ;		OldInt12Mem = Saved value of 40:13h
 35070                                  ;
 35071                                  ;	Output : none
 35072                                  ;
 35073                                  ;	Resets the INT 12 Memory variable if we were lying about int 12
 35074                                  ;	and resets the flag which indicates that we were lying
 35075                                  ;
 35076                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35077                                  
 35078                                  TrueInt12Mem:
 35079                                  	; 11/12/2022
 35080                                  	; ds = cs
 35081 000028FB 803E[6E1F]00            	cmp	byte [Int12Lied],0
 35082                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; were we lying so far?
 35083                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS, SYS.INIT:2B1Dh)
 35084                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0	; reset it anyway
 35085 00002900 7412                    	je	short timx		; no, we weren't
 35086                                  	; 18/12/2022
 35087 00002902 B84000                  	mov	ax,40h
 35088 00002905 8826[6E1F]              	mov	[Int12Lied],ah ; 0
 35089                                  	;mov	byte [Int12Lied],0
 35090                                  	;mov	byte [cs:Int12Lied],0
 35091 00002909 1E                      	push	ds
 35092                                  	;mov	ax,40h
 35093 0000290A 8ED8                    	mov	ds,ax
 35094 0000290C 2EA1[6F1F]              	mov	ax,[cs:OldInt12Mem]
 35095 00002910 A31300                  	mov	[13h],ax		; restore INT 12 memory
 35096 00002913 1F                      	pop	ds
 35097                                  timx:
 35098 00002914 C3                      	retn

 35151                                  ; 31/12/2022 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 35152                                  ; (SYSINIT:2EEEh)
 35153                                  
 35154                                  ;include highload.inc	; Routines for devicehigh parsing, control of HIDDEN
 35155                                  ;include highexit.inc	; umb's, etc
 35156                                  
 35157                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 35158                                  ; HIGHLOAD.INC (MSDOS 6.0 - 1991) 	
 35159                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 35160                                  ; 07/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35161                                  
 35162                                  ;******************************************************************************
 35163                                  ;
 35164                                  ; This file contains routines needed to parse and implement user-given
 35165                                  ; command-line options of the form "/S/L:3,0x500;2;7,127;0x0BE4". InitVar()
 35166                                  ; and Parsevar() are used to parse this data and place it in encoded form into
 35167                                  ; the variables in highvar.inc, for use by the rest of the routines.
 35168                                  ;
 35169                                  ; DeviceHigh accepts this command-line (handled in sysconf.asm, not here):
 35170                                  ;    DEVICEHIGH SIZE=hhhhhh module opts
 35171                                  ; Or, DeviceHigh and LoadHigh accept any of the following:
 35172                                  ;    DH/LH module opts
 35173                                  ;    DH/LH [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] module opts
 35174                                  ;    DH/LH [/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*][/S] module opts
 35175                                  ; The initial UMB,SIZE pair designates the module's load address; the remainder
 35176                                  ; of the UMB and SIZE pairs are used to indicate specific UMBs to be left
 35177                                  ; available during the load.
 35178                                  ;
 35179                                  ; When an actual load is ready to be performed, a call to HideUMBs() will
 35180                                  ; temporarily allocate (as owner 8+"HIDDEN  ") all free elements in any
 35181                                  ; upper-memory block which was not specified by the user... in addition, if
 35182                                  ; UMBs were marked to shrink (/S option) to a certain size ("umb,size"), any
 35183                                  ; elements in that umb SAVE the lower-half of the newly-shrunken one are also
 35184                                  ; allocated. After the load, the function UnHideUMBs() (in highexit.inc) will
 35185                                  ; free any UMBs so allocated.
 35186                                  ;
 35187                                  ; When a device driver loads, there is the additional problem of allocating its
 35188                                  ; initial load site; this should be restricted to the first UMB specified on
 35189                                  ; the command-line. The function FreezeUM temporarily allocates all remaining
 35190                                  ; free upper-memory elements (as owner 8+"FROZEN  "), except those in the load
 35191                                  ; UMB. Then the initial allocation may be made, and a call to UnFreeze will
 35192                                  ; return any so-allocated memory elements to FREE, for the true load. Note
 35193                                  ; that UnFreeze leaves HIDDEN elements allocated; it only frees FROZEN ones.
 35194                                  ;
 35195                                  ;******************************************************************************
 35196                                  
 35197                                  SWTCH	equ	'/'		; Switch character
 35198                                  
 35199                                  DOS_CHECK_STRATEGY  equ	5800h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 0 = check alloc strat
 35200                                  DOS_SET_STRATEGY    equ	5801h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 1 = set alloc strategy
 35201                                  DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK   equ	5802h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 2 = check link state
 35202                                  DOS_GET_UMBLINK	    equ 5802h ; 20/04/2019
 35203                                  DOS_SET_UMBLINK     equ	5803h	; Int 21h, Func 58h, Svc 3 = set link state
 35204                                  DOS_GET_DOS_LISTS   equ	  52h	; Int 21h, Func 52h = return list of lists
 35205                                  DOS_UMB_HEAD        equ	  8Ch	; Offset from ES (after func52h) to get UMBHead
 35206                                  
 35207                                  CR	equ	0Dh		; Carriage Return
 35208                                  LF	equ	0Ah		; Line Feed
 35209                                  TAB	equ	09h		; Tab character (^I)
 35210                                  
 35211                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35212                                  ;*** InitVar - initializes all the variables used in ParseVar and HideUMBs
 35213                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35214                                  ; ENTRY:       None
 35215                                  ; EXIT:        Variables listed in highvar.inc are initialized
 35216                                  ; ERROR EXIT:  None
 35217                                  ; USES:        Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 35218                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35219                                  ; Note that element 0 references UMB 0 (conventional), not UMB 1. Its contents
 35220                                  ; are largely ignored, but it is initialized nonetheless.
 35221                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35222                                  
 35223                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
