 35281                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35282                                  ;*** FixMem - scans the upper memory chain and concatenates adjacent free MCBs
 35283                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35284                                  ; ENTRY   : None
 35285                                  ; EXIT    : None
 35286                                  ; ERROR   : None
 35287                                  ; USES    : Flags, fm_umb, fm_strat
 35288                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35289                                  
 35290                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 35291                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F22h)
 35292                                  FixMem:
 35293                                  	; 01/01/2023
 35294                                  	;push	ax
 35295                                  	;push	bx
 35296                                  	;push	cx
 35297                                  	;push	dx
 35298 00002967 06                      	push	es
 35299                                  
 35300 00002968 E84900                  	call	fm_link		; Link in UMBs
 35301                                  
 35302 0000296B E80002                  	call	UmbHead		; Get first upper-memory MCB address (0x9FFF)
 35303 0000296E 723F                    	jc	short fmX	; (if couldn't get it, leave now).
 35304                                  
 35305 00002970 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax		; It returns in AX, so move it to ES.
 35306                                  
 35307                                  ; - Walk MCB Chain ------------------------------------------------------------
 35308                                  
 35309 00002972 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx		; We're keeping the address of the last MCB
 35310 00002974 89D1                    	mov 	cx,dx		; in CX... and the last owner
 35311 00002976 42                      	inc	dx		; in dx as we go through the loop:
 35312                                  
 35313                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 35314                                  ; FM10--DX  = last MCB's owner's PSP address
 35315                                  ;       CX  = last MCB's address (segment)
 35316                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 35317                                  
 35318 00002977 26A00000                fm10:	mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE] ; if 'Z', don't repeat loop
 35319 0000297B 268B1E0100              	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; if not zero, do nothing
 35320 00002980 09D3                    	or	bx,dx			; dx was owner of previous MCB
 35321 00002982 7516                    	jnz	short fm30		; If not both zero, don't cat.
 35322                                  
 35323                                  	; - Coalesce memory blocks at ES:00 and CX:00 -------------------------
 35324                                  
 35325 00002984 268B1E0300              fm20:	mov	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Grab this block's Size,
 35326 00002989 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx			; Go back to prev MCB's address
 35327 0000298B 26A20000                	mov	[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],al ; & move the SECOND sig here
 35328                                  
 35329 0000298F 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]	; Size += first MCB's size
 35330                                  	;add	bx,1			; And add one for the header
 35331                                  	; 11/07/2023
 35332 00002994 43                      	inc	bx
 35333 00002995 26891E0300              	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],bx	; Write the size
 35334                                  
 35335                                  	; ---------------------------------------------------------------------
 35336                                  
 35337 0000299A 8CC1                    fm30:	mov	cx,es			; Put this address on the stack
 35338 0000299C 268B160100              	mov	dx,[es:ARENA.OWNER]	; And remember its owner
 35339                                  
 35340 000029A1 8CC3                    	mov	bx,es			; Move to the next MCB
 35341 000029A3 26031E0300              	add	bx,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 35342 000029A8 43                      	inc	bx
 35343 000029A9 8EC3                    	mov	es,bx
 35344                                  
 35345                                  	;cmp	al,'Z'
 35346 000029AB 3C5A                    	cmp	al,arena_signature_end
 35347 000029AD 75C8                    	jne	short fm10		; If signature != 'Z', there are more.
 35348                                  fmX:	
 35349 000029AF E81300                  	call	fm_unlink		; Unlink UMBs
 35350                                  
 35351 000029B2 07                      	pop	es
 35352                                  	; 01/01/2023
 35353                                  	;pop	dx
 35354                                  	;pop	cx
 35355                                  	;pop	bx
 35356                                  	;pop	ax
 35357                                  
 35358 000029B3 C3                      	retn
 35359                                  
 35360                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35361                                  ;*** fm_link - links UMBs not already linked in
 35362                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35363                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 35364                                  ; EXIT:     fm_umb == 0 if not linked in previously, 1 if already linked in
 35365                                  ; ERROR:    None
 35366                                  ; USES:     AX, BX, fm_umb
 35367                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35368                                  
 35369                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 35370                                  fm_link:
 35371 000029B4 B80258                  	mov	ax,DOS_CHECK_UMBLINK ; 5802h
 35372 000029B7 CD21                    	int	21h			; Current link-state is now in al
 35373                                  
 35374                                  	;putdata fm_umb,al		; So store it in fm_umb for later
 35375                                  	;
 35376                                  	;push	es
 35377                                  	;push	cs
 35378                                  	;pop	es
 35379                                  	;mov	[es:fm_umb],al
 35380                                  	;pop	es
 35381                                  	
 35382                                  	; 01/01/2023
 35383                                  	; ds = cs
 35384                                  	;mov	[cs:fm_umb],al
 35385 000029B9 A2[4A1F]                	mov	[fm_umb],al
 35386                                  
 35387 000029BC B80358                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 35388 000029BF BB0100                  	mov	bx,1
 35389 000029C2 CD21                    	int	21h
 35390 000029C4 C3                      	retn
 35391                                  
 35392                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35393                                  ;*** fm_unlink - unlinks UMBs if fm_umb is set to 0
 35394                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35395                                  ; ENTRY:    fm_umb == 1 : leave linked, else unlink
 35396                                  ; EXIT:     None
 35397                                  ; ERROR:    None
 35398                                  ; USES:     AX, BX
 35399                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35400                                  
 35401                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 35402                                  fm_unlink:
 35403 000029C5 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 35404                                  	
 35405                                  	;getdata bl,fm_umb		; fm_umb already has the old link-state
 35406                                  	;
 35407                                  	;push	ds
 35408                                  	;push	cs
 35409                                  	;pop	ds
 35410                                  	;mov	bl,[fm_umb]	
 35411                                  	;pop	ds
 35412                                  	
 35413                                  	; 01/01/2023
 35414                                  	; ds = cs
 35415                                  	;mov	bl,[cs:fm_umb]
 35416 000029C7 8A1E[4A1F]              	mov	bl,[fm_umb]
 35417                                  
 35418 000029CB B80358                  	mov	ax,DOS_SET_UMBLINK ; 5803h
 35419 000029CE CD21                    	int	21h			; so just use that, and call int 21h
 35420 000029D0 C3                      	retn
 35421                                  
 35422                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35423                                  
 35424                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35425                                  ;*** ParseVar - parses [/S][/L:umb[,size][;umb[,size]]*] and builds the table
 35426                                  ; laid out in highvar.inc
 35427                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35428                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to command tail of LoadHigh/DeviceHigh (whitespace ok)
 35429                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character in child program name
 35430                                  ; ERROR:    ES:SI points to character which caused error, carry set, AX == code
 35431                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, AX, flags, variables in highvar.inc
 35432                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35433                                  ; Error codes (in AX if carry set on return):
 35434                                  ;
 35435                                  PV_InvArg	equ	1	; Invalid argument passed
 35436                                  PV_BadUMB	equ	2	; Bad UMB number passed (duplicate?)
 35437                                  PV_InvSwt	equ	3	; Unrecognized switch passed
 35438                                  ;
 35439                                  ; This routine exects ES:SI to point to a string much like the following:
 35440                                  ;    "/S/L:1,200;2 module options"
 35441                                  ; Optionally, the string can begin with whitespace; neither /S nor /L is
 35442                                  ; required, though that's what this routine is supposed to parse.
 35443                                  ;
 35444                                  optS		equ	'S'	; /S
 35445                                  optL		equ	'L'	; /L:...
 35446                                  ;
 35447                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35448                                  ; LoadHigh has a list of arguments, returned by cparse, which is used to create
 35449                                  ; a command-line for spawning a child process. For a typical LH command, say,
 35450                                  ;     lh /l:1,1000;2 print/d:lpt2
 35451                                  ; the arguments would look like (one per line):
 35452                                  ;     lh
 35453                                  ;     /l
 35454                                  ;     1
 35455                                  ;     1000
 35456                                  ;     2
 35457                                  ;     print
 35458                                  ;     /d
 35459                                  ;     :lpt2
 35460                                  ; In short, if "print" were, say, "43", there'd be no way to determine which
 35461                                  ; arg was the filename. So, inside this routine, we keep a running counter
 35462                                  ; of the number of arguments LH will need to skip in order to get to the
 35463                                  ; program name. The "lh" is implicit--it'll always have to skip that. So if
 35464                                  ; there's no "/l" or "/s", fm_argc will be 0 ... other than that, 1 is added
 35465                                  ; for:
 35466                                  ;    Each /L
 35467                                  ;    Each /S (there should be only one)
 35468                                  ;    Each UMB number (they follow ":" or ";")
 35469                                  ;    Each UMB size   (they follow ",")
 35470                                  ; So, in the above example, fm_argc would be 4-- and LH would skip right to
 35471                                  ; "print".  Note that InitVar initializes fm_argc to zero.
 35472                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35473                                  
 35474                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 35475                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F9Fh)
 35476                                  
 35477                                  ParseVar:
 35478                                  	;pushreg <di, ds, es>
 35479                                  	; 01/01/2023
 35480                                  	;push	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 35481 000029D1 1E                      	push	ds
 35482 000029D2 06                      	push	es
 35483                                  
 35484 000029D3 06                      	push	es		; Make DS:SI point to it, as well as ES:SI
 35485 000029D4 1F                      	pop	ds		; (regardless if we're in devhigh or loadhigh)
 35486 000029D5 FC                      	cld
 35487                                  
 35488                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 35489                                  ; PV10--ES:SI = any whitespace on the command-line
 35490                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 35491                                  
 35492 000029D6 AC                      pv10:	lodsb			; here, ES:SI=="  /L..."--must eat whitespace
 35493 000029D7 E8A200                  	call	isWhite
 35494 000029DA 74FA                    	jz	short pv10	;       ES:SI==" /L..."--keep eating.
 35495                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 35496 000029DC 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH
 35497 000029DE 7404                    	je	short pv20	;       ES:SI=="/L..."--go process a switch
 35498                                  
 35499 000029E0 4E                      	dec	si		; Backup--it's now "odule options", and we need
 35500 000029E1 F8                      	clc			; that "m" we just read (or whatever it is).
 35501 000029E2 EB2B                    	jmp	short pvX	; Then return with carry clear == we're done.
 35502                                  
 35503 000029E4 AC                      pv20:	lodsb			; Just read 'S' or 'L', hopefully
 35504                                  	;toUpper al		; So we make it upper-case, and...
 35505 000029E5 24DF                    	and	al,0DFh
 35506                                  	;cmp	al,'S'
 35507 000029E7 3C53                    	cmp	al,optS		; just read 'S'?
 35508 000029E9 750D                    	jne	short pv30
 35509                                  
 35510                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /S, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 35511 000029EB 2EFE06[4C1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 35512                                  
 35513                                  	;putdata fUmbTiny,1	; /S, so ES:SI=="  /L..." or " module opts", or
 35514                                  	;
 35515                                  	;push	es
 35516                                  	;push	cs
 35517                                  	;pop	es
 35518                                  	;mov	[es:fUmbTiny],1	
 35519                                  	;pop	es
 35520                                  
 35521 000029F0 2EC606[161F]01          	mov	byte [cs:fUmbTiny],1
 35522                                  
 35523 000029F6 EBDE                    	jmp	short pv10	; possibly even "/L...".
 35524                                  
 35525                                  pv30:	;cmp	al,'L'
 35526 000029F8 3C4C                    	cmp	al,optL		; If it's not 'L' either, then 'tis a bad
 35527 000029FA 750D                    	jne	short pvE1		; switch!
 35528                                  
 35529                                  	;call	incArgc		; If it's /L, it's another arg for LH to skip.
 35530 000029FC 2EFE06[4C1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 19/04/2019
 35531                                  
 35532 00002A01 E80E00                  	call	parseL
 35533 00002A04 73D0                    	jnc	short pv10	; If no carry, go back and look for more
 35534                                  
 35535 00002A06 4E                      	dec	si		; Else, back up and exit.
 35536 00002A07 EB03                    	jmp	short pvErr	; AX has already been set by parseL
 35537                                  
 35538                                  pvE1:	;mov	ax,3
 35539 00002A09 B80300                  	mov	ax,PV_InvSwt	; Unrecognized switch passed
 35540 00002A0C 4E                      pvErr:	dec	si
 35541 00002A0D 4E                      	dec	si
 35542 00002A0E F9                      	stc
 35543                                  pvX:	;popreg	<es, ds, di>
 35544 00002A0F 07                      	pop	es
 35545 00002A10 1F                      	pop	ds
 35546                                  	; 01/01/2023
 35547                                  	;pop	di ; * ; (not required) ; 01/01/2023
 35548 00002A11 C3                      	retn
 35549                                  
 35550                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35551                                  ;*** parseL - parses ":nnnn[,nnnn][;nnnn[,nnnn]]*" for ParseVar
 35552                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35553                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to colon
 35554                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI points to first character not parsed
 35555                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set; rewind three characters and return (see ParseVar)
 35556                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, flags, AX, CX, DX, variables in highvar.inc
 35557                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35558                                  ; If the string here is terminated with anything other than whitespace or a
 35559                                  ; switchchar (perhaps it's /S or another /L:... ), then we return with carry
 35560                                  ; set, indicating that they've screwed up the syntax.  The 3-character rewind
 35561                                  ; makes sure the app /L: is reported as being the culprit.
 35562                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35563                                  
 35564                                  parseL:
 35565 00002A12 AC                      	lodsb
 35566 00002A13 3C3A                    	cmp	al,':'		; Make sure they did /L:
 35567 00002A15 754E                    	jne	short plE1	; If they didn't, return with carry set.
 35568                                  
 35569                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 35570                                  ; PL10--ES:SI = a UMB number, after /L: or ;
 35571                                  ; ------------------------------------------
 35572                                  
 35573 00002A17 E8DB00                  pl10:	call	GetXNum		; After this, 'tis ",size" or ";umb" or " mod"
 35574 00002A1A 724F                    	jc	short plE2	; And error if it's a bad number.
 35575 00002A1C E89D01                  	call	convUMB		; Convert any address to a UMB number
 35576                                  
 35577 00002A1F 88C1                    	mov	cl,al		; Remember the UMB number
 35578 00002A21 E87600                  	call	stowUMB		; Mark this UMB # as used;
 35579 00002A24 7245                    	jc	short plE2	; If it was already marked, it'll error
 35580                                  
 35581                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB number is another arg for LH to skip
 35582 00002A26 2EFE06[4C1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35583                                  
 35584 00002A2B AC                      	lodsb
 35585 00002A2C 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; Did "umb;" ?
 35586 00002A2E 74E7                    	je	short pl10	; Yep: go back and get another UMB.
 35587                                  
 35588 00002A30 E84900                  	call	isWhite		; Did "umb " ?
 35589 00002A33 743B                    	jz	short plX	; Yep: return (it'll go back to whitespace)
 35590                                  
 35591 00002A35 E83900                  	call	isEOL		; Did "umb" ?
 35592 00002A38 7435                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 35593                                  
 35594                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 35595 00002A3A 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH 	; Did "umb/" ? (as in, "/L:1,100;2/S")
 35596 00002A3C 7431                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, back up ES:SI one character and return
 35597                                  
 35598 00002A3E 3C2C                    	cmp	al,','		; Did "umb," ?
 35599 00002A40 7523                    	jne	short plE1	; Just what the heck DID they do? Return error.
 35600                                  
 35601                                  ; --- Read a size -------------------------------------------------------------
 35602                                  
 35603 00002A42 E8B000                  	call	GetXNum		; Stop on "size;" or "size " or anything else
 35604 00002A45 721E                    	jc	short plE1	; And error if it's a bad size.
 35605                                  
 35606 00002A47 E81601                  	call	toPara		; Convert from bytes to paragraphs
 35607                                  
 35608 00002A4A E8CE01                  	call	stowSiz		; CL still has the UMB number for this routine
 35609                                  
 35610                                  	;call	incArgc		; Each UMB size is another arg for LH to skip
 35611 00002A4D 2EFE06[4C1F]            	inc	byte [cs:fm_argc] ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35612                                  
 35613 00002A52 AC                      	lodsb
 35614 00002A53 3C3B                    	cmp	al,';'		; They did "umb,size;", so get another UMB.
 35615 00002A55 74C0                    	je	short pl10	;
 35616                                  
 35617 00002A57 E82200                  	call	isWhite		; Did it end with whitespace?
 35618 00002A5A 7414                    	jz	short plX	; If so, we're done here--go back.
 35619                                  
 35620 00002A5C E81200                  	call	isEOL		; Did they do "umb,size" and end??? (stupid)
 35621 00002A5F 740E                    	jz	short plSwX	; If so, backup and exit like everything's ok
 35622                                  
 35623                                  	;cmp	al,'/'
 35624 00002A61 3C2F                    	cmp	al,SWTCH	; Did they do "umb,size/" ?
 35625 00002A63 740A                    	je	short plSwX	; If so, again, we're done here.
 35626                                  plE1:	
 35627                                  	;mov	ax,1
 35628 00002A65 B80100                  	mov	ax,PV_InvArg	; If not, we don't know WHAT they did...
 35629 00002A68 4E                      	dec	si
 35630 00002A69 F9                      	stc
 35631 00002A6A C3                      	retn
 35632                                  
 35633                                  plE2:	;mov	ax,2
 35634 00002A6B B80200                  	mov	ax,PV_BadUMB	; In this case, they've specified a UMB twice
 35635                                  	; 12/12/2022
 35636                                  	; cf=1
 35637                                  	;stc
 35638 00002A6E C3                      	retn
 35639                                  plSwX:	
 35640 00002A6F 4E                      	dec	si		; If we hit a '/' character, back up one char
 35641                                  				; so the whitespace checker will see it too.
 35642                                  plX:	; 12/12/2022
 35643                                  	; cf=0
 35644                                  	;clc			; Then just return with carry clear, so
 35645 00002A70 C3                      	retn			; ParseVar will go about its business.
 35646                                  
 35647                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35648                                  ;*** incArgc - increments fm_argc, for use with LoadHigh command-line parsing
 35649                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35650                                  ; ENTRY:    None
 35651                                  ; EXIT:     None
 35652                                  ; ERROR:    None
 35653                                  ; USES:     fm_argc, flags
 35654                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35655                                  
 35656                                  ;incArgc:
 35657                                  	;push	ax
 35658                                  
 35659                                  	;;getdata al, fm_argc	; Obtain previous value of fm_argc,
 35660

 35672                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35673                                  ;*** isEOL - returns with ZF set if AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 35674                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35675                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 35676                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains CR or LF, or 0
 35677                                  ; ERROR:    None
 35678                                  ; USES:     ZF
 35679                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35680                                  
 35681                                  isEOL:
 35682 00002A71 3C00                    	cmp	al,0		; Null-terminator
 35683 00002A73 7406                    	je	short ieX
 35684 00002A75 3C0D                    	cmp	al,CR ; 0Dh	; Carriage Return
 35685 00002A77 7402                    	je	short ieX
 35686 00002A79 3C0A                    	cmp	al,LF ; 0Ah	; LineFeed
 35687                                  ieX:	
 35688 00002A7B C3                      	retn
 35689                                  
 35690                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35691                                  ;*** isWhite - returns with ZF set if AL contains whitespace (or "=")
 35692                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35693                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains character to test
 35694                                  ; EXIT:     ZF set iff AL contains space, tab, or equals
 35695                                  ; ERROR:    None
 35696                                  ; USES:     ZF
 35697                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35698                                  
 35699                                  isWhite:
 35700 00002A7C 3C20                    	cmp	al,' '		; Space
 35701 00002A7E 7406                    	je	short iwX
 35702 00002A80 3C3D                    	cmp	al,'='		; Equals (treat as whitespace)
 35703 00002A82 7402                    	je	short iwX
 35704 00002A84 3C09                    	cmp	al,tab ; 9	; Tab
 35705                                  iwX:	
 35706 00002A86 C3                      	retn

 35742                                  	;cmp	[cs:UmbLoad],al
 35743                                  	;;cmp	[es:UmbLoad],al
 35744 00002A93 7504                    	jne	short umu10

 35759                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35760                                  ;*** stowUMB - marks a given UMB as used, if it hasn't been so marked before
 35761                                  ;            -- accepts a UMB # in AL, and makes sure it hasn't yet been
 35762                                  ; listed in the /L:... chain. If it's the first one specified, it sets UmbLoad
 35763                                  ; to that UMB #... and in any case, it marks the UMB as specified.
 35764                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35765                                  ; ENTRY:    AL contains UMB number, as specified by the user
 35766                                  ; EXIT:     None
 35767                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if UMB # is less than 0 or >= MAXUMB (see highvar.inc)
 35768                                  ; USES:     AX, Flags, variables in highvar.inc
 35769                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35770                                  
 35771                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 35772                                  stowUMB:
 35773 00002A9A 3C10                    	cmp	al,MAXUMB ; 16
 35774 00002A9C 7202                    	jb	short su10
 35775 00002A9E F9                      	stc
 35776 00002A9F C3                      	retn			; Ooops-- UMB>=MAXUMB
 35777                                  su10:	
 35778                                  	; 01/01/2023
 35779                                  	;push	bx
 35780                                  	;push	di
 35781                                  	;push	si
 35782                                  	;push	ds
 35783                                  	;push	es
 35784                                  	;push	cs
 35785                                  	;pop	es
 35786                                  	;push	cs
 35787                                  	;pop	ds
 35788                                  
 35789                                  	; 01/01/2023
 35790                                  	; ds <> cs
 35791                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:UmbLoad],0FFh
 35792 00002AA0 2E803E[191F]FF          	cmp	byte [cs:UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED
 35793                                  				; If this, we haven't been here before
 35794 00002AA6 7504                    	jne	short su20
 35795 00002AA8 2EA2[191F]              	mov	[cs:UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 35796                                  
 35797                                  	;;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],0FFh
 35798                                  	;cmp	byte [UmbLoad],UNSPECIFIED ; If this, we haven't been here before
 35799                                  	;jne	short su20
 35800                                  	;mov	[UmbLoad],al	; So remember this UMB as the load UMB slot.
 35801                                  su20:	
 35802 00002AAC 08C0                    	or	al,al		; If they gave UMB 0, there's really nothing
 35803 00002AAE 740E                    	jz	short su30	; that we should do here.
 35804                                  
 35805                                  	;mov	bl,al
 35806                                  	;xor	bh,bh
 35807                                  	;mov	ax,1		; Now, AX = 1, and BX = UMB Number
 35808                                  	; 01/01/2023
 35809 00002AB0 30E4                    	xor	ah,ah
 35810 00002AB2 89C3                    	mov	bx,ax
 35811 00002AB4 B001                    	mov	al,1
 35812                                  
 35813                                  	;xchg	[es:bx+UmbUsed],al
 35814                                  	; 01/01/2023
 35815 00002AB6 2E8687[1A1F]            	xchg	[cs:bx+UmbUsed],al
 35816                                  
 35817                                  	;or	al,al		; If it was already 1, then al==1... and that
 35818                                  	;jz	short su30	; means an error.
 35819                                  	;
 35820                                  	;stc			; OOOPS!  This one's been used before.  :(
 35821                                  	
 35822                                  	; 01/01/2023
 35823 00002ABB 3C01                    	cmp	al,1
 35824 00002ABD F5                      	cmc 	; if al > 0 -> cf = 1
 35825                                  su30:	
 35826                                  	; 01/01/2023
 35827                                  	;pop	es
 35828                                  	;pop	ds
 35829                                  	;pop	si
 35830                                  	;pop	di
 35831                                  	;pop	bx
 35832 00002ABE C3                      	retn
 35833                                  
 35834                                  ; 08/09/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (Optimization)
 35835                                  %if 0

 35871                                  
 35872                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35873                                  ;*** toDigit - converts a character-digit to its binary counterpart
 35874                                  ;            -- verifies that CL contains a valid character-digit; if so, it
 35875                                  ; changes CL to its counterpart binary digit ((CL-'0') or (CL-'A'+10)).
 35876                                  ; A-F are considered valid iff gnradix is 16.
 35877                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35878                                  ; ENTRY:    CL contains a digit ('0' to '9' or, if gnradix==16, 'A' to 'F')
 35879                                  ; EXIT:     CL contains digit in binary (0 to 9 or, if gnradix==16, 0 to 15)
 35880                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set indicates invalid digit; carry clear indicates good digit
 35881                                  ; USES:     CL, Flags
 35882                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35883                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 35884                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 35885                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 35886                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35887                                  
 35888                                  gnradix:
 35889 00002ABF 0000                    	dw	0		; Must be a word--16x16 multiplication
 35890                                  
 35891                                  toDigit:
 35892 00002AC1 2E833E[BF2A]10          	cmp	word [cs:gnradix],16
 35893 00002AC7 751C                    	jne	short td20	; Don't check hex digits if radix isn't 16
 35894                                  
 35895                                  toDigit_hex:
 35896 00002AC9 80F961                  	cmp	cl,'a'	; 61h
 35897 00002ACC 7209                    	jb	short td10
 35898 00002ACE 80F966                  	cmp	cl,'f'	; 66h
 35899 00002AD1 7720                    	ja	short tdE	; Nothing valid above 'z' at all...
 35900 00002AD3 80E957                  	sub	cl,'a'-10 ; 57h	; Make 'a'==10 and return.
 35901                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 35902 00002AD6 C3                      	retn
 35903                                  td10:	
 35904 00002AD7 80F941                  	cmp	cl,'A'  ; 41h
 35905 00002ADA 7209                    	jb	short td20	; Below 'A'?  Not a letter...
 35906 00002ADC 80F946                  	cmp	cl,'F'	; 46h
 35907 00002ADF 7712                    	ja	short tdE	; Above 'F'?  Not a digit.
 35908 00002AE1 80E937                  	sub	cl,'A'-10 ; 37h	; Make 'A'==10 and return.
 35909                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 35910 00002AE4 C3                      	retn
 35911                                  toDigit_dec:
 35912                                  td20:	
 35913 00002AE5 80F930                  	cmp	cl,'0'		; If less than zero,
 35914                                  	;jb	short tdE	; Done.
 35915 00002AE8 720A                    	jb	short tdEr ; 08/04/2019
 35916 00002AEA 80F939                  	cmp	cl,'9'		; Or, if greater than nine,
 35917 00002AED 7704                    	ja	short tdE	; Done.
 35918 00002AEF 80E930                  	sub	cl,'0'	; 30h	; Okay--make '0'==0 and return.
 35919                                  	;clc			; <- CLC is implicit from last SUB
 35920 00002AF2 C3                      	retn
 35921                                  tdE:	
 35922 00002AF3 F9                      	stc
 35923                                  tdEr:		; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0	
 35924 00002AF4 C3                      	retn
 35925                                  
 35926                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35927                                  ;*** GetXNum - reads a 32-bit ASCII number at ES:SI and returns it in DX:AX
 35928                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35929                                  ; ENTRY:    ES:SI points to an ascii string to scan
 35930                                  ; EXIT:     ES:SI moved to first invalid digit, DX:AX contains value read
 35931                                  ; ERROR:    Carry set if # is too big, or has no digits (EOL possibly)
 35932                                  ; USES:     ES:SI, DX, AX, Flags, gnradix
 35933                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35934                                  ; If the string is preceeded with "0x", the value is read as hexadecimal; else,
 35935                                  ; as decimal. After a read, you may check the radix by examining gnradix--it
 35936                                  ; will be 10 or 16.
 35937                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 35938                                  
 35939                                  ; 08/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 35940                                  
 35941                                  ; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 35942                                  ; (SYSINIT:3109h)
 35943                                  
 35944                                  GetXNum:
 35945                                  	;pushreg <bx, cx, ds>
 35946                                  	; 01/01/2023
 35947                                  	;push	bx
 35948 00002AF5 51                      	push	cx ; *
 35949                                  	;push	ds
 35950                                  
 35951 00002AF6 FC                      	cld
 35952 00002AF7 31C0                    	xor	ax,ax
 35953 00002AF9 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 35954 00002AFB 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx
 35955 00002AFD 31D2                    	xor	dx,dx			; Start with 0 (makes sense)
 35956                                  
 35957 00002AFF 2EC706[BF2A]0A00        	mov	word [cs:gnradix],10	; And default to a radix of 10 (dec)
 35958                                  
 35959 00002B06 268A0C                  	mov	cl,[es:si]		; Now AX=0, BX=0, CH=0/CL=char, DX=0
 35960                                  	;call	toDigit
 35961 00002B09 E8D9FF                  	call	toDigit_dec
 35962                                  	;jc	short gxnE		; If it's not a digit, leave now.
 35963                                  	; 01/01/2023
 35964 00002B0C 7233                    	jc	short gxnX
 35965                                  
 35966 00002B0E 08C9                    	or	cl,cl
 35967 00002B10 7517                    	jnz	short gxn20		; Doesn't have '0x'
 35968 00002B12 268A4C01                	mov	cl,[es:si+1]
 35969 00002B16 80F978                  	cmp	cl,'x'			; Either 'x'...
 35970 00002B19 7405                    	je	short gxn10
 35971 00002B1B 80F958                  	cmp	cl,'X'			; ...or 'X' means it's hexadecimal
 35972 00002B1E 7509                    	jne	short gxn20
 35973                                  
 35974                                  gxn10:	
 35975 00002B20 2EC706[BF2A]1000        	mov	word [cs:gnradix], 16
 35976 00002B27 46                      	inc	si			; Since we read "0x", march over it.
 35977 00002B28 46                      	inc	si
 35978                                  
 35979                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 35980                                  ; GXN20--ES:SI = a digit in a number; if not, we're done
 35981                                  ;        DX:AX = current total
 35982                                  ;        BX    = 0
 35983                                  ;        CH    = 0
 35984                                  ; ------------------------------------------------------
 35985                                  
 35986                                  gxn20:	
 35987 00002B29 268A0C                  	mov	cl,[es:si]	; Now DX:AX=current total, CH=0/CL=char
 35988 00002B2C 46                      	inc	si
 35989                                  
 35990 00002B2D E891FF                  	call	toDigit		; Accepts only valid digits, A-F -> 10-16
 35991 00002B30 720D                    	jc	short gxnQ	; <- Ah... wasn't a digit. Stop.
 35992                                  
 35993 00002B32 E80E00                  	call	mul32		; Multiply DX:AX by gnradix
 35994 00002B35 720A                    	jc	short gxnX	; (if it's too big, error out)
 35995                                  
 35996 00002B37 01C8                    	add	ax,cx		; Add the digit
 35997 00002B39 11DA                    	adc	dx,bx		; (BX is 0!)--Adds 1 iff last add wrapped
 35998                                  	;jc	short gxnX	; If _that_ wrapped, it's too big.
 35999                                  	;jmp	short gxn20
 36000 00002B3B 73EC                    	jnc	short gxn20
 36001                                  gxnE:	
 36002                                  	;stc			; In this case, we need to set the carry
 36003 00002B3D EB02                    	jmp	short gxnX	; and leave--there were no digits given.
 36004                                  gxnQ:	
 36005 00002B3F 4E                      	dec	si		; Don't read in the offensive character.
 36006 00002B40 F8                      	clc			; And clear carry, so they know it's okay.
 36007                                  gxnX:	
 36008                                  	; 01/01/2023
 36009                                  	;pop	ds
 36010 00002B41 59                      	pop	cx ; *
 36011                                  	;pop	bx
 36012 00002B42 C3                      	retn
 36013                                  
 36014                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36015                                  ;*** mul32 - multiplies the number in DX:AX by gnradix
 36016                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36017                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be multiplied, BX = 0, gnradix = multiplier
 36018                                  ; EXIT:    DX:AX has been multiplied by gnradix if carry clear; BX still 0
 36019                                  ; ERROR:   Carry set if number was too large
 36020                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 36021                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36022                                  
 36023                                  mul32:
 36024 00002B43 50                      	push	ax		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 36025 00002B44 89D0                    	mov	ax,dx		; DX=old:hi, AX=old:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 36026 00002B46 2EF726[BF2A]            	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=?, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 36027 00002B4B 7211                    	jc	short m32E	; Too big?
 36028                                  
 36029 00002B4D 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:hi, TOS=old:lo, BX=0
 36030 00002B4F 58                      	pop	ax		; DX=new:hi, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 36031                                  
 36032 00002B50 87DA                    	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=0, AX=old:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 36033 00002B52 2EF726[BF2A]            	mul	word [cs:gnradix] ; DX=carry,  AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=new:hi
 36034 00002B57 87DA                    	xchg	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 36035 00002B59 01DA                    	add	dx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=carry
 36036 00002B5B 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx		; DX=new:hi, AX=new:lo, TOS=orig, BX=0
 36037 00002B5D C3                      	retn
 36038                                  m32E:	
 36039 00002B5E 58                      	pop	ax
 36040 00002B5F C3                      	retn
 36041                                  
 36042                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36043                                  ;*** toPara - divides DX:AX by 16; result in AX only (discards extra DX data)
 36044                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36045                                  ; ENTRY:   DX:AX = the number to be divided
 36046                                  ; EXIT:    Interpereting DX:AX as bytes, AX=paragraph equivalent, 0xFFFF max
 36047                                  ; ERROR:   None
 36048                                  ; USES:    Flags, AX, DX
 36049                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36050                                  ; Note: The 386 has a 32-bit SHR, which would work perfectly for this... but we
 36051                                  ;       can't ensure a 386 host machine. Sorry.
 36052                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36053                                  
 36054                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 36055                                  toPara:
 36056 00002B60 51                      	push	cx		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:LLLL llll llll llll
 36057                                  
 36058 00002B61 B104                    	mov	cl,4		;
 36059 00002B63 D3E8                    	shr	ax,cl		; DX:AX=HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh:0000 LLLL llll llll
 36060 00002B65 92                      	xchg	ax,dx		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:HHHH hhhh hhhh hhhh
 36061 00002B66 B10C                    	mov	cl,12
 36062 00002B68 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl		; DX:AX=0000 LLLL llll llll:hhhh 0000 0000 0000
 36063 00002B6A 09D0                    	or	ax,dx		;    AX=hhhh LLLL llll llll
 36064                                  
 36065 00002B6C 59                      	pop	cx
 36066 00002B6D C3                      	retn
 36067                                  
 36068                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36069                                  ;*** UmbHead - returns in AX the address of the first UMB block (0x9FFF)
 36070                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36071                                  ; ENTRY:  Nothing
 36072                                  ; EXIT:   AX contains 0x9FFF for most systems
 36073                                  ; ERROR:  Carry set if pointer is 0xFFFF (if not set up yet--DH runs into this)
 36074                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 36075                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36076                                  ; Early in the boot-cycle, the pointer used to obtain this value isn't set up;
 36077                                  ; to be precise, before a UMB provider is around. In this event, the pointer
 36078                                  ; is always set to 0xFFFF; it changes once a provider is around. On most
 36079                                  ; machines (all of 'em I've seen), it changes to 0x9FFF at that point.
 36080                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36081                                  
 36082                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 36083                                  UmbHead:
 36084                                  	; 13/05/2019 (because of callers, pushs & pops are not needed here)
 36085                                  
 36086                                  	;push	si ; ?
 36087                                  	;push	ds ; ? 
 36088                                  	;push	es
 36089                                  	;push	bx ; *	
 36090                                  
 36091                                  	; 09/04/2019
 36092                                  	; !!! No need to save es,bx,ds,si above !!! (es,bx are changed here)
 36093                                  
 36094 00002B6E B452                    	mov	ah,GET_IN_VARS		; Call int 21h, function 52h...
 36095 00002B70 CD21                    	int	21h
 36096                                  
 36097 00002B72 26A18C00                	mov	ax,[es:DOS_UMB_HEAD]	; And read what's in ES:[008C]
 36098                                  	
 36099                                  	; 01/01/2023
 36100 00002B76 83F8FF                  	cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 36101 00002B79 F5                      	cmc
 36102                                  	; if AX=0FFFFh -> CF=1
 36103 00002B7A C3                      	retn
 36104                                  
 36105                                  ; 01/01/2023
 36106                                  ;%if 0
 36107                                  ;	cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 36108                                  ;	je	short uhE		; If it's 0xFFFF, it's an error...
 36109                                  ;
 36110                                  ;	clc				; Else, it isn't (CLC done by prev cmp)
 36111                                  ;	;jmp	short uhX
 36112                                  ;	; 12/12/2022
 36113                                  ;	retn
 36114                                  ;uhE:	
 36115                                  ;	stc
 36116                                  ;uhX:

 36124                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36125                                  ;*** isSysMCB - sets ZF if ES points to an MCB owned by "SC" + (8 or 9)
 36126                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36127                                  ; ENTRY:  ES:0 should point to a valid MCB
 36128                                  ; EXIT:   ZF set if owned by SC+8 or SC+9 (for japan)
 36129                                  ; USES:   Flags
 36130                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36131                                  
 36132                                  isSysMCB:
 36133                                  	;push	ax
 36134

 36154                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36155                                  ;*** AddrToUmb - converts a segment address in AX to its appropriate UMB number
 36156                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36157                                  ; ENTRY:  AX contains a segment address
 36158                                  ; EXIT:   AX will contain the UMB number which contains the address (0==conv)
 36159                                  ; ERROR:  If the address is above UM Range, AX will return as FFFF.
 36160                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 36161                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36162                                  ; An address in the following areas is treated as:
 36163                                  ;    0      <-> umbhead (0x9FFF)          = Conventional memory
 36164                                  ;    0x9FFF <-> addr of first UM sys MCB  = UMB #1
 36165                                  ;      ...
 36166                                  ;    addr of last UM sys MCB <-> TOM      = invalid; returns #0xFFFF
 36167                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36168                                  
 36169                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 36170                                  AddrToUmb:
 36171                                  	; 01/01/2023
 36172                                  	;push	cx
 36173                                  	;push	dx
 36174 00002B8B 06                      	push	es
 36175                                  
 36176 00002B8C 89C2                    	mov	dx,ax		; DX = address to search for
 36177                                  
 36178 00002B8E E8DDFF                  	call	UmbHead		; AX = first segment
 36179 00002B91 7222                    	jc	short atuE	; If it couldn't get it, error out.
 36180                                  
 36181                                  	; 22/07/2023
 36182                                  	;mov	es,ax ; *	; ES = first UMB segment
 36183 00002B93 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx ; 0	; Pretend we're on UMB 0 for now... (cx = UMB#)
 36184                                  
 36185                                  	; 22/07/2023
 36186                                  atu10:
 36187 00002B95 8EC0                    	mov	es,ax ; * ; ** ; 22/07/2023
 36188                                  ; ----------------------------------------
 36189                                  ; ATU10--ES - Current MCB address
 36190                                  ;        DX - Address given for conversion
 36191                                  ;        CX - Current UMB #
 36192                                  ; ----------------------------------------
 36193                                  
 36194                                  ;atu10:	
 36195                                  	;mov	ax,es ; * ; 18/07/2023
 36196 00002B97 39D0                            cmp	ax,dx		; Present segment >= given segment?
 36197 00002B99 731D                    	jae	short atuX	; Yep--done.
 36198                                  
 36199 00002B9B E8DDFF                  	call	isSysMCB	; Returns with ZF set if this is a system MCB
 36200 00002B9E 7501                    	jnz	short atu20
 36201                                  
 36202 00002BA0 41                      	inc	cx		; If it _was_ a system MCB, we're in a new UMB.
 36203                                  atu20:	
 36204                                  	;mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 36205                                  	;cmp	al,arena_signature_end  ; 'Z'
 36206                                  	; 22/07/2023
 36207                                  	; ax = es
 36208                                  	;mov	ax,es ; **
 36209 00002BA1 2603060300              	add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 36210 00002BA6 26803E00005A            	cmp	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_end
 36211 00002BAC 7403                    	je	short atu30		; 'Z' means this was the last MCB... that's it.
 36212                                  
 36213                                  	;NextMCB es,ax
 36214                                  
 36215                                  	;mov	ax,es ; **
 36216                                  	;;add	ax,[es:3]
 36217                                  	;add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 36218 00002BAE 40                      	inc	ax
 36219                                  	; 22/07/2023
 36220                                  	;mov	es,ax ; *
 36221 00002BAF EBE4                    	jmp	short atu10
 36222                                  
 36223                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36224                                  ; if we get to atu30, they specified a number that was past the last MCB.
 36225                                  ; make sure it's not _inside_ that MCB before we return an error condition.
 36226                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36227                                  
 36228                                  atu30:	
 36229                                  	; 22/07/2023
 36230                                  	; ax = es + [es:ARENA.SIZE] 
 36231                                  	;mov	ax,es ; **
 36232                                  	;add	ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE] ; **
 36233 00002BB1 39D0                    	cmp	ax,dx		; Present >= given?
 36234 00002BB3 7303                    	jae	short atuX	; Yep! It _was_ inside.
 36235                                  atuE:	
 36236 00002BB5 31C9                    	xor	cx,cx ; 0	; Else, fall through with UMB # == -1
 36237 00002BB7 49                      	dec	cx		; (that makes it return 0xFFFF and sets CF)
 36238                                  atuX:	
 36239 00002BB8 89C8                    	mov	ax,cx		; Return the UMB number in AX
 36240                                  	
 36241 00002BBA 07                      	pop	es	
 36242                                  	; 01/01/2023
 36243                                  	;pop	dx
 36244                                  	;pop	cx
 36245 00002BBB C3                      	retn
 36246                                  
 36247                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36248                                  ;*** convUMB - checks after GetXNum to convert an address to a UMB number
 36249                                  ;            -- if GetXNum read a hex number, we interperete that as a segment
 36250                                  ; address rather than a UMB number... and use that address to look up a UMB.
 36251                                  ; This routine checks for that condition and calls AddrToUmb if necessary.
 36252                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36253                                  ; ENTRY:  AX contains a UMB number or segment, gnradix has been set by GetXNum
 36254                                  ; EXIT:   AX will contain a UMB number
 36255                                  ; ERROR:  None
 36256                                  ; USES:   Flags, AX
 36257                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36258                                  
 36259                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 36260                                  convUMB:
 36261 00002BBC 2E833E[BF2A]10          	cmp	word [cs:gnradix],16
 36262 00002BC2 7507                    	jne	short cu10	; If it didn't read in hex, it's not an address
 36263 00002BC4 E8C4FF                  	call	AddrToUmb	; Else, convert the address to a UMB number
 36264                                  	;cmp	ax,0FFFFh
 36265                                  	;jne	short cu10
 36266                                  	;inc	ax		; If too high, ignore it (make it conventional)
 36267                                  	; 01/01/2023
 36268 00002BC7 40                      	inc	ax
 36269 00002BC8 7401                    	jz	short cu10	; If too high, ignore it (make it conventional)
 36270 00002BCA 48                      	dec	ax
 36271                                  cu10:	
 36272 00002BCB C3                      	retn

 36663                                  ;*** hideUMB - marks as HIDDEN all FREE elements in UMB passed as AL
 36664                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36665                                  ; ENTRY:    AL must indicate a valid UMB; 0==conv && is invalid.
 36666                                  ; EXIT:     None; free elements in UMB marked as hidden
 36667                                  ; ERROR:    None
 36668                                  ; USES:     Flags
 36669                                  ; -----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 36670                                  
 36671                                  	; 01/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 36672                                  hideUMB:
 36673                                  	; 02/01/2023
 36674 00002C27 52                      	push	dx ; (*)
 36675                                  	; 01/01/2023
 36676                                  	;push	ax
 36677 00002C28 06                      	push	es
 36678                                  
 36679 00002C29 E86800                  	call	findUMB	; (*)	; Returns with carry if err, else ES == MCB
 36680 00002C2C 7224                    	jc	short huX
 36681                                  
 36682                                  ; ------------------------------------------------
 36683                                  ; HU10--ES - MCB inside UMB; if it's a system MCB,
 36684                                  ;            we're not in the same UMB, so exit.
 36685                                  ; ------------------------------------------------

 36687 00002C2E E84AFF                  hu10:	call	isSysMCB	; Returns with ZF set if owner is SYSTEM
 36688 00002C31 741F                    	jz	short huX	; If it is, we've finished the UMB.
 36689                                  	;call	isFreeMCB	; Returns with ZF set if owner is 0
 36690 00002C33 26830E010000            	or	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],0
 36691 00002C39 7503                    	jnz	short hu20
 36692                                  
 36693 00002C3B E81700                  	call	hideMCB
 36694                                  hu20:	
 36695                                  	;mov	al,[es:ARENA.SIGNATURE]
 36696                                  	;cmp	al,arena_signature_end  ;'Z'
 36697                                  	; 19/07/2023
 36698 00002C3E 26803E00005A            	cmp	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],'Z'
 36699 00002C44 740C                    	jz	short huX	; 'Z' means this was the last MCB... that's it.
 36700                                  
 36701                                  	;NextMCB es,ax		; Go on forward.
 36702 00002C46 8CC0                    	mov     ax,es
 36703                                  	;add	ax,[es:3]
 36704 00002C48 2603060300              	add     ax,[es:ARENA.SIZE]
 36705 00002C4D 40                      	inc     ax
 36706 00002C4E 8EC0                    	mov     es,ax
 36707                                  
 36708 00002C50 EBDC                    	jmp	short hu10
 36709                                  huX:	
 36710 00002C52 07                      	pop	es
 36711                                  	; 01/01/2023
 36712                                  	;pop	ax
 36713                                  	; 02/01/2023
 36714 00002C53 5A                      	pop	dx ; (*)
 36715 00002C54 C3                      	retn
 36716

 36718                                  %if 0
