 39077                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39078                                  ;
 39079                                  ; procedure : LinkFirstUMB
 39080                                  ;
 39081                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39082                                  
 39083                                  	; 01/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 39084                                  	; (SYSINIT:2F81h)
 39085                                  LinkFirstUMB:
 39086                                  	; 31/12/2022
 39087                                  	; ds = cs
 39088 0000331F E8CEFF                  	call	umb_allocate
 39089 00003322 72FA                    	jc	short lfu_err  ; ds = cs ; 31/12/2022
 39090                                  
 39091                                  ; bx = segment of allocated UMB
 39092                                  ; dx = size of UMB
 39093                                  
 39094                                  	; 31/12/2022
 39095                                  	; ds = cs
 39096                                  
 39097 00003324 CD12                    	int	12h			; ax = size of memory
 39098 00003326 B106                    	mov	cl,6
 39099 00003328 D3E0                    	shl	ax,cl			; ax = size in paragraphs
 39100                                  
 39101 0000332A 89C1                    	mov	cx,ax			; cx = size in paras
 39102 0000332C 29D8                    	sub	ax,bx			; ax = - size of unused block
 39103                                  
 39104 0000332E F7D8                    	neg	ax
 39105                                  
 39106                                  	;sub	cx,1			; cx = first umb_arena
 39107                                  	; 09/09/2023
 39108 00003330 49                      	dec	cx
 39109 00003331 8EC1                    	mov	es,cx			; es = first umb_arena
 39110                                  	
 39111 00003333 26C60600004D            	mov	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_normal ; 'M'
 39112 00003339 26C70601000800          	mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],8	; mark as system owned
 39113                                  					
 39114 00003340 26A30300                	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],ax	
 39115 00003344 26C70608005343          	mov	word [es:ARENA.NAME],'SC' ; 4353h
 39116                                  
 39117                                  ; put in the arena for the first UMB
 39118                                  
 39119 0000334B 8EC3                    	mov	es,bx			; es has first free umb seg
 39120 0000334D 26C60600005A            	mov	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_end ; 'Z'
 39121 00003353 26C70601000000          	mov	word [es:ARENA.OWNER],arena_owner_system ; 0	
 39122                                  					; mark as free 
 39123 0000335A 4A                      	dec	dx			; make room for arena
 39124 0000335B 2689160300              	mov	[es:ARENA.SIZE],dx	
 39125                                  
 39126                                  	;mov	es,[cs:DevDOSData]
 39127                                  	; 31/12/2022
 39128 00003360 8E06[7A1F]              	mov	es,[DevDOSData] ; ds = cs
 39129 00003364 BF8C00                  	mov	di,UMB_ARENA ; 8Ch
 39130 00003367 26890D                  	mov	[es:di],cx		; initialize umb_head in DOS
 39131                                  					;  data segment with the arena
 39132                                  					;  just below Top of Mem
 39133                                  
 39134                                  ; we must now scan the arena chain and update the size of the last arena
 39135                                  
 39136 0000336A BF2400                  	mov	di,DOS_ARENA ; 24h
 39137 0000336D 268E05                  	mov	es,[es:di]		; es = start arena
 39138 00003370 31FF                    	xor	di,di
 39139                                  ;scan_next
 39140                                  ; 09/12/2022
 39141                                  scannext:
 39142 00003372 26803D5A                	cmp	byte [es:di],arena_signature_end  ; 'Z'
 39143 00003376 740C                    	je	short got_last
 39144

 39147 0000337F 40                      	inc	ax

 39149                                  	;jmp	short scan_next
 39150                                  	; 09/12/2022
 39151 00003382 EBEE                    	jmp	short scannext
 39152                                  got_last:
 39153                                  	;sub	word [es:ARENA.SIZE],1
 39154                                  	; 09/09/2023
 39155 00003384 26FF0E0300              	dec	word [es:ARENA.SIZE]
 39156                                  
 39157 00003389 26C60600004D            	mov	byte [es:ARENA.SIGNATURE],arena_signature_normal ; 'M'
 39158                                  	;clc
 39159                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 39160                                  	; 11/12/2022
 39161                                  	; cf=0
 39162                                  	;clc
 39163 0000338F C3                      	retn
 39164                                  
 39165                                  ; 11/12/2022
 39166                                  ;;lfu_err:
 39167                                  ;	;stc
 39168                                  ;	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 39169                                  ;	; 11/12/2022
 39170                                  ;	; cf=1
 39171                                  ;	;stc
 39172                                  ;	retn

 39174                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39175                                  ;
 39176                                  ; procedure : ShrinkUMB
 39177                                  ;
 39178                                  ;	Shrinks the current UMB in use, so that the unused portions
 39179                                  ;	of the UMB is given back to the DOS free mem pool
 39180                                  ;
 39181                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39182                                  
 39183                                  ShrinkUMB:
 39184                                  	; 12/12/2022

 39252                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 39253                                  ; SYSINIT2.ASM - MSDOS 6.0 - 1991
 39254                                  ; ----------------------------------------------------------------------
 39255                                  ; 14/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 39256                                  
 39257                                  ; Multiple configuration block support  Created 16-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 39258                                  ;
 39259                                  ; Summary:
 39260                                  ;
 39261                                  ;   The procedure "organize" crunches the in-memory copy of config.sys
 39262                                  ;   into lines delimited by CR/LF (sometimes no CR, but *always* an LF)
 39263                                  ;   with the leading "keyword=" replaced by single character codes (eg, B
 39264                                  ;   for BUFFERS, D for DEVICE, Z for any unrecognized keyword); see comtab
 39265                                  ;   and/or config.inc for the full list.
 39266                                  ;
 39267                                  ;   [blockname] and INCLUDE are the major syntactical additions for multi-
 39268                                  ;   configuration support. blockname is either MENU, which contains one
 39269                                  ;   or more MENUITEM lines, an optional MENUDEFAULT (which includes optional
 39270                                  ;   time-out), or any user-defined keyword, such as NETWORK, CD-ROM, etc.
 39271                                  ;   INCLUDE allows the current block to name another block for inclusion
 39272                                  ;   during the processing phase of CONFIG.SYS. An INCLUDE is only honored
 39273                                  ;   once, precluding nasty infinite-loop scenarios. If blocks are present
 39274                                  ;   without a MENU block, then only lines inside COMMON blocks are processed.
 39275                                  ;
 39276                                  ; Example:
 39277                                  ;
 39278                                  ;   [menu]
 39279                                  ;   menuitem=misc,Miscellaneous
 39280                                  ;   menuitem=network,Network Configuration
 39281                                  ;   menudefault=network,15
 39282                                  ;
 39283                                  ;   [network]
 39284                                  ;   include misc
 39285                                  ;   device=foo
 39286                                  ;
 39287                                  ;   [misc]
 39288                                  ;   device=bar
 39289                                  ;   include alternate
 39290                                  ;
 39291                                  ;   [alternate]
 39292                                  ;   device=tar
 39293                                  ;
 39294                                  ;
 39295                                  ;   When the menu is displayed
 39296                                  ;
 39297                                  ;    1. Miscellaneous
 39298                                  ;    2. Network Configuration
 39299                                  ;
 39300                                  ;   #2 is highlighted as the default option, and will be automatically
 39301                                  ;   selected after 15 seconds. It will invoke the following lines in the
 39302                                  ;   following order:
 39303                                  ;
 39304                                  ;       DEVICE=BAR
 39305                                  ;       DEVICE=TAR
 39306                                  ;       DEVICE=FOO
 39307                                  ;
 39308                                  
 39309                                  ;MULTI_CONFIG equ 1
 39310                                  
 39311                                  ; the following depend on the positions of the various letters in switchlist
 39312                                  
 39313                                  switchnum	equ 11111000b ; 0F8h	; which switches require number
 39314                                  
 39315                                  flagec35	equ 00000100b ; 4	; electrically compatible 3.5 inch disk drive
 39316                                  flagdrive	equ 00001000b ; 8 
 39317                                  flagcyln	equ 00010000b ; 16
 39318                                  flagseclim	equ 00100000b ; 32
 39319                                  flagheads	equ 01000000b ; 64
 39320                                  flagff		equ 10000000b ; 128
 39321                                  
 39322                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39323                                  ; 19/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 39324                                  
 39325                                  ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:3E78h
 39326                                  
 39327                                  ; 01/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 39328                                  ; MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:3054h
 39329                                  
 39330 000033E3 00                      insert_blank:	db 	0

 39472                                  ;
 39473                                  ; procedure : parseline
 39474                                  ;
 39475                                  ; entry point is parseline. al contains the first character in command line.
 39476                                  ;
 39477                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39478                                  
 39479                                  	; 03/01/2023 - Retrodos v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 39480                                  	; (SYSINIT:3EDFh)
 39481                                  
 39482                                  	; 01/11/2022 - Retrodos v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 39483                                  	; (SYSINIT:30ACh)
 39484                                  parseline:
 39485                                  	; 03/01/2023
 39486                                  	; ds = cs ; *
 39487                                  
 39488                                  	;push	ds ; *
 39489                                  
 39490                                  	;push	cs ; *
 39491                                  	;pop	ds ; *
 39492                                  
 39493                                  nextswtch:
 39494                                  	cmp	al,cr			; carriage return?
 39495                                  	je	short done_line
 39496                                  	cmp	al,lf			; linefeed?
 39497                                  	je	short put_back		; put it back and done
 39498                                  
 39499                                  ; anything less or equal to a space is ignored.
 39500                                  
 39501                                  	cmp	al,' '                  ; space?
 39502                                  	jbe	short getnext		; skip over space
 39503                                  	cmp	al,'/'
 39504                                  	je	short getparm
 39505                                  	stc				; mark error invalid-character-in-input
 39506                                  	;jmp	short exitpl
 39507                                  	; 03/01/2023
 39508                                  swterr:
 39509                                  	retn
 39510                                  
 39511                                  getparm:
 39512                                  	call	check_switch
 39513                                  	mov	[switches],bx		; save switches read so far
 39514                                  	jc	short swterr
 39515                                  getnext:
 39516                                  	call	getchr
 39517                                  	;jc	short done_line
 39518                                  	;jmp	short nextswtch
 39519                                  	; 03/01/2023
 39520                                  	jnc	short nextswtch
 39521                                  ;swterr:
 39522                                  	;jmp	short exitpl		; exit if error
 39523                                  
 39524                                  done_line:
 39525                                  	; 12/12/2022
 39526                                  	test	byte [switches],flagdrive ; 8
 39527                                  	;test	word [switches],flagdrive ; 8 ; see if drive specified
 39528                                  	jnz	short okay
 39529                                  	stc				; mark error no-drive-specified
 39530                                  	;jmp	short exitpl
 39531                                  	; 03/01/2023
 39532                                  	retn
 39533                                  
 39534                                  okay:
 39535                                  	mov	ax,[switches]
 39536                                  	and	ax,0003h	    ; get flag bits for changeline and non-rem
 39537                                  	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_DEVICEATTRIBUTES],ax
 39538                                  	mov	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_TRACKTABLEENTRIES],0
 39539                                  	;clc			    ; everything is fine
 39540                                  	; 01/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 39541                                  	; 12/12/2022
 39542                                  	; cf=0
 39543                                  	;clc
 39544                                  	;call	setdeviceparameters
 39545                                  	; 03/01/2023
 39546                                  	jmp	setdeviceparameters
 39547                                  ;exitpl:
 39548                                  	; 03/01/2023
 39549                                  	; ds = cs
 39550                                  	;pop	ds ; *
 39551                                  	retn
 39552                                  put_back:
 39553                                  	inc	word [count]		; one more char to scan
 39554                                  	dec	word [chrptr]		; back up over linefeed
 39555                                  	jmp	short done_line
 39556                                  
 39557                                  %endif

 39561                                  ; procedure : check_switch
 39562                                  ;
 39563                                  ; processes a switch in the input. it ensures that the switch is valid, and
 39564                                  ; gets the number, if any required, following the switch. the switch and the
 39565                                  ; number *must* be separated by a colon. carry is set if there is any kind of
 39566                                  ; error.

 39570                                  ; 09/09/2023
 39571                                  
 39572                                  err_swtch:

 39574                                  err_check:
 39575 0000342A F9                      	stc
 39576                                  err_chk:
 39577                                  done_swtch:	; 09/09/2023 (cf=0)
 39578 0000342B C3                      	retn

 39658                                  ;
 39659                                  ; procedure : process_num
 39660                                  ;
 39661                                  ; this routine takes the switch just input, and the number following (if any),
 39662                                  ; and sets the value in the appropriate variable. if the number input is zero
 39663                                  ; then it does nothing - it assumes the default value that is present in the
 39664                                  ; variable at the beginning. zero is ok for form factor and drive, however.
 39665                                  ;
 39666                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39667                                  
 39668                                  	; 02/11/2022 - Retrodos v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 39669                                  	; (SYSINIT:3156h)
 39670                                  process_num:

 39672 0000347B 752B                    	jnz	short done_ret		; ignore this one.
 39673                                  	; 12/12/2022
 39674 0000347D F6C108                  	test	cl,flagdrive ; 8
 39675                                  	;test	cx,flagdrive ; 8
 39676 00003480 7404                    	jz	short try_f
 39677 00003482 A2[6248]                	mov	byte [drive],al
 39678                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 39679                                  	;jmp	short done_ret
 39680                                  	; 12/12/2022
 39681                                  	; cf=0
 39682 00003485 C3                      	retn	; 13/05/2019
 39683                                  try_f:
 39684                                  	; 12/12/2022
 39685 00003486 F6C180                  	test	cl,flagff ; 80h
 39686                                  	;test	cx,flagff ; 80h
 39687 00003489 7404                    	jz	short try_t
 39688                                  
 39689                                  ; ensure that we do not get bogus form factors that are not supported
 39690                                  
 39691                                  	;mov	[deviceparameters+1],al
 39692 0000348B A2[0547]                	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_DEVICETYPE],al
 39693                                  	; 02/11/2022 (MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS SYSINIT compatibility)
 39694                                  	;jmp	short done_ret
 39695                                  	; 12/12/2022
 39696                                  	; cf=0
 39697 0000348E C3                      	retn	; 13/05/2019
 39698                                  try_t:
 39699 0000348F 09C0                    	or	ax,ax
 39700 00003491 7415                    	jz	short done_ret		; if number entered was 0, assume default value
 39701                                  	; 12/12/2022
 39702 00003493 F6C110                  	test	cl,flagcyln ; 10h
 39703                                  	;test	cx,flagcyln ; 10h
 39704 00003496 7404                    	jz	short try_s

 39844                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39845                                  ;
 39846                                  ; procedure : setdeviceparameters
 39847                                  ;
 39848                                  ; setdeviceparameters sets up the recommended bpb in each bds in the
 39849                                  ; system based on the form factor. it is assumed that the bpbs for the
 39850                                  ; various form factors are present in the bpbtable. for hard files,
 39851                                  ; the recommended bpb is the same as the bpb on the drive.
 39852                                  ; no attempt is made to preserve registers since we are going to jump to
 39853                                  ; sysinit straight after this routine.
 39854                                  ;
 39855                                  ;	if we return carry, the DRIVPARM will be aborted, but presently
 39856                                  ;	  we always return no carry
 39857                                  ;
 39858                                  ;	note:  there is a routine by the same name in msdioctl.asm
 39859                                  ;
 39860                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 39861                                  
 39862                                  ; 15/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 39863                                  
 39864                                  	; 02/11/2022 - Retro DOS v4.0 (Modified MSDOS 5.0 IO.SYS)
 39865                                  
 39866                                  	; 03/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 39867                                  	; (SYSINIT:3FC4h)
 39868                                  
 39869                                  	; 09/09/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (Optimization)
 39870                                  	; (PCDOS 7.1 IBMBIO.COM - SYSINIT:4236h)
 39871                                  
 39872                                  setdeviceparameters:
 39873                                  	; 03/01/2023
 39874                                  	; ds = cs
 39875                                  
 39876 000034EB 06                      	push	es
 39877                                  
 39878 000034EC 0E                      	push	cs
 39879 000034ED 07                      	pop	es
 39880                                  
 39881 000034EE 31DB                    	xor	bx,bx
 39882 000034F0 8A1E[0547]              	mov	bl,[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_DEVICETYPE]
 39883 000034F4 80FB00                  	cmp	bl,DEV_5INCH ; 0
 39884 000034F7 7506                    	jne	short got_80
 39885                                  
 39886 000034F9 C706[0847]2800          	mov	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_CYLINDERS],40
 39887                                  							; 48 tpi=40 cyl
 39888                                  got_80:

 39890 00003501 8BB7[7449]              	mov	si,[bpbtable+bx]	; get address of bpb

 39923                                  
 39924                                  heads_not_altered:
 39925                                  
 39926                                  ; set up correct media descriptor byte and sectors/cluster
 39927                                  ;   sectors/cluster is always 2 except for any one sided disk or 1.44M
 39928                                  
 39929                                  	;mov	byte [deviceparameters+9],2
 39930                                  	; 02/11/2022
 39931                                  	;mov	byte [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER],2
 39932                                  	; 03/01/2023
 39933 00003529 B80200                  	mov	ax,2	
 39934 0000352C A2[0D47]                	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER],al ; 2
 39935                                  
 39936 0000352F B3F0                    	mov	bl,0F0h			; get default mediabyte
 39937                                  
 39938                                  ;	preload the mediadescriptor from the bpb into bh for convenient access
 39939                                  
 39940                                  	;mov	bh,[deviceparameters+17]
 39941                                  	; 02/11/2022
 39942 00003531 8A3E[1547]              	mov	bh,[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR]
 39943                                  	
 39944                                  	; 03/01/2023
 39945                                  	; ax = 2
 39946 00003535 3906[1A47]              	cmp	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.HEADS],ax ; >2 heads?
 39947                                  	;cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.HEADS],2 ; >2 heads?
 39948 00003539 773C                    	ja	short got_correct_mediad ; just use default if heads>2
 39949                                  
 39950 0000353B 7524                    	jne	short only_one_head	; one head, do one head stuff
 39951                                  
 39952                                  ;	two head drives will use the mediadescriptor from the bpb
 39953                                  
 39954 0000353D 88FB                    	mov	bl,bh			; get mediadescriptor from bpb
 39955                                  
 39956                                  ;	two sided drives have two special cases to look for. One is
 39957                                  ;	   a 320K diskette (40 tracks, 8 secs per track). It uses
 39958                                  ;	   a mediaid of 0fch. The other is 1.44M, which uses only
 39959                                  ;	   one sector/cluster.
 39960                                  
 39961                                  ;	any drive with 18secs/trk, 2 heads, 80 tracks, will be assumed
 39962                                  ;	   to be a 1.44M and use only 1 sector per cluster. Any other
 39963                                  ;	   type of 2 headed drive is all set.
 39964                                  
 39965 0000353F 833E[1847]12            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.SECTORSPERTRACK],18
 39966 00003544 7509                    	jne	short not_144m
 39967 00003546 833E[0847]50            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_CYLINDERS],80
 39968 0000354B 7502                    	jne	short not_144m
 39969                                  
 39970                                  ;	We've got cyl=80, heads=2, secpertrack=18. Set cluster size to 1.
 39971                                  
 39972 0000354D EB24                    	jmp	short got_one_secperclus_drive
 39973                                  
 39974                                  ;	check for 320K
 39975                                  
 39976                                  not_144m:
 39977 0000354F 833E[0847]28            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_CYLINDERS],40
 39978 00003554 7521                    	jne	short got_correct_mediad
 39979 00003556 833E[1847]08            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.SECTORSPERTRACK],8
 39980 0000355B 751A                    	jne	short got_correct_mediad
 39981                                  
 39982 0000355D B3FC                    	mov	bl,0FCh
 39983 0000355F EB16                    	jmp	short got_correct_mediad
 39984                                  
 39985                                  only_one_head:
 39986                                  
 39987                                  ;	if we don't have a 360K drive, then just go use 0f0h as media descr.
 39988                                  
 39989 00003561 803E[0547]00            	cmp	byte [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_DEVICETYPE],DEV_5INCH ; 0
 39990 00003566 740B                    	je	short got_one_secperclus_drive
 39991                                  
 39992                                  ;	single sided 360K drive uses either 0fch or 0feh, depending on
 39993                                  ;	  whether sectorspertrack is 8 or 9. For our purposes, anything
 39994                                  ;	  besides 8 will be considered 0fch
 39995                                  
 39996 00003568 B3FC                    	mov	bl,0FCh			; single sided 9 sector media id
 39997 0000356A 833E[1847]08            	cmp	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.SECTORSPERTRACK],8
 39998                                  	; 12/12/2022
 39999 0000356F 7502                    	jne	short got_one_secperclus_drive ; okay if anything besides 8
 40000                                  
 40001 00003571 B3FE                    	mov	bl,0FEh			; 160K mediaid
 40002                                  
 40003                                  ;	we've either got a one sided drive, or a 1.44M drive
 40004                                  ;	  either case we'll use 1 sector per cluster instead of 2
 40005                                  
 40006                                  got_one_secperclus_drive:
 40007                                  	; 03/01/2023
 40008                                  	; ax = 2
 40009 00003573 48                      	dec	ax  ; ax = 1
 40010 00003574 A2[0D47]                	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER],al ; 1
 40011                                  	;mov	byte [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.SECTORSPERCLUSTER],1
 40012                                  
 40013                                  got_correct_mediad:
 40014 00003577 881E[1547]              	mov	[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.MEDIADESCRIPTOR],bl
 40015                                  
 40016                                  ;	 Calculate the correct number of Total Sectors on medium
 40017                                  
 40018 0000357B A1[0847]                	mov	ax,[deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_CYLINDERS]
 40019 0000357E F726[1A47]              	mul	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.HEADS]
 40020 00003582 F726[1847]              	mul	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.SECTORSPERTRACK]
 40021 00003586 A3[1347]                	mov	word [deviceparameters+A_DEVICEPARAMETERS.DP_BPB+A_BPB.TOTALSECTORS],ax
 40022 00003589 F8                      	clc				; we currently return no errors
 40023                                  
 40024 0000358A C3                      	retn
 40025

 40586                                  ;
 40587                                  ; procedure : skip_comment
 40588                                  ;
 40589                                  ;skip the commented string until lf, if current es:si-> a comment string.
 40590                                  ;in) es:si-> string
 40591                                  ;	 cx -> length.
 40592                                  ;out) zero flag not set if not found a comment string.
 40593                                  ;	  zero flag set if found a comment string and skipped it. al will contain
 40594                                  ;	  the line feed character at this moment when return.
 40595                                  ;	  ax register destroyed.
 40596                                  ;	  if found, si, cx register adjusted accordingly.
 40597                                  ;
 40598                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40599                                  
 40600                                  	; 03/01/2023 - Retrodos v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 40601                                  	; (SYSINIT:428Dh)
 40602                                  
 40603                                  skip_comment:
 40604 0000377E E3EA                    	jcxz	noget		; get out of the organize routine.
 40605                                  
 40606                                  	; 03/01/2023
 40607                                  	; ds = cs	
 40608                                  
 40609 00003780 803E[4C03]00            	cmp	byte [com_level],0
 40610                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:com_level],0 ; only check it if parameter level is 0.
 40611 00003785 752C                    	jne	short no_commt	 ; (not inside quotations)
 40612                                  
 40613 00003787 803E[4D03]01            	cmp	byte [cmmt],1
 40614                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:cmmt],1
 40615 0000378C 7225                    	jb	short no_commt
 40616                                  
 40617 0000378E 268A04                  	mov	al,[es:si]
 40618                                  	
 40619 00003791 3806[4E03]              	cmp	[cmmt1],al
 40620                                  	;cmp	[cs:cmmt1],al
 40621 00003795 751C                    	jne	short no_commt
 40622                                  
 40623 00003797 803E[4D03]02            	cmp	byte [cmmt],2
 40624                                  	;cmp	byte [cs:cmmt],2
 40625 0000379C 750A                    	jne	short skip_cmmt
 40626                                  
 40627 0000379E 268A4401                	mov	al,[es:si+1]
 40628                                  	
 40629 000037A2 3806[4F03]              	cmp	[cmmt2],al
 40630                                  	;cmp	[cs:cmmt2],al
 40631 000037A6 750B                    	jne	short no_commt
 40632                                  skip_cmmt:
 40633 000037A8 E3C0                    	jcxz	noget		; get out of organize routine.
 40634 000037AA 268A04                  	mov	al,[es:si]
 40635 000037AD 46                      	inc	si
 40636 000037AE 49                      	dec	cx
 40637 000037AF 3C0A                    	cmp	al,lf		; line feed?
 40638 000037B1 75F5                    	jne	short skip_cmmt
 40639                                  no_commt:
 40640 000037B3 C3                      	retn

 40654                                  ;   INPUT
 40655                                  ;       DS == CS == sysinitseg
 40656                                  ;
 40657                                  ;   OUTPUT
 40658                                  ;       Carry SET to clean boot, CLEAR otherwise
 40659                                  ;
 40660                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 40661                                  ;       All
 40662                                  ;
 40663                                  ;   HISTORY
 40664                                  ;       Created 16-Nov-1992 by JeffPar
 40665                                  ;
 40666                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40667                                  
 40668                                  kbd_read:
 40669 000037B4 F606[E045]02                    test    byte [bDisableUI],2
 40670 000037B9 7520                            jnz     short kbd_nodelay
 40671                                  
 40672 000037BB 1E                              push    ds              ; the bios timer tick count is incremented
 40673 000037BC 29C0                            sub     ax,ax           ; 18.2 times per second;
 40674 000037BE 8ED8                            mov     ds,ax           ; watch the timer tick count for 37 transitions
 40675                                  	;mov	dx,[046Ch]	; get initial value
 40676                                  kbd_loop:
 40677 000037C0 B401                            mov     ah,1            ;
 40678 000037C2 CD16                            int     16h             ; peek the keyboard
 40679 000037C4 7514                            jnz	short kbd_loopdone ; something's there, get out
 40680 000037C6 B402                            mov     ah,2            ; peek the shift states
 40681 000037C8 CD16                            int     16h             ;
 40682 000037CA A803                            test    al,03h          ; either right or left shift key bits set?
 40683 000037CC 750C                            jnz	short kbd_loopdone ; yes
 40684 000037CE A16C04                          mov     ax,[046Ch]	;
 40685                                  	;sub	ax,dx           ; get difference
 40686                                  	; 15/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 40687 000037D1 2E2B06[8203]            	sub	ax,[cs:_timer_lw_] ; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:42E5h        
 40688                                  
 40689 000037D6 3C25                    	cmp     al,37           ; reached limit?  ; (2 seconds)
 40690 000037D8 72E6                            jb	short kbd_loop	; not yet
 40691                                  kbd_loopdone:
 40692 000037DA 1F                              pop     ds              ; delay complete!
 40693                                  kbd_nodelay:
 40694 000037DB 29DB                            sub     bx,bx           ; assume clean boot
 40695 000037DD B402                            mov     ah,2            ; peek the shift states
 40696 000037DF CD16                            int     16h             ;
 40697 000037E1 A803                            test    al,03h          ; either right or left shift key bits set?
 40698 000037E3 7407                            jz      short kbd_notshift ; no
 40699 000037E5 43                              inc     bx              ; yes
 40700 000037E6 43                              inc     bx
 40701                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:4301h
 40702 000037E7 800E[E445]04            	or	byte [bQueryOpt],4
 40703                                  kbd_notshift:                   ;
 40704 000037EC B401                            mov     ah,1            ; peek the keyboard
 40705 000037EE CD16                            int     16h             ;
 40706 000037F0 743E                            jz	short kbd_test	; no key present
 40707 000037F2 08C0                            or      al,al           ; is it a function key?
 40708 000037F4 753A                            jnz	short kbd_test	; no
 40709                                  
 40710                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:430Bh
 40711 000037F6 80FC62                          cmp     ah,62h          ; CTRL F5
 40712 000037F9 7405                            je	short kbd_cfg_bypass
 40713                                  	
 40714 000037FB 80FC3F                          cmp     ah,3Fh          ; F5 function key?
 40715 000037FE 750D                            jne	short kbd_notf5	; no
 40716                                  kbd_cfg_bypass:
 40717 00003800 BA[424B]                        mov     dx,_$CleanMsg
 40718 00003803 E8AD0B                          call    print
 40719                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:431Bh
 40720 00003806 800E[E445]04            	or	byte [bQueryOpt],4 
 40721 0000380B EB16                            jmp     short kbd_eat   ; yes, clean boot selected
 40722                                  kbd_notf5:
 40723                                  	; MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS - SYSINIT:4322h
 40724 0000380D 80FC65                          cmp     ah,65h          ; CTRL F8
 40725 00003810 7405                            je	short kbd_cfg_confirm
 40726                                  
 40727 00003812 80FC42                          cmp     ah,42h          ; F8 function key?
 40728 00003815 7523                            jne	short kbd_exit	; no
 40729                                  kbd_cfg_confirm:
 40730 00003817 BA[804B]                        mov     dx,_$InterMsg
 40731 0000381A E8960B                          call    print           ;
 40732 0000381D B301                            mov     bl,1            ; yes, interactive-boot option enabled
 40733 0000381F 881E[E445]                      mov     [bQueryOpt],bl  ; change default setting
 40734                                  kbd_eat:                        ;
 40735 00003823 B400                            mov     ah,0            ;
 40736 00003825 CD16                            int     16h             ; eat the key we assumed was a signal
 40737 00003827 C606[EA45]FF                    mov	byte [secElapsed],-1
 40738 0000382C 09DB                            or      bx,bx           ;
 40739 0000382E 7405                            jz	short kbd_clean	;
 40740                                  kbd_test:                       ;
 40741 00003830 80FB02                          cmp     bl,2            ;
 40742 00003833 7205                            jb	short kbd_exit	;
 40743                                  kbd_clean:                      ;
 40744 00003835 E83E08                          call    disable_autoexec; yes, tell COMMAND to skip autoexec.bat
 40745 00003838 F9                              stc                     ; set carry to indicate abort
 40746 00003839 C3                              retn			;
 40747                                  kbd_exit:                       ;
 40748 0000383A F8                              clc                     ; clear carry to indicate success
 40749 0000383B C3                              retn			;
 40750                                  
 40751                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40752                                  ;
 40753                                  ;   set_numlock: set numlock LED
 40754                                  ;
 40755                                  ;   INPUT
 40756                                  ;       ES:SI -> numlock setting (ie, "ON" or "OFF")
 40757                                  ;
 40758                                  ;   OUTPUT
 40759                                  ;       None
 40760                                  ;
 40761                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 40762                                  ;       None
 40763                                  ;
 40764                                  ;   HISTORY
 40765                                  ;       Created 16-Nov-1992 by JeffPar
 40766                                  ;
 40767                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40768                                  
 40769                                  	; 04/01/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2
 40770                                  
 40771                                  set_numlock:
 40772                                          ; 04/01/2023
 40773                                  	;push	ax
 40774 0000383C 1E                              push    ds
 40775 0000383D 29C0                            sub     ax,ax
 40776 0000383F 8ED8                            mov     ds,ax
 40777 00003841 268B04                          mov     ax,[es:si]      ; get 1st 2 bytes of value (ON or OF)
 40778 00003844 2E3B06[0A4B]                    cmp     ax,[cs:OnOff+2]	; should we turn it off?
 40779 00003849 7507                            jne	short not_off	; no
 40780 0000384B 80261704DF                      and     byte [0417h],~20h ; 0DFh
 40781 00003850 EB0D                            jmp     short set_done
 40782                                  not_off:
 40783 00003852 2E3B06[084B]                    cmp     ax,[cs:OnOff]	; should we turn it on?
 40784 00003857 F9                              stc
 40785 00003858 7505                            jne	short set_done	; no
 40786 0000385A 800E170420                      or      byte [0417h],20h
 40787                                  set_done:
 40788 0000385F 1F                              pop     ds
 40789                                  	; 04/01/2023
 40790                                  	;pop	ax
 40791 00003860 C3                              retn
 40792                                  
 40793                                  ; 16/04/2019 - Retro DOS v4.0
 40794                                  
 40795                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40796                                  ;
 40797                                  ;   menu_check:  check for presence of menu (and other) configuration blocks
 40798                                  ;
 40799                                  ;   INPUT
 40800                                  ;       CX == "organized" config.sys memory image length
 40801                                  ;    ES:SI -> "organized" config.sys memory image
 40802                                  ;       DS == CS == sysinitseg
 40803                                  ;
 40804                                  ;   OUTPUT
 40805                                  ;       Same as above; the idea is that menu_check simply transforms
 40806                                  ;       a block-structured config.sys image into a conventional image,
 40807                                  ;       based on the user's block selection and any other boot-time options
 40808                                  ;       the user may have employed...
 40809                                  ;
 40810                                  ;   OTHER REGS USED
 40811                                  ;       All
 40812                                  ;
 40813                                  ;   NOTES
 40814                                  ;       [count] and [org_count] are set to the new config.sys image length
 40815                                  ;
 40816                                  ;   HISTORY
 40817                                  ;       Created 16-Mar-1992 by JeffPar
 40818                                  ;
 40819                                  ;----------------------------------------------------------------------------
 40820                                  
 40821                                  	; 04/01/2023 - Retrodos v4.2 (Modified MSDOS 6.21 IO.SYS)
 40822                                  	; (SYSINIT:4378h)
 40823                                  
 40824                                  menu_check:
 40825                                  
 40826                                  ;   Search for SWITCHES, determine if /N or /F are present; if so, then
 40827                                  ;   disable clean/interactive boot options
 40828                                  
 40829 00003861 51                              push    cx              ;
 40830 00003862 56                              push    si              ;
 40831 00003863 29DB                            sub     bx,bx           ; remains ZERO until first block
 40832                                  swchk_loop:                     ;
 40833 00003865 E80507                          call    get_char        ; get first char of current line
 40834 00003868 721C                            jc	short swchk_end	; hit eof
 40835 0000386A 3C5B                            cmp     al,CONFIG_BEGIN ; '['
 40836 0000386C 7503                            jne	short swchk_next1 ;
 40837 0000386E 43                              inc     bx              ; remember that we've seen a block
 40838 0000386F EB10                            jmp     short swchk_nextline
 40839                                  swchk_next1:                    ;
 40840 00003871 3C4E                            cmp     al,CONFIG_NUMLOCK
 40841                                          ;jne	short swchk_next2
 40842                                  	; 18/03/2025 - MiniDOS 1.0
 40843 00003873 750C                    	jne	short swchk_nextline
 40844                                  
 40845 00003875 09DB                            or      bx,bx           ; only do NUMLOCK commands that exist
 40846 00003877 7508                            jnz	short swchk_nextline ; before the first block
 40847 00003879 E8C0FF                          call    set_numlock     ; REM it out so we don't act on it later, too
 40848 0000387C 26C644FF30                      mov     byte [es:si-1],CONFIG_REM
 40849                                  
 40850                                  ; 18/03/2025 - MiniDOS 1.0
 40851                                  %if 0
 40852                                          jmp     short swchk_nextline
 40853                                  swchk_next2:                    ;
 40854                                          cmp     al,CONFIG_SWITCHES
 40855                                          jne	short swchk_nextline ; this line ain't it
 40856                                  swchk_scan:                     ;
 40857                                          call    get_char        ; look for /N or /F
 40858                                  swchk_scan1:                    ;
 40859                                          cmp     al,LF           ; end of line?
 40860                                          je	short swchk_nextline ; yes
 40861                                          cmp     al,'/'          ; switch-char?
 40862                                          jne	short swchk_scan ; no
 40863                                          call    get_char        ;
 40864                                          and     al,~20h ; 0DFh	; convert to upper case
 40865                                          cmp     al,[swit_n+1]	; 'N'
 40866                                          jne	short swchk_scan2 ; no
 40867                                          or      byte [bDisableUI],1
 40868                                          jmp	short swchk_scan ; continue looking for switches of interest
 40869                                  swchk_scan2:                    ;
 40870                                          cmp     al,[swit_f+1]	; 'F'
 40871                                          jne	short swchk_scan1 ; no
 40872                                          or      byte [bDisableUI],2
 40873                                          jmp     short swchk_scan ; continue looking for switches of interest
 40874                                  %endif
 40875                                  
 40876                                  swchk_nextline:                 ;
 40877 00003881 E8C306                          call    skip_opt_line   ;
 40878 00003884 EBDF                            jmp     short swchk_loop ;
 40879                                  swchk_end:                      ;
 40880 00003886 5E                              pop     si              ;
 40881 00003887 59                              pop     cx              ;
 40882                                  
 40883                                  ;   Do the keyboard tests for clean/interactive boot now, but only if
 40884                                  ;   the DisableUI flag is still clear
 40885                                  
 40886 00003888 F606[E045]01                    test    byte [bDisableUI],1
 40887 0000388D 7508                            jnz	short menu_search
 40888                                  ;
 40889                                  ;   Wait for 2 seconds first, UNLESS the /F bit was set in bDisableUI, or
 40890                                  ;   there is anything at all in the keyboard buffer
 40891                                  ;
 40892 0000388F E822FF                          call    kbd_read
 40893 00003892 7303                            jnc	short menu_search
 40894 00003894 E9EE01                          jmp	menu_abort
 40895                                  
 40896                                  ;   Search for MENU block; it is allowed to be anywhere in config.sys
 40897                                  
 40898                                  menu_search:
 40899 00003897 29DB                            sub     bx,bx           ; if no MENU, default to zero for no_selection
 40900 00003899 BF[2546]                        mov     di,szMenu	;
 40901 0000389C E80304                          call    find_block      ; find the MENU block
 40902 0000389F 7337                            jnc	short menu_found ;
 40903 000038A1 C606[1D46]00                    mov     byte [szBoot],0
 40904 000038A6 E90C02                          jmp	no_selection ; not found
 40905                                  
 40906                                  ;   Process the requested menu color(s)
 40907                                  
 40908                                  menu_color:
 40909 000038A9 51                      	push	cx              ;
 40910 000038AA 52                      	push	dx              ;
 40911                                  	;;mov	dx,0007h        ; default color setting
 40912                                  	; 10/09/2023
 40913                                  	;mov	dl,7 ; !*!
 40914 000038AB E89E06                  	call	get_number	; get first number
 40915 000038AE 80E30F                  	and	bl,0Fh  ; !**!	; first # is foreground color (for low nibble)
 40916 000038B1 88DD                    	mov	ch,bl           ; save it in CH
 40917                                  	; 01/08/2023 - Retro DOS v4.2 IO.SYS (optimization) by Erdogan Tan 
 40918                                  	; (high nibble of dl is 0)
 40919                                  	;and	dl,0F0h	; !*!	; (low nibble of dl would be zero)
 40920                                  	;or	dl,bl		; (low nibble of dl is 7) ! 14/08/2023
 40921 000038B3 88DA                    	mov	dl,bl	; 14/08/2023
 40922 000038B5 E83108                  	call	delim           ; did we hit a delimiter
 40923 000038B8 750E                    	jne	short check_color ; no, all done
 40924 000038BA E88F06                  	call	get_number	; get next number
 40925 000038BD 80E30F                  	and	bl,0Fh		; second # is background color (for high nibble)
 40926 000038C0 88DE                    	mov	dh,bl           ; save it in DH
 40927                                  	; 10/09/2023
 40928                                  	;and	dl,0Fh	; !**!	;
 40929 000038C2 B104                    	mov	cl,4            ;
 40930 000038C4 D2E3                    	shl	bl,cl           ;
 40931 000038C6 08DA                    	or	dl,bl           ;
 40932                                  check_color:
 40933 000038C8 38F5                    	cmp	ch,dh           ; are foreground/background the same?
 40934 000038CA 7503                    	jne	short set_color	; no
 40935 000038CC 80F208                  	xor	dl,08h          ; yes, so modify the fgnd intensity
 40936                                  set_color:
 40937 000038CF 8816[DB45]              	mov	[bMenuColor],dl ;
 40938 000038D3 5A                      	pop	dx              ;
 40939 000038D4 59                      	pop	cx              ;
 40940 000038D5 E9A900                  	jmp	menu_nextitem
 40941                                  
 40942                                  ;   Back to our regularly scheduled program (the COLOR and other goop
 40943                                  ;   above is there simply to alleviate short jump problems)
 40944                                  
 40945                                  menu_found:
 40946 000038D8 C606[E545]01                    mov     byte [bDefBlock],1
 40947                                          ;mov	word [offDefBlock],0
 40948 000038DD C606[E945]FF                    mov     byte [secTimeOut],-1
 40949 000038E2 8026[E445]FD                    and     byte [bQueryOpt],~2 ; 0FDh
 40950                                  	; 10/09/2023
 40951 000038E7 29D2                    	sub	dx,dx
 40952 000038E9 8916[E745]              	mov	[offDefBlock],dx ; 0
 40953                                  
 40954 000038ED E85706                          call    skip_opt_line   ; skip to next line
 40955                                  	; 10/09/2023
 40956                                  	;sub	dx,dx		; initialize total block count (0 => none yet)
 40957                                  
 40958                                  ;   Process the menu block now
 40959                                  
 40960                                  menu_process:
 40961 000038F0 E87A06                          call    get_char        ; get first char of current line
 40962 000038F3 722E                            jc	short to_menu_getdefault ; could happen if menu block at end (rare)
 40963 000038F5 247F                            and     al,~CONFIG_OPTION_QUERY ; 7Fh
 40964 000038F7 3C5B                            cmp     al,CONFIG_BEGIN ; BEGIN implies END
 40965 000038F9 7428                            je	short to_menu_getdefault
 40966 000038FB 3C4F                            cmp     al,CONFIG_SUBMENU
 40967 000038FD 744D                            je	short menu_item	; go process sub-menu
 40968 000038FF 3C45                            cmp     al,CONFIG_MENUITEM
 40969 00003901 7449                            je	short menu_item	; go process menu item
 40970 00003903 3C41                            cmp     al,CONFIG_MENUDEFAULT
 40971 00003905 741E                            je	short menu_default ; go process menu default
 40972 00003907 3C52                            cmp     al,CONFIG_MENUCOLOR
 40973 00003909 749E                            je	short menu_color ; go process menu color
 40974 0000390B 3C4E                            cmp     al,CONFIG_NUMLOCK
 40975 0000390D 740F                            je	short menu_numlock ;
 40976 0000390F 3C30                            cmp     al,CONFIG_REM   ; allow remarks in menu block
 40977 00003911 746E                            je	short menu_nextitem ;
 40978 00003913 E8C307                          call    any_delim       ; allow blank lines and such
 40979 00003916 7469                            je	short menu_nextitem ;
 40980 00003918 F9                              stc                     ;
 40981 00003919 E82607                          call    print_error     ; non-MENU command!
 40982 0000391C EB63                            jmp     short menu_nextitem
 40983                                  menu_numlock:
 40984 0000391E E81BFF                          call    set_numlock
 40985 00003921 EB5E                            jmp     short menu_nextitem
 40986                                  to_menu_getdefault:
 40987 00003923 EB62                            jmp     short menu_getdefault
 40988                                  
 40989                                  ;   Save the offset of the default block name, we'll need it later
 40990                                  
 40991                                  menu_default:
 40992 00003925 8936[E745]                      mov     [offDefBlock],si; save address of default block name
 40993 00003929 803E[EA45]00                    cmp     byte [secElapsed],0
 40994 0000392E 751A                            jne	short timeout_skip ; secElapsed is only zero for the FIRST menu,
 40995 00003930 E8EA05                          call    skip_token      ; and for subsequent menus IF nothing was typed;
 40996 00003933 724C                            jc	short menu_nextitem ; secElapsed becomes -1 forever as soon as
 40997 00003935 E8FB05                          call    skip_delim      ; something is typed
 40998 00003938 7247                            jc	short menu_nextitem ;
 40999 0000393A 89DE                            mov     si,bx           ;
 41000 0000393C E80D06                          call    get_number      ; get number (of seconds for timeout)
 41001 0000393F 80FB5A                          cmp     bl,90           ; limit it to a reasonable number
 41002                                  	;jb	short timeout_ok ; (besides, 99 is the largest # my simple
 41003 00003942 7602                            jna	short timeout_ok ; 01/08/2023
 41004 00003944 B35A                    	mov     bl,90           ;  display function can handle)
 41005                                  timeout_ok:                    ;
 41006 00003946 881E[E945]                      mov     [secTimeOut],bl ;
 41007                                  timeout_skip:
 41008 0000394A EB35                            jmp     short menu_nextitem
 41009                                  
 41010                                  ;   Verify that this is a valid menu item by searching for the named block
 41011                                  
 41012                                  menu_item:
 41013                                  	;cmp	dl,9	; 04/01/2023
 41014 0000394C 80FA09                          cmp     dl,MAX_MULTI_CONFIG ; have we reached the max # of items yet?
 41015 0000394F 7330                            jae	short menu_nextitem ;
 41016 00003951 89F7                            mov     di,si           ; DS:DI -> block name to search for
 41017 00003953 E83303                          call    srch_block      ;
 41018 00003956 7406                            je	short menu_itemfound ;
 41019 00003958 F9                              stc                     ;
 41020 00003959 E8E606                          call    print_error     ; print error and pause
 41021 0000395C EB23                            jmp     short menu_nextitem ; if not found, ignore this menu item
 41022                                  
 41023                                  ;   srch_block, having succeeded, returns DI -> past the token that it
 41024                                  ;   just matched, which in this case should be a descriptive string; ES:SI
 41025                                  ;   and CX are unmodified
 41026                                  
 41027                                  menu_itemfound:
 41028 0000395E 42                              inc     dx              ; otherwise, increment total block count
 41029 0000395F 89D3                            mov     bx,dx           ; and use it to index the arrays of offsets
 41030 00003961 8887[EB45]                      mov	[abBlockType+bx],al
 41031 00003965 01DB                            add     bx,bx           ; of recorded block names and descriptions
 41032                                  
 41033                                  ;   There should be a description immediately following the block name on
 41034                                  ;   MENUITEM line; failing that, we'll just use the block name as the
 41035                                  ;   description...
 41036                                  
 41037 00003967 89B7[F545]                      mov     [aoffBlockName+bx],si
 41038 0000396B 89B7[0946]                      mov     [aoffBlockDesc+bx],si
 41039 0000396F 89DF                            mov     di,bx           ; skip_delim modifies BX, so stash it in DI
 41040 00003971 E8A905                          call    skip_token      ;
 41041 00003974 720B                            jc	short menu_nextitem ; hit eol/eof
 41042 00003976 E8BA05                          call    skip_delim      ;
 41043 00003979 7206                            jc	short menu_nextitem ; hit eol/eof
 41044 0000397B 87FB                            xchg    bx,di           ;
 41045 0000397D 89BF[0946]                      mov     [aoffBlockDesc+bx],di
 41046                                  
 41047                                  menu_nextitem:
 41048 00003981 E8C305                          call    skip_opt_line   ;
 41049 00003984 E969FF                          jmp     menu_process    ; go back for more lines
 41050                                  
 41051                                  ;   Display menu items now, after determining which one is default
 41052                                  
 41053                                  menu_getdefault:
 41054 00003987 08D2                            or      dl,dl           ; where there any valid blocks at all?
 41055 00003989 7505                            jnz	short menu_valid ; yes
 41056 0000398B 29DB                            sub     bx,bx           ; no, so force autoselect of 0
 41057 0000398D E9ED00                          jmp     menu_autoselect ; (meaning: process common blocks only)
 41058                                  menu_valid:
 41059 00003990 29DB                            sub     bx,bx           ;
 41060 00003992 8816[E645]                      mov     [bMaxBlock],dl  ; first, record how many blocks we found
 41061 00003996 8B3E[E745]                      mov     di,[offDefBlock];
 41062 0000399A 09FF                            or      di,di           ; does a default block exist?
 41063 0000399C 741C                            jz	short menu_nodefault ; no
 41064 0000399E 43                              inc     bx              ; yes, walk name table, looking for default
 41065                                  menu_chkdefault:
 41066 0000399F 53                              push    bx              ;
 41067 000039A0 01DB                            add     bx,bx           ;
 41068 000039A2 8BB7[F545]                      mov     si,[aoffBlockName+bx]
 41069 000039A6 B98000                          mov     cx,128          ; arbitrary maximum length of a name
 41070 000039A9 1E                              push    ds              ;
 41071 000039AA 06                              push    es              ;
 41072 000039AB 1F                              pop     ds              ;
 41073 000039AC E81A03                          call    comp_names      ; is this block the same as the default?
 41074 000039AF 1F                              pop     ds              ;
 41075 000039B0 5B                              pop     bx              ;
 41076 000039B1 7409                            je	short menu_setdefault ; yes
 41077 000039B3 43                              inc     bx              ;
 41078 000039B4 3A1E[E645]                      cmp     bl,[bMaxBlock]  ; all done searching?
 41079 000039B8 76E5                            jbe	short menu_chkdefault ; not yet
 41080                                  menu_nodefault:
 41081 000039BA B301                            mov     bl,1            ; if no default, force default to #1
 41082                                  menu_setdefault:
 41083 000039BC 881E[E545]                      mov     [bDefBlock],bl  ; yes, this will be the initial current block
 41084                                  
 41085                                  ;   If the timeout was explicitly set to 0 (or technically, anything that
 41086                                  ;   failed to resolve to a number, like "NONE" or "EAT POTATOES"), then we're
 41087                                  ;   supposed to skip menu display and run with the specified default block;
 41088                                  ;   however, if the user hit Enter prior to boot, thereby requesting fully
 41089                                  ;   INTERACTIVE boot, then we shall display the menu block anyway (though still
 41090                                  ;   with no timeout)
 41091                                  
 41092 000039C0 803E[E945]00                    cmp     byte [secTimeOut],0 ; is timeout zero? (ie, assume default)
 41093 000039C5 750A                            jne	short menu_display ; no
 41094 000039C7 F606[E445]01                    test    byte [bQueryOpt],1 ; yes, but was INTERACTIVE requested?
 41095 000039CC 7503                            jnz	short menu_display ; yes, so *don't* assume default after all
 41096 000039CE E9C700                          jmp     not_topmenu	;
 41097                                  
 41098                                  ;   Reset the mode, so that we know screen is clean and cursor is home
 41099                                  
 41100                                  menu_display:
 41101 000039D1 B40F                            mov     ah,0Fh          ; get current video mode
 41102 000039D3 CD10                            int     10h             ;
 41103 000039D5 B400                            mov     ah,00h          ; just re-select that mode
 41104 000039D7 CD10                            int     10h             ;
 41105 000039D9 06                              push    es              ;
 41106 000039DA B84000                          mov     ax,40h          ; reach down into the ROM BIOS data area
 41107 000039DD 8EC0                            mov     es,ax           ; and save the current (default) video page
 41108 000039DF 26A14E00                        mov     ax,[es:004Eh]   ; start address and page #, in case the
 41109 000039E3 A3[E245]                        mov     [wCRTStart],ax  ; undocumented QUIET option was enabled
 41110 000039E6 26A06200                        mov     al,[es:0062h]   ;
 41111 000039EA A2[E145]                        mov     [bCRTPage],al   ;
 41112 000039ED A1[DC45]                        mov     ax,[bMenuPage]	; select new page for menu
 41113 000039F0 CD10                            int     10h             ;
 41114 000039F2 B80006                          mov     ax,0600h        ; clear entire screen
 41115 000039F5 8A3E[DB45]                      mov     bh,[bMenuColor] ; using this color
 41116 000039F9 29C9                            sub     cx,cx           ; upper left row/col
 41117                                          ;mov	dl,[es:CRT_Cols] 
 41118 000039FB 268A164A00                      mov	dl,[es:4Ah]
 41119 00003A00 FECA                    	dec     dl              ;
 41120                                          ;mov	dh,[es:CRT_Rows];
 41121 00003A02 268A368400                      mov	dh,[es:84h]
 41122 00003A07 08F6                    	or      dh,dh           ; # of rows valid?
 41123 00003A09 7504                            jnz	short menu_clear ; hopefully
 41124 00003A0B 8A36[DF45]                      mov     dh,[bLastRow]   ; no, use a default
 41125                                  menu_clear:
 41126 00003A0F CD10                            int     10h             ; clear the screen using the req. attribute
 41127 00003A11 07                              pop     es              ;
 41128 00003A12 8836[DF45]                      mov     [bLastRow],dh   ; save DH
 41129 00003A16 BA[BD4B]                        mov     dx,_$MenuHeader
 41130 00003A19 E89709                          call    print           ; cursor now on row 3 (numbered from 0)
 41131                                  
 41132 00003A1C F606[E045]01                    test    byte [bDisableUI],1
 41133 00003A21 751F                            jnz     short menu_nostatus
 41134 00003A23 8A3E[DC45]                      mov     bh,[bMenuPage]  ;
 41135 00003A27 8A36[DF45]                      mov     dh,[bLastRow]   ; restore DH
 41136 00003A2B B200                            mov     dl,0            ; print the status line on row DH, col 0,
 41137 00003A2D B402                            mov     ah,02h          ; now that we can trash the cursor position
 41138 00003A2F CD10                            int     10h             ;
 41139 00003A31 BA[094C]                        mov     dx,_$StatusLine
 41140 00003A34 E87C09                          call    print           ;
 41141 00003A37 B403                            mov     ah,3            ; get cursor position
 41142 00003A39 CD10                            int     10h             ;
 41143 00003A3B 80EA02                          sub     dl,2            ;
 41144 00003A3E 8816[DE45]                      mov     [bLastCol],dl   ; save column where status char will go
 41145                                  
 41146                                  menu_nostatus:
 41147 00003A42 BB0100                          mov     bx,1            ; now prepare to display all the menu items
 41148                                  menu_disploop:
 41149 00003A45 E8B002                          call    print_item	; print item #BL
 41150 00003A48 43                              inc     bx              ; why "inc bx"? because it's a 1-byte opcode
 41151 00003A49 3A1E[E645]                      cmp     bl,[bMaxBlock]  ; all done?
 41152 00003A4D 76F6                            jbe	short menu_disploop ; not yet
 41153                                  
 41154                                  ;   Set cursor position to just below the menu items
 41155                                  
 41156 00003A4F B200                            mov     dl,0            ; select column
 41157 00003A51 88DE                            mov     dh,bl           ;
 41158 00003A53 80C604                          add     dh,4            ; select row below menu
 41159 00003A56 8A3E[DC45]                      mov     bh,[bMenuPage]  ;
 41160 00003A5A B402                            mov     ah,02h          ; set cursor position beneath the block list
 41161 00003A5C CD10                            int     10h             ;
 41162                                  
 41163 00003A5E BA[F64B]                        mov     dx,_$MenuPrmpt
 41164 00003A61 E84F09                          call    print           ;
 41165 00003A64 E82903                          call    select_item     ; make a selection, return # in BX
 41166 00003A67 BA[B649]                        mov     dx,crlfm	
 41167 00003A6A E84609                          call    print           ;
 41168 00003A6D FF36[E045]                      push    word [bDisableUI]
 41169 00003A71 800E[E045]01                    or      byte [bDisableUI],1
 41170 00003A76 E86704                          call    show_status     ; clear the status line now
 41171 00003A79 8F06[E045]                      pop     word [bDisableUI]
 41172                                  
 41173                                  ;   Now begins the "re-organization" process...
 41174                                  
 41175                                  menu_autoselect:
 41176 00003A7D 83FBFF                          cmp     bx,-1 ; 0FFFFh	; clean boot requested?
 41177 00003A80 7508                            jne	short normal_boot ; no
 41178 00003A82 E8F105                          call    disable_autoexec; basically, add a /D to the command.com line
 41179                                  menu_abort:
 41180 00003A85 29C9                            sub     cx,cx           ; then immediately exit with 0 config.sys image
 41181 00003A87 E9E400                          jmp	menu_exit	;
 41182                                  
 41183                                  normal_boot:
 41184 00003A8A 83FBFE                          cmp     bx,-2 ; 0FFFEh	; back to top-level menu?
 41185 00003A8D 7509                            jne	short not_topmenu ; no
 41186 00003A8F 8B0E[5203]                      mov     cx,[count]      ; yes, start all over
 41187 00003A93 29F6                            sub     si,si           ;
 41188 00003A95 E9FFFD                          jmp     menu_search
 41189                                  
 41190                                  not_topmenu:
 41191 00003A98 80BF[EB45]4F                    cmp     byte [abBlockType+bx],CONFIG_SUBMENU
 41192 00003A9D 7510                            jne	short not_submenu
 41193 00003A9F 01DB                            add     bx,bx           ;
 41194 00003AA1 8BBF[F545]                      mov     di,[aoffBlockName+bx]
 41195 00003AA5 E8E101                          call    srch_block      ; THIS CANNOT FAIL!
 41196 00003AA8 89FE                            mov     si,di           ;
 41197 00003AAA 89D9                            mov     cx,bx           ; ES:SI and CX are ready for another round
 41198 00003AAC E929FE                          jmp     menu_found
 41199                                  
 41200                                  not_submenu:
 41201 00003AAF 01DB                            add     bx,bx           ; get BX -> name of selected block
 41202 00003AB1 8B9F[F545]                      mov     bx,[aoffBlockName+bx]
 41203                                  
 41204                                  ;   BX should now either be ZERO (meaning no block has been selected) or
 41205                                  ;   the offset relative to ES of the block name to be processed (along with
 41206                                  ;   all the "common" lines of course)
 41207                                  
 41208                                  no_selection:
 41209 00003AB5 891E[E745]                      mov     [offDefBlock],bx; save selection
 41210 00003AB9 8B0E[5203]                      mov     cx,[count]      ; reset ES:SI and CX for reprocessing
 41211 00003ABD 29F6                            sub     si,si           ;
 41212 00003ABF 1E                              push    ds              ;
 41213 00003AC0 8E1E[D114]                      mov     ds,[config_wrkseg]; this is where we'll store new config.sys image
 41214 00003AC4 29FF                            sub     di,di           ;
 41215                                  
 41216                                  ;   ES:SI-> config.sys, DS:DI -> new config.sys workspace
 41217                                  ;
 41218                                  ;   Work our way through the config.sys image again, this time copying
 41219                                  ;   all lines that are (A) "common" lines outside any block or (B) lines
 41220                                  ;   within the requested block. Lines inside INCLUDEd blocks are transparently
